'''Annie Bishop''' is a child who had a cardiac tumor.


Annie had a cardiac tumor. She was scheduled to have the tumor removed. [[Noah Barnes]] operated, but wasn't able to get the whole tumor. He said he believed chemo would shrink it more and then he'd be able to remove the rest in another month. Annie didn't believe them, as that's what they'd said the last time. She said she didn't want more surgery.

A month later, after chemo, her labs looked good. She said she still didn't want the surgery. She talked to Cooper and said that she wanted to feel good for a little bit and live her life and be normal for a while before she died. Her parents and doctors had a meeting and Cooper stood up for her, saying that stopping the treatment might be the best thing for her. Noah still insisted he could help, but her parents decided they wanted to take her home. Cooper went to take her catheter out, but Charlotte stopped him, saying Noah was going to a judge to get a court order. [[Judge McLennan]] came in and ruled that her catheter would stay in and she'd have the surgery on the first available date.

After another month, Annie was upset. She believed she'd die in the hospital. After seeing her condition, [[Charlotte King]] went to Noah and said she supported the decision to end treatment and questioned who Noah was really fighting for. Noah went to Cooper and said he wouldn't push anymore. He told the judge he reevaluated his position. Annie was told that once the catheter was out, it would be hard to get it back in, meaning they wouldn't be able to get medicine to her fast enough if something went wrong. Annie said it was okay and that she'd finally get to see the ocean.

A month later, on Annie's th birthday, she had a party on the beach and was able to surf and talk to her friends.



Annie's parents supported her decision to end treatment and live her life.


*She was  when she decided she didn't want any more treatment.
*She was interested in surfing.

{{Attending Infobox |image = PPx-.jpg |name = Archer Forbes Montgomery |alias = Archie |status = Alive |title = M.D. |parents = *[[Bizzy Forbes]] \u *[["The Captain" Montgomery]] |siblings = [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] |grandparents = Grandfather |other family = *[[Jake Reilly]] ''(brother-in-law)'' *[[Henry Montgomery]] ''(nephew)'' *[[Susan Grant]] \u ''(stepmother)'' |job = *[[Attending]] [[Neurology|Neurologist]] *Author |workplace = '''Former'''
[[Pacific Wellcare Center]] |first appearance = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Tempting Faith]] |last appearance = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Home Again]] |only appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Before and After]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Grant Show]] }} '''Archer Forbes Montgomery''' is the brother of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison Montgomery]]. He is a famous neurologist and author. Archer was born in [[Connecticut]] into a wealthy background along with his younger sister, [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addie]], and mother, [[Bizzy Forbes]]. When Addison was seven, she fell off her bike in the vineyard while going downhill because her tire came off. She flipped over the handlebars and scraped her face, but Archer picked her up, told her it was going to be okay, and carried her the half mile back home. This is how Addison has always seen her brother, as the big brother who carried her home. ''("[[Acceptance]]")'' Archer came to Los Angeles without telling his sister he was coming. She discovered him on her kitchen floor, having sex. He told her he was there for a winter launch party for his publisher. After the party, he took Naomi home and had sex with her, upsetting his sister and Sam, who punched Archer when he found out. During the party, Archer told [[Kevin Nelson|Kevin]], Addison's boyfriend, that he wasn't good enough for her, causing him to doubt their relationship. Addison confronted Archer on that and told him he needed to leave. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' Archer returned to Los Angeles when he was hired to replace [[Wyatt Lockhart]] at [[Pacific Wellcare Center]]. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")'' His first case in Los Angeles was [[Jane Williams]], a pregnant woman who had had a stroke. He and Addison disagreed about her treatment but ultimately worked together to save her life and her baby. After the case was finished, Addison said that she was glad he was there, but he needed to stay out of her personal life. ''("[[Second Chances]]")'' After Archer had a tonic-clonic seizure after having sex with Naomi, she took him to the hospital. He insisted that he was okay and left the hospital against medical advice after telling Naomi not to tell Addison. When Naomi pushed, he admitted he had an inoperable glioma in his brain. Naomi cracked and told Addison, who got Archer's scans. While he was looking at his scans, they noticed upward-gaze palsy, which wasn't consistent with his diagnosis, so they got another CT scan. When they saw multiple lesions, Archer diagnosed himself with neurocysticercosis. Addison wanted to call Derek to see if he could remove them. Archer wanted to try antiparasitics instead. Addison pleaded with him, saying she wanted to fix it because she didn't want to lose him. When he had another seizure, he was admitted to the hospital and given a paralyzing agent in an attempt to stop the seizures. When that didn't work, the neurologist wanted to induce a coma. Once Archer was in the coma, Addison called Derek to see if he could help. ''("[[Acceptance]]")'' Archer was brought to Seattle for Derek to operate on him. He had to be stabilized in the ER before being taken to CT, which revealed that the single cyst from his previous CT had multiplied and he now had eight. They were clogging the left ventricle. Derek said surgery wasn't an option and Archer was going to die. He consulted with two other surgeons who agreed that it was inoperable. However, Addison encouraged him to try harder and Sam suggested that he think about it as if there were only one and work on a plan to extract them one at a time. Archer didn't believe Derek could do it and didn't want to have the surgery, but Derek goaded him into agreeing to the surgery by calling him a coward. He removed the first seven cysts easily, but the eighth cyst ruptured in his brain and released the worm into his brain. Archer's heart stopped, but Derek insisted on finding the worm before starting compressions. He found the worm and Archer stabilized. He was stable in his room after surgery. ''("[[Before and After]]")'' Archer woke up after his surgery. Because his speech was still slurred and his vision was blurry, he was convinced that Derek missed something and demanded that he run a CT. Derek denied his request, saying his exam was normal. However, Archer went around him and the CT showed what looked like persistent cysts. He believed he was going to die, so he confessed to several embarrassing things. When Derek saw the CT, he came into Archer's room and explained the sacs had filled with fluid and would clear in a month. ''("[[Ex-Life]]")'' After Addison told Naomi that Archer was cheating on her, he decided to go back to New York. He left without saying anything to Naomi about it. ''("[[Wait and See]]")'' After Bizzy killed herself, the family gathered in Connecticut for a public memorial service and a private internment. The night before the memorial, Archer slept with Naomi. After the memorial, he got drunk. And at the internment, he cried. ''("[[Home Again]]")'' On arrival in LA, Addison walked in on Archer having sex with a woman in her kitchen. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' [[Naomi Bennett]] After his publisher's launch party, Archer took Naomi home and they had sex. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' When he was hired by Pacific Wellcare and returned, they resumed their sexual relationship. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")'' Naomi enjoyed the sex, but she was upset to learn that Archer had a date with another woman. He said that he was the good-time guy and wasn't going to be her boyfriend. However, he showed up at her house instead of going on his date, saying he'd rather be with her. ''("[[Second Chances]]")'' When he believed he was dying, he lamented not being able to be a better man for her. ''("[[Ex-Life]]")'' Shortly after his recovery, Addison caught him with another woman while Naomi believed they were monogamous. Not long after that, she caught him after sleeping with [[Charlotte King]]. She told Naomi that he was cheating and Naomi went to his office to find that he had left. ''("[[Wait and See]]")'' When Naomi came to Connecticut for Bizzy's funeral, she and Archer slept together. ''("[[Home Again]]")'' [[Charlotte King]] He had sex once with [[Charlotte King]]. ''("[[Wait and See]]")'' He is very close with his sister, Addison. Archer was part of Addison and Derek's group of friends but he always disliked Derek even before the divorce, with Derek referring to him as "an ass". ''("[[Before and After]]")'' He is a world class neurologist and a famous author, writing up interesting medical cases he has had. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' *He slept with Amy Garrison, Mark's sophomore year girlfriend.[[Ex-Life]], x (PP) *He once wrecked Sam's car and let someone else take the blame.[[Ex-Life]], x (PP) *He and Addison are both terrible sailors, to The Captain's disappointment.[[Losing Battles]], x (PP) PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Tempting Faith]] PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Nothing to Fear]] PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Second Chances]] PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Acceptance]] ArcherMontgomery.png|[[Before and After]] PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Ex-Life]] PPArcherMontgomery.png|[[Wait and See]] PPxArcherMontgomery.png|[[Home Again]] PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg {{Archer Montgomery Appearances}} [[de:Archer Montgomery]] {{Scrollbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Montgomery, Archer}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters|Archer Montgomery]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]]

'''Arlene Perkins''' is the mother of [[Michael Perkins]].


Arlene moved her family to Switzerland after her son, Jeffrey, was diagnosed with autism. Two years later, they returned to the US. They came to see their old pediatrician, Cooper, when Michael caught what Arlene thought was a cold on the plane. However, when Cooper examined him, he saw that Michael had measles. They locked down the practice because of it. Cooper also tried to get Arlene to agree to vaccinate her youngest child, Will, in order to prevent him from getting it as well. After the lockdown was lifted, Arlene took her kids home, but later took Michael to the hospital when his fever went up and she couldn't get it down. He was admitted to the pediatric ICU in an isolation room with trouble breathing. Cooper tried again to convince Arlene to vaccinate Will. She said that she couldn't lose a second child to autism and believed that would happen to Will if he got the vaccination.

Michael's condition continued to decline and he had to be intubated. Cooper then went out to the waiting area and vaccinated Will over Arlene's objections. Arlene yelled at Cooper, but then an alarm went off in Michael's room. He stopped breathing and they attempted resuscitation, but were unable to save him and he was pronounced dead.



She is married. Her husband stayed in Switzerland while his family returned to LA.


She has three children: Jeffrey, Michael, and Will. Jeffrey is autistic and because of that, Arlene moved the family to Switzerland for experimental therapies.

'''Ashley Minahan''' is a woman who was pregnant with her fourth child.


Ashley was pregnant with her fourth child and ultrasounds had indicated that it was a girl after three boys. She was very excited to be finally having a girl. She came to the practice for a checkup and was found to be in labor. She labored at the practice for a while and then told Dell the baby was coming. He called Naomi to deliver the baby, but by the time she arrived, the baby was born. Naomi had to tell Ashley that the baby was a boy. She was upset and demanded a girl. She refused to look at her new son. They called in Violet to talk to her, to try to get her to bond with her son. Ashley said she couldn't raise four boys on her own. Her husband didn't really help with the parenting. He preferred just to be their friend.

The doctors called Patrick in and confronted Patrick along with Ashley. They said he needed to grow up and become a parent. Naomi then also said that Ashley needed to grow up. She needed to take the boy she got and not get upset. Or she could meet one of the families Naomi treated who can't even have a baby. When the Minahans' other sons were brought in, Patrick told them to give their mom a break, stepping up.



She is married to [[Patrick Minahan]].


She and her husband have four sons. She was looking forward to having a daughter with their fourth baby and was upset when it turned about to be a boy.

'''Augusta King''' is the mother of [[Charlotte King]].



When her husband was dying, Charlotte came home to Alabama to turn off the machines and say goodbye. During this time, Augusta was holed up in her room on drugs. ''("[[Homeward Bound]]")''


Augusta came to Los Angeles for Charlotte and Cooper's wedding. Charlotte showed her around and despite being introduced to Cooper's parents, they kept things separate. Augusta quickly picked up on the fact that the Freedmans didn't like Charlotte.

After Amelia's plea that the Freedmans get to know Charlotte better, they talked to Augusta at the party. The three of them agreed that Charlotte and Cooper shouldn't get married and told their children that.

After hearing that, Charlotte and Cooper flew to Las Vegas to elope instead of having the wedding. ''("[[Something Old, Something New]]")''



She was married to Big Daddy King until he died.


She has three kids: Duke, Landry, and Charlotte.


*She's a drug addict.

}}

'''Barbara''' is a patient who had ECT to treat her severe depression.


Barbara had severe depression. Her fianc\ue, [[Jimmy]], had to drag her into the practice for her treatment, which included biofeedback and talk therapy. She said that she didn't want to continue her treatment and just wanted to kill herself.

Jimmy talked to Pete, saying he watched her all the time, but she'd stopped eating. She had nursed her father and then it had been a whole year of her severe depression. After a session with Violet, Barbara decided she wanted to use electroconvulsive therapy to treat her depression.

They set up the procedure and performed it. Barbara woke up in the hospital with a headache, but without anything pressing down on her shoulders. When Jimmy came in to see her, she asked him who he was.

Violet cautioned him that memory loss was not uncommon. They told him to go in and try to jog her memory.

Violet talked to Barbara, asking her questions, trying to figure out if there were other gaps in her memory. She still had no memory of Jimmy, but everything else was still there. Violet told Pete that because the rest of her memory was intact, she believed that something traumatic happened with Jimmy, something so bad that she blocked it out.

They brought Jimmy into the room and asked him to talk about their last fight. He said they don't fight because he never wanted to make things worse for her. When Barbara was asked to talk about the last fight she'd had with anyone, she said that she didn't want to think about fights because she was so happy and didn't want to go back.

They then talked to Barbara, saying that ECT doesn't erase an entire person from your memory. They told her they believed Jimmy was dangerous and that's why she'd blocked him out. She started laughing at the idea that anyone could find Jimmy dangerous because he was a nice guy. She admitted that when she'd woken up, she smiled, but when she saw him, she did't want to smile anymore. She didn't want to hurt his feelings after everything he'd done, but because she knew ECT caused memory loss, she used that to help her. She couldn't remember why she was engaged to him, saying when she was depressed, he seemed fine, but now that she's not, he didn't seem right for her.

Wanting to spare Jimmy's feelings, Pete and Violet said he was just gone from her memory and wouldn't come back. They said Barbara was happy now and he should try to be happy for her and move on.



She was engaged to [[Jimmy]] until she had ECT. She said before, he seemed fine, but afterward, she couldn't figure out why she liked him, so she pretended not to remember him.


She nursed her father when he was sick. He used to tell her stories about Venice, where her parents went on their honeymoon. Her father liked Jimmy a lot.


*She went to Monklands High School.
*She went to the Romance in Venice prom with Eddie Parker.

'''Barbara Douglas''' is the mother of [[Bobby Douglas]].


Barbara and her husband, Ted, came to the hospital when their son, Bobby, had an allergic reaction. He'd been given medication to treat chlamydia by his teacher, [[Donna Keating]], with whom he'd had sexual contact. However, he lied and told his parents that his friend had given him something to help him stay awake so he could study. However, they found out the truth when Donna came back to the hospital to visit him. They were horrified and Donna was arrested for statutory rape. After she was bailed out, Barbara and Ted allowed Donna to speak to Bobby to break things off with him.



She is married to [[Ted Douglas]].


Her son, Bobby, was hospitalized for an allergic reaction after taking medicine for chlamydia.

'''Becky Merring''' is one of the four sisters who repeatedly turned blue.


Becky came to the practice with her mother when her sister's skin turned cornflower blue. After looking for possible causes, Cooper found out that Erin had recently had her first ever cavity filled at the dentist and believed the dental drugs had reacted with the hemoglobin in her blood, which had turned her blue. He gave her methylene blue to make her pink again and sent her home. However, she came back and was blue again, along with her three sisters.

After giving them all methylene blue, Cooper went to their house to look for environment poisons, but found nothing. While he was there, Erin had a seizure and had to rushed to the hospital. Desperate to find an answer, Cooper went back to the house and pretended to be a princess with Becky, Kim, and Sasha, and they led him to their castle, which was a shed that had bags of fertilizer with ammonium nitrate in it, which was poisoning them.



Becky is very close with her three sisters. The four of them play princesses, which included going into a castle together. They rarely speak to adults.


*She and her sister, Kim, are twins.

'''Ben King''' is a patient whose allergies and asthma were treated with alternative therapies.


Ben came into the practice to see Pete, who used alternative therapies for Ben's asthma and allergies, which were severe. Pete used acupuncture to treat him, while Ben tried to set him up with his mother.

Ben came in to the practice with his mom. He'd called her from a friend's house saying he had trouble swallowing. By the time they arrived, he was having trouble breathing. Pete gave him a shot of adrenaline to help him breathe. Ben, Pete, and Lisa later spent time together happily. ''("[[Do the Right Thing]]")''

Pete told Lisa that Ben seemed to have no residual damage from his asthma attacks. ''("[[What You Do for Love]]")''

When Pete ended things with Lisa, Pete wanted to keep Ben as a patient because he didn't want the breakup to affect him. Lisa decided otherwise. ''("[[What You Do for Love]]")''



He set his mother up with [[Pete Wilder]] because he liked him.

'''Beth Burton''' is a woman who was attacked during a home invasion.


While her husband was a on a business trip, Beth was attacked by a home invader. She claimed she hit her head on a glass table and that was the extent of the damage. Her CT was negative, but she asked about a drug that could make you forget a traumatic experience. She said that she'd like to use it because her husband was away for business a lot and she didn't think she'd be able to get a good night's sleep again.

Sam consulted with Violet on the drug to see if Beth was a candidate. She suggested that they start with a few sessions of talk therapy before jumping right to medication and even medication would involve talking through what had happened. Beth refused and walked out. Violet became worried at something Beth said and figured out that more had happened during the break-in than Beth had said. When Violet came to her house to talk to her, she admitted that she'd been sexually assaulted. She hadn't told anyone because she didn't believe her husband could handle it. Violet then brought both Beth and her husband in to talk to them, to start working through the trauma.



She is married to [[John Burton]].


She and her husband have at least two children, including one son.

'''Beth O'Brien''' is the mother of [[Sarah O'Brien]], who was switched with [[Emily Stinson]] as an infant.


Greg and Beth O'Brien had a nine month old, Emily, who had been ill since she was an infant. The cause of her neurological symptoms was a mystery until a blood draw showed Pelizaeus-Merzbacher disease, an incurable genetic disorder. Concerned about it being genetic, the O'Briens requested tests to figure out which of them had the genetic marker. When tests revealed that neither of them was a carrier, the doctors concluded that Emily wasn't their daughter. Greg and Beth were told that under California law, they'd have to say goodbye to Emily and welcome the other child into their home. Beth insisted that it couldn't be true, believing that as a mother, she would know. After obtaining the nursery records, they determined that their baby had been switched shortly after birth with [[Duncan Stinson|Duncan]] and [[Melinda Stinson|Melinda Stinson's]] baby.

Duncan was arrested after it was discovered that he had switched the girls in the nursery after Emily had a seizure while he was holding her. Under the observation of [[Violet Turner]], the O'Briens handed Emily over to Melinda and took Sarah from her. Beth hesitated because it didn't feel right, but Violet said it was natural to feel like strangers at first. She and Melinda shared information about the girls that would help them transition to their new lives.



She is married to [[Greg O'Brien]].


Beth and Greg have one child. They named her Emily at birth, but after she was switched, she was called Sarah. When they were nine months old, the girls were switched back to live with their birth parents. They spent nine months raising the Stinsons' baby, who had an incurable genetic disorder.

She also has a sister who was trying to get pregnant, which is why she wanted genetic tests to see which of them was a carrier.

'''Betsey Parker''' is the daughter of the late [[Dell Parker|Dell]] and [[Heather Parker]]. After her father's death, she spent some time with an aunt and then in foster care before [[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]] took her to New York with her.



When [[Dell Parker]] was seventeen years old, he started dating [[Heather Parker|Heather]]. They were both heroin addicts at the time. She got pregnant, but they hadn't been dating long and broke up.

Dell felt guilty about trying to force Heather to have an abortion, stating he drove her to the clinic, and when she wouldn't leave the car, he shouted at her, which is the reason he has issues with abortions. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")'' Betsey was born and lived with her mother.

Dell was only reunited with his daughter much later, as Heather got clean and Dell had access to her.


Dell attempted to get an office from both [[Sam Bennett|Sam]] and [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]], but both put it off for later. He eventually cleaned out a spare office to impress Betsey, wanting her to see that one of her parents had it together after her mother relapsed. When Addison was about to discipline Dell for going against her wishes, she saw Betsey and allowed Dell to keep the office. ''("[[Serving Two Masters]]")''


After realizing that he couldn't protect his daughter from the people Heather hung out with, he decided to get a lawyer and fight her for custody. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")''


Betsey was with Dell at the practice when a kid came in and was diagnosed with measles. She had also played with the kid, [[Michael Perkins]], in the waiting room. Unsure if Betsey had been vaccinated and unable to get a hold of Heather, Dell worried that Betsey could get measles. Cooper advised him to wait until Heather could be reached because he had  hours to vaccinate her. When he was finally able to get a hold of Heather at the end of the day, she admitted that she didn't know whether or not Betsey was vaccinated. ''("[[Contamination]]")''


Heather got promoted at her job, but the promotion meant moving to St. Louis. Dell refused to let Heather take Betsey, so Heather left in anger. When Dell showed up at the apartment to talk to Heather about it again, he found the apartment cleared out and both Heather and Betsey gone. ''("[[What Women Want]]")''


Eventually, the pressure of her new job got to Heather and she relapsed. She brought Betsey back to Los Angeles and told Dell he could have her if he gave her $,. He got the money from Sam, but when she showed up, he said he wouldn't give her the money to kill herself, for Betsey's sake. He then told her to say goodbye to Betsey. She did so and left, leaving Betsey with Dell. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''


When Violet was attacked and hospitalized, Betsey went with Dell to the hospital, where they waited for news. ''("[[A Death in the Family]]")''


Dell took some time off from work to take care of Betsey. When she started at a new school, she cried and clung to his leg when he dropped her off. ''("[[Pushing the Limits]]")''


Betsey was in the house with Heather when it exploded. Dell got Betsey out and they were both taken to the hospital. Heather had severe burns, but Betsey had only a minor brain contusion and carbon monoxide poisoning. Dell was told she'd wake in a few hours and she did. Once awake, Pete tried to get Dell to let her see Heather to say goodbye before Heather died. Dell refused, but Pete tried to sneak her there anyway. Right before they arrived, Dell showed up and took Betsey back to her room. Heather then died with only Pete by her side. ''("[[Blowups]]")''


Since their home was destroyed, Dell and Betsey moved in with Naomi. She refused to speak to her father, still angry at him for not letting her say goodbye to her mother. Dell eventually went to Betsey and admitted that he'd made a mistake and was trying to protect her. He apologized to her. ''("[[Another Second Chance]]")''


When Dell was injured in a car accident, he asked to have Betsey brought to him before he had to have brain surgery. He talked to her, saying that if something happened to him, it would be okay because she'd know that everything bad to happen in her life would have already happened, so she'd have good things happening after that. When Dell died in surgery, Pete had to tell Betsey, who started to punch him and cry. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''

Betsey was then left orphaned after the accident, ending up with Aunt Monica.


Aunt Monica showed up one day in OWG, telling Violet that she couldn't keep her for long, and left Betsey behind. Betsey colored and played in her dad's old office. Betsey was later taken home by Violet and Betsey asked if she could stay with them forever, but arguments ensued between Pete and Violet, Cooper and Charlotte, and Sam and Addison about keeping Betsey with them, with none of them willing to keep her for a greater stretch of time. After the discussion, it was decided that Betsey should be submitted to social services and put in foster care. ''("[[A Better Place to Be]]")''


A few months later, Betsey ended up in [[St. Ambrose Hospital|St. Ambrose Hospital's]] [[Emergency Room|ER]] because she fell down the stairs in her foster home. While she was being checked out, she said she didn't want to be there because her mommy and daddy died there. She had a brain contusion, but Amelia said the swelling could go down on its own. They did x-rays, which showed a recent clavicle fracture that had healed. Cooper became suspicious that her foster parents were abusing her. They monitored for a while, but when Betsey started seizing, they rushed her into surgery. Gina and Phil left to follow, leaving their son, Marshall, with Pete. Pete took Marshall to the cafeteria where they were joined by Sheldon. He asked Marshall about his parents. He said that when Betsey doesn't listen, he helps her to listen. He said that the jungle gym fall was her fault.

In surgery, Betsey started bleeding, so Amelia had to work to stop it. Meanwhile, Sheldon talked to the others, saying he believed Marshall would need help. They went to the Rakoffs about Marshall.

After surgery, Betsey was stable, but comatose. After some time, Betsey woke up. When she learned that the Rakoffs had left, she asked where she was going to live. Naomi told her she was coming to live with her. ''("[[God Bless the Child]]")''


Because Maya had been accepted to Columbia and Naomi wanted to be around to help her with Olivia and she and Gabriel became engaged, she moved Betsey with her to New York. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")''

Betsey\ualived\uawith\ua[[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]]\uaand\ua[[Gabriel Fife]], Naomi's fianc\ue,\uain New York\uauntil Naomi and Fife broke up. Naomi and Betsey moved back to LA for Sam, when Naomi became pregnant with his baby.


*Betsey is often seen drawing.
*Her last line in the show was, "That's too bad. I like him." (referring to [[Gabriel Fife]]).
*She was a week overdue.<ref>[[Pushing the Limits]], x (PP)</ref>
*She hates the cold.<ref>[[Blowups]], x (PP)</ref>
*She and Dell watched cartoons together.<ref>[[A Better Place to Be]], x</ref>
*According to Naomi, she and Olivia adore each other.<ref>[[In Which We Say Goodbye]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Betty Crawford''' is the mother of [[Ryan Crawford]].


Betty's son, Ryan, was in isolation in his bedroom because of SCID. He'd receive treatment to try to build up his immunity, which was supplemented with alternative methods because he wanted to go to the homecoming dance with his girlfriend. His blood count came back high enough, but because his mother had a fever, they said that he'd been compromised and couldn't go. She later called the doctors and said that Ryan was missing and so was his suit. They found him at the dance and when he collapsed, they took him from there to the hospital, where he was stabilized and taken into isolation.



She is very protective of her son because of his SCID.

'''Beverly''' is a patient who kept seeking alternative treatments for her cancer.


Beverly came in to see Pete. She pleaded with him to give her just a quick session and he agreed. After their session, Pete told her that he loved seeing her, but they couldn't keep doing it. She pushed him for just one more thing.

Beverly kept coming back and trying to get him to treat her, but he told her directly that she has stage II lymphoma and she needed to see the oncologist he recommended because he was one of her favorite patients and he wanted her to live. She said she went to the waiting room, but seeing the other patients scared her away. He told her that they look like that because they're fighting and she needs to fight, too.

'''Bill Henderson''' is the father of [[Lucy Henderson]].


Bill came to the practice with his daughter, Lucy, was in labor. He hadn't even known she was pregnant. He was extremely disinterested in helping her during her labor until she went into congestive heart failure while pushing, at which point he told the doctors his wife had died giving birth to Lucy. He stayed by her side as Addison performed a c-section and then went to the hospital with his daughter and new granddaughter.



He was married until his wife died giving birth to their daughter.


His daughter, Lucy, hid her pregnancy from him until she was in labor. He was upset at her, but forgave her when he thought he might lose her the way he lost his wife. After the baby was born, he held her while they left the practice to go to the hospital.

'''Billy Douglas''' is Charlotte King's ex-husband.



Billy slept with [[Tiffany]] in order to check if his lack of interest in Charlotte was because of Charlotte or because he was gay. She walked in on them having sex and injured her head leaving, which led to her narcotic addiction. ''("[[If I Hadn't Forgotten...]]")''


Wanting to know why Charlotte was still holding onto a picture of Billy, Cooper went to see him because he wanted to know why Billy had cheated on her. He then brought Billy back to the practice to talk to Charlotte. He confessed to Charlotte that he figured out he was gay, which caused her to tell him to leave and never come back.

Charlotte later went to see him at work and asked why he didn't tell her he was gay. He said he thought she was the problem and wanted to see if he felt the same way about other women. He said she was amazing and it was nothing she did. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''



[[Charlotte King]]
Not much is known about him except that Charlotte and Billy had a fairy tale romance. ''("[[The Hard Part]]")'' He then cheated on her and they got a divorce. Charlotte said that she doesn't know what would have happened if she had stayed and if her personality would be different. He later told her he cheated on her because he was trying to see if he was gay or not. He realized he was. He cheated on her to figure out if it was just Charlotte or all women he was not attracted to. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''


He works as a mechanic. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''

'''Bizzy Forbes''' was the eccentric mother of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] and [[Archer Montgomery]].



After The Captain called her to come tell Addison the truth, she flew to Los Angeles. When Susan came there after her, Addison believed that the Captain was having an affair with Susan. However, Addison was shocked when she walked in on Bizzy and Susan kissing. Believing that The Captain pushed Bizzy to do it, Addison talked to Bizzy about facing it, but Bizzy corrected her that she and Susan had been together for  years. Bizzy said that Susan was the one thing she did for\uaherself among all the things she did for her children. Seeing how upset having her parents there made Addison, Sam came to her house and told them to leave. They did so, but Addison came to the airport to see them off and talk\uato Bizzy, though they only talked about\uathe bad\uaservice she'd received on the flight to Los Angeles. ''("[[Blowups]]")''


Bizzy called Addison in the middle of the night when Susan became sick. They then flew to Los Angeles to get Addison's help. ''("[[Just Lose It]]")''

Susan had stage IV ovarian cancer. Addison ran tests and then had to deliver the news that the cancer had spread and there was nothing she could do. Bizzy slapped Addison and commanded Addison to save Susan's life. Addison called in [[Eric Rodriguez]] and asked for his professional advice. He agreed that there was nothing there could do, but agreed to do some research and consult with colleagues. He suggested that Addison scope her. When Addison did the scope, she saw that the tumor had spread to her liver. She suggested not doing anything, but Bizzy kept pushing, so Addison suggested using the [[Da Vinci Surgical System]] to get angles she couldn't get with her own hands. Susan agreed to try it for Bizzy. Addison brought Eric in on the surgery to use hot chemo to kill the cancer cells left behind. They were able to remove the cancer and place her port for chemo. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''


Bizzy, wanting to give Susan the wedding she wanted, had Addison plan an elaborate ceremony. When Addison went to check to see if Susan was dressed for the wedding, she discovered that Susan wasn't better. She knew that her cancer had come back and had chosen to be discharged anyway because she wanted her wedding. She said she'd signed a DNR and didn't want Addison to tell Bizzy. After the wedding, Susan collapsed. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''


Susan was stabilized in the ER, but she was in septic shock. They started antibiotics, but Susan developed a clot in her lung and because of her DNR, Addison was unable to do anything. Shortly after Bizzy returned to her bedside, Susan died. Bizzy worried about what she'd do next and Addison said she'd help her figure it out. However, when Addison came to see Bizzy, she found that she had killed herself. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''


Bizzy requested that Addison give the eulogy at her funeral. Addison hid from everyone that Bizzy had committed suicide. Despite wanting to tell everyone her mother's true colors, Addison gave a glowing eulogy, talking about Bizzy's charity work and personal accomplishments. Before she was interred, Addison placed the urn with Susan's ashes in Bizzy's coffin. ''("[[Home Again]]")''



She had a thing with another girl at summer camp when she was . ''("[[Blowups]]")''

[["The Captain" Montgomery]]
She married The Captain, but even though she loved him, she was not "in love" with him. They stayed together because of their children, Archer and Addison. The marriage wasn't an easy one. The Captain knew that Bizzy's interest was not in him and therefore had many affairs to fill the void. \ua
[[Susan Grant]]
[[File:PPx-.jpg|thumb|Bizzy and Susan at their wedding.]]She had a  year secret relationship with her assistant, Susan.

When Bizzy and Susan returned to Los Angeles, after Susan had surgery, Bizzy told Addison that she had divorced The Captain and was marrying Susan. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

Addison planned an elaborate wedding and the two of them married. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''

Susan died and Bizzy killed herself. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''


Bizzy's relationship with her children wasn't an easy one. She wasn't a loving mother, but instead was very demanding of them.

When Addison was able to treat Susan after working hard to come up with a solution, she was disappointed when Bizzy didn't even thank her. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

At Bizzy and Susan's reception, Bizzy thanked Addison for planning it and said she'd done a beautiful job. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''

After Susan died, Bizzy blamed Addison for not doing enough to save her. While Bizzy packed up her things, Addison came and told her she loves her and was there for her as she figured out what was next. They made plans for the next day, but when Addison came by to get Bizzy, she found that she had killed herself. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''


*Bizzy refused to be called ''mom''.<ref>[[Tempting Faith]], x (PP)</ref>
*She was  at the time of her death.<ref>[[Home Again]], x (PP)</ref>
*In lieu of flowers, she asked for donations to the City Ballet or the garden club in her name.<ref>[[Home Again]], x (PP)</ref>
*At her funeral <ref>[[Home Again]], x (PP)</ref> it's revealed that her first name is Beatrice

'''Bob Schwartz''' is the husband of [[Georgie Schwartz]].


Bob's wife, Georgie, was in a ski accident when she was  and never regained consciousness. However, Bob refused to give up hope. He perceived the remaining reflexes as signs of life. When Amelia was brought in to consult on her case, her husband insisted that Amelia run tests to see if anything could be done for Georgie. The results of the labs showed that Georgie was pregnant. They immediately assumed that she had been raped by a staff member at her care facility. However, when her husband found out, he admitted that he had gotten her pregnant and was excited about it. She had some bleeding and was taken to the hospital.

While Georgie was being treated, Bob spoke to Sheldon, who tried to get him to come to terms with Georgie's condition. Despite Addison's best efforts, she could not continue the pregnancy. Bob was devastated, but agreed to keeping seeing Sheldon to work on it. However, when Addison heard Bob telling Georgie they'd try again for another baby, she called the police on him.



He is married to [[Georgie Schwartz]]. Despite the assurances of several doctors, he still believed she was reacting to him beyond her primitive reflexes.

'''Bob Yates''' is a patient who confessed to child molestation after a heart attack.


Bob collapsed during a school play and was taken to the hospital. Sam looked at his scans and diagnosed an acute myocardial infarction. He needed bypass. [[Dr. Warren]] was paged away, so Sam took him up himself, with instructions to call someone if he needed help. As they were taking him to the OR, he became worried he might die and said that he needed to confess something first. He told Sam that he'd molested several children. He said he tried to stop, but he couldn't.

Before surgery, Bob had a CT angio which revealed a dissecting aneurysm. Because of his confession, Sam decided not to call in help and took Bob up to surgery himself. In surgery, Sam fixed the problem, but Bob started bleeding. Sam delayed life-saving care and Bob was pronounced dead in the OR.


He was a teacher.

'''Bobby Douglas''' is the student [[Donna Keating]] slept with.


Bobby came into the ER with a severe allergic reaction. He wouldn't say what he'd ingested that might have caused it, leading Cooper to suspect he'd taken something illegal. His teacher, [[Donna Keating]], came in with him, saying she'd found him. She admitted to Sam that she'd given him both the medicines prescribed to her because she'd been having sexual contact with him. They were able to treat Bobby and stabilize him. He'd reacted to the sulfadiazine.

He lied to his parents, saying his friend had given something to stay awake so he could study. However, the truth came out when Donna came to visit him again in the hospital. The police arrested Donna, but Bobby insisted that he loved her and wanted to be with her. After being bailed out, she came to see him and told him he didn't love her. He believed she was lying, but she quickly left.



While he was a senior in high school, he had sexual contact with one of his teachers, [[Donna Keating]].


His parents came to the hospital with him when he had an allergic reaction. They were horrified to learn what had happened between him and his teacher.

'''Braden Tisch''' is a kid whose mother believed he was autistic because he wouldn't speak.


Braden came into the practice with his mother, Nicole, who was worried because he wasn't socializing or speaking. He'd had treatments for autism previously, but they hadn't worked. Braden had started speaking and then stopped suddenly at four. Cooper agreed to look into it and see if he could figure out what was wrong. Cooper examined him and during his exam, Braden briefly made eye contact with him before breaking it.

Nicole later returned to the practice enraged because she figured out that she recognized Cooper from an adult sex site. She said he shouldn't be a doctor and left quickly.

Despite Nicole's desire to have Cooper not work on her son, Cooper consulted with Sam, asking what he knew about acquired aphasia. He wondered if Braden was having seizures in his sleep, which was causing the aphasia.

Cooper went to Nicole's house and she slammed the door in his face. He got her to open it again by saying that Braden might not be autistic. He suggested instead that he had Landau-Kleffner syndrome. He'd had several seizures which caused his aphasia, which caused him to withdraw. He gave her the names of three pediatricians and all his research.

Nicole brought Braden back into the practice, where Cooper gave him prednisone. After the prednisone had a chance to work, Braden said a few hesitant words, thanking Cooper for the truck. His mother said he'd started talking  minutes prior and said that whatever else Cooper is, he's a good doctor.



His mother, Nicole, was very worried about him when he stopped speaking suddenly after turning four.

'''Brandon Henry''' is a patient who contracted throat cancer due to HPV.



Brandon had a cleft palate as a kid as well as several other ailments. He was one of Cooper's patients and Cooper says Brandon singlehandedly kept his first practice open.


Brandon came into the practice with a sore throat. Sam examined him and found a lump in Brandon's throat and wanted to do a biopsy.

The biopsy showed that the mass was cancerous. The mass was also positive for HPV. When Brandon's girlfriend, [[Lyla]], heard this, she believed she caused his cancer because she also had HPV. She hadn't told him because she didn't think the virus could hurt him. Brandon assured her that he didn't blame her. They ran more tests to stage the cancer and found that it was stage IV and he needed surgery that would involve removing part of his jaw. He said he didn't want that because he had a whole childhood of looking different and didn't want to go back to that. Cooper suggested that they could try chemotherapy and radiation first, but when Brandon started coughing up blood, they found out the tumor was pressing against his carotid artery and would need to be removed surgically. When Lyla heard about this, she left Brandon. Despite initial reluctance, Brandon agreed to have surgery.



He was dating [[Lyla]]. They met when they were lab partners and he had purchased a ring to propose, but was trying to get up the nerve to ask her. She left him when he learned he needed surgery to remove part of his jaw.


His mother called him her "little lemon" because he was always getting sick.


*He was  at the time of his cancer diagnosis.

}}'''Brendon''' is a newlywed who overdose on EDs and ended up with priapism.


Brendon came into the practice after his wedding with two of his friends, Buck and Dan. He had wanted his wedding night to be special, so he took ED meds right after the ceremony and was unable to go flaccid. Cooper called in Charlotte to take care of him.

Brendon was embarrassed about his condition and only removed his pants after Cooper went in to talk to him. When needle aspiration failed, Charlotte suggested a shunt. By this point, Brendon's wife, [[Melissa (The Hard Part)|Melissa]] had arrived. When she heard that the next option was de-gloving, she ran from the room in horror.

While Charlotte was placing the shunt, Melissa confessed that she was pregnant. He was enraged that she'd had sex with someone else. The shunt worked and Brendon was flaccid and had no signs of permanent damage. Charlotte spoke to him and advised him he might regret it if he walked away from his marriage because of what Melissa had done. She advised him to stick it out if he loved her because he owed it to himself to give her a second chance.

He then told Melissa he loved her and wasn't ready to walk away. They left the practice after Charlotte told him not to use his penis for a few days.



He is married to [[Melissa (The Hard Part)|Melissa]]. They made a virginity pledge while they were dating. However, Melissa broke that and had sex with someone else, which resulted in a pregnancy. Despite this, he decided to stay with her.


His friends [[Dan]] and [[Buck]] were his groomsmen and came to the practice with him.

'''Brett Loveman''' is a convicted murderer who was counseled while awaiting his execution.


Brett was on death row and scheduled to be executed in  hours. His wife, Hillary, was in therapy to get some closure on the issue, but she said she'd rather spend the time calling the governor's office to try to get another stay. Meanwhile, Brett was also being counseled in his last days. He'd been in prison for  years and had maintained his innocence the entire time, but in the last days, he confessed to Sheldon that he had done it.

He was a very calm guy, never raised his voice to anyone, but snapped. He'd met a man in a bar who was rude and disrespectful, so he followed him home and killed him. He said it felt like something inside him broke. He went home to get his gun, came back, and shot him. He said he didn't want Hillary to spend any more time hating the world, so she needed to know the truth about what he'd done.

Hillary continued to work on ways to get Brett another stay. Violet came to her home and asked her to talk about what would happen if she couldn't get a stay. She was determined to clear Brett's name, even if it happened after he was dead.

Brett had Hillary brought to the prison and confessed to her that he'd killed Paul Miller. She initially laughed in disbelief and then left without talking to Brett.

Despite the confession, Hillary continued to try to to get a stay. She said that their son was colicky. And Brett had gotten fired when they were already broke. Then his mother died. And she believed that's why he killed Paul.

Hillary went to [[Ellen Miller]], Paul's wife, and told her that Brett had murdered her husband. She said she already knew that and Hillary had been the only person who seemed not to know that. Hillary apologized to Ellen and then asked her to ask the governor for a stay, saying she needed more time. Ellen talked about the milestones in their children's lives that Paul had missed because of Brett. She said Brett had taken all the time she had left from her, so she wouldn't give Hillary more time with Brett.

As Brett was taken to be prepared for his execution, Hillary still refused to see him. After he was taken, she decided she wanted to see him, but was told she could witness the execution, but couldn't talk to him anymore. She decided to attend the execution and watched as Brett was given a lethal injection.



He was married to [[Hillary Loveman]] until his death. They'd been together since high school.


His son, Justin, was only nine months old when he was imprisoned.


*He was  when he was sent to prison in .

'''Brian Jacobs''' is a patient who came to the practice because he and his wife were unable to conceive.


Brian came into the practice with his wife, Lisa. They'd been married for five years and hadn't been able to conceive. They came to the practice in the hopes that the doctors could help them conceive. The doctors ran tests and found that Lisa and Brian were biological half-siblings. Their parents had used the same sperm donor to get pregnant.

Naomi and Addison broke the news to Lisa and Brian and they asked the doctors to help them get pregnant still. They said they were staying together and still wanted a baby. Addison and Naomi said they couldn't help them conceive. They couldn't use a sperm donor or adopt. Brian said they could be together and not have kids. Addison said they'd have to stop having sex because no birth control was %. Lisa then declared that she wanted her tubes tied. Addison said she wouldn't do it because Lisa was only .

Lisa came to Addison alone, pleading with her to do the surgery because she said Brian was her missing piece.

The next day, they came back to the practice, hoping Addison would do the surgery. She said she wouldn't. And then Brian revealed that he knew before they got married that they had the same biological father. He thought it was suspicious that they had the same allergy, blood type, and toes. He looked into it. Lisa was horrified that he had known and married her anyway. She said it was over between them.

Addison set Lisa up with an appointment to see Violet and Brian got a hotel room.



He is married to [[Lisa Jacobs]]. They met in middle school and married when they were . They felt like they were meant to be together because they had so much in common. When Lisa learned that Brian knew that they were siblings before they were married, she was disgusted and left him.


Brian's parents used a sperm donor to conceive him.


*He's allergic to grass and peanuts.

'''Brian Reynolds''' is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Oncology|oncologist]] working at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]].


Brian started seeing [[Lillie Jordan]] when she was admitted to the hospital when her ovarian cancer got worse. She talked to him and decided to stop treatment, which he supported. He later went to see her with Addison, but when they arrived, she was dead.



While they were on their way to visit Lillie, Brian asked Addison out for coffee. She agreed, but after Lillie died, she said she couldn't do it.


Dr. Brian Reynolds is an [[Attending|attending physician]] at [[St. Ambrose Hospital|St. Ambrose Hospital's]] [[Oncology|oncology department]].

Dr. Reynolds' most recent case was consulting on [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Dr. Addison Montgomery's]] ovarian cancer patient when it spread to the liver. Dr. Reynolds became [[Lillie Jordan|the patient's]] new primary oncologist and agreed with the patient's choice to withhold chemotherapy.

'''Bruce Tanner''' is the father of [[Justin Tanner]].


Bruce's son, Justin, came into the practice for the first time in three years. Cooper was shocked to see that he had gained a large amount of weight. It had gotten a lot harder for him to move around, especially recently. Cooper weighed him and found that he had gained  pounds in three years.

Cooper consulted with Naomi and called in Justin's parents to talk about the situation. He had diabetes and high blood pressure. Bruce believed he was just lazy. They'd hired him a trainer and nutritionist and sent him to fat camp. They ruled out hormonal causes for his weight gain. Justin said he didn't want to get any bigger and he didn't feel good. While they were talking, Justin passed out. They took him to the hospital.

His blood sugar spiked, which caused dehydration. His parents argued over his case. His mother, Pam, said that he was stressed and used the food as comfort while his father said his mother coddled him.

When Justin woke up, he told Cooper that he was being molested and that's why he kept eating, because he thought it would stop if he gained enough weight. Cooper angrily went out to the waiting room and punched Bruce, believing he was the abuser. Bruce quickly called a lawyer to sue Cooper and the hospital.

Cooper went back to Justin's hospital room and told Bruce he was telling the police what he'd been doing to Justin. Justin then said it wasn't Bruce. It was Pam. Pam tried to comfort him and both Bruce and Cooper told her to back away. Bruce was very angry and asked how she could hurt their son like that. Pam said that Justin loves him. Bruce then tried to attack Pam, but Cooper restrained him and had security called.

Naomi brought in Sheldon to talk to Justin, who said he didn't want to talk about it. He blamed himself for his mom getting arrested. Sheldon said that being fat was his protection. He didn't know how to stop. Bruce came in and apologized for not seeing what Pam was doing to him. Justin said it was okay, but Sheldon told him not to bury his feelings, to tell his father how he really feels. Justin asked how he didn't see it, why he didn't protect him. Bruce said he loves Justin and he failed. He hoped that someday, Justin would forgive him. They hugged.



He is married to [[Pam Tanner]]. When he learned she'd been molesting their son, he tried to attack her and had to be restrained.


When he learned his son had been molested, he apologized to him for not seeing it and asked Justin to forgive him.

'''Carl''' is one of Violet's patients who also flirted with Addison.


Carl met Addison while they were both waiting in line to order coffee. He let her cut in line after figuring out she was impatient. After getting his coffee, he went upstairs for a session with Violet. He had anxiety and talked about how he was dealing with it. He told her about meeting Addison and exchanging business cards with her. He said he believed he was ready to try dating again.

He later called Addison and set up a date that night. On the date, he confessed that he was seeing Violet and believed she'd made him a better man. Their date was then interrupted when Addison got a safe surrender call.

The next day, Carl came to the practice to bring flowers for Addison. She was sleeping, so he left them with Violet and also said that he felt like he was ready to quit therapy. Violet encouraged him to keep at it, but he was insistent.

Violet later got a call that Carl was in the hospital. She arrived and was told that they were able to extract the body non-surgically. The ER intern then asked if she knew whose shoe it was that Carl had put in his anus. Violet talked to him and he said he didn't mean to steal Addison's shoe. Violet said that this is why he needed to continue therapy. He agreed and asked Violet to talk to Addison. She's great, but he can't trust himself around her shoes.



He briefly dated Addison. However, because of his anxiety and his compulsion to stick shoes in his anus, he asked Violet to break things off with her for him.

'''Carl''' is a soldier who had a heart blockage that threatened to take him out of active duty.


Carl came into the practice with his wife, Lucia, who was pregnant. He had passed out on the toilet and hit his head, so Addison referred him to Amelia to get checked out. He was on leave for three weeks so he could be home when the baby was born. He admitted that sometimes, he got dizzy. His EKG showed that there might be a problem with his heart.

Lucia confessed that she wanted them to find something wrong, something that would keep him out of the Army because she was worried about him dying.

Sam reviewed Carl's cardiac CTs and found a serious blockage in his artery. He believed Carl was a candidate for a stent, but Addison suggested drug therapy instead, so that he could get discharged.

Sam brought Lucia and Carl in to talk to them about their options. Lucia believed the surgery was too risky, but Carl said that he has guys who depend on him to stay alive. Lucia said that she and the baby depend on him too. Carl said he still wanted the surgery, because he was a soldier and wanted to go back.

As he went into surgery, he said that he knew he should be there for his wife and child, but he felt a responsibility to go back to service.

In surgery, Sam said that his vessels were more clogged than he thought. The stent might not hold. He used bypass instead, which would permanently take him out of the Army.

After the surgery, Sam told Carl he wouldn't be able to return to active duty. Carl was upset because that's not what he wanted.



He is married to [[Lucia]].


He and his wife are expecting their first child.


He is a member of the US Army.

'''Carl Davis''' is the father of [[Troy Davis]].


Carl's son, Troy, who had a history of cardiomyopathy, came into the ER unable to breathe. When they said they needed to put him on a ventilator so he could keep breathing, his partner, Roger, said that Troy didn't want that and just to let him go. However, before they could comply, Carl came in and asked them to keep Roger away from Troy. Carl hadn't seen Roger Troy in five years because he didn't accept his son's relationship with Roger, whom he insisted was simply Troy's roommate. Carl decided he wanted them to do whatever possible to keep Troy alive, including putting him on a ventilator. They hadn't filled out the paperwork making Roger his medical proxy because they thought they had more time, so when Carl said Roger had to leave, he had no choice.

Despite being ordered to stay away, Roger decided to sneak in after Carl left and sit by Troy's bedside to hold his hand and talk to him.

Carl was told that Troy's cardiac function was still declining despite the ventilator. Sam said that they could do more to help him, but it would only prolong the inevitable and Troy was going to die. He asked Carl why he was doing all this, despite knowing what Troy wanted and how much he loved Roger. Carl talked about Troy's childhood and how close they were. He believed Roger had manipulated Troy. Sam said that he believed Roger really loved Troy and didn't want to lose him, so he must be honoring Troy's wishes. Carl still decided to have Sam continue extraordinary care.

Roger brought to the hospital printed pages from Troy's computer journal saying he didn't want to be hooked up to machines. However, Pete said it wasn't a legal document and they couldn't honor it.

Despite this, Pete allowed Roger to go into Troy's hospital room to say goodbye before turning off the machines. Roger stayed by his side, holding him while he took his last breaths and telling him how he wanted more time with him and he loved him.

Carl attacked Pete when he learned Troy had died, saying Pete had killed him. Pete said that Troy was gone and forced Carl to face the fact that his son wasn't coming back. Carl wondered what he had done.



His wife died when their son was young.


He was close with his son, Troy, due to the early death of Troy's mother. They remained close until Troy told his father he was gay. They remained estranged until Troy's death.

'''Carley''' is a patient who was putting herself through college working as a call girl.


Carley came into the practice for an annual wellness exam. She was relieved when Addison said she was healthy, because she'd had a greater than usual number of sexual partners. She admitted that she was saving for medical school and she made a lot of money with that work, which she said was easy. She also mentioned that a few of the other girls doing the same thing thought they might have picked something up at a party they went to and asked if they could come see Addison to get tested for STDs. Addison was reluctant, but agreed and gave Carley her personal cell phone number.

That night, Carley called Addison from her hotel room. When Addison arrived with Sam, she found Carley seriously beaten on the bed. Sam called an ambulance while Addison examined her. She had some broken ribs, one of which punctured her lung. Addison relieved the pressure so she could breathe. Carley was worried that her parents would find out what she'd been doing, so Addison advised her to give the hospital a fake name and pay cash, so they couldn't deny her care.

Addison later visited Carley in the hospital and said that this was the life she'd chosen for herself and she couldn't be Carley's doctor anymore because of that choice.


Carley worked as a call girl to save money for medical school.


*She wants to go to medical school.
*She was in room  at the Grand Camden Hotel when she was attacked.

'''Carlos''' is the brother of [[Elisa]].


Carlos's sister, Elisa, came into the ER with fluid around her heart. Pete used needle aspiration to drain the fluid, which helped her feel better. Her father was worried that her cancer was back. Cooper believed that the lymphoma tissue had invaded her pericardium. Her father said she couldn't take more chemo because it was so hard on her before. He wanted to forgo western medicine in favor of using a shaman.

The shaman came to their house and did a healing ritual, observed by Cooper and Pete, who brought a quartz, saying that the medicine men he'd worked with said it was a powerful healer. During the ritual, Elisa lost her pulse. They started CPR and called an ambulance.

At the hospital, she had surgery to make a hole in her pericardium to drain the fluid. Cooper wanted to keep her for observation until they could start chemo. Her father insisted that he just wanted to take her home. Cooper called for a judge to force them to get chemotherapy for Elisa.

When Elisa woke up, she said she felt better and wanted to go home. She'd heard about Cooper bringing in a judge and said she didn't want chemo. Pete asked if she believed the shaman would heal her.

When [[R.L. Hansen|the judge]] arrived, Diego explained his point of view. The judge then asked Elisa what she wanted. Elisa said that if she had to have more chemo, it would destroy her family. They were living in a trailer park because her treatment had bankrupted them. She admitted that she didn't believe what her father believed, but she wasn't afraid of dying. The judge ordered that she undergo chemotherapy.

The shaman came to the hospital to do a healing ritual there before her chemo.

'''Carol''' is a woman who tried to have a baby with a surrogate.


[[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] was chosen by Carol and [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, [[Doug]] (Carol's current husband), and her own husband, [[Jim (Season )|Jim]], meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



Carol was married to [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], but they divorced and she married [[Doug]]. Before they divorced, Rick and Carol used [[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] as a surrogate to have a baby.


Lisa gave birth to a healthy baby girl. She decided to turn the baby over to Carol on the condition that they'd all be a part of her life, giving the baby two moms and three dads.

'''Carrie Sinclair''' is a woman who was attempting to adopt [[Judy|Judy's]] baby.



Carrie and her husband, Matt, wanted to adopt a baby. They'd met two prior birth mothers, but both adoptions fell through. They were then matched with [[Judy]] and the doctors allowed them to talk and get to know each other. They also sat down with an adoption attorney and agreed to pay Judy's living expenses until the baby was born. ''("[[Know When to Fold]]")''


Judy came back to the practice to delivery. During delivery, the baby got stuck by his shoulder. Addison pushed the baby back up and they took her to the the hospital for a c-section. She delivered the baby and noted that the baby had a diaphragmatic hernia. They asked her what she wanted to do, but she insisted that the Sinclairs make the decision because he was their baby. Addison explained the condition to the Sinclairs and gave them two options. They decided they couldn't make the decision and left. Violet came in to counsel Judy on the decision, who was worried she couldn't make the choice and then let go of him. The surgery was successful and afterward, Judy worried about him being all alone. Dell then took her to see him. The Sinclairs returned, saying that they wanted him still, but Judy said no, because they left when things were hard. She looked at the baby and said she was going to keep him.

The Sinclairs stopped by the practice to bring the things they'd bought for the baby, wanting him to have them even though they didn't have him. They explained that every time Carrie had a miscarriage or an adoption fell through, they felt like they'd lost a baby and didn't want to lose him. Naomi told Judy about the stuff they'd brought and said that she'd know what the right decision to make was. She ultimately decided to give the baby to the Sinclairs. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")''



She is married to [[Matt Sinclair]].


She and her husband adopted a newborn baby born to [[Judy]].


She is a lawyer.

'''Casey''' is one of three girls who made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.


Casey's mother, Terri, [[Pam (The Hardest Part)|Pam]], and [[Ricky]] were in talk therapy with Sheldon and Violet because their three daughters, Casey, [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]], and [[Jamie]] had made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.

The three daughters also came in to have talk therapy together, to try to explain why they'd done it. Casey said she didn't think she should worry about good grades or college when all she wanted was to be a mom, Jamie said it was instant status, and Lisa said babies love you no matter what. There's a lot going on at her house, so her mother can't give them all attention all the time.

Ricky came in late to their joint session. She'd told Jamie she needed to pick up her brother, but she came back with Violet's book, saying Violet wasn't the right therapist for their daughters. She took Jamie and left.

Sheldon and Violet took Casey and Lisa to tour the hospital. Casey and Lisa by that point had read Violet's book and made several comments about it. Violet started to fight back, but Casey started having serious abdominal pain and bleeding. She was rushed in for an emergency c-section. Lisa watched as Casey's baby was delivered and said it wasn't what she expected and left.

Casey held her baby after his birth. Lisa had not come back. Jamie called and said she was giving her baby up for adoption. She felt her friends had abandoned the pact. Casey said her mom had only come by to criticize her and yell. She wondered how she'd do it on her own because she was totally alone. Sheldon told her she wasn't alone, she had Ben. She said she was scared and Sheldon said they could work on that.



Her mother tried to force her to have an abortion. After her son was born, her mother showed up only to criticize and yell at her.


She and her friends Jamie and Lisa made a pact to get pregnant together. However, after Casey's baby was born, Jamie and Lisa both backed out of the original plan.

'''Catherine''' is the mother of [[Michael (In Which Addison Has a Very Casual Get Together)|Michael]].


Catherine came to the practice with her son, Michael, who was sick. Cooper tested him for mono, but the test was negative. After Catherine left the room, Michael admitted he wasn't sick, just in love. Cooper encouraged him to confess his feelings.

Catherine later returned to the practice with her husband when Michael went missing after being beaten up. Cooper agreed to join the search and ultimately found Michael on a roof.



She is married to [[Daniel]].


Her son, Michael, ran away after being beaten up by his best friend, Brian, whom he had asked out on a date.

'''Charlie Jensen''' is the father of [[Kirk Jensen]].


Charlie came into the practice with his son, Kirk, who had a terminal lung virus. He hadn't been very compliant with his meds. At the practice, Kirk stopped breathing, so he was taken to the hospital and intubated. When he woke up, he pulled the tube out of his throat and said he didn't want to be intubated. He knew the tracheotomy was next and didn't want that. He asked Sam to let him die.

Charlie later called Sam to the hospital to ask him to put the tube back into Kirk's throat. Sam did so under pressure from Charlie. In order to keep Kirk from pulling the tube out again, they restrained him.

Sam later went back to the hospital and told Charlie that he wouldn't want to force someone he loved to live a life they couldn't deal with. Charlie agreed to let Sam remove the tube and he stayed with Kirk as he died.



He was married until his wife died.


His son, Kirk, had a terminal illness. He was in denial about Kirk's imminent death and tried to insist that Sam prolong Kirk's life as much as possible, even when Kirk said that he wanted to die.


He runs a company. He made a deal with the practice to get all his employees executive physicals.
