'''Debra Diamanti''' is the daughter of [[Ed Diamanti]].


Debra's father, Ed, was a recovering alcoholic who was seeing Violet. He invited Debra to one of his sessions to try to make amends with her. She showed up at the session visibly pregnant, to his surprise. Ed told her he'd been sober for six months and needed to talk to her. She talked bout their history and about how he just left. He said that she'd told him to leave which is why he went. He thought it would be better for her if he left, but she said that after he left, her mother was broken. She told him she wasn't sorry just as her water broke in the office.

Addison examined her at the practice and then had her moved to the hospital, where she said Debra's regular OB would meet her. Ed worried about going to the hospital to be with Debra, saying she didn't want him around. Violet encouraged him to go anyway.

At the hospital, Jake took over Debra's care because her OB was held up at another hospital. She labored alone because when Ed came to the hospital, he had a cardiac episode and had to be rushed in for a catheterization to open his closed artery. During his procedure, he talked about all the events that had lined up to save his life.

After her baby was born, Amelia talked to Debra and brought her and the baby to see Ed, who apologized to her. She introduced him to his grandson, Max.



She hadn't seen her father for  years when he asked her to come to one of his sessions. She'd told him to leave when she was  and he did. It destroyed her mother, who never recovered from it. When her father got back into touch with her while she was pregnant, they started to work on repairing their relationship.


Her best friend was supposed to be with her during her labor, but took a trip to Cabo and missed the birth.


*She got a job at  to help support herself and her mother after her dad left.
*She hates needles because of her father's frequent hospitalizations.

'''Dee Bennett''' is the mother of [[Sam Bennett]].


While Sam had cameras following him to film a reality pilot about his life, Dee came to visit him. She brought with her [[Raymond McCray|Raymond]] and [[Jillian McCray]], her boss and his wife. Raymond needed cardiac studies after being in the ER a few weeks prior with chest pain. His symptoms had been getting worse since then. His EKG showed non-specific abnormalities, so Sam moved him to St. Ambrose for a chest CT and an echo.

Raymond's tests showed pulmonary hypertension. Sam started him on anti-coagulants and placed an umbrella, which he hoped would solve the problem. When Jillian and Sam left Raymond's hospital room, the camera crew caught Dee and Raymond kissing in his room. Sam walked back in time to see it as well.

While they ate dinner that night, Dee mentioned visiting Corinne, who was doing well. Sam snapped at her for putting a lot of salt on her food and then confronted her about her relationship with Raymond. Dee defended herself, saying things happen and it was for her to deal with.

Dee, Raymond, and Jillian all attended a barbecue at Sam's house a few days later. Raymond pulled Sam aside and said it wasn't a fling and he really loved Dee. Sam told him to get away from him. Raymond collapsed at the party and had to be rushed to the ER. They stabilized him and moved him to the OR to remove the clots.

During the surgery, he started to bleed into his chest. He survived the surgery, but was told he needed a lung transplant. Sam suggested they start testing family members, but Raymond and Jillian said they didn't have any children or nieces and nephews. Dee wanted to pray, but Jillian instead suggested that Sam get tested revealing that Raymond is his biological father. Jillian told Raymond she'd known all along, but hadn't said anything.

Dee talked to Sam about how their relationship played out. Sam decided to get tested to see if he was a match for Raymond. The test revealed that he was a match and he told Raymond he'd donate if Raymond wanted it. Raymond told Sam about how he'd watched Sam grow up and how he'd thought a lot about what would be different if they were a family. But he made the choice to stay with Jillian. He told Sam he wouldn't let Sam take a part of himself to save him. He was ready to go. Jillian took Raymond back home to die.



Dee had an affair for over  years with her married boss, [[Raymond McCray]]. The relationship produced two children, Sam and Corinne. After Sam was born, Dee told Raymond that if he wanted to be in Sam's life, they needed to be a family. He decided to stay with his wife, so she tried to move on, but she couldn't stay away from him.


Dee raised her two children by herself because their father was married to another woman. According to her son, despite doing it alone, she spent more time with him than other kids whose moms stayed home. When they were young, Dee told her children that their father had walked out on them, but as an adult, Sam learned that Raymond, his mom's boss, was his biological father.


She works at the print shop that Raymond owns.

 
*[[Bizzy Forbes]] once got drunk and asked Dee if ''Amistad'' was an accurate portrayal of slavery. Dee sarcastically told Bizzy that she would \ucask her slave friends\ud. <ref>[[The Next Episode]], x (PP) </ref>

[[St. Ambrose Hospital]] |first appearance = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[In Which We Meet Addison, a Nice Girl From Somewhere Else]] |last appearance = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]], [[Season (Private Practice)|]], and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Chris Lowell]] }} '''Dell Parker''' was a nurse and midwife, as well as the receptionist at [[Oceanside Wellness Group]]. He was married to [[Heather Parker]] until her death and had one daughter, [[Betsey Parker]]. He died following injuries sustained from a car crash. During his childhood, Dell was abused by his mother.[[In Which Charlotte Goes Down the Rabbit Hole]], x (PP) Dell became addicted to heroin and he introduced his girlfriend Heather to his drug dealing friends. When he was , Heather became pregnant with their child, Betsey. Dell wanted her to have an abortion. They even drove up to the clinic and when Heather refused to get out of the car, he yelled at her for it. However, after Betsey's birth, he was grateful Heather didn't have the abortion. The experience caused him to become anti-abortion.[[Crime and Punishment]], x (PP) Dell managed to stop using, but it wasn't for a few more years that Heather managed to stop. Dell was enrolled as a student in the South Bay School of Holistic Midwifery and Family Nursing. He earned credit towards his degree in midwifery by assisting staff doctors with obstetrical exams and childbirths. Dell's hobbies included surfing during his lunch break. When Heather got a promotion at work, she talked to Dell, informing him the promotion was in St. Louis. Dell did not want this to happen, and they fought about it. Later on, when Dell went to talk to her, he found her apartment empty, and Betsey gone. However, the job put pressure on Heather and she started using again. She returned to Los Angeles to ask Dell for $, in exchange for his daughter. While he got the money from Sam, he changed his mind when Heather came to collect it. He told her he would call the police or DCFS if necessary, but he couldn't give her money to go kill herself with drugs since Betsey loved her. Heather then left but promised she would somehow get Betsey back. Later, Dell married Heather when she went through rehab. Most of the group at the practice did not approve of this. He later yelled at Violet and Naomi due to them not approving of his marriage. This angered him and led him to say things that they had done. One night when Dell was heading out for work, his home exploded. Betsey was injured, and Heather received rd degree burns on her body. Later, the explosion was revealed to have been caused by Crystal Meth being cooked on the stove by Heather. Dell was furious and told Heather to go die and suffer a miserable death due to putting their daughter in danger. After this, Dell refused to let Betsey see her mother. Later in the hospital that night, Heather died due to her injuries, without having the chance to say goodbye to Dell or Betsey.[[Blowups]], x (PP) Dell announced he was accepted into the UCLA Medical School. Dell died of a brain hemorrhage and subdural hematomas sustained from a collision with an intoxicated driver while driving Maya to the hospital to deliver her baby. His bleeding was overlooked causing the damage to spread before being detected.[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]], x (PP) Dell often gets caught up in his emotions. He loves and hates wholeheartedly. As often shown, this can lead to situations he has not thought through well. [[Naomi Bennett]] Dell had a crush on his boss, [[Naomi Bennett]]. He often showed it by getting her coffee, bringing her home-baked chocolate cake, and generally complimenting and adoring her. Naomi didn't take his crush seriously, calling him a "kid" although when she needed to feel better, at one o' clock, she and Violet would go to the lobby to see Dell walk down to the beach for surfing in only his swimming trunks and also an hour later, when he was wet. After realizing his feelings had developed into something more serious than a crush, Dell decided to fight for Naomi and when putting her jacket on her, he kissed her and told her he sure didn't have it all together, but that he was a man, not a kid. He promised he'd fight for her and left her office, only to see her kissing Sam seconds later. This made him realize Sam was fighting for ex-wife again, just like him. Unable to handle the pressures of covering for Naomi and financial problems of the practice any more and not even getting some attention from her in return, a frustrated Dell quit his job. He started working at St. Ambrose Hospital, where Naomi came to say hi after finding out. He didn't want to talk to her and just continued working. She later returned and told him she took him for granted and should've listened to him, and that she and the practice had been adrift since he left. She begged him to come back, but he told her he was happy at the hospital, as he was respected and taught there. [[Heather Parker]] Dell married Heather and most of the group at the Practice did not approve of this. He later yelled at Violet and Naomi due to them not approving of his marriage, which angered him to say things they had done, such as Violet being so cold to Pete and their son Lucas, and Naomi leaving the practice for the other practice downstairs. Dell was primarily raised by his grandparents. His father presumably left his mother during her pregnancy or shortly after Dell's birth, as he didn't have a part in raising Dell. Dell's mother, whom he described as a "traveling stone", started traveling around the world. She "rolled right off" and left Dell with her parents. She only sends him occasional postcards. Thereby, Dell has no close relationship with any of his parents. When his grandmother died, Dell was left on his own when his grandfather moved to a nursing home. Dell greeted people with a happy smile when they arrived at the [[Oceanside Wellness Group]]. Much more than just their receptionist, Dell performed many of the day-to-day operations that kept the practice up and running. Dell received his nursing degree. Dell was also a trainee midwife, frequently shadowing [[Naomi Bennett]] and [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] during births at the practice. Dell also briefly worked at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] as a nurse after he left Oceanside Wellness, unable to handle the pressures of covering for Naomi and financial problems of the practice any more. Dell got into medical school at [[UCLA Medical Center|UCLA]] before his death. No one knew about it except Charlotte, Violet, and Maya, whom he told her in order for her to calm down. *He hated wearing pink scrubs.[[Nothing to Talk About]], x (PP) *Dell was pro-life.[[Crime and Punishment]], x (PP) *He had a scar from when a patient threw a coffee cup at his head.[[In the Name of Love]], x (PP) *He was when he died. *He was the only adult main character of either ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' or ''[[Private Practice]]'' that wasn't a doctor. *He was the first main character to be killed off in Private Practice.\ua *Dell had a personalized scrub cap, which was outer-space themed.\ua PPDellParker.png PPDellParker.png PPDellParker.png PPDellParker.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Dell-centric or are otherwise very informative about his life. *[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]] *[[Serving Two Masters]] *[[Crime and Punishment]] *[[Blowups]] *[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]] :'''Dell:''' I think Betsey's owed one. She's just had such a tough life, you know, teenage parents and a mom on drugs. And I will never know what this has done to her. But I figured she's owed, right? She's had it so bad, that this can't be her end. Because then, what was her life for, just suffering? That would be cruel. That would be just beyond cruel. {{Dell Parker Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Dell Parker]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Parker, Dell}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Deceased Characters]] [[Category:Nurses]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]]

'''Denise''' is the daughter of [[Melissa (Too Much)|Melissa]].


Denise brought in Eli, whom she said was her son. He had been crying for  hours and wasn't able to eat or sleep. Pete and Cooper examined him and said he was small for ten days and he was malnourished and dehydrated. They questioned why she was bottle feeding instead of breastfeeding, if there was trouble latching or what. Cooper then noticed she didn't look like she'd given birth ten days prior. They figured out Eli wasn't her son.

She explained that Eli was her brother. Her mother's a drug addict who gave birth and then left him two days later to score. Her mom had been doing it to her since she was eight. She was in foster care for a while and went back and forth. She wanted better for Eli, so she was taking care of him.

Eli had neonatal abstinence syndrome because of his mother's drug use and a cystic adenomatoid malformation. It needed to be removed, but operating with him being so small was risky. Pete brought in [[Melissa (Too Much)|Melissa]], whom he had found. She said she'd left to score drugs, but she changed her mind and got clean instead by locking herself in a motel room for eight days. She said she'd called during those eight days, but Denise didn't answer or call or her back.

Melissa went in to see Eli and Denise yelled at her, saying she wouldn't let her hurt Eli. Eli started crashing and they had to rush him into surgery.

After his surgery, Melissa said she was trying to do the wrong thing and really wanted to have the chance to be a mother to Eli.

Because of the complicated situation, they called social services, who sent [[Gladys]]. Gladys spoke to Melissa and Denise and said that if the doctors believed Melissa having Eli was to his detriment, they could explore other options.

Cooper spoke to Denise, telling her that Melissa would need a lot of help taking care of Eli and said that even if it didn't seem like it, they were a family and they needed to look out for one another.

Denise came to see Eli in the NICU and talked to Melissa. Melissa told Denise she was sorry and Denise told her to do better with Eli.



Her mother is a drug addict. She was eight the first time her mother left her to score drugs. She woke up and the house was empty. In high school, a teacher found out and Denise spent time in foster care. She spent time going back and forth until she was an adult. When her brother, Eli, was born, she wanted to protect him from that.


*She was  when Eli was born.

'''Dennis Hoffman''' is the grandfather of [[Patrick Hoffman]].


Dennis's grandson, Patrick, a piano prodigy, came in to see Cooper because of numbness. Cooper decided to order an MRI and have Amelia consult. He was being raised by Dennis after his parents died in a car accident when he was five.

The MRI showed a large brain tumor in the area of Patrick's brain that controls hand function. Amelia recommended surgery, but said the safest option meant that Patrick might lose all function in his right hand, meaning he wouldn't be able to play piano. The alternative was an awake craniotomy, in order to allow her to track progress and monitor his hand function as she worked. But because it would take longer, there was a risk he'd end up with paralysis in his right leg. Patrick said he needed piano and asked Dennis to let him have the surgery because he needed piano, but didn't need his legs.

However, Dennis said they were going to go with the safer option, though Patrick said it wasn't what he wanted. Amelia and Cooper informed them that they couldn't do what Patrick wanted without Dennis's consent and they also couldn't do what Dennis wanted without Patrick's consent. It would become a matter for the courts. They'd probably rule with Dennis, but they didn't have time to wait for that. Patrick said Dennis could either let him do the awake craniotomy or let him die.

Cooper went to talk to Patrick, who said that being a musician was the most important thing in the world to him. He also said that music was his entire relationship with his grandfather. After his parents' funeral, Dennis never looked at him until he started to teach him to play piano. He believed Dennis couldn't learn another way to bond with him.

Amelia brought Dennis in and said that they needed to talk to each other and choose a surgery because his tumor would keep growing. Dennis said he loves Patrick, even though he doesn't say it. Amelia told him what Patrick had said about his relationship and said Dennis needed to tell Patrick he loves him. He became angry, saying she didn't understand, but after she told him about her father's death, he said to do the surgery if that's what Patrick wanted.

Patrick was taken in for surgery and believed his grandfather wouldn't show up to see him before the surgery because he only loved him for his music. During the surgery, Patrick played piano in order to give Amelia an idea of which areas she could cut into and which she couldn't. He said he wished Cooper had been right about his grandfather loving him no matter what.

Dennis arrived at the hospital after Patrick was already in surgery. He regretted agreeing to the surgery, saying he thought if he gave Patrick what he wanted, Patrick would know how he felt. Not wanting to risk Patrick dying before he had a chance to tell him, Cooper brought Dennis into the OR to tell Patrick he loved him. At that moment, Patrick started bleeding and said he couldn't feel his hand. Cooper took Dennis back out of the OR while Amelia worked to stop the bleeding.

Amelia later came out and told Dennis she'd gotten the whole tumor. They wouldn't know until he woke up if he'd have any paralysis, but she was hopeful.



His wife died of a stroke.


His son died in a car accident. After the accident, Dennis took over raising his grandson, Patrick.


He was a renowned conductor until his son died.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hoffman, Dennis}}

}}'''Detective Smith''' is the detective who arrested Cooper for helping [[Frank Dawson]] hide his son, [[Evan Dawson|Evan]].


Detective Smith showed up at the practice and arrested Cooper. He took Cooper into a room and said that [[Lynn Jarvey]] had received a call from her kidnapped son asking her to stop looking for him so that his father and Cooper didn't get into trouble. He told Cooper that if he told them where Frank and Evan were, he'd be released. Cooper said he was going to wait for his lawyer.

On a tip from Addison, he and his co-workers found and arrested Frank Dawson.


He is a detective in Los Angeles.

'''Diane''' is Sheldon's therapist.


Sheldon was seeing Diane while [[Sarah Nelson]] was missing. She was concerned because of his focus on [[Nick Calhoun]] and why Nick wasn't seeing him anymore. She also forced him to confront his cancer and treatment options.

After Nick came to see him saying he had met a woman, Sheldon discussed his doubt with Diane, who believed Sheldon was off the mark.

When Sheldon told her he'd turned down a lunch offer from [[Miranda (Season )|Miranda]], he said it was because their relationship didn't go outside that room, but she said it was already outside that room, which he knew. He said she's terminal. He rejected the idea that he was like Laura, who'd left him when she found out he had cancer. He admitted he was afraid.


She is a therapist.

'''Diego''' is the father of [[Elisa]].


Diego's daughter, Elisa, came into the ER with fluid around her heart. Pete used needle aspiration to drain the fluid, which helped her feel better. Diego was worried that her cancer was back. Cooper believed that the lymphoma tissue had invaded her pericardium. Her father said she couldn't take more chemo because it was so hard on her before. He wanted to forgo western medicine in favor of using a shaman.

The shaman came to their house and did a healing ritual, observed by Cooper and Pete, who brought a quartz, saying that the medicine men he'd worked with said it was a powerful healer. During the ritual, Elisa lost her pulse. They started CPR and called an ambulance.

At the hospital, she had surgery to make a hole in her pericardium to drain the fluid. Cooper wanted to keep her for observation until they could start chemo. Her father insisted that he just wanted to take her home. Cooper called for a judge to force them to get chemotherapy for Elisa.

When Elisa woke up, she said she felt better and wanted to go home. She'd heard about Cooper bringing in a judge and said she didn't want chemo. Pete asked if she believed the shaman would heal her.

When [[R.L. Hansen|the judge]] arrived, Diego explained his point of view. The judge then asked Elisa what she wanted. Elisa said that if she had to have more chemo, it would destroy her family. They were living in a trailer park because her treatment had bankrupted them. She admitted that she didn't believe what her father believed, but she wasn't afraid of dying. The judge ordered that she undergo chemotherapy.

The shaman came to the hospital to do a healing ritual there before her chemo.



His wife, Alice, died of a ruptured aneurysm.

'''Doc''' was the dog of [[Meredith Grey]], [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]], and [[Derek Shepherd]].



After losing [[Emily Russell]], Izzie was upset and in need of something to cheer her up, so she and Meredith went to the pound and adopted Doc. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''

Her roommates however (particularly George) didn't like him around the house so George delivered Meredith an ultimatum, him or the dog. Eventually Meredith decided to give the dog to Addison and Derek.


During Christmas, Izzie decorated a tree with many lights and ornaments. At the end of the day, she, George, and Meredith lay under the tree and looked up at the lights. Doc came and joined them under the tree. ''("[[Grandma Got Run Over By a Reindeer]]")''


While Doc liked Meredith, he terrorized Izzie and George, leading them to say that something needed to change. Meredith denied this, saying that he's their dog and they love their dog. However, after Doc started eating her laundry, Meredith hid with the others. ''("[[Begin the Begin]]")''

After he peed on Izzie's bed, she insisted that they get rid of him. George backed her up, saying either the dog goes or he goes. When Meredith hesitated, he said he'd be moving out. Izzie made up a flyer to try to get someone else to take Doc. At the end of the day, Izzie refused to take Doc home, so Meredith took him out to [[Derek's Trailer]], where he went to live with Derek and Addison. ''("[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]]")''

Despite him living with Derek and Addison, Meredith continued to see Doc, even meeting Derek in the park so they could walk him together. ''("[[What Have I Done to Deserve This?]]")''


When Doc suddenly became sick, Derek took him to the vet. ''("[[The Name of the Game]]")''

Finn ran some tests and said Doc could go home while he waited for the results. Derek took him home, but brought him back that evening, saying he was listless and hadn't eaten all day. ''("[[Blues for Sister Someone]]")''

The tests revealed that Doc had bone cancer. Finn gave them treatment options, but Derek suggested that it might be more humane to put him down. After consulting with [[Callie Torres]], Meredith realized that Doc wasn't going to get better, a conclusion she confirmed with Finn. He said the best case scenario is that Doc has a year left, but Doc wasn't the best case scenario. ''("[[ Seconds]]")''


Doc's cancer spread to his brain and they made the decision to put him to sleep. Although Finn had the means of disposing him, Meredith did not want him thrown away like garbage and so Derek agreed to have him buried at the clearing by trailer, overlooking the water. After he was given the injection, Meredith and Derek stayed with him while he died. ''("[[Losing My Religion]]")''


Meredith's Near-Death Experience
When Meredith drowned in [[Elliott Bay]], she awoke in an afterlife, where she met, among others, a completely healthy Doc. ''("[[Some Kind of Miracle]]")''

Day of the Dead
Doc was amongst the spirits of Meredith's loved ones who visited her on Day of the Dead. ''("[[Flowers Grow Out of My Grave]]")''


*He chewed on everything.<ref>[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]], x</ref>
*He hated cats and small, yappy dogs.<ref>[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]], x</ref>
*When Meredith drowned in [[Elliott Bay]], in the afterlife, she met a completely healthy Doc.<ref>[[Some Kind of Miracle]], x</ref>
*He was not housebroken.<ref>[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]], x</ref>

'''Donna''' is the mother of [[Judi]].


Donna is the mother of [[Judi]]. She disapproved of Judi's boyfriend, which caused them to lose contact with each other for a year. When Judi contacted her again, Donna was surprised to learn that Judi had given birth to a boy, [[Henry Montgomery|Henry]], and had given him up for adoption.

When Judi met with [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison Montgomery]] at the park with Henry, Donna went along, wanting to meet her grandson. She was allowed to hold him.



Donna has a daughter, Judi. After they reconciled, Donna told Judi that she should have told her she was pregnant, as she could have helped her through it. It was Donna who gave Judi the courage to contact Addison after eight months.


*She said Henry looks exactly like Judi did when she was his age.

'''Donna Keating''' was a patient of [[Sam Bennett|Sam]] who had a [[Medical Glossary#U|UTI]] and contracted chlamydia.


Donna came into the practice suspecting she had a UTI. Sam ran the tests, which showed she had a UTI and also chlamydia. He gave her prescriptions for both of them and asked how she might have gotten it. She said her husband had been cheating for a while. She said she needed to be away from Bill.

She later came into the ER with one of her students, [[Bobby Douglas]], who was having a severe allergic reaction. She said she'd found him. She admitted that she'd given him both her medicines because she'd had sexual contact with him. She talked to Sam about it. She said she'd just found out about her husband's affair and the women were younger and it made her feel old. Bobby was transferred into her class and they made excuses to spend time together outside of class. She claimed she loved Bobby. They gave her an ultimatum, saying they'd call the cops if she didn't end things immediately.

Donna came to the hospital and Cooper told her to leave. When Bobby's parents came in, she made an excuse and left quickly, but not before his parents figured out what had happened.

The police showed up at the hospital and arrested Donna for statutory rape. Bill bailed her out of jail and left her. Donna continued to receive texts from Bobby, saying he loved her and wanted to be with her still. Sam advised her that if she loved him, she needed to let him go.

She went to see Bobby with his parents' permission. She told him she needed him because she was in a bad place, but didn't love him. He believed she was lying, but she insisted she wasn't and left.



Bill Keating
Donna married Bill Keating. Unfortunately, he had been cheating on her with very young women, and that made her feel old, so she had an affair with her  year old student [[Bobby Douglas]], whom she claimed to love. She was later arrested for statutory rape. Bill posted bail as his final gift for her and walked out.

[[Bobby Douglas]]
When she started to feel old because her husband was cheating on her with younger women, she started a sexual relationship with Bobby, one of her students. When she got Chlamydia and gave it to him, she shared her medication with him, which caused an allergic reaction. This caused the truth to come out and Donna was arrested for statutory rape. She later told Bobby that she didn't love him and left him.


Donna is a senior class teacher. She seems to be a very supportive teacher and always tells her students, "Stay focused on the problem and the answer will be clear."

{{DEFAULTSORT:Keating, Donna}}

'''Dorie Russell''' is the mother of the [[Quintuplets|quints]] born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Dorie and her husband used fertility drugs and got pregnant with triplets: Adam, Oliver, and Graham.


When the triplets were four, Dorie and Tom had used fertility drugs again and Dorie was pregnant with quintuplets. Four of the five girls had health problems that would require surgery shortly after birth.

When she was  weeks pregnant, she was admitted to the hospital for bed rest. She wanted to try to get to  weeks, but she started having contractions. Addison gave her magnesium and put her in Trendelenburg position in order to stop the contractions, but Dorie's placenta started tearing and so she had to be taken into an emergency c-section. ''("[[Much too Much]]")''

After their births, the quintuplets were all taken to the NICU. Dorie visited them in the NICU, but while she was visiting Charlotte's lung collapsed, so she went back to her room. Meredith called her husband to see if he could bring their sons to visit, but they had the flu, so Meredith said bringing them wasn't a good idea.

Emily had hypoplastic left-heart syndrome and needed surgery to repair her heart. However, once they opened, they discovered that there was nothing that could be done and had to close. Emily died early the next morning. After she died, her mother was allowed to hold her.

Charlotte's lungs were a little less developed than her sisters', so she was given a special mask to help her breathe. Her lung collapsed, but they re-inflated it. When she stopped breathing again, they intubated her. Meredith then had the idea to put the most stable quint, Kate, in with Charlotte, to help comfort her. It worked and Charlotte immediately started improving.

Lucy had hydrocephalus, so she had surgery to insert a shunt and was doing well afterward.

Julie had an omphalocele, a sac of her organs outside of her body. She had once surgery shortly after birth, but they weren't able to close because it put too much pressure on her lungs, so they had to wait a few more days to perform her second surgery.

Kate was premature, but otherwise had no major health problems. She was in the NICU to be monitored and gain weight. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''



[[Tom Russell]]
She is married to Tom and have  kids, three boys and five girls. One of them, Emily, is deceased. Despite the doctors' recommendation and Tom's agreement, Dorie decided not to reduce the quintuplet pregnancy to triplets.


She has three sons and five daughters, one deceased, with her husband.

'''Dorothy''' is the grandmother of [[Nina (Deal With It)|Nina]].


Dorothy's granddaughter, Nina, came to see Addison for a consult. She'd been seeing Jake for fertility and he sent her to Addison. She'd been born without a uterus, but had functional ovaries. She wanted Addison to give her Dorthy's uterus.

After speaking to Nina, Addison agreed to do the surgery. However, there was bleeding and in order to save Nina's life, they had to cut off blood supply to the graft.

Jake had to break the news to her that the transplant didn't take and told her there were other ways for her to become a mother.



When her daughter was sick as a child, she cleaned her room and bought her flowers, something her daughter then did for her own daughter.

'''Doug''' is the husband of [[Carol]].



Doug was seeing Pete for anxiety and stress, for which he had be prescribed valerian root.


[[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] was chosen by [[Carol]] and [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, Doug (Carol's current husband), and her own husband, [[Jim (Season )|Jim]], meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



Doug is married to [[Carol]]. He also slept with [[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] the week she was implanted.


Lisa gave birth to a healthy baby girl. She decided to turn the baby over to Carol on the condition that they'd all be a part of her life, giving the baby two moms and three dads.

'''Doug Adams''' is a patient who spent three years in therapy getting up the courage to leave his wife.



After  months of seeing Violet, Doug felt that he was prepared to ask his wife for a divorce, something he'd wanted for a while. After a successful session, he went home and asked her for one, but she became angry at him and dragged him back down to the practice, where she confronted Violet. During the confrontation, she had a serious nosebleed, so Sam took her into a room and tried to cauterize the bleed while Doug went to talk to Violet again. Doug was resolute in his decision, but when he went to tell Karen he was leaving, he found that the bleeding had worsened. When Karen was then diagnosed with Wegener's disease, he decided to stay with her, even after learning that she had known about it for six months and hadn't told him. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''


Doug called Violet one night and asked her to come to his house. She arrived and Doug led her upstairs, where his wife's body was. He told Violet he'd killed her, but claimed it was a mercy killing and that she had asked him to do it. After speaking to [[Kevin Nelson]] about the case, Violet went back to the jail and talked to Doug again. When she pressed him, he admitted that she had been abusive to him and that's why he killed her. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''



Doug was married to [[Karen Adams]] for  years, but wanted to leave her. He spent months in therapy trying to get to the point where he felt confident in his choice, but when he went to Karen, her nose started bleeding seriously. He decided to stay with her after she was diagnosed with Wegener's disease. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''

Later, Doug killed her. He first claimed it was a mercy killing, but later said that she had been highly abusive to him, calling him an idiot and throwing things at him, so he murdered her. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''

'''Doug Iverson''' is the husband of Shannon Iverson.


Doug's wife, Shannon, came into the ER after a car accident in which she sustained a head injury. She was  weeks pregnant following fertility treatments. She had no signs of brain activity, but the fetal heart rate was strong. Doug had left Shannon a year prior, but Jake tried to track him down so they could consult with him on what to do.

Doug agreed to fly in from London, but they struggled to keep Shannon stable on life support while they waited. When Doug arrived at the hospital, he was informed of the situation. After thinking about the situation, Doug decided to allow them to donate Shannon's organs.



He is married to Shannon Iverson. However, they'd been separated for a year when she was in an accident.


He and his wife used fertility treatments for four years. After Doug left, Shannon continued to try to get pregnant on her own.


*Shannon's lungs went to a non-smoking dad who got cancer anyway. Her liver was split between a woman at St. Ambrose and a soldier in Fresno. Her heart went to [[Leanne Schaffer]].

'''Dr. Barksdale''' is a neurosurgery resident at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]].


Dr. Barksdale came to [[Charlotte King|Charlotte]], saying that one of Amelia's patients, Kelly Garrity, showing signs of pituitary apoplexy. He worried she'd need emergency surgery because Amelia had gone home sick and wasn't answering her phone. Charlotte told him she'd find Amelia and to book on OR in case it was needed.

Kelly's tumor started bleeding, so Dr. Barksdale said she needed surgery within  minutes or she'd lose her eyesight. He felt confident that he could do it, so Charlotte told him to prep her and then standby in case Amelia wasn't available.

Before he took her into surgery, Charlotte gave him a pep talk, telling him he needed to act more confident than he looked to her.


He is a neurosurgery resident at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]].

'''Dr. Gibson''' is a friend of Pete's who treated patients outside of medical facilities.


Gibby, an old friend of Pete's, had dinner with Pete and Violet. They told stories about working together overseas. He'd been running a clinic in LA for six months and Violet was surprised she hadn't met him before. While they were eating, [[Suchin]] and [[Kwan]] came to the door. Kwan had severe abdominal pain. Violet wanted to call an ambulance, but Gibby instead said to take him into a back room where he had a makeshift OR set up in his house. He operated and removed Kwan's appendix.

The next day, Pete brought supplies into Gibby's clinic, saying he saw that he was running low. He said that he could make some calls and get Gibby a partnership with a surgical center. Gibby said that most of his patients wouldn't go for that.

Pete started volunteering his time at Gibby's clinic.

When [[Alex (Playing God)|Alex]] came in with his girlfriend, who had been shot, Pete found out that Gibby was taking money from gangs in order to fund his clinic. When it became clear that Gibby couldn't treat the girlfriend properly in his house, Pete called an ambulance, which came and took her to the hospital.

Gibby got upset with Pete for calling an ambulance, but Pete said that if he heard about Gibby treating another patient, he'd personally call the police and get him shut down.



He and Pete worked together with Doctors Without Borders. They were friends during that time, but after Pete discovered that Gibby had set up a makeshift OR in his house, he said that he couldn't be okay with that.


He is a doctor.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gibson, Dr.}}

'''Dr. Whitehouse''' was Pete and Violet's marriage counselor.


Pete and Violet decided to start working on their marriage with the aid of a couples counselor. They chose Dr. Whitehouse after two other therapists weren't a good fit. He started their session by asking them what initially drew each of them to the other.

In another session, they argued about the case of [[Drea Spencer]] and how they disagreed over things. Whitehouse watched them argue and Pete said he looked smug. Whitehouse said that he was just hopeful for them. The fighting was ugly, but it was better than just being polite because being polite wouldn't give their marriage a chance.

Whitehouse suggested unpacking everything that had been revealed in their last session. Pete said that he thought the problem they were having was that they disagreed about how to get to a good place. He wanted to just laugh and play and love each other instead of unpacking all their issues. He kissed her and left the office.


He is a therapist who does couples counseling.

'''Drea Spencer''' is a girl who was stabbed several times by her sister, Missy.


Drea came into the ER with several stab wounds, including one to her chest. Her sister, Missy, came into the ER with her and said that she had told Drea she needed half an hour to finish her homework and then they'd make cupcakes, but when she came to get her, she wasn't in her room. Their parents arrived just before they prepared to do a thoracotomy on Drea in the ER. When Violet went to lead the family out of the room while they cracked her chest, she noticed that Missy was looking at what they were doing intently.

Drea's parents were upset about her injuries and Violet saw that Missy didn't seem upset, so she asked their father, Gary, if he wanted her to speak to Missy to see how she was feeling about the situation. He hinted that others had noticed odd behavior from her and said he wasn't concerned with how Missy was feeling at the moment because Drea was fighting for her life.

After her surgery, Drea was pronounced brain dead. While their parents decided what to do about life support, Violet offered to talk to Missy again. Violet shared with Missy her experience being stabbed and said she wondered what Katie felt while she was stabbing her. Missy said she probably felt powerful and in control.

After that conversation, Violet went to her parents and said she was showing signs of juvenile sociopathy and she believed Missy was involved in the stabbing. Jasmine said it was crazy, but Gary believed her.

Violet talked to Missy again and said she had thought Missy was smart to figure out what Katie did what she did to fell powerful, but Violet disagreed. She thought Katie did it because she was jealous. Missy said she might have stabbed her to know if she could really do it. Violet pretended to be dubious, but Missy said it was only scary for a second and then you were in it. Missy then confessed that she'd stabbed her sister and it wasn't scary for her. It was the coolest thing she'd ever done. The police came in and arrested Missy.

Amelia found Gary sitting by Drea's bedside. He said Jasmine had to leave. His family was destroyed because one of his daughters had killed the other. He felt that Drea's life should have counted for more and asked Amelia about organ donation. Amelia said he could do that and it would matter to a lot of people.



Her sister, Missy, stabbed her and caused her death, devastating their parents.


*She was nine years old at the time of her death.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Spencer, Drea}}

'''Duncan''' is a lawyer and friend of [[Sam Bennett]].



Duncan came into the practice to pick up Sam for court. Sam was his expert witness in the case against [[Harold Allen]], his client, a doctor who was being charged with malpractice regarding the death of one of his patients. When Sam did poorly on the stand, Duncan wanted to put him back on there to give them a chance at winning the case. In order to prepare himself, Sam reviewed and memorized all the medicine in the case. When he did so, Sam discovered that the patient had received morphine for a surgery two years prior, which was overkill unless the patient was allergic to aspirin, which Martin Weiser was. He noticed that it wasn't flagged on the chart, but there was a blank page where that information would have been. He figured out that Harold Allen hadn't been able to revive him because he'd given him aspirin and he was allergic. He hid it because he was worried he'd lose everything over that mistake. After Sam testified about it, Duncan asked why he hadn't told him. Sam said that he needed to tell the truth and telling him would have put Duncan in a bad position. ''("[[Do the Right Thing]]")''


When [[Amelia Sawyer]] and [[Zoe Salter]] ended up pregnant after their embryos were switched prior to implantation, they called in Duncan to start damage-control to protect the practice's image. He said they needed to offer to cover all medical expenses, plus a large settlement to each family in exchange for them agreeing not to pursue additional claims and confidentiality. He also believed they needed to fire Dell to show that someone was paying for the mistake. Instead of doing that, Naomi offered to quit as she was offered the job running [[Pacific Wellcare Center]]. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''



After [[Harold Allen|Harold Allen's]] hearing, Duncan went on a date with [[Naomi Bennett]]. ''("[[Do the Right Thing]]")''


He and [[Sam Bennett]] are good friends. Sam acted as an expert witness at Duncan's request.


He is a lawyer. He represented [[Harold Allen]] when he was sued for malpractice.

He specializes in medical malpractice. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''

'''Duncan Stinson''' is the father of [[Emily Stinson]], whom he switched with [[Sarah O'Brien]] when they were two days old.


Melinda and Duncan were called into the practice when it was discovered that their baby had been switched with [[Beth O'Brien|Beth]] and [[Greg O'Brien|Greg O'Brien's]] baby when they were infants. Duncan in particular was upset when they learned that their daughter had an incurable genetic disorder, because they'd spent thousands of dollars on fertility treatments to get pregnant.

After looking through staff schedules and visitor logs, the doctors determined that Duncan had been the one to switch the girls after Emily had a seizure when she was two days old and he was arrested. Melinda was upset at him for having given away her baby. She'd had a c-section with complications, meaning she was unaware of anything being wrong with the baby after she was born. After Duncan's arrest, the girls were switched back.



He is married to [[Melinda Stinson]]. However, after learning that he'd switched their baby with another one in the nursery, Melinda said he wasn't her husband anymore, indicating that she'd be pursuing divorce.


Melinda and Duncan wanted a baby, but were unable to conceive on their own, so they enlisted the help of [[Naomi Bennett]], who helped them conceive. When their baby was two days old, she had a seizure, so Duncan switched the two girls. Melinda unknowingly raised the O'Briens' baby for nine months until the switch was discovered and the girls were switched back.

'''Ed Diamanti''' is an alcoholic man who wanted to reunite with his estranged daughter.


Ed was a recovering alcoholic who was seeing Violet. He invited his daughter, Debra, to one of his sessions to try to make amends with her. She showed up at the session visibly pregnant, to his surprise. Ed told her he'd been sober for six months and needed to talk to her. She talked bout their history and about how he just left. He said that she'd told him to leave which is why he went. He thought it would be better for her if he left, but she said that after he left, her mother was broken. She told him she wasn't sorry just as her water broke in the office.

Addison examined her at the practice and then had her moved to the hospital, where she said Debra's regular OB would meet her. Ed worried about going to the hospital to be with Debra, saying she didn't want him around. Violet encouraged him to go anyway.

At the hospital, Jake took over Debra's care because her OB was held up at another hospital. She labored alone because when Ed came to the hospital, he had a cardiac episode and had to be rushed in for a catheterization to open his closed artery. During his procedure, he talked about all the events that had lined up to save his life.

After her baby was born, Amelia talked to Debra and brought her and the baby to see Ed, who apologized to her. She introduced him to his grandson, Max.



He was married, but he left his wife and daughter.


He hadn't seen Debra in  years when he got sober and invited her to one of his therapy sessions to try to make amends. When he had a cardiac episode while she was giving birth, Debra decided to start working on their relationship.

'''Eddie Lindy''' is the husband of [[Kayla Lindy]].


Eddie's wife, Kayla, acting as a surrogate for [[Angie McConnell|Angie]] and [[Simon McConnell]], was pregnant with triplets. At  weeks, she was on bed rest because of a blood clot. Even with heparin, she was forming more clots. Addison recommended reducing the pregnancy to one, but Angie and Simon opposed the idea.

The McConnells called in [[Vanessa Hoyt]] as a consult and she believed that it was safe for Kayla to continue the pregnancy as triplets.

Sam agreed to do the surgery on Kayla. It was successful.

Kayla was stable for a while after the surgery, but then she started forming clots above the umbrella. Addison rushed her into surgery to reduce the pregnancy load. Before she could do that, Kayla started throwing more clots and they needed to close and move her to ICU. Her heart stopped when a clot moved to her lung. There was no evidence of higher brain function and she was put on life support. The McConnells asked about the baby that was left and were told that the reduction hadn't been performed. As long as Kayla was on the ventilator, the babies would continue to grow. ''("[[Triangles]]")''

As Kayla was in a coma, Eddie decided he wanted to turn the machines off, believing Kayla wouldn't want to live like that. Vanessa, opposing the decision, went to Simon and Angie and told them about it. They believed Kayla would want them to continue life support until the babies were born. Eddie still insisted he just wanted Kayla to have peace. The McConnells got a lawyer to prevent him from turning off the machines. Only essential medical personnel were allowed in Kayla's room while they waited for a judge to rule on what would happen.

Eddie waited outside Kayla's room in the hallway. He called some lawyers, but couldn't afford any of them. [[Charlotte King]] gave him the name of a lawyer at a non-profit aid group and encouraged him to call.

The judge came in and ruled that Kayla's life would have to continue until viability had been reached. She also ordered that her room continued to be closed to all but essential medical personnel.

Charlotte later saw Eddie waiting outside Kayla's room, so she left the door unlocked and told him the nurse was on break. He went into her room and locked the door. He then disconnected her ventilator. They broke a window to get into the room, but before they could reconnect the ventilator, they saw that Kayla was breathing on her own. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''

After six weeks in a coma, Eddie called in [[Geraldine Ginsberg]] to try to wake Kayla up. After she ran tests and examined Kayla, Ginsberg believed nothing could be done. However, [[Amelia Shepherd]], who was on Ginsberg's team, had an idea. Ginsberg believed it wouldn't work, so she refused to do it. When Ginsberg fired Amelia, she stayed to help Kayla. After speaking with Eddie, Amelia agreed to do the surgery.

After hearing about what Amelia had planned, the McConnells asked her not to operate, to give them a little more time so the babies could mature more. Despite this, she operated. During the surgery, the three babies had to be delivered, but Amelia was then able to finish the procedure.

After surgery, Kayla's reflexes started to re-emerge and she woke up. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''



He is married to [[Kayla Lindy]]. Prior to her hospitalization, they had barely spent a night apart. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''


He and his wife have two children.


He worked two jobs to make ends meet for his family.

'''Eleanor''' is a member of the couples support group run by Violet and Sheldon.


Three couples ([[Sasha (Wait and See)|Sasha]] and [[Ryan (Wait and See)|Ryan]], Eleanor and [[Paul (Wait and See)|Paul]], and [[Greg (Wait and See)|Greg]] and [[Carol (Wait and See)|Carol]]) were in a therapy group together. At the group, Eleanor said her husband, Paul, didn't want to have sex anymore. He defended that he was tired when he got home from work.

After Violet caught Eleanor in the stairwell with Ryan, she and Sheldon called the two of them in privately. They talked about how the affair had come to be. They said it was easy and the communication was there unlike with their spouses. Sheldon suggested that they go home, talk to their spouses, and work on their marriages. Eleanor insisted that they wanted to be together and they should tell their spouses so they could start a new life together.

After Ryan started to work on things with his wife and they talked about it in group, Eleanor admitted to having an affair, though she didn't say with whom. Paul was outraged and asked if it was someone he knows. Eleanor said she made a mistake, but Paul said he didn't care. He decided he was done and left the room.



[[Paul (Wait and See)|Paul]]
Eleanor is married to [[Paul (Wait and See)|Paul]]. Their relationship was strained because Paul never wanted to have sex after he came home from work. He ultimately left her after she admitted to having an affair.

[[Ryan (Wait and See)|Ryan]]
She had an affair with Ryan while still married to Paul. They were attracted to each other because they were able to communicate with each other unlike with their spouses.

'''Eleanor Bergin''' is a pregnant woman whose fetus had hydrocephalus.


Eleanor was  weeks pregnant when her OB noticed a fluid buildup under the baby's skull. Addison looked at her scans and recommended fetal surgery. Because of her advanced age, she'd used an egg donor and IVF to get pregnant. Her age made the surgery more dangerous, but it was the best viable option.

The baby's heart rate started to slow down because of the buildup. Addison said the baby wasn't going to make it to viability and they either needed to terminate or do the surgery. Eleanor chose to have the surgery.

Her husband was worried about her health and begged her to reconsider. She told him that they're never going to have the time other couples have together, but after she was gone, he'd have their baby to remember what they were together. After hearing that, he agreed to the surgery.

Addison operated and was successful, but her stitches didn't hold, so she had to have a second surgery. The second surgery went well.



She is married to [[Ronald Bergin]]. He is  years younger than she is.


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.

'''Elena Debray''' was a patient of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]].



Elena found out she was pregnant the day before the accident that left her in a coma. For the next eight months, she was on life support as the fetus gestated. Her boyfriend, Shawn, wanted Addison to allow her body to labor and deliver vaginally, but she recommended against it. Charlotte had St. Ambrose's legal team investigate and they found out that Shawn and Elena were never married, meaning that her parents still had legal authority to make medical decisions for her in her stead. They instructed Addison to perform the c-section. However, before she could do so, Shawn petitioned the court as guardian of the fetus and stopped the process. Ultimately, a judge stepped in and convinced Shawn to withdraw his protest rather than being ruled against. Addison performed the c-section and successfully delivered their daughter. Unfortunately, Addison was unable to save Elena and she died during the surgery. Addison handed the baby over to Shawn, who brought her back into the OR to see Elena before her body was taken away.



She was dating [[Shawn]] before her car accident. They planned to get married after she found out she was pregnant.


Elena has a daughter who was born during the same surgery Elena died from.


*Her daughter has her eyes, according to her parents.

'''Elena Stone''' is a pregnant woman who had chronic pain.


Elena was  weeks pregnant and came into the ER in severe pain. Pete called in Addison, who did an ultrasound. She'd had chronic pain for the last five years, but no one had been able to find any cause. The baby was fine, but Addison believed the pregnancy was exasperating her condition. Pete believed she had fibromyalgia. They couldn't use meds because it was dangerous for the baby and they didn't have time for alternative methods to work.

Her pain worsened and she asked for something to help with the pain. She was told she couldn't have anything because anything strong enough to help would hurt the baby. She asked about delivering the baby, but she hadn't yet reached viability. She said that if they couldn't help, she couldn't continue the pregnancy.

Elena's husband, Steven, begged them not to let her terminate. She didn't want a kid in the first place, but he pushed her and now he can't touch her because of the pain, so he'd never felt the baby kick, but he was excited about the baby.

When Amelia overheard Pete and Addison discussing her case, she told them to run an MRI. The MRI showed a chiari malformation. It put pressure on her brain, causing her pain. Amelia said she could operate. Pete opposed surgery, suggesting alternative methods.

They went to the Stones with their plans and Elena decided she wanted the surgery after Addison said she recommended it.

They operated and Elena and the baby were both stable afterward. When she woke up, she had a headache, but was otherwise pain-free. Steven was able to feel the baby kick for the first time.



She is married to [[Steven Stone]]. He says that when he met her, he fell hard and fast. He also said that at some point, the thing that drew him to her was gone, possibly as a result of her disease.


*She was  years old at the time of her pregnancy.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Stone, Elena}}

'''Eli Wilson''' is a professor and boyfriend of [[Angela Reilly]].


Eli met Angela Reilly at the college he teaches at. A while after they started dating, the couple bumped into Angela's dad, Jake, and his girlfriend, Addison, at the movie theatre.

Eli introduced himself as Eli Wilson, PhD. It was clear, however, that Jake did not approve, creating an awkward silence before Angela excused them and they left.

Later in the week, Eli and Angela went to Addison's house for dinner with Jake and Addison. Jake made the situation very uncomfortable after he kept implying that Eli was too old for Angela. Jake excused himself from the table, and Eli followed him to the patio.

Eli told Jake that he has never dated a student before, and Angela is different from other students. This angered Jake more and he told Eli to break off his relationship with Angela or else. And Jake assured him he didn't want to know what "or else" was. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''

Eli was set to teach in Rome for a semester, and he invited Angela to come along with him. She happily accepted.



Eli is currently dating Angela Reilly, much to her father's disapproval, as he is  years older than she is. Jake once threatened him. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''

Eli invited Angela to go to Rome with him for a semester. She accepted. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''


Eli is a professor of human sexuality at the college that Angela Reilly attends. He went to teach in Rome for a semester.


*He's a basketball fan. He likes the Lakers. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''

'''Elisa''' is a patient who had cancer and wanted to refuse treatment.


Elisa came into the ER with fluid around her heart. Pete used needle aspiration to drain the fluid, which helped her feel better. Her father was worried that her cancer was back. Cooper believed that the lymphoma tissue had invaded her pericardium. Her father said she couldn't take more chemo because it was so hard on her before. He wanted to forgo western medicine in favor of using a shaman.

The shaman came to their house and did a healing ritual, observed by Cooper and Pete, who brought a quartz, saying that the medicine men he'd worked with said it was a powerful healer. During the ritual, Elisa lost her pulse. They started CPR and called an ambulance.

At the hospital, she had surgery to make a hole in her pericardium to drain the fluid. Cooper wanted to keep her for observation until they could start chemo. Her father insisted that he just wanted to take her home. Cooper called for a judge to force them to get chemotherapy for Elisa.

When Elisa woke up, she said she felt better and wanted to go home. She'd heard about Cooper bringing in a judge and said she didn't want chemo. Pete asked if she believed the shaman would heal her.

When [[R.L. Hansen|the judge]] arrived, Diego explained his point of view. The judge then asked Elisa what she wanted. Elisa said that if she had to have more chemo, it would destroy her family. They were living in a trailer park because her treatment had bankrupted them. She admitted that she didn't believe what her father believed, but she wasn't afraid of dying. The judge ordered that she undergo chemotherapy.

The shaman came to the hospital to do a healing ritual there before her chemo.



She was worried about how her family would make it if she had chemotherapy. She said that her brother and sister shouldn't have to grow up with every resource dedicated to Elisa's treatment.


*She was  at the time of her recurrence.

'''Elise Wilson''' is the wife of Kurt Wilson. She murdered her first two children and had a third, who is in the care of Kurt.


Elise was in jail. Sheldon came to speak with her as her doctor. She said that, like every other day, she felt like she was a monster because she'd murdered her two children. She was pregnant with her third when it happened.

Elise's husband, Kurt, was upset to learn that Sheldon was going to testify on her behalf. Jake said he'd called Sheldon in for a consult because Elise was on suicide watch. Kurt said that Elise had murdered their two children and should rot in jail.

Sheldon believed Elise had a psychotic break due to undiagnosed postpartum depression. Jake felt guilty because he'd helped Elise and Kurt conceive their second and third children. He noticed something was off with Elise during the second try, but he didn't step back.

Elise told Sheldon the story of what happened that day. Kurt was out on a business trip. Max was sick and Josie was upset that Elise couldn't give her the attention that she wanted. Both of them couldn't stop crying and they would wake up over and over again in the middle of the night. Elise was exhausted. So, she told them they were going to the park, got them dressed, and put them in their car seats. She said to them that she was going to get their snacks and went inside, leaving her two children in the running car to suffocate. Elise was sent to jail for that.

Sheldon explained to her that she'd had a psychotic break and he wanted her to understand that and wanted to help everyone else understand that. Elise said she didn't deserve it because she'd killed her children. While they are talking, Elise suddenly collapsed.

Addison told Elise she'd had an eclamptic seizure. The baby was stable, but as soon as Elise was stable, Addison said she'd induce labor so Elise could give birth. She'd have a few moments with the baby before she'd be handed over to Kurt. Once she recovered, she'd be sent back to the jail.

Addison delivered her baby at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]], where Kurt was waiting to whisk the baby away. Elise initially refused to look at her, but when Addison held her up by Elise's face, she apologized to the baby, but refused to name her and she was taken to Kurt.

Kurt held his daughter and then took her back into Elise's room so Elise could see her.



She is married to [[Kurt Wilson]].


Her daughter, Josie, was four when she died. She had red hair and freckles. Max was two and still in diapers.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Wilson, Elise}}

'''Elisha''' is a woman who was pregnant and whose fianc\ue contracted tuberculosis.


Elisha was pregnant and at the practice for an ultrasound. The baby had a heart defect which would require multiple surgeries after he was born. Her fianc\ue, Esau, was an immigrant and his visa had expired, so he got a physical so he could apply for his green card.

Esau's chest x-ray revealed that he had tuberculosis, so he was taken to the hospital. Esau pleaded with Sam not to tell Immigration that he was sick because they would send him back if they knew. When Sam said he had an obligation to send it in, Elisha said they'd just go back to Kenya and live with Esau's parents there, but she was told that with her baby's heart condition, he wouldn't be able to get the care he needed there.

The tests showed that Esau's tuberculosis was MDR, which meant it was drug resistant. They went to put him in isolation, but found his bed empty because he and Elisha had left.

Addison and Sam tried to find them, but weren't successful. Esau and Elisha returned to the hospital when Elisha went into labor. Esau wanted to go with her, but Sam said he needed to go back to isolation. [[Agent Jones]] from Immigration arrived to take Esau, but Sam said his oxygen levels had dropped and he needed to stay in the hospital. Agent Jones said they'd wait until he was stable. This gave them the time for him to meet his son before Immigration took him away.



She is engaged to [[Esau Ajawke]].


Her son was born with a serious heart condition that required multiple surgeries.


*She had recently defended her dissertation.

'''Ellen Weston''' is the mother of Kip Weston, whose cord blood was given to [[Kerri Gilbert]].


Ellen and her husband, Robert, banked their kids' cord blood when they were born. Kip died in a car accident when he was six, but they kept his blood in case their other son, Matt, ever needed it. When [[Kerri Gilbert]] needed a cord blood transfusion, Cooper found that Kip was a match and approached the Westons about using Kip's blood. They wanted to continue to keep the blood for Matt, but Cooper said that since he was a teenager, it was unlikely he'd need it. He said they had the chance to spare another family the pain they'd gone through of losing a child.

When Robert found out that Cooper had forged his signature and used the blood anyway, Robert threatened to sue the hospital and told Cooper he'd stolen the only thing they had left of Kip.

In order to avoid a lawsuit, Charlotte called the Westons in and talked to them about the new protocols they'd put in place to avoid a similar situation happened in the future. She walked them out just as [[Greg Gilbert]] was nearby. When he figured out who they were, he thanked them and hugged them. He offered to give them the chance to meet her, which they took.



She is married to [[Robert Weston]].


Her son, Kip, died in a car accident when he was six.

'''Elliott''' is the husband of [[Lorraine (A Step Too Far)|Lorraine]].


Elliott's wife, Lorraine, came to see Pete. He examined her and she was shocked that after so much time, she was cancer-free and pain-free. Her husband and sister were her support group. Her sister, [[Claudine]], was even acting as a surrogate so that Lorraine and Elliott could have a baby. After Lorraine's exam, Claudine had abdominal pain, so Pete called in Addison to check her out.

When Addison came to examine her, Pete was shocked to see Claudine and Elliott kissing. Elliott said it wasn't a tawdry affair. Before the cancer, things weren't great between him and Lorraine. Then the cancer happened and he and Claudine teamed up to take care of her. They spent a lot of time together and bonded over their shared experience. The feelings got stronger until they gave into them. Elliott planned to tell Lorraine after the baby was born. They were planning for him to leave Lorraine so they could be together.

Addison said Claudine was in the very early stages of labor. Because her OB was out of town, she asked Addison to deliver the baby. She also refused to tell Lorraine about the affair. Lorraine had always wanted to be a mom, but Claudine didn't want kids. She only wanted to fall in love. It had never happened for her until Elliott.

When the baby went into distress, Elliott comforted Claudine before she was taken for an emergency c-section, leading Lorraine to figure out they'd been having an affair. After the baby was delivered, Claudine had a lot of bleeding.

After her surgery was completed, Addison told Claudine she'd had to perform a hysterectomy to stop the bleeding, meaning Claudine wouldn't be able to carry more children. Elliott then said they could take the baby and leave together.

Pete told Lorraine about their intentions and told Lorraine she needed to fight, to dig deep.

Addison brought the baby to see Claudine, who asked Addison what she'd do in her position. Addison said if she was asking, Claudine could have the baby or Elliott, but not both.

Elliott and Claudine prepared to leave the hospital without talking to Lorraine. Lorraine confronted them and said she wanted the baby. Elliott said it wasn't hers and they'd go to court if necessary. Elliott tried to get Claudine to leave, but she said the baby wasn't hers. It was Lorraine's. She asked Lorraine for forgiveness, but Lorraine said she couldn't. They'd never been what they were before, but she could still be a good aunt to Lorraine's baby. Claudine then handed the baby over to Lorraine.



[[Lorraine (A Step Too Far)|Lorraine]]
Elliott was married to Lorraine for eight years. They split when Lorraine learned that Elliott was having an affair with her sister.

[[Claudine]]
While they were working together caring for Lorraine, Elliott became close with her sister, Claudine, eventually falling in love with her.

'''Emily''' is the sister of [[Sarah Freemont]].


After [[Izzie Stevens]] made a mistake when treating Sarah, she was flown down to Los Angeles to receive a kidney transplant from her sister. Emily couldn't travel to Seattle because she had three small children and her ex-husband is abusive. Emily had been tested as a partial match three years prior. At the time, that wasn't good enough, but since Sarah's condition had declined, they decided to use it. Emily tried to get them to skip the pre-operative tests, but Bailey said they needed to let her rest and get assurances that Sarah was strong enough for the transplant. During the testing, they discovered that Emily was infected with HIV. She was aware of that and hoped they'd still be able to do the transplant because Sarah had no other option. She said she'd rather get AIDS than die. Because of the anti-rejection drugs she'd have to take for the kidney, the doctors believed she had the potential to develop full-blown AIDS quickly.

When Sarah's organs started shutting down, Bailey appealed to Charlotte to do the transplant with Emily's kidney. Charlotte agreed to try to get a team together. Once the team was put together, Bailey asked them all again if they were sure they were willing to participate. [[Tommy (Right Here, Right Now)|One member]] of the team backed out. Without him, Charlotte said the surgery couldn't go on. However, Sam stepped in, saying he'd done a surgical residency, and he'd take the open place.

The surgery went on and Sarah went into pericardial tamponade. Sam did a pericardiocentesis to relieve the pressure, which was successful, allowing them to complete the transplant.



Her ex-husband is abusive, which led to their divorce.


When she left her abusive husband, her sister, Sarah, came to live with her for six months to make sure Emily and her daughters were safe.

Her oldest child is Lily, whom she says has the biggest eyes you've ever seen. She also has two other young children.


*Her blood type is AB+.
*She's a scorpio.

'''Emily Russell''' is the one of the quintuplets born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Emily was part of a quintuplet pregnancy. She was diagnosed in utero with hypoplastic left heart syndrome, meaning she'd need to have surgery shortly after birth. When their mother was  weeks pregnant, she was hospitalized until she was ready to deliver, which she hoped would not be until  weeks. However, she started having contractions at just  weeks. They put her in trendellenberg and put her on magnesium to try to stop the labor. Despite their efforts, her placenta started tearing, forcing them to deliver all five babies at  weeks. ''("[[Much too Much]]")''


After birth, Burke used a catheter to open Emily's atrial septum. Then they planned a surgery to reconstruct the left side of her heart. In surgery, they found that her aorta was narrower than they thought, so they closed without doing anything. Addison decided to use her as a teaching tool for Izzie, so she told Izzie to keep Emily alive overnight, lying that Burke thought she had a chance if she could make it through the next ten hours. Despite Izzie's efforts, Emily died early the next morning. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''



She is part of a set of quintuplets. Their parents also have a set of triplets.


*She was the only Russell quintuplet to die.
*She had the hiccups almost every day in utero.<ref>[[Much too Much]], x</ref>

'''Emily Stinson''' born '''Sarah Stinson''' is a baby who was switched two days after birth with [[Sarah O'Brien]].


When Emily was born, her parents, Duncan and Melinda, named her Sarah. However, when she was two days old, while Duncan was holding her, she had a seizure. He decided to switch his daughter with [[Sarah O'Brien|Emily O'Brien]], who was in the nursery at the same time.

Emily, now being raised by Greg and Beth O'Brien, continued to have serious neurological symptoms. Cooper decided to run some tests, which showed Pelizaneaus-Merzbacher disease. Greg and Beth were told that her symptoms could be treated, but there was no cure. She wouldn't live much beyond the age of five. Because it was genetic, Beth wanted to know if it was possible her sister might carry it because she was trying to get pregnant. However, the tests revealed that Greg and Beth weren't her biological parents. The doctors told them it was possible it was an innocent mixup, but their baby might also have been switched purposely.

They went to Charlotte, who found that only one other African-Amercan girl was in the nursery at the same time, but she refused to give them the name until after speaking with the hospital's lawyers. The hospital's lawyers said she needed to release the information to them. It was Duncan and Melinda, whom Naomi had helped conceive.

She called the Stinsons in and explained the situation to them. They and the O'Briens were told that according to California law, if the blood tests showed that their suspicions were correct, Emily would go live with the Stinsons and Sarah with the O'Briens. The tests confirmed that Emily was the Stinsons' and Sarah was the O'Briens'. Duncan Stinson was angry, saying he wanted his money back, after learning that the other baby in the switch, their baby, was sick. Melinda went to see Violet, saying she could take Sarah and run, but Violet said she wouldn't because Emily was her baby.

After reviewing the visitations records at the hospital, the doctors figured out that Duncan had switched the babies intentionally after Emily had a seizure when she was two days old. Duncan confessed that they'd done it because he wanted a healthy child. Melinda was shocked that he'd given her baby away.

They set up a trade and Melinda gave Sarah to the O'Briens and took Emily with her. Melinda and Beth gave each other tips on their respective babies. When Beth struggled, Melinda encouraged her to look at Sarah and embrace her. Beth slowly looked down at her and said hi. Greg said he thought he couldn't watch Emily die and then found he couldn't watch her leave.



She was born to Duncan and Melinda Stinson, who named her Sarah. However, her father switched her with [[Sarah O'Brien|Emily O'Brien]] when she was two days old and she started living with the O'Briens. Cooper worried about Greg O'Brien's connection to Emily, thinking he was disconnected from his child. When they were nine months old, the girls were switched back and Melinda started to raise Emily alone after Duncan was arrested for switching the girls.


*She hates needles.
