'''Emily Wendel''' is a drug addict who had gotten pregnant several times while on drugs.


Emily came into the ER, with hypertension and early labor. She came in pregnant every  months like clockwork. She had a history of pre-eclampsia and drug use. Each time she came in, they offered her rehab and therapy and long-term birth control options, and when she refused, they offered her $ and in exchange, she'd sign over the rights to the baby. They prepared to do that again.

Addison examined her and said that belay was breech, so she needed to have a c-section. Emily said that she'd gotten clean and had been clean for the entire pregnancy and she wanted to keep the baby, who was healthy, despite not getting prenatal care. She'd given birth four prior times and each kid was disabled. Three were in foster care and one had died.

When Addison came to check on Emily, she said she wanted her tubes tied, but Addison suspected Pete had bribed her. Pete admitted to offering her $ to agree to have her tubes tied.

Addison did her c-section, but didn't tie Emily's tubes. When they told Emily about it, she said she needed the money, so Addison needed to tie her tubes. Violet offered her $ for nothing and then asked if she still wanted her tubes tied. Violet then asked if she'd sign over the baby for the $. Emily said she was healthy, so she was worth $ and agreed to sell her for $. Violet left without paying her.

Addison brought the baby to her. She offered her help with the baby or $ to sign her rights over. She signed the papers and took the money, refusing even to see the baby.


*She likes Pete.

'''Eric Madison''' is the father of [[Jason Madison]].


Eric's son, Jason, was diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia. He'd undergone treatment, but his parents decided to pay $, to use selective IVF to get pregnant with a baby that could give Jason the cord blood transfusion he needed to save his life. In the meantime, they found a partial match to give him a bone marrow transplant. They prepared for the bone marrow transplant, which included killing off Jason's immune system, but the donor developed pneumonia and was unable to donate.

Despite being only  weeks pregnant, Jason's mother begged Addison to deliver the baby immediately so they could use her cord blood to save Jason. Addison refused, saying that their daughter was important and she wasn't willing to risk the baby's life to save Jason's.

Molly came into the hospital with her water broken. They tried to say it just happened, but Addison refused to help them until they told the truth. Molly admitted that she'd broken her own water with a knitting needle. Addison took her into the OR for a c-section. She delivered the baby and the cord blood was harvested for Jason. While he had his transfusion, Addison did liquid ventilation to keep his sister alive. Despite it being only experimental, it was successful and her condition improved. Jason's transfusion was also successful. Molly later thanked Addison and said she did what she had to do to save her family.



He is married to [[Molly Madison]].


His son, Jason, has leukemia. He and his wife had a second child to get cord blood to save his life.

'''Eric Rodriguez''' is an\ua[[Attending|attending]] [[Oncology|oncologist]]\uaat\ua[[St. Ambrose Hospital]].



When Kyla was born with a large tumor on her lung, Eric was called in to consult on the case. He wanted to use chemo, while Addison believed surgery was a better option. Ultimately, the parents chose surgery and Kyla's tumor was completely removed. ''("[[In or Out]]")''


Addison asked Eric for a consult when her mother asked her to cure her lover, Susan, who was suffering from ovarian cancer.\uaHe initially shared her professional opinion that it wasn't treatable, but when Bizzy pushed, Addison figured out she could operated with the [[Da Vinci Surgical System]] and asked Eric to join her and use hot chemo to kill the cells she left behind. He agreed and they were able to remove all the cancer and place a port for chemo. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

When Addison confronted him about Susan being sick, he admitted that he knew her cancer was back, but wanted to give Susan and Bizzy the wedding day they wanted. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''

When Susan was brought back to the hospital after the wedding, they were able to stabilize her, but she was in septic shock because the chemo had made her vulnerable to infection. She ultimately died when she threw a clot in her lung. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''



[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]
Eric had a crush on Addison and flirted openly with her, despite her objections. After they worked on Kyla Woods together, he asked her on a date. She declined because she was seeing Sam. ''("[[In or Out]]")''

When Addison paged him to help her with [[Susan Grant]], he said he thought she'd changed her mind about going out with him, but she said she hadn't. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

He continued to flirt with Addison, even though she repeatedly told him she was in love with Sam. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''


He's from a prominent family in South America. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''


Eric Rodriguez is\uaan\ua[[Attending|attending]]\ua[[Oncology|oncologist]]\uaat\ua[[St. Ambrose Hospital]].

'''Erica Warner''' is the mother of [[Mason Warner]].



Erica had a one-night stand with Cooper in her car and got pregnant. She thought about calling him but she was too scared since she thought it could've been possible Cooper wasn't the father and then they'd been stuck in each other's lives.


One day, Erica approached Cooper at Seaside Health and Wellness, the practice where he works. He initially didn't recognize her. Erica reminded him who she was and showed him Mason, their son. ''("[[Deal With It]]")''

He was shocked and asked if she was sure. When she said she was, Cooper asked why she had come now. Erica said Mason had been asking about him and he was too old to be distracted. She suggested he give Mason a checkup as a start. He impressed Mason with a magic trick. They later hung out at the pier, but Erica told Cooper she wasn't ready for Mason to know that Cooper was his father.


Charlotte, unconvinced that Erica was telling the truth, met up with her and wrote her a check, telling her to come to her again if she needed more money, but to stay away from Cooper. Erica was supposed to bring Mason to see Cooper that night, but she didn't show up. She came in the next day, giving Cooper the check back and saying she wasn't a whore. Cooper told her that he didn't do it and said he'd make it right. A paternity test confirmed that Cooper was Mason's biological father. ''("[[Remember Me]]")''


After the incident with Charlotte, Erica decided to set ground rules for the time they spent together. She said Charlotte wasn't allowed around Mason and she didn't want Cooper to tell Mason he was his father. In order to get to see him, those were her conditions. The three of them went fishing together and Mason asked Cooper if he was dating Erica. Cooper said he wasn't.

Mason decided he didn't want to keep seeing Cooper. When Cooper talked to him later, Mason asked if Cooper was his dad. Mason said they couldn't be friends if he was not going to be around, like the other guys. They told Mason Cooper was his dad and Cooper said he wasn't going anywhere. ''("[[Step One]]")''

As Mason and Cooper bonded, Erica maintained that she didn't want Mason to be around Charlotte. When she came to pick Mason up at the end of the day and found Charlotte there, she was upset and left abruptly. She later came to see Cooper and said that she had realized that Charlotte wasn't a bad person. ''("[[Don't Stop 'Till You Get Enough]]")''


Mason had a part in James and the Giant Peach at his school. Cooper helped him rehearse and promised to go see the show. Erica was working backstage with the kids on costumes. When Cooper had to miss the play to take care of a patient, she told him he covered well, but he didn't believe her. ''("[[The Breaking Point]]")''


She and Mason went to Thanksgiving dinner at Addison's house along with the other doctors in the practice. ''("[[The Breaking Point]]")''


Erica visited Cooper and Mason, who were drinking milkshakes in the practice's kitchen. Amelia, who was also in the kitchen, noticed Erica's hand shaking. Erica picked up a milkshake glass and suddenly dropped it due to the weakness in her hand.

This made Amelia suspicious. She stitched up Erica's cut finger and offered to give Erica a neuro work up, but she refused. Amelia told Charlotte about her suspicions, so Charlotte called a clinic Erica had been to recently and had them courier over her most recent brain scan, which revealed that she had a massive gliosarcoma.

When confronted by Charlotte, Erica admitted that she had gone to numerous surgeons, all of whom had determined the tumor to be inoperable. Erica didn't want to tell Cooper, but after Charlotte pressured her, she did. ''("[[The Standing Eight Count]]")''

Cooper had papers drawn up to ensure that if Erica died, Mason would go to Cooper. Erica was reluctant to sign it. Cooper figured out she hadn't reached acceptance, which meant she still had hope. He told her not to waste it. She agreed to see Amelia to look into options. Amelia did new tests and said that the best they could do was aggressive radiation therapy and chemotherapy to slow the growth. It could give her about six months and it would be rough. She decided she didn't want to try it, but Cooper said that without it, she'd miss Mason's next birthday. It's not much time, but another birthday with his mom would mean a lot to Mason. Erica went to Amelia and asked if she'd do chemotherapy and radiation if she were in Erica's shoes. Amelia admitted that she wouldn't do the treatment. Erica took the paperwork back to Cooper and said they'd sign it tomorrow. Cooper was upset that she was giving up. ''("[[Losing Battles]]")''


Soon after that, Erica and Mason were brought to the ER after being in a car accident. She was disoriented after the accident and Mason said she'd fallen asleep at the wheel. Amelia ran tests and determined that the likely cause of the accident was a seizure caused by the tumor. She warned that Erica only had a few months to live and her symptoms would get worse during that time. When Mason came to visit her later, she had a tonic clonic seizure in front of him. Cooper later went to Erica and asked her to fight. ''("[[The Time Has Come]]")''


Erica started chemotherapy and refused to let Mason come in to see her during her treatments. Amelia did research into gliosarcomas during this time, trying to figure out another option for Erica. She found an experimental treatment in New Zealand, but Erica said she wouldn't go because it would mean leaving Mason. Amelia did more research and suggested instead that they go to Seattle, where Derek would help her. ''("[[Too Much]]")''


After Amelia and Derek practiced the procedure and felt confident they could do it, Erica came to Seattle to have surgery the next morning. She wanted to spend one more day with Mason first. As they played football in the park, Erica started to cry and she finally told Mason she was sick and needed to have surgery.

The next day, they successfully cut off and restored blood flow within the required  seconds, but Erica threw a clot and had a stroke. Despite that, they were able to remove her whole tumor and finish her surgery. She woke up after surgery in pain, but able to move her fingers and toes. ''("[[You Break My Heart]]")''


While Erica was weak and recovering from her surgery, Cooper tried to be there with her and Mason every night, but it started affecting his ability to do his job, so Charlotte hired a night nurse to stay overnight and take care of Erica. ''("[[Andromeda]]")''


Not long after the surgery, Erica was in severe abdominal pain and began to vomit blood. She was rushed to the ER where it was determined that the gliosarcoma had spread to her liver, GI tract, and near her spine. She was told she had about a week to live, during which she'd develop paralysis and be in serious pain. She didn't want Mason to be there to watch that happen, so they brought him in to say goodbye for the last time. Charlotte went to see her afterward to see if there was anyone she wanted Charlotte to call. When Erica said she didn't have anyone, Charlotte held her hand and told her that wasn't true. ''("[[The Letting Go]]")''

Erica's condition continued to decline with Charlotte by her side. She continued to refuse to see Mason. When the time came that she had only minutes to live, Erica relented and Charlotte rushed to bring Mason to Erica's bedside. Mason arrived in time and climbed into Erica's bed and hugged her until she died. ''("[[It Was Inevitable]]")''



Mason mentioned that Erica had had some boyfriends, but they all left her at some point.


[[Mason Warner]]
Erica was a loving mother to Mason. She wanted to protect Mason from everything, even keeping her tumor a secret from him. When he found out that she was sick, he was very upset. However, he forgave her when she was on her deathbed.

She originally didn't want Mason to see her dying because she cared so much about him. Charlotte convinced her that Mason would never get closure if he didn't see his mother one last time, so Erica allowed him to come into her hospital room. She died as he held her in a hug.

[[Cooper Freedman]]
Erica and Cooper had a one-night stand in her car. The result of this night was Erica getting pregnant with their son, [[Mason Warner|Mason]]. Years later, Erica searched for Cooper so he could start to be Mason's father, as she had been diagnosed with an inoperable gliosarcoma.


[[Charlotte King]]
When Charlotte was suspicious that Erica was lying about Cooper being Mason's father, she was very mean to Erica. She even sent her a check for Erica to go away and never talk to Cooper again.


She was a bartender when she and Cooper first met.


*She once spat on a six year old for spitting on then three year old Mason.<ref>[[Don't Stop 'Till You Get Enough]], x (PP)</ref>
*She liked to party before she had Mason.<ref>[[Remember Me]], x (PP)</ref>
*She talks like Yoda when she is stressed.

'''Erin George''' is the mother of [[Tanya George]].


Erin brought her daughter, Tanya, into the practice. She was worried because she'd caught Tanya having sex with [[Ricky (Two Steps Back)|Ricky]], a classmate of hers who also had special needs. Tanya had been complaining of stomach pains, so her mother asked Sam to run a pregnancy test. He did an ultrasound, which revealed that she was pregnant.

Her mother was worried she would be unable to carry a pregnancy safely because of her heart problems, but Sam said it would be high-risk, but not impossible. Erin then asked about how Tanya and Ricky would manage raising a child, especially if the baby also had special needs. The baby had a % chance of having Down syndrome. Erin said she loved Tanya, but she didn't know if she could raise another child with Down syndrome. She felt aborting the baby was the only option she had. Naomi suggested CVS before doing that, so she'd know if the baby was healthy or had Down syndrome. Erin agreed to let her run the test.

They did the CVS and Ricky came into the room just after they finished. Erin then decided to tell Ricky and Tanya about the pregnancy. They were both excited about it. Erin said that despite their excitement, she couldn't trust them with the baby, so she'd have to baby. She then told Ricky and Tanya they didn't get to have the baby for sure.

Naomi got the results of Tanya's CVS back, but Erin wasn't answering the phone, so Naomi and Sam drove over to her house. Naomi told Erin the baby didn't have Down syndrome or any other abnormalities, but Erin said that she'd taken Tanya for an abortion that morning.



Her daughter has Down syndrome. Because of this, she stayed home with her to raise her.

'''Erin Merring''' is one of the four sisters who repeatedly turned blue. She was the first to become sick.


Erin came to the practice with her mother when her skin turned cornflower blue. After looking for possible causes, Cooper found out that Erin had recently had her first ever cavity filled at the dentist and believed the dental drugs had reacted with the hemoglobin in her blood, which had turned her blue. He gave her methylene blue to make her pink again and sent her home. However, she came back and was blue again, along with her three sisters.

After giving them all methylene blue, Cooper went to their house to look for environment poisons, but found nothing. While he was there, Erin had a seizure and had to rushed to the hospital. Desperate to find an answer, Cooper went back to the house and pretended to be a princess with Becky, Kim, and Sasha, and they led him to their castle, which was a shed that had bags of fertilizer with ammonium nitrate in it, which was poisoning them.



Erin is very close with her three sisters. The four of them play princesses, which included going into a castle together. They rarely speak to adults.

'''Esau Ajawke''' is a patient who contracted tuberculosis and was deported because of it.


Esau's fianc\uee, Elisha, was pregnant and at the practice for an ultrasound. The baby had a heart defect which would require multiple surgeries after he was born. Esau was an immigrant and his visa had expired, so he got a physical so he could apply for his green card.

Esau's chest x-ray revealed that he had tuberculosis, so he was taken to the hospital. Esau pleaded with Sam not to tell Immigration that he was sick because they would send him back if they knew. When Sam said he had an obligation to send it in, Elisha said they'd just go back to Kenya and live with Esau's parents there, but she was told that with her baby's heart condition, he wouldn't be able to get the care he needs there.

The tests showed that Esau's tuberculosis was MDR, which meant it was drug resistant. They went to put him in isolation, but found his bed empty because he and Elisha had left.

Addison and Sam tried to find them, but weren't successful. Esau and Elisha returned to the hospital when Elisha went into labor. Esau wanted to go with her, but Sam said he needed to go back to isolation. [[Agent Jones]] from Immigration arrived to take Esau, but Sam said his oxygen levels had dropped and he needed to stay in the hospital. Agent Jones said they'd wait until he was stable. This gave them the time for him to meet his son before Immigration took him away.



He is engaged to [[Elisha]].


His parents live in Kenya.

His son was born with a serious heart condition that required multiple surgeries.


*He loves Elvis Presley.

'''Evan Arnold''' is a patient who was injured in a car accident and was diagnosed with HIV in the hospital.


Evan was in a car accident with [[Jacob Deever]]. He wasn't wearing a seatbelt, so he had more serious injuries. In the hospital, he was recognized as a male prostitute. His injuries were treated and he stayed in the hospital to recover.

When Jacob tested positive for HIV, they asked Evan if he always uses condoms with his tricks and he said he did, but when he found out they were asking because of Jacob, he said that Jacob was his boyfriend, not a trick.

Evan went with Jacob to tell his wife that he was gay and had HIV. She said she always knew he was gay and told Evan to take care of him. However, when she learned that Jacob had exposed her to HIV, she slapped him and left.



He is dating [[Jacob Deever]].


He is a prostitute.

'''Evan Dawson''' is a kid who went on the run with his father.



A kid calling himself Porter came in to see Cooper for an exam. He had diabetes, so Cooper took his blood sugar level and it was . He said that his insulin pump got clogged sometimes, but his dad fixed it. They'd been on the road for the last five weeks. Cooper checked out his insulin pump and found that it was infected. Cooper asked him about keeping it clean, but he said they were sleeping in the car, which made it difficult to keep the area clean.

Cooper gave him a prescription for antibiotics, but also told his father he'd need a new insulin pump. Cooper said that that would take a few days, but Frank said that he needed to get to Oregon in order to keep a job he'd gotten. Cooper talked to him and said that he needed to wait for his kid's well being. Cooper ran the serial number on Porter's pump and found that it was registered to Evan Dawson. When Cooper called the doctor who placed it, he found out that Evan had been kidnapped. Cooper called Frank and Porter back to the practice, saying he needed to run a few more tests. Once alone with Porter, Cooper asked him about it. Evan then confessed that he and his father had run away because his mom's boyfriend, who was living with her, had started to hit him and his father was the only person who believed him. Evan then had a seizure due to low blood sugar. He was rushed to the hospital and a new pump was placed. However, the hospital also ran the number on his old pump and found that he had been kidnapped and called the police. However, Cooper gave them a heads up and sent them out of the hospital with some supplies to keep them going for a while. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")''


When [[Lynn Jarvey]] came to the practice looking for her son, Cooper said he didn't know where Evan was. However, he met up with Evan and his father in the park and examined him and drew some blood for tests. Cooper told Frank about Lynn coming to see him, but said they didn't need to run, but to be careful.

Cooper was arrested for helping them and the detective showed Cooper a call log that showed that Lynn received a call from Evan asking her to stop looking for him so his dad and Cooper didn't get in trouble. Since he was in jail, Cooper sent Charlotte to get Evan's labs and give him antibiotics for his kidney infection.

At a grand jury hearing, Cooper refused to answer questions about where Evan and Frank were. A judge offered him immunity in exchange for telling where they were. When he again refused, he was held in contempt without bail.

Charlotte picked up Evan's labs and took antibiotics to him. However, the police found them, tipped off by Addison, and arrested Frank and returned Evan to his mother. Evan later came into the ER saying that Ted had stabbed him, but Charlotte and Sam observed that he had intention marks meaning he'd do it himself. He said that he thought it would force them to release his father from jail. Charlotte said they needed to find real evidence to put Ted in jail. Evan then admitted that he'd made it up to try to keep his parents together, but his mother didn't believe him and his father did. And once he'd started, he didn't know how to stop.

Lynn dropped the charges and Frank was then released from jail. ''("[[Sins of the Father]]")''



Evan ran off with his father at the age of  being he claimed that his mom's boyfriend was hitting him and the only person to believe him was his father.


*He was  at the time of his infection, but  when he was reunited with his mother.
*He likes The Three Musketeers. He chose his fake name, Porter, based on his favorite musketeer:\uaPorthos.<ref>[[Worlds Apart]], x (PP)</ref>

}}
'''Evan Olsen''' is one of a polyamorous triad that wanted to have a baby via assisted reproduction.


Evan came in with [[Kendra Templeton]] and [[Rose Filmore]]. Rose and Kendra said they'd been together for six years and they were ready to have a baby. Evan was there to be the sperm donor. They wanted to use Rose's egg, but have Kendra carry so they could both be part of the experience. Jake consulted with them and then insisted that they sit down with Violet before proceeding because they were using a known donor, so that everyone would know what the expectations and limitations were.

They sat down with Violet, who asked Evan what he saw his role as. He said he'd donate the sperm, put together the crib, and then be the cool uncle. Violet questioned what would happen when the baby got a little older and he disagreed with a parenting decision. Her insistence on the truth pressed the three of them to admit that they were a polyamorous triad and planned to raise the baby together. Violet reminded them that they'd have to raise the child in the real world, which wouldn't be as accepting of their family as they were. They believed that they had enough love that they could it through.

Rose and Kendra went in to be examined before starting the process. Kendra's exam was unremarkable, but Rose was informed that she had uterine scarring and ovarian failure secondary to pelvic tuberculosis, making her completely infertile. However, Jake said that Kendra and Evan would not likely have trouble conceiving without assistance if they want. Rose quickly backed out of the pursuit for a baby, saying that they couldn't do it if they couldn't all be part of it.

Kendra and Evan saw Violet without Rose, saying they didn't understand the problem. Violet explained Rose's point of view on them sharing something she wasn't part of. They wanted to fix it, so Violet suggested a compromise.

Rose went to Jake asking if there was anything he could do to make her able to participate. He said that many women come to him unable to conceive and he still finds a way to make them mothers. She was worried a baby would change everything. He said that if the love were real, it could withstand anything, but admitted he didn't actually believe that. Love's powerful, but sometimes life wins.

Rose went to Kendra and Evan and said she wanted a baby, but not that way. Despite that, she said she loved them and agreed to trust them and have them conceive together. Evan agreed, but Kendra said she couldn't do it. She said the reason they worked was because of the rules. They needed unanimous to avoid someone getting hurt. She said they could have a baby another way, but given the choice, she chose the three of them. Evan said it wasn't trivial. He wanted a biological child and wasn't sure he could choose the relationship above that.



He's been seeing Kendra and Rose for six years. They said the first night was amazing and so was the next morning and the morning after that. To make the relationship work, they had very strict rules to follow, including one that stated all decisions had to be unanimous so no one felt ganged up on. Rose's infertility threatened their relationship, leaving their future together in question.


Evan says he grew up in a family with a lot of commitment, but not a lot of love.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Olsen, Evan}}

'''Mark''' is Naomi and Sam's priest who called them when a nun got seriously ill.


Mark called the practice asking that Naomi and Sam come to see him as soon as possible. When they arrived, he told them that one of the nuns, Sister Helen, was sick. They'd been sequestered together for three weeks. Naomi examined Helen and found a rash on her abdomen. They took a picture of her rash and sent it to Dell to try to identify it. In the meantime, they decided to send Helen out to the hospital. However, before she could be taken, the illness quickly spread and they decided to lock down the place while waiting for St. Ambrose to prepare an isolation unit for them. The infectious disease specialist came back with a diagnosis of typhus. They started antibiotics for all the nuns and started asking if anyone had broken sequester, because the incubation period for typhus is two weeks. No one would admit to anything, but Sam and Naomi watched Mark give the sacrament of the sick and began to suspect that there was more to their relationship than he had said. They went to him and said they wanted to test him as a typhus carrier. He admitted to them that he would sneak into the convent at night and they would cook together. They said they'd start him on antibiotics.



He was very fond of Sister Helen. He would sneak into the convent at night so they could cook together, but he says they never crossed the line and got physical. When she was away, he said he looked forward to his return because he missed her.


Sam and Naomi Bennett are members of his congregation.


He is a Catholic priest. Sam and Naomi are part of his congregation.


*He couldn't cook until Sister Helen taught him.

'''Fillmore "Dink" Davis''' is the husband of [[Maya Bennett]] and the father of [[Olivia Davis]].



He met his girlfriend, Maya's, mother when she caught them together skipping school. He then met her father when Maya threw a party at her father's house. ''("[[The Parent Trap]]")''


When Sam and Naomi found out that Maya was pregnant, Sam went to the basketball court and confronted Dink, saying that Dink should have been more scared of him. Dink was shocked to learn that Maya was pregnant because he hadn't known that. He told Sam he loved Maya. ''("[[Best Laid Plans]]")''


He got married to Maya while Maya was pregnant. ''("[['Til Death Do Us Part]]")''


Dink came to the hospital when he heard Maya was in labor. However, when he arrived, he learned that Maya had been in a car accident. When he was told he'd have to choose what he wanted because he was Maya's husband, he said that he didn't know how to choose because he was still just a kid and he loved both Maya and the baby. After Maya had surgery and the baby was delivered, he held his newborn daughter in his wife's hospital room. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''


After Olivia was born, Maya moved in with Naomi, who helped her take care of Olivia. When Sam found that out, he confronted Dink, saying he needed to step up and take care of Olivia. Dink said he wanted to help, but Naomi wasn't letting him do anything. Sam got him to understand that he needed to stand up to Naomi and sent him home to take care of his family. He stood up to Naomi and started taking care of Olivia. ''("[[Take Two]]")''


When Maya was accepted to Columbia and decided to go, the family moved to New York. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")''



[[Maya Bennett]]
Maya had a crush on Dink before starting to date him. ''("[[The Parent Trap]]")''

After learning that Maya was pregnant, Dink and Maya discussed it and decided they wanted to get married. Dink then went to Sam to ask his permission. When they discussed the wedding later, Dink told Naomi that he wouldn't walk away. Sam agreed to sign the consent form, even though Naomi refused. ''("[[Shotgun]]")''

[[File:PPx-.jpg|thumb|px|Dink and Maya get married.]]
The two prepared for the wedding and got married. ''("[['Til Death Do Us Part]]")''

When Maya was in labor, Dink goes immediately to the hospital, only to learn that Maya is caught in a car accident. He worried about her and the baby, but both were saved by Addison and Amelia. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''


*He's in a band. ''("[[The Parent Trap]]")''
*He made a mix tape for Maya to give birth to. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")''

'''Finn Dandridge''' is a vet and the former love interest of [[Meredith Grey]].



Finn's mother was diagnosed with cancer when he was  and when she died, his father stopped caring and would only lie down in front of the television with a bottle of scotch. ''("[[Damage Case]]")''


Derek brought [[Doc]] to Finn's office when he became sick. ''("[[The Name of the Game]]")''

Finn ran some tests and sent Doc home while he waited for the results. Derek came and took him home, but brought him back that evening as he'd been listless and hadn't eaten all day. ''("[[Blues for Sister Someone]]")''

The tests came back and showed that Doc had bone cancer. Finn said he still needed to do more testing to see how far it had spread. He gave them treatment options, but Derek said it might be better to put him to sleep, so he wouldn't suffer. After consulting with [[Callie Torres]] on bone cancer, Meredith asked Finn to tell her the truth. He said that best case is the Doc had a year left, but he wasn't the best case. ''("[[ Seconds]]")''

The next day, Finn told Meredith that Doc had had some seizures. The cancer had spread to his brain and there was nothing Finn could do. ''("[[Losing My Religion]]")''


Finn came to the hospital prom after being invited by Meredith. However, during the prom, she left the area and had sex with Derek in an exam room. When Finn said he'd drive Meredith home, she was stuck looking between him and Derek. ''("[[Losing My Religion]]")''


Finn came to Meredith's house to see her. He spent some time chatting with Callie when Meredith left the room to avoid him. ''("[[Time Has Come Today]]")''


Finn came to the house one day. He was shocked to see Meredith as he thought she'd be at work. He'd stopped by to bring Izzie lunch. ''("[[I Am a Tree]]")''


When Meredith was hospitalized with appendicitis, Finn came to visit her. However, after her surgery, she broke things off with him. ''("[[What I Am]]")''



Liz Dandridge
His wife, Liz, died in a car accident. ''("[[Damage Case]]")''

He said that after she died, there wasn't anything anyone could say that would help, but bringing food actually did help. ''("[[I Am a Tree]]")''

His wife hated that he fished as much as he did. ''("[[What I Am]]")''

[[Meredith Grey]]
[[File:FinnandDerek.png|thumb|px|Finn and Derek meet Meredith at Joe's bar.|left]]
Finn met Meredith when she came to his office to sit with [[Doc]] while he was there after getting sick. ''("[[The Name of the Game]]")''

Finn asked Meredith out for a date. She initially declined, but later showed up at his practice after closing. She said she'd like to go on a date, but he hesitated. She thought it meant he wasn't interested anymore, but he said he just had an errand to run, but invited her to come along. She went with him and watched as he birthed a horse. He then invited her to come up to his place so he could cook her dinner. She was reluctant, but ultimately went upstairs with him on the condition that they wouldn't be having sex. ''("[[Blues for Sister Someone]]")''

They continued to see each other, including Finn making Meredith breakfast. When he asked her about the last guy she dated, she fled. At that point, they'd been on four dates and hadn't yet kissed. Meredith later said he didn't want to get involved with her, saying she was scary and damaged and he didn't want to get into that. He revealed that he had his own share of damage and they shared a kiss. ''("[[Damage Case]]")''

He and Meredith went to the hospital prom together. However, she left the prom and had sex with Derek in an exam room. At the end of the night, when Finn offered to drive her home, she was stuck looking between the two of them. ''("[[Losing My Religion]]")''

The day after the prom, Finn came to Meredith's house to see her, but she made an excuse about checking on Izzie to avoid him. When she came back in, he said he didn't know what happened the previous night and didn't want to know. He then said if there was a ring, his hat was in. ''("[[Time Has Come Today]]")''

Meredith thought she had chosen Derek, but when Finn showed up at the house to bring Izzie lunch without knowing that Meredith was even there, she saw how great Finn was and thought she might pick him. Unable to make a decision, she called both of them to the bar where she told them that she planned to date both of them to consider her options. ''("[[I Am a Tree]]")''

Finn stopped by the hospital to bring Meredith coffee cake and invite her to dinner. However, she already had dinner plans with Derek, so they settled on lunch at the hospital instead. They had lunch, but were interrupted by Derek offering Meredith a surgery. That night, Finn stopped by the house to bring Meredith homemade strawberry ice cream made by one of his patients. He bickered with Derek, who came home with Meredith. Meredith yelled at them, saying she wanted to be wooed. ''("[[Sometimes a Fantasy]]")''

When Meredith needed an appendectomy, Finn came to visit her. He waited in her room while she was in surgery. After her surgery, Derek told Meredith he was walking away and letting her be with Finn. Despite this, Meredith told Finn that Derek was the one. He said Derek would only hurt her again and when he did, Finn wouldn't be there waiting. ''("[[What I Am]]")''


Finn is a veterinarian who takes care of all types of animals. He treated [[Doc]], Meredith, Derek, and Addison's dog. On his and Meredith's first date, he had to run some errands, which consisted of him birthing a horse while Meredith helped. After Finn realized Doc had gotten bone cancer, he was the one to put him down. 


*The interns gave him the nickname "[["Mc" Labeling|McVet]]", in accordance with Derek Shepherd's nickname, [["Mc" Labeling|McDreamy]].
*He was prom king in high school.<ref>[[Losing My Religion]], x</ref>
*He fishes as much as he can.<ref>[[What I Am]], x</ref>
*He is said to make famous lasagna.<ref>[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]</ref>
*His wife died in a car crash.
*[[Debbie|Debbie's]] cat, Skittles, was one of his patients.<ref>[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]</ref>

'''Frances''' was a patient of [[Sam Bennett|Sam]].


Henry came to Oceanside Wellness for a check up from Sam, but as Frances had Alzheimer's, he was unable to leave her alone. When [[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]] came to greet them, Frances mistook Naomi for Helen, her sister, and so Naomi pretended to be Helen to keep Frances happy while Henry saw Sam.

Following the appointment at the practice, Frances was admitted to the [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] [[Emergency Room|ER]] after falling and hitting her head as Henry tried to her get out of the tub. While looking over Frances's notes in the ER, Naomi noticed Frances wasn't given a [[Computed Tomography|CT]] scan prior to the diagnosis of Alzheimer's, Henry stating that her doctor said she didn't require any more tests. Back at the practice, Naomi did some research and diagnosed her with normal-pressure hydrocephalus. Sam pointed out Frances was not a candidate for neurosurgery, but Naomi pulled up another study claiming that a spinal tap to drain away excess cerebrospinal fluid could give Frances a few moments of lucidity, and Naomi wanted that so she could see how bad things were for Henry.

[[Sam Bennett|Sam]] performed the spinal tap at [[St. Ambrose Hospital|St. Ambrose]], and while waiting for Frances to wake up, Henry recalled their last moments together the last time she was lucid: Frances was shivering, and Henry asked if she wanted him to turn the heat up and he did, and when he returned, she didn't know who he was. Following this, Frances woke up lucid. Naomi quickly explained the situation, and had him promise her that he would visit her every day and hold her hand, and then let her go.



Frances has a husband, Henry. They have been married for almost  years. After she was diagnosed with Alzheimer's, he provided round the clock care for her as he promised her he would never put her in a home. This put a lot of stress on Henry and they did a spinal tap to give Frances a few lucid moments to tell Henry to put her in a nursing home.


Frances had one sister, Helen. At the time of her health issues, Helen had passed away "a few years ago." She believed that Naomi was Helen.

'''Frances Wilder''' was the mother of [[Pete Wilder]].



When Pete was a teen, she dated a man named Henry. Henry was good to Pete and Adam and wanted to marry Frances, but during a fight, Frances stabbed Henry to death. ''("[[All in the Family]]")''


Frances had served  years in prison for manslaughter when Adam went to Pete to try to repair their relationship. Pete went to see Frances, but saw that she didn't have any condition that would merit compassionate release. He went to Sam and asked him to lie and get Frances released. Sam offered to lie for him, but Pete spoke to his mother and decided he couldn't go through with it after hearing that his mother didn't feel bad for killing Henry or anything else about Pete's childhood. ''("[[Can't Find My Way Back Home]]")''


Frances came into the ER with an arrhythmia. Sam put in a temporary pacemaker in the ER to stabilize her. She'd been released from prison the previous week after developing congestive heart failure. When questioned, Adam admitted to bribing a guard to give her digoxin. When they learned that, they rushed to reverse the drug's effects.

Violet visited Frances' room. Frances asked Violet to get Pete to visit her. She needed Pete to forgive her before she died. Violet talked to Pete about forgiving Frances, but he said he couldn't. However, he brought Lucas to visit her. He talked about the love he felt for Lucas and wondered how she didn't feel that love. She said it was because of the drinking and the drugs. She asked if it was too late to start over. He introduced Lucas to her. Sam then informed Pete that the damage to her heart was extensive and she would die soon. Pete and Adam sat by her bedside as she died. ''("[[The Hardest Part]]")''



When Pete was a teen, Frances dated a man named Henry, whom Pete says is the first good man that he knew. Henry wanted to marry Frances, but they once had a fight that ended with Frances stabbing Henry to death. ''("[[All in the Family]]")''

Prior to Henry, she had multiple partners, to the point where Pete has no idea who his father is.


While Adam has stuck by her side and defended her actions, Pete resented his mother for killing the only man he ever felt was a good role model for him.


*She was  at the time of her death.

'''Frank''' is the husband of [[Isabelle]].


Frank's wife, Isabelle, was pregnant with a baby who had been diagnosed with hypoplastic left-heart syndrome. Addison looked at all the scans and said that neither fetal surgery nor neonatal surgery was an option for her, but Isabelle and Frank had another idea. They had conceived the baby with their last embryo and Isabelle didn't have any eggs left, so they wanted to harvest their baby's eggs to use to become parents.

Isabelle and Frank came into the practice to try to convince Addison to do the surgery. She said they had other options to be parents, such as adoption, but Isabelle said she needed to be a parent to a baby she carried herself. Addison agreed to do the surgery, but only after the baby was born, so she wouldn't have to cut into Isabelle's uterus.

When Isabelle went into labor, Addison went to the hospital to deliver the baby. The cord prolapsed, so Addison rushed her into surgery for a c-section.

After the baby was born, Addison asked Frank and Isabelle if they'd thought about a name, but they were just interested in how soon she could do the surgery and didn't want to meet her at all.

Addison brought the baby to see them, saying that they wanted to be parents and this was their chance. They said they didn't want to bond with her because they didn't want to have to grieve. Addison said that was inevitable and they finally held the baby until she died.



He is married to [[Isabelle]]. They've been together for over  years.

'''Frank Dawson''' is the father of [[Evan Dawson]].


Frank came into the practice with a kid calling himself Porter. Porter was examined by Cooper. He had diabetes, so Cooper took his blood sugar level and it was . He said that his insulin pump got clogged sometimes, but his dad fixed it. They'd been on the road for the last five weeks. Cooper checked out his insulin pump and found that it was infected. Cooper asked him about keeping it clean, but he said they were sleeping in the car, which made it difficult to keep the area clean.

Cooper gave him a prescription for antibiotics, but also told his father he'd need a new insulin pump. Cooper said that that would take a few days, but Frank said that he needed to get to Oregon in order to keep a job he'd gotten. Cooper talked to him and said that he needed to wait for his kid's well being. Cooper ran the serial number on Porter's pump and found that it was registered to Evan Dawson. When Cooper called the doctor who placed it, he found out that Evan had been kidnapped. Cooper called Frank and Porter back to the practice, saying he needed to run a few more tests. Once alone with Porter, Cooper asked him about it. Evan then confessed that he and his father had run away because his mom's boyfriend, who was living with her, had started to hit him and his father was the only person who believed him. Evan then had a seizure due to low blood sugar. He was rushed to the hospital and a new pump was placed. However, the hospital also ran the number on his old pump and found that he had been kidnapped and called the police. However, Cooper gave them a heads up and sent them out of the hospital with some supplies to keep them going for a while. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")''


When [[Lynn Jarvey]] came to the practice looking for her son, Cooper said he didn't know where Evan was. However, he met up with Evan and his father in the park and examined him and drew some blood for tests. Cooper told Frank about Lynn coming to see him, but said they didn't need to run, but to be careful.

Cooper was arrested for helping them and the detective showed Cooper a call log that showed that Lynn received a call from Evan asking her to stop looking for him so his dad and Cooper didn't get in trouble. Since he was in jail, Cooper sent Charlotte to get Evan's labs and give him antibiotics for his kidney infection.

At a grand jury hearing, Cooper refused to answer questions about where Evan and Frank were. A judge offered him immunity in exchange for telling where they were. When he again refused, he was held in contempt without bail.

Charlotte picked up Evan's labs and took antibiotics to him. However, the police found them, tipped off by Addison, and arrested Frank and returned Evan to his mother. Evan later came into the ER saying that Ted had stabbed him, but Charlotte and Sam observed that he had intention marks meaning he'd do it himself. He said that he thought it would force them to release his father from jail. Charlotte said they needed to find real evidence to put Ted in jail. Evan then admitted that he'd made it up to try to keep his parents together, but his mother didn't believe him and his father did. And once he'd started, he didn't know how to stop.

Lynn dropped the charged and Frank was then released from jail. ''("[[Sins of the Father]]")''



He was married to [[Lynn Jarvey]]. They had one son together and then divorced.


He is very protective of his son, Evan, even kidnapping him when he believed he was being abused.

'''Frank Kimble''' is a fire captain who wore lingerie to cope with panic attacks.


Frank, a fire captain, was having panic attacks due to the trauma of several close calls with fires. He was seeing Pete, who gave him herbs and he'd done acupuncture and exercised. However, Frank revealed to Pete that what really helped him was wearing bras. He was worried about how the other firefighters would react if they found out, so he asked Pete to help him stop.

Frank and Pete worked on reducing Frank's panic without using the panties. He felt that the other firefighters wouldn't trust him anymore if they found out and he'd almost been caught twice before.

Pete was later paged to the hospital when Frank was burned in a fire. He had partial-thickness burns, but refused to let anyone but Pete touch him. Pete began to treat his burns, but he was shocked when his co-workers came to see him and saw his bra. He told Pete he was done. Pete said he'd be up and around in a few weeks, but Frank maintained that he was quitting. Pete said there was nothing wrong with his coping mechanism. He agreed to go to therapy, but still said he was done. Pete said that if it were him, he wouldn't care what Frank was wearing as long as he got him out alive. He also encouraged Frank to share the burden of his stress with others.


Frank is a fire captain. He'd faced several very serious fires, which gave him a lot of stress.

{{Patient Infobox |image = PPx-.jpg |name = Gabi Rivera |status = Alive |treatment = Grief counseling |marital = Ex-husband |job = Writer |workplace = '''Former'''
National Geographic |first appearance = [[Good Grief]] |last appearance = [[Life Support]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Marianne Jean-Baptiste]] }} '''Gabi Rivera''' is a woman Violet met at her grief group. Gabi was in a grief group. She talked about Ally, her partner. Two doctors said she was brain dead and a third told her not to give up hope. She struggled with the idea of turning off life support, wondering how she'd know that the next day wouldn't be the one where Ally woke up. Ally never gave up on anything, so why should she give up on her? ''("[[Good Grief]]")'' Violet later saw Gabi at the hospital on the way to grief group. She said she visited Ally every day to tell her she loved her. They then decided together not to go to grief group and instead spent the time together. A couple weeks later, Gabi and Violet had coffee on a bench. Gabi talked about how she was already starting to forget things about Ally. She couldn't remember the name of the restaurant where they met. She said as long as a chance existed for Ally to wake up, she couldn't give up and the doctors couldn't agree on a possible timeline. Violet asked Amelia to check on Ally for her. Amelia looked at her scans and said that Ally had no activity and wouldn't be waking up ever. Gabi came in and interrupted them. When Violet introduced Amelia, Gabi asked them to leave. Violet went to Gabi and admitted she'd overstepped. She wanted to help because Gabi's her friend. Two doctors had already told her what Amelia told her months ago, but she couldn't accept it, so she went to a psychic, which she knows is ridiculous. But the psychic said there was hope. She was worried no one would ever love her like Ally did again. Violet admitted to being relieved when Pete died. Gabi said she wasn't relieved and just wanted Ally back. A few weeks later, with Violet's help, Gabi decided to turn off the machines and allow Ally to die. ''("[[Life Support]]")'' Ex-Husband She was married to a wonderful man for . years. She says he was her best friend, but she didn't know there could be more until she met Ally. Ally She met her girlfriend, Ally, in Mexico. Gabi was writing for National Geographic and Ally was taking the pictures. ''("[[Life Support]]")'' She once did a three-week cleanse with Ally. Two days in, Gabi was eating cookies, but Ally finished it. ''("[[Good Grief]]")'' They were together for ten years when Ally was left brain dead. Gabi struggled to accept this and refused to give up hope that Ally would wake up. She and [[Violet Turner]] became friends after meeting in a grief group. She used to write for National Geographic. ''("[[Life Support]]")'' PPxGabiRivera.png|[[Good Grief]] PPxGabiRivera.png|[[Life Support]] PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg {{Gabi Rivera Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rivera, Gabi}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Psych)]]

{{Attending Infobox |image = PPx-.jpg |name = Gabriel Fife |status = Alive |title = M.D. |marital = [[Naomi Bennett]] ''(ex-fianc\uee)'' |job = [[Attending]] [[Medical Genetics|Medical Geneticist]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[National Institutes of Health]]
'''Former'''
[[Pacific Wellcare Center]] |first appearance = [[Slip Slidin' Away]] |last appearance = [[...To Change the Things I Can]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Michael Patrick Thornton]] }} '''Gabriel Fife''' was a [[Medical Genetics|medical geneticist]] who fell in love with [[Naomi Bennett]]. Dr. Fife was hired behind Naomi Bennett's back by [[William White]] as a cutting edge genetic specialist who targeted experimental and risky procedures. His first case at [[Pacific Wellcare Center]] was with Naomi. [[Sally Donovan|Sally]] and [[Curtis Donovan]] were both dwarfs. They wanted a dwarf baby and wanted to use selective IVF to get one. Naomi was reluctant, but agreed, until she found that the dwarf embryos also had a mutation that had a % chance of causing cancer. He said the Donovans had agreed to go ahead anyway. Naomi talked to the Donovans and said that she would not implant the mutated embryos. Gabriel then told her that medicine would go the way toward genetic engineering whether she was okay with it or not. ''("[[Slip Slidin' Away]]")'' When Gabriel heard that Pete was trying to keep [[Neil Delhom]] alive for six more weeks so that he could meet his unborn daughter, Gabriel suggested a device that would target the tumor. He implanted the device, but it didn't work, so he suggested instead delivering the baby early. He then said he'd use what he learned to save other lives even though he couldn't save Neil. ''("[[Sins of the Father]]")'' When [[Colin Bowman|Colin Bowman's]] arm had to be amputated, Gabriel sent him to Sweden to have a bolt implanted that allowed him to get an electronic arm that gave him use similar to his own natural arm. When an infection developed, Gabriel ignore Pete's recommendation to remove the bolt and tried a drug protocol to treat it. When Colin developed neurotoxicity as a result, Gabriel lowered the dosage. When the infection took over his body, Gabriel finally admitted they'd need to remove the bolt and possibly what was left of Colin's arm. Pete instead suggested antibiotic implants, which would fight the infection and give him a chance to keep what was left of his arm. ''("[[Best Laid Plans]]")'' Gabriel attended a fundraising ball at which William was being honored. At the ball, he talked to Naomi, but their conversation was interrupted by William. Later, he watched as they left the practice together and shared a kiss. ''("[[Love Bites]]")'' Gabriel started working on an ALS antibiotic trial to slow the muscle decline. He had dinner with Naomi in order to convince her that the work was important and should be accelerated. After finding out from Pete that William had ALS and that's why he was pushing Gabriel's research forward, because he needed it personally. ''("[[Triangles]]")'' When it was time for phase two of his trial, Naomi was out of the country, so he had Pete read and approve his application. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")'' When William returned to Los Angeles with Naomi, his condition had declined significantly, leading Naomi to ask Gabriel to use his ALS protocol on him, even though it hadn't gotten FDA approval and likely wouldn't if they used it outside the trial. He refused to give William the treatment. However, when Pete got him to realize that he'd said no for the wrong reasons, he said that he'd send over the treatment. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")'' William refused the treatment and sent Gabriel to the hospital to be with Naomi after Maya's accident. Gabriel was also tasked with telling Naomi that William had refused the treatment and left. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")'' Gabriel returned to Los Angeles, wanting to woo Naomi after giving her time to mourn William's death. He said that he'd left his job, his home, everything for Naomi. When she became disillusioned by what was happening at the practice, he offered her the chance to go back with him, saying the NIH had thrown money at him to do research. ''("[[Love and Lies]]")'' Gabriel went along with Naomi to see [[Marion]], a patient in assisted living. He figured out that she was upset because her friend had died and she never told him she loved him because she felt that doing so would be betraying her late husband. ''("[[Something Old, Something New]]")'' Gabriel gave Naomi one last chance to move to DC with him. However, she refused. At the last minute, she changed her mind and went to the airport. She arrived after the doors were closed, but saw that Gabriel hadn't gotten on the plane, knowing she'd come after him. He proposed and she accepted, but said they'd be moving to New York instead of DC and she'd open an office of the foundation and they'd work together. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")'' [[Naomi Bennett]] After she found out Maya was pregnant, Naomi tried to force her to have an abortion. After Maya didn't have one, Naomi went to Gabriel and cried. He held her for a moment, but then she left, saying it never happened. ''("[[Best Laid Plans]]")'' After Naomi started dating William, Gabriel told her that she would just be a trophy for William, but he cared about her. He said that she made him a better person. Despite this, she continued to see William. ''("[[Fear of Flying]]")'' They had dinner together to talk about Gabriel's ALS trial and Gabriel labelled the dinner a date despite Naomi's insistence that it wasn't. She later kissed him despite being with William. ''("[[Triangles]]")'' After the kiss, Naomi said that she was seeing William, so they weren't going to talk about it. She was then shocked when Gabriel informed her that William had gone to Switzerland without telling her. After a second conversation about Naomi's unhappiness in her life, they kissed again. Naomi then talked to Charlotte about options for sex because of Gabriel's limited mobility. Gabriel found the guide Charlotte had given her on Naomi's desk. He asked why she didn't just ask him. He clarified that he can have sex and said if she wanted, they could go back to his place with a bottle of wine and see what happened. They ultimately slept together, but Naomi felt guilty because of William. Gabriel then told her about his ALS, causing her to go to Switzerland. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")'' He refused to give William his ALS treatment because he was in love with Naomi and wanted to be with her. But he later said that he wanted to give her what she wanted because he wanted her to be happy. He agreed to have the treatment sent over for William. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")'' When William left to see his daughter in Sun Valley, he told Gabriel to go be with Naomi. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")'' After William died, Gabriel gave Naomi time to mourn between returning to woo her. Naomi agreed to have a meal with him, but continued to resist his advances. When Naomi became disillusioned by life at the practice, Gabriel offered her the chance to go back to the NIH with him. ''("[[Love and Lies]]")'' Gabriel followed Naomi around, at the practice and elsewhere, trying to win her over. He attended the party before Cooper and Charlotte's wedding at which he and Naomi shared a kiss. ''("[[Something Old, Something New]]")'' After the wedding, they slept together and Gabriel asked Naomi to move to DC with him. She said she wouldn't move with him. ''("[[God Bless the Child]]")'' He prepared to move, but came back to give Naomi one more chance to say yes to moving with him. She said no, so he left. However, she showed up at the airport and saw that he hadn't gotten on his plane. He proposed and she accepted, on the condition they'd move to New York instead of DC and open an office of the foundation where they'd work together. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")'' They later separated. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")'' Dr. Fife was initially hired by [[William White]] to work under [[Naomi Bennett|Dr. Bennett]] at [[Pacific Wellcare Center]]. As a [[Medical Genetics|medical geneticist]], Dr. Fife worked with other doctors, both from Pacific Wellcare and [[Oceanside Wellness Group|Oceanside Wellness]], to further his cutting edge, yet morally-questionable, research. Dr. Fife later resigned from Pacific Wellcare Center to work for the [[National Institutes of Health|N.I.H.]] and run their research division. *He told Naomi losing his legs wasn't his worst day, but she said he was full of crap. ''("[[Best Laid Plans]]")'' PPGabrielFife.png|[[Slip Slidin' Away]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Sins of the Father]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Best Laid Plans]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Love Bites]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Fear of Flying]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Triangles]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Pulling the Plug]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[Eyes Wide Open]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[In the Name of Love]] PPGabrielFife.png|[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]] PPxGabrielFife.png|[[Love and Lies]] PPxGabrielFife.png|[[Something Old, Something New]] PPxGabrielFife.png|[[God Bless the Child]] PPxGabrielFife.png|[[...To Change the Things I Can]] PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg {{Gabriel Fife Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fife, Gabriel}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]]

'''Garry''' is the father of [[Jenna]].


Garry came into the practice with his daughter, Jenna, who was dying of cancer and wanted a baby as her last wish. They retrieved her eggs and got a sperm sample from her husband, [[Nick (Let It Go)|Nick]], and fertilized one of her eggs. However, Nick confessed that he didn't really want a baby and was only doing it because Jenna wanted it so badly.

When Nick didn't come home that night, Jenna decided to go ahead with the pregnancy with a sperm donor with her parents' support. However, Naomi said she couldn't do it, because what they all really wanted was for Jenna not to be dying. Nick agreed, saying he didn't want a baby, but he did want Jenna.



He is married to [[Lynn (Let It Go)|Lynn]].


His only daughter, Jenna, is dying of cancer. Desperate to keep a part of her alive, her parents supported her decision to try to have a baby.

}}

'''Gary Spencer''' is the father of [[Drea Spencer]].


Gary's daughter, Drea, came into the ER with several stab wounds, including one to her chest. Her sister, Missy, came into the ER with her and said that she had told Drea she needed half an hour to finish her homework and then they'd make cupcakes, but when she came to get her, she wasn't in her room. Gary and Jasmine arrived just before they prepared to do a thoracotomy on Drea in the ER. When Violet went to lead the family out of the room while they cracked her chest, she noticed that Missy was looking at what they were doing intently.

Drea's parents were upset about her injuries and Violet saw that Missy didn't seem upset, so she asked Gary if he wanted her to speak to Missy to see how she was feeling about the situation. He hinted that others had noticed odd behavior from her and said he wasn't concerned with how Missy was feeling at the moment because Drea was fighting for her life.

After her surgery, Drea was pronounced brain dead. While their parents decided what to do about life support, Violet offered to talk to Missy again. Violet shared with Missy her experience being stabbed and said she wondered what Katie felt while she was stabbing her. Missy said she probably felt powerful and in control.

After that conversation, Violet went to her parents and said she was showing signs of juvenile sociopathy and she believed Missy was involved in the stabbing. Jasmine said it was crazy, but Gary believed her.

Violet talked to Missy again and said she had thought Missy was smart to figure out what Katie did what she did to fell powerful, but Violet disagreed. She thought Katie did it because she was jealous. Missy said she might have stabbed her to know if she could really do it. Violet pretended to be dubious, but Missy said it was only scary for a second and then you were in it. Missy then confessed that she'd stabbed her sister and it wasn't scary for her. It was the coolest thing she'd ever done. The police came in and arrested Missy.

Amelia found Gary sitting by Drea's bedside. He said Jasmine had to leave. His family was destroyed because one of his daughters had killed the other. He felt that Drea's life should have counted for more and asked Amelia about organ donation. Amelia said he could do that and it would matter to a lot of people.



He is married to [[Jasmine Spencer]].


One of his daughters stabbed the other and caused her death.

'''Gary Woodward''' is the husband of [[Val Woodward]].


Gary's wife, Val, was  weeks pregnant. During a routine exam, Sam saw that her glands were swollen, so he did a biopsy. The biopsy revealed Burkitt's lymphoma. Because it was so aggressive, they suggested getting her to the hospital immediately for more testing. The type of cancer she had made chemotherapy her only option, but she couldn't start treatment while she was pregnant. She didn't have time to wait until she reached full term in her pregnancy, so Addison suggested delivering the baby immediately. Gary wanted to deliver and start treatment, but Val said with all the past miscarriages, she wanted to carry the baby to term, even if it killed her.

Val was admitted to the hospital for testing. She told Addison that Gary said he could deal with being with a career woman, but no kids would be a deal breaker for him. When Addison pushed a little more, Val admitted she'd had an abortion early in their marriage without telling Gary. While talking to Addison, Val started to have trouble breathing, so Addison gave her oxygen.

Even though her condition was deteriorating and she had a problem with her heart, Val continued to insist that she didn't want to start treatment yet. Gary said he wanted to be a parent, but not without her. Val admitted that she'd had an abortion. He was upset and left the room.

Despite his anger, Gary stayed in the waiting room because he couldn't leave. Addison spoke to him and convinced him to tell Val to have the c-section. After the c-section, they watched over their baby in the NICU.



He is married to [[Val Woodward]].

George's wife, Laurie, abandoned their daughter, Patty, at the practice before she was meant to have surgery to reconstruct her knee after a car accident. Cooper was able to track them down at Laurie's sister's house and he tried to convince them to come back and be there for Patty, but they said the bills kept piling up and they couldn't handle it anymore. He told them they didn't deserve Patty and left.



He is married to [[Laurie]].


He and his wife abandoned their daughter because her medical care after a car accident was too expensive.

}}

'''George Walters''' is the man who kidnapped [[Lainie]] and kept her prisoner for  years.


George came into the ER with a woman he called Kim, whom he claimed was his daughter. She was  weeks pregnant and had serious back pain. She hadn't had any prenatal care, but Addison said the baby was the appropriate size for her gestation. She called in Sam for a consult, noting that something was off about the two of them.

Her scans revealed an abdominal aortic aneurysm, so they said they wanted to keep her at the hospital to watch her and run more tests and delay surgery because of her pregnancy. They also asked for a family medical history. George insisted on accompanying Kim to all of her tests.

When Sam reviewed a second set of scans and said she needed surgery right away, even with the risks to the baby. She tested positive for the gene associated with fibrillin disease, which caused the aneurysm. It also revealed that George wasn't biologically related to her because he didn't have the disease.

Sam used the excuse of running more tests to get Kim away from George and took her to talk to Sheldon.

She told Sheldon she didn't remember her mother, whom they had said was dead, at all. He asked her about future plans. She said George didn't think she needed to go to college. She then asked about him. He then told her that the condition she had could only have been inherited from a father and George didn't have it.

After speaking to her, Sheldon said he believed they were witnessing an abducted girl and her kidnapper. George overheard that and tried to take Kim out of the hospital. Sheldon called security while Sam restrained George. Kim was taken into surgery and George was arrested.

'''Georgia King-Freedman''' is the eldest daughter of\ua[[Charlotte King]]\uaand\ua[[Cooper Freedman]].



When Charlotte went into labor at  weeks, they attempted to stop her labor, but one of the babies was already presenting, so they were forced to deliver. After she was born, labor stopped and the remaining membranes were intact, so they sewed up her cervix to keep the others in while the newborn was rushed to the NICU.


She was born with ectopic cordis, which required immediate surgery. Sam said he'd operate that day and then in a year, when she'd grown more, she'd need a skin graft. Her heart was twisted under the graft, but Sam was able to untwist it and her surgery was successful.

After her surgery, Cooper stole holy water from the hospital chapel and poured it over her incubator after telling her to fight. ''("[[Life Support]]")''

When she was two weeks old, she started breathing on her own, so they took her off the ventilator and allowed Cooper to hold her skin to skin, which helped her oxygenation. Later, Cooper worried about her falling pulse ox and rising heart rate. Over the objections of [[Nurse Danielle|Danielle]], he ordered tests for her. The tests showed RSV pneumonia, which meant she had to go back on the ventilator. When she continued to decline, Sam decided to try ECMO, but Addison said it was risky. They decided it was the best chance she had, so they did it despite the risks. She started to improve on ECMO, though she had to stay on the ventilator, before eventually being able to come off that again as well. When Charlotte went into labor, she visited the baby for the first time on her way to labor and delivery and named her Georgia. ''("[[Georgia on My Mind]]")''

When her sisters were born, Georgia was proclaimed well enough to leave the NICU to visit. ''("[[Full Release]]")''


After they went home, Cooper decided to stay home to raise the triplets. However, after doing so for a while, he decided that they needed to hire a nanny. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''



Georgia is one of a set of triplets, along with [[Rachel King-Freedman|Rachel]] and [[Caroline King-Freedman|Caroline]]. They live with their parents and older brother, [[Mason Warner]].


*She was born at  weeks.<ref>[[Life Support]], x (PP)</ref>
*Addison stated that she was presenting as a footling breech.<ref>[[Life Support]], x (PP)</ref>
*She has a different birthday than her sisters.
*[[Charlotte King|Charlotte]]\uachose her name.<ref>[[Georgia on My Mind]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Georgie Schwartz''' was a patient who was in a persistent vegetative state following a ski accident when she was .


Georgie was in a ski accident when she was  and never regained consciousness. However, her husband, [[Bob Schwartz|Bob]], refused to give up hope. He perceived the remaining reflexes as signs of life. When Amelia was brought in to consult on her case, her husband insisted that Amelia run tests to see if anything could be done for Georgie. The results of the labs showed that Georgie was pregnant. They immediately assumed that she had been raped by a staff member at her care facility. However, when her husband found out, he admitted that he had gotten her pregnant and was excited about it. She had some bleeding and was taken to the hospital.

While Georgie was being treated, Bob spoke to Sheldon, who tried to get him to come to terms with Georgie's condition. Despite Addison's best efforts, she could not continue the pregnancy. Bob was devastated, but agreed to keeping seeing Sheldon to work on it. However, when Addison heard Bob telling Georgie they'd try again for another baby, she called the police on him.



She and [[Bob Schwartz]] were married prior to her accident. Following the accident, he remained convinced that she would wake up and that she was interacting with him, despite the assurances of multiple doctors.

'''Geraldine Ginsberg''' is a famed [[Attending|attending]] [[Neurosurgery|neurosurgeon]] at [[Harvard Medical School]] who specializes in reviving coma patients.


At the request of [[Eddie Lindy]], Dr. Geraldine Ginsberg visited [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] to assess Eddie's wife, Kayla. With the hopes of reviving her, Dr. Ginsberg had her team, including [[Amelia Shepherd|Dr. Amelia Shepherd]], run diagnostic tests to verify if Kayla was a viable candidate.

After she reviewed the results with her team, she, unfortunately, informed Eddie that surgical intervention would not help Kayla's condition. This assessment was not shared by Dr. Shepherd, who suggested an experimental procedure to revive Kayla, and openly defied Dr. Ginsberg in front of Eddie.

Dr. Ginsberg was adamant that the procedure would not garner the results that both Eddie and Dr. Shepherd wanted, and due to the latter's insubordination, she fired Dr. Shepherd from her team prior to her departure.


Dr. Geraldine Ginsberg is an extremely accomplished [[Neurosurgery|neurosurgeon]] working at [[Harvard Medical School]]. She employs gifted neurosurgeons as [[Teaching Fellow|teaching fellows]] who comprise her team.

During her career, she was able to revive a patient after being in a coma for  years and has garnered a world-class reputation.


*During the diagnostic process, Dr. Ginsberg prefers family members to wait outside.
*[[Amelia Shepherd|Dr. Amelia Shepherd]] refers to her as a "beast, but brilliant".

'''Gina Rakoff''' is the former foster mother of [[Betsey Parker]].


Gina and her husband, Phil, came into the ER when their foster daughter, Betsey, fell down the stairs. Because of that injury and a previous healed clavicle fracture, Cooper suspected she was being abused. Naomi got Gina and Phil out of the room and Cooper asked her about it, but she said she fell. When they figured out what was happening, the Rakoffs asked Cooper to leave.

Cooper called in [[Gladys]] because of his concerns. Gladys said she believed he was wrong, but she'd follow-up on his complaint.

Later, while eating ice cream with Marshall, Sheldon had concerns that Marshall was the one who had hurt Betsey. He went to the Rakoffs about it, but they were angry at the implication and refused to listen.

Sheldon went to Gina alone and deduced that she'd already been concerned about Marshall. She said that she'd known for a while that he was different, but she didn't want to see it. She thought bringing another kid into their home would give him a friend. She told a comatose Betsey that she loved her and left, saying she needed to put Marshall first.



She is married to [[Phil Rakoff]].


Her son, Marshall, has emotional problems. Because of this, she and her husband stopped fostering Betsey to focus on his care.

'''Gladys''' is a social worker in [[Los Angeles]].



When the doctors at the practice decided that none of them could keep Betsey, they called in Gladys to take her and place her in foster care. ''("[[A Better Place to Be]]")''


While she was living with [[Phil Rakoff|Phil]] and [[Gina Rakoff]], Betsey ended up in the hospital after falling down the stairs. When Cooper learned that she'd also previously broken her clavicle, he contacted Gladys to report them. Gladys came to the hospital and said she'd follow-up, but she said she was sure that he was wrong about them. ''("[[God Bless the Child]]")''


When baby Eli was caught between his mother, [[Melissa (Too Much)|Melissa]], who was addicted to drugs, and his sister, [[Denise]], who believed Melissa was bad for him, Gladys came in and talked to both of them and Eli's doctors. She said that having the child with a biological parent was the idea, but if the doctors believed having him around Melissa would be detrimental to him, they could explore other options. ''("[[Too Much]]")''


She is a social worker in [[Los Angeles]].

'''Gloria Murphy''' is a patient who became pregnant despite medical advice.


Gloria came into the ER with difficulty breathing. Sam was shocked when the paramedic said she was  weeks pregnant because she had received a heart transplant and he'd previously warned her as her doctor that pregnancy in her condition could kill her. Jake then arrived and said he'd gotten her pregnant, unaware that she'd had a transplant.

They advised that she have a c-section immediately to reduce the strain on her heart. She refused.

Gloria's condition continued to deteriorate. Sam said she needed to go to the cath lab, but she refused because it could cause precipitous labor. Sam was confused as to why she was starting to reject her heart until she confessed that she'd stopped taking her anti-rejection meds when she got pregnant because she was worried about them hurting the baby. Her water then broke and she was rushed into labor and delivery, where she quickly gave birth. She lost pulse, so Sam cracked her chest in the delivery room while Addison finished delivering her baby. Her aorta was dissected and Sam tried to repair it, but she unfortunately died in the delivery room.

Her husband held their daughter by Gloria's bedside and wondered what he'd name her because they hadn't talked about girls' names.



She was married to [[Mr. Murphy]] until her death.


Her daughter was born shortly before she died.


*They planned to use the name Thomas for a boy.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Murphy, Gloria}}

'''Gloria Walker''' is the mother of [[David Walker]] and the grandmother of [[Stevie Walker]].


Gloria's son, David, had a headache and nausea and called Sam at the practice to get a house call. Sam arrived and found Dave on the kitchen floor. Gloria seemed dazed and wouldn't let Sam in, so he broke a window. By that point, Gloria's grandson, Stevie, was with his father, who was unresponsive. Sam called an ambulance and had the paramedics take Stevie and Gloria along with Dave to the hospital, worried about leaving Gloria in charge of Stevie. In the ER, Dave was quickly discharged at his own request. Later, Stevie came to the practice with the same symptoms of his father. Suspicious, Sam ran tests and found coprine in Stevie's blood, a natural antabuse from ink cap mushrooms. He deduced that Gloria had been feeding them to Dave to get him to stop drinking, because drinking made him violently ill after consuming the mushrooms. Sam spoke to Gloria privately, trying to convince her to stop, but she was unwilling to do so because she knew she didn't have much time left to live and didn't want her son to keep drinking, as she knew he would end up dead. Sam called Stevie and Dave into his office and lied to them, saying that Dave was allergic to alcohol and that it could be genetic, so Stevie also shouldn't drink to be safe.



Her family means everything to her. She lives with her son, Dave, and her grandson, Stevie. When she saw that Dave's drinking had gotten out of control, she fed him ink cap mushrooms, which she knew would make him seriously ill if he drank alcohol.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Walker, Gloria}}
