'''Gracie Rousakis''' is a cystic fibrosis patient who contracted a very serious bacterial infection.


Gracie came into the practice with her father and brother, all of whom had cystic fibrosis. They examined the family and ran some labs. Gracie's tests came back and revealed that she had burkholderia cepacia, an aggressive bacteria. She had to be isolated from her brother and father because the bacteria is highly contagious among cystic fibrosis patients. Cooper took her over to the hospital and got her into isolation.

Daron struggled with having to choose between letting Gracie die alone or being with her and leaving Julian behind without a father. When [[Wyatt Lockhart]] saw Gracie, he proposed a solution, saying that he'd had success treating a similar condition in cancer patients. Daron agreed to try, even after being told it was a long shot.

They extracted the bacteria from Gracie's lungs and then tried several antibiotic combinations to treat it. However, none of them work and Pete had to tell Gracie that she was going to die. Unable to watch Gracie die alone, Daron handed Julian and the keys to his house over to the doctors and broke isolation to be with Gracie, exposing himself to the bacteria.



Gracie's mother had died and her brother and father both have cystic fibrosis like herself.


*She got a camera for her birthday.
*She was nine at the time of her infection.
*She loves horses.

'''Greg Bishop''' is the father of [[Annie Bishop]].


Greg's daughter, Annie, had a cardiac tumor. She was scheduled to have the tumor removed. [[Noah Barnes]] operated, but wasn't able to get the whole tumor. He said he believed chemo would shrink it more and then he'd be able to remove the rest in another month. Annie didn't believe them, as that's what they'd said the last time. She said she didn't want more surgery.

A month later, after chemo, her labs looked good. She said she still didn't want the surgery. She talked to Cooper and said that she wanted to feel good for a little bit and live her life and be normal for a while before she died. Her parents and doctors had a meeting and Cooper stood up for her, saying that stopping the treatment might be the best thing for her. Noah still insisted he could help, but her parents decided they wanted to take her home. Cooper went to take her catheter out, but Charlotte stopped him, saying Noah was going to a judge to get a court order. [[Judge McLennan]] came in and ruled that her catheter would stay in and she'd have the surgery on the first available date.

After another month, Annie was upset. She believed she'd die in the hospital. After seeing her condition, [[Charlotte King]] went to Noah and said she supported the decision to end treatment and questioned who Noah was really fighting for. Noah went to Cooper and said he wouldn't push anymore. He told the judge he reevaluated his position. Annie was told that once the catheter was out, it would be hard to get it back in, meaning they wouldn't be able to get medicine to her fast enough if something went wrong. Annie said it was okay and that she'd finally get to see the ocean.

A month later, on Annie's th birthday, she had a party on the beach and was able to surf and talk to her friends.



He is married to [[Terri Bishop]].


His daughter, Annie, had a cardiac tumor. Despite not wanting to lose her, he and his wife supported her decision to stop treatment and live the life she had left.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Bishop, Greg}}

'''Greg Gilbert''' is the father of [[Kerri Gilbert]].


Greg's daughter, Kerri, was in the hospital. Her labs showed that despite a bone marrow transplant from Greg, her cancer had returned. The only option left was a cord blood transfusion. Cooper said they'd search the public donor banks. There were no matches, so Cooper asked Charlotte to search the private banks. She refused because that cord blood is for the families' personal use.

Cooper went to watch a movie with Kerri. She said she was tired and asked if he'd come back the next day. He said he couldn't, but could come back Saturday, prompting her to ask if she'd still be alive on Saturday. Cooper then used Charlotte's computer to search the private banks and found a match.

He went to [[Robert Weston|Robert]] and [[Ellen Weston]], whose deceased son, Kip, was the match. He asked them to give Kerri the blood so spare another family the grief of losing a child. However, they wanted to keep the blood for their other son, Matt, in case he needed it.

Despite this, Cooper used the blood to treat Kerri. The treatment worked and Kerri's condition rapidly improved.

When the Westons came to the hospital to talk to Charlotte about the situation, they cross paths with Greg, who, upon figuring out who they were, hugged them, thanked them, and offered them the chance to meet Kerri, which they took.



He is married to [[Jessica Gilbert]].


His daughter, Kerri, has leukemia. He donated bone marrow to her, but it didn't work.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gilbert, Greg}}

'''Greg O'Brien''' is the father of [[Sarah O'Brien]], who was switched with [[Emily Stinson]] as an infant.


Greg and Beth O'Brien had a nine month old, Emily, who had been ill since she was an infant. Cooper was concerned because Greg didn't seem to have bonded with Emily at all and seemed disinterested in her care. The cause of her neurological symptoms was a mystery until a blood draw showed Pelizaeus-Merzbacher disease, an incurable genetic disorder. Concerned about it being genetic, the O'Briens requested tests to figure out which of them had the genetic marker. When tests revealed that neither of them was a carrier, the doctors concluded that Emily wasn't their daughter. Greg and Beth were told that under California law, they'd have to say goodbye to Emily and welcome the other child into their home. Beth insisted that it couldn't be true, believing that as a mother, she would know. After obtaining the nursery records, they determined that their baby had been switched shortly after birth with [[Duncan Stinson|Duncan]] and [[Melinda Stinson|Melinda Stinson's]] baby.

Duncan was arrested after it was discovered that he had switched the girls in the nursery after Emily had a seizure while he was holding her. Under the observation of [[Violet Turner]], the O'Briens handed Emily over to Melinda and took Sarah from her. Cooper noticed Greg crying to the side and Greg told him that he thought he couldn't watch Emily die and now he was having trouble saying goodbye to her.



He is married to [[Beth O'Brien]].


Greg and Beth have one child. They named her Emily at birth, but after she was switched, she was called Sarah. When they were nine months old, the girls were switched back to live with their birth parents. They spent nine months raising the Stinsons' baby, who had an incurable genetic disorder.

'''Gregory Milford''' is the husband of [[Tess Milford]].


Gregory's wife, Tess, was pregnant with triplets after using IVF. An ultrasound showed that two of the triplets had TTTS, so Addison wanted to operate. However, the Milfords were religious and decided not to interfere a second time.

Tess later collapsed at the airport. One of the babies had fluid around his heart and Tess was mirroring. She stabilized while resting, but was advised that that wasn't enough. Addison pleaded with Gregory to let her help Tess. Tess had the surgery, but had a reaction to the anesthesia, so Addison wasn't able to finish.

Addison later got paged to Tess's bedside. Addison did an ultrasound and determined that the triplet not involved in the connection had died. Tess begged Addison for her help. Addison said she was too weak for another surgery. Addison said they could do local, but it was too danger. Tess implored her to try something, so Addison agreed and did the surgery with local anesthesia. It was successful and the blood vessels were separated.



He is married to [[Tess Milford]].


Desperate to have children, Tess and Gregory turned to IVF. They had one embryo implanted and it split into triplets. However, one of the triplets later died in utero.

'''Gwen Petrucci''' is a girl with spina bifida who had surgery before she was born.


Gwen was diagnosed in utero with spina bifida. Her mother decided to have fetal surgery at Addison's recommendation to repair her spinal column. The surgery was successful, but even so, Gwen was struggling to learn to walk at age seven. While in physical therapy, she fell and hit her head.

Unbeknownst to Gwen, her mother saw Addison in the ER and decided to sue her in order to get money to raise and care for Gwen after being laid off. Addison eventually convinced her to drop the lawsuit so that Gwen wouldn't even find out and get the feeling that she wasn't wanted.



Her father left the family before she was two. After that, her mother raised and cared for her alone.

'''Hal Jarvis''' is a pedophile who was treated by Violet as a condition of his release.


Hal was on trial for possession of photographs of children in minimal clothing. Violet was subpoenaed for his case because she'd seen him as a client for three sessions. He received a suspended sentence, but a condition was that he had daily sessions with Violet, which had to be after hours, because the practice also had pediatric patients.

In their first mandated session, he told Violet he knew it was sick and was sorry he hadn't told her before. He said that that's why he was depressed. He was keeping that secret. He said that getting caught was freeing because he couldn't hide anymore. He wanted to get the thoughts out of his head. He believed that if he did anything to any of the children, they'd become like him because he was also abused as a child. It tore him apart and he didn't want to do it to anyone else. He asked Violet for her help.

In a later session, he spoke explicitly about Jody Sampica. He said that he didn't want to hurt her, but he did want to be with her. The photographs, to him, felt less dangerous than his fantasy about Jody. He said he just wants to talk to her, but Violet asked if that's what his abuser told him. She told him she didn't want to just talk.

After his session, he went out to the waiting room and saw [[Maya Bennett]]. He sat down next to her and started to talk. When Violet saw, she pushed Hal out the door, telling him to leave.

Violet later called the judge and said that she believed that Hal was a danger, so he was arrested. Violet visited him in jail and said that she had an ethical obligation to help people and since he couldn't control his impulses yet, he was a danger. He repeated that he hadn't done anything, which she said she knew.



He is divorced. His divorce is one of the subjects he discussed with Violet during their sessions.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Jarvis, Hal}}

'''Hank Bauer''' is a patient of Violet's who came into the ER after he was found yelling at a fire hydrant.


Hank was picked up by paramedics when he was found yelling at a fire hydrant. They brought him to St. Ambrose, where he insisted that people were waiting to hear him speak. They tried to calm him down, but he said he had two knives and would stab everyone in there. Violet ordered haloperidol and talked to Hank. She was able to convince him to take the pills.

'''Harold Allen''' is a doctor who was put on trial related to the death of a patient.


Harold was sued by a patient's family for malpractice after the patient died. Sam was an expert witness in the case and testified that Harold had given the standard of care. However, when questioned by the other side, he became flustered. In order to save the case, [[Duncan]], Harold's lawyer, decided to put Sam back on the stand. When Sam reviewed the medicine to prepare for this, he discovered that the patient had received morphine for a surgery two years prior, which was overkill unless the patient was allergic to aspirin, which Martin Weiser was. He noticed that it wasn't flagged on the chart, but there was a blank page where that information would have been. He figured out that Harold Allen hadn't been able to revive him because he'd given him aspirin and he was allergic. He went to Harold with the information and Harold said he hid it because he was worried he'd lose everything over that mistake.

The next day in court, Sam testified that Harold had done everything he should have with what he knew at the time. When [[Corinne Lee]] questioned what he meant by that, he said that Harold didn't review the patient's medical records, which listed an aspirin sensitivity. Corinne noted that that wasn't in their discovery, which Sam said was due to Harold changing the pages.


He is a doctor. He was sued for malpractice when a patient died because he was unaware of the patient's aspirin sensitivity.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Allen, Harold}}

'''Heather Parker''' is a drug addict, who was married to [[Dell Parker]], and died because of an explosion in her house that occurred because she was cooking meth. She died at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] while talking to [[Pete Wilder]].



Heather initially got into drugs because of [[Dell Parker]] when they were teenagers. ''("[[Contamination]]")''


She got clean and relapsed several times over the early years of Betsey's life, providing an unstable early childhood. At one point, she got cleaned up enough to get a good job. In order to get the job, she left Betsey with Dell all day and was unable to be reached. She received notification that day that Dell petitioned for full custody. She confronted Dell about it and he said that they could work something out, so he could get to see her more, but he also didn't take her away from Heather. ''("[[Contamination]]")''


Heather got a promotion at work, but said it was in St. Louis. Dell said Heather could go, but that Betsey needed to stay. Heather left angry. Dell later came to the apartment to talk to Heather, but found the apartment cleared out and Betsey and Heather gone. ''("[[What Women Want]]")''


Heather came back to Los Angeles and showed up at the practice alone. The pressure of her job got to her and she started using drugs again. She came to Dell because she needed $,. She said that if he gave her the money, she'd let him have Betsey. He got the money from Sam, but when Heather showed up for it, he told her he could call the police or DCFS. He couldn't give her the money to go kill herself because while he didn't like her, he loved his daughter and Heather is his daughter's mother. He then told her to come say goodbye to Betsey. She did so and then left, saying she'd somehow get Betsey back. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''


Heather got clean again and this time, she and Dell got married. Violet and Naomi tried an intervention, but Dell said he was happy with Heather. She said the same thing. She'd gone through rehab and wasn't doing drugs, which gave them the chance to be a family. ''("[[Sins of the Father]]")''


Heather was cooking at the stove when the house exploded around her. Dell came in and got Betsey out. He went back for Heather, but by that point, she was seriously burned. They were both rushed to the hospital, where they started treating Heather's burns. [[Dr. Simcox]] did burn treatment and estimated a % chance of survival. When Dell learned that Heather had been cooking meth, he went to her room and told her he hoped she died. She then continued burn treatment, but told Pete just to let her die. Knowing she was going to die, she asked to see Betsey to say goodbye. Dell refused because of Heather's drug use. However, Pete tried to sneak her away, but was thwarted by Dell. Heather then died with just Pete there, apologizing to Dell for what she'd done. ''("[[Blowups]]")''



She was married to [[Dell Parker]] until her death. They met in high school and dated briefly, but didn't get married until several years later. ''("[[Sins of the Father]]")''


*At the time of her death, she was  years old.
*Her last words were "I wanted to be a good mom. I wanted to."<ref>[[Blowups]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Henry''' is a patient who was struggling to maintain his own health as he cared for his wife, [[Frances]].


After cancelling his appointment several times because it was hard to get away from his wife, [[Frances]], who had Alzheimer's, Henry finally saw a doctor. He had lost significant weight and was anemic. Because caring for his wife put additional stress on him, Sam suggested that he put his wife in a nursing home so she could get the care she needed and he could start taking better care of himself.

When Frances had an accident while Henry was helping her out of the tub, they both landed in the hospital. While looking through Frances's chart, Naomi saw that they hadn't done a CT before diagnosing her with Alzheimer's. Naomi looked into it and believed that Frances had normal-pressure hydrocephalus instead of Alzheimer's. She was too fragile for neurosurgery, but Naomi suggested that a spinal tap could relieve the pressure enough to make her lucid for long enough to see how hard things are for Henry, hoping she could convince him to put her in a home.

They did the spinal tap and Frances woke up. When she heard about her condition, she told Henry to promise to visit her every day, hold her hand, and then let her go.



He has been married to [[Frances]] for almost  years. When she was diagnosed with Alzheimer's, he became her primary caregiver, which put great strain on his health.

'''Henry''' is the boyfriend of [[May]].


Henry's girlfriend, May, was at the practice with pain. Her boyfriend, Henry, had just flown in from another country and they consummated their relationship. She had severe pain in her genitals, so Naomi did an exam.

May had signs of an allergic reaction, but she couldn't pin down the cause, so she called in Pete for help. Pete determined that she was allergic to Henry's sperm and the next reaction would likely be worse. Naomi said they could still have a baby, washing his sperm before inseminating. They were also told they'd need to use condoms until Pete could figure out a treatment. He consulted with [[Charlotte King]] for information on semen allergies.

May later showed up in the ambulance with difficulty breathing. Pete gave her a breathing treatment to ease her breathing. Henry said they'd used a condom, but it either broke or leaked because there was seminal fluid present. Henry said he couldn't keep doing that because he didn't want to hurt or kill her. Pete asked them to be patient while he looked for a way.

May later came to Pete and said Henry had broken up with her, so he didn't have to waste his time looking for a solution.

Pete had Henry and May both come in and suggested exposure therapy. He couldn't guarantee it would work and it would take months, but it could help them.



He met his girlfriend, May, online. They were in love and believed they were soul mates.


He sells rare Peruvian lily seedlings online. Through that work, he met his girlfriend, May.

}}'''Henry Montgomery''' is the son of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] and [[Jake Reilly]].



Henry was born to his biological mother [[Judi]], who was a patient of Addison's and thought that she would be a perfect mother for her son. He was delivered by Addison herself only to be adopted by her just several hours later. ''("[[It Was Inevitable]]")''


When Henry was eight months old, Judi expressed desire to see Henry for the first time. She talked to Addison about him and visited. She visited him first at Addison's home and then the next day at the park. Addison was uncomfortable by the visits, but after talking to [[Vivian Carlsmith]] about her own experience giving up a child for adoption, she went to Judi and said Judi would always be welcome in Henry's home. ''("[[Apron Strings]]")''


Addison went to court and finalized Henry's adoption, despite a snafu when [[Mildred Clemons]] expressed concern about Jake's violent past. ''("[[Full Release]]")''



When he was still very young, Addison wondered about his life and how much of the person he'd become was already written into his DNA. Despite this, she told her therapist that she believed nurture trumped nature because Henry looked at her with love and knew she was his mom and no gene told him to do that. ''("[[True Colors (Private Practice)|True Colors]]")''


*[[Sam Bennett]] often takes care of him.
*His godmother is [[Amelia Shepherd]], who was there when Henry was born.
*Addison fed him donated breast milk from the milk bank.<ref>[[And Then There Was One]], x (PP)</ref>
*When he was eight months old, he liked Tigger, mashed carrots, and all things orange.<ref>[[Apron Strings]], x (PP)</ref>
*He's into drawing, spilling, and smearing and completely destroyed Addison's white walls and carpets.<ref>[[Bend & Break]], x (GA)</ref>
*During her visit to Grey Sloan to perform a uterine transplant, Addison mentions that he is  years old.<ref>[[Hotter Than Hell]], x (GA)</ref>
*He is a gamer and a fan of Game of Thrones.<ref>[[With a Little Help From My Friends|With A Little Help From My Friends]], x</ref>

'''Hillary Loveman''' is the wife of [[Brett Loveman]].


Hillary's husband, Brett, was on death row and scheduled to be executed in  hours. She was in therapy to get some closure on the issue, but she said she'd rather spend the time calling the governor's office to try to get another stay. Meanwhile, Brett was also being counseled in his last days. He'd been in prison for  years and had maintained his innocence the entire time, but in the last days, he confessed to Sheldon that he had done it.

He was a very calm guy, never raised his voice to anyone, but snapped. He'd met a man in a bar who was rude and disrespectful, so he followed him home and killed him. He said it felt like something inside him broke. He went home to get his gun, came back, and shot him. He said he didn't want Hillary to spend any more time hating the world, so she needed to know the truth about what he'd done.

Hillary continued to work on ways to get Brett another stay. Violet came to her home and asked her to talk about what would happen if she couldn't get a stay. She was determined to clear Brett's name, even if it happened after he was dead.

Brett had Hillary brought to the prison and confessed to her that he'd killed Paul Miller. She initially laughed in disbelief and then left without talking to Brett.

Despite the confession, Hillary continued to try to to get a stay. She said that their son was colicky. And Brett had gotten fired when they were already broke. Then his mother died. And she believed that's why he killed Paul.

Hillary went to [[Ellen Miller]], Paul's wife, and told her that Brett had murdered her husband. She said she already knew that and Hillary had been the only person who seemed not to know that. Hillary apologized to Ellen and then asked her to ask the governor for a stay, saying she needed more time. Ellen talked about the milestones in their children's lives that Paul had missed because of Brett. She said Brett had taken all the time she had left from her, so she wouldn't give Hillary more time with Brett.

As Brett was taken to be prepared for his execution, Hillary still refused to see him. After he was taken, she decided she wanted to see him, but was told she could witness the execution, but couldn't talk to him anymore. She decided to attend the execution and watched as Brett was given a lethal injection.



She was married to [[Brett Loveman]] until his death. They'd been together since high school.


Her son, Justin, was nine months old when her husband was imprisoned.

'''Holly''' is a patient of Violet's who had lost her parents and boyfriend in a car accident.


Holly was seeing Violet. She talked about her day and said it wasn't until she went to bed that she realized it was the six year anniversary of the car accident that killed her parents and boyfriend. She felt guilty because it didn't seem right that she could forget them, but then she felt relieved. At the end of their session, Violet told Holly that she believed they were done. Holly'd been seeing her for five years, but she'd been weaned off her medications and was living on her own. She was applying to cooking schools. She'd been able to visit with her boyfriend's parents for the first time since the accident, the final step on her goal list. Holly said it was great and hugged Violet.

Holly later came to Violet's office to tell her that she'd gotten into Le Cordon Bleu. She didn't believe she could go, but Violet said she could handle it. Holly started to panic, saying it was too far away from Violet, who had said she'd always be there for her. She said she wasn't going and she wasn't leaving therapy because she wasn't ready. Violet agreed to keep seeing Holly.

At a later session, Holly was talking about a recipe when Violet said that it would be their last session and the receptionist wouldn't let her make another if she called. She was ready to be done because she was sitting there talking about food instead of feelings. Holly asked how she should know she was done, but Violet said she just needed to trust her. Violet said that she got into Le Cordon Bleu because she'd applied. She wanted to go and Violet worried that her ability to keep coming back to therapy was holding her back. Holly admitted she was scared, but Violet said that was normal.

As Holly prepared to get in the cab to the airport, Violet reminded her she could do it and told her to have a wonderful time. Holly thanked her for what she'd done and Violet said she'd be just fine.



Her boyfriend died in a car accident, along with her parents. Holly herself survived the accident.


Her parents died in a car accident in which she was the only survivor.


*She was the last patient to be treated on screen in ''[[Private Practice]]''.
*She was the symbol of Private Practice ending: her treatment took  years, which is as long as the series ran, and she was ready to move in the finale.

'''Ike Holden''' is a kid who had a hernia repaired and had to have a second surgery for ischemia.


Cooper examined Ike after he'd had a hernia repaired and Ike had a little trouble making sentences, but Cooper said it was probably after-effects of the anesthesia wearing off. [[Scott Barker]], Ike's surgeon, then came to see him, saying the surgery went well. Cooper said the anesthesia effects would wear off in an hour or so.

When the time came for Ike to be discharged, Scott didn't show up, so Cooper did the discharge.

Ike later came back to the hospital with ischemia. Scott planned to operate, but Charlotte asked him if he'd taken anything that day. She wouldn't let him operate until he said he hadn't taken anything that day. He wasn't able to say that.

'''Irwin''' is the husband of [[Claire (Private Practice)|Claire]].


Irwin's wife, Claire, came into the practice with him. She'd seen Violet previously and had always been very angry, so Violet was shocked to see her happy and very loving toward Irwin. She said that she was feeling better, doing charity work, and wasn't angry anymore. Irwin was concerned because of the drastic personality change. Claire said that she had found God and that's why she wasn't angry anymore.

Amelia consulted and ran tests on Claire, which revealed a large tumor in her frontal lobe. It caused the personality change.

Claire was disbelieving when Amelia told her she had a brain tumor. She insisted that it was God. Amelia warned her that the tumor was slow-growing, but would kill her if she didn't have it removed. She decided that if dying was God's plan, she'd die.

Amelia stopped her from leaving. She talked about her history of drug abuse and how it made her artificially happy, just like Claire's tumor, but almost killed her, just like Claire's tumor would. After hearing what Amelia said, Claire agreed to have the surgery.

While Claire was in surgery, Violet talked to Irwin, who said that he loved Claire the way she was with the tumor and didn't know if he could love her if she went back to how she was before.

After surgery, Claire woke up as angry as she was before. When Irwin left, she told Amelia she had nothing left and Amelia should have let her die happy. Violet talked to her, saying she didn't have to be alone. She offered other treatment options to try to deal with her anger.



He is married to [[Claire (Private Practice)|Claire]].

'''Isabelle''' was a woman pregnant with a baby with hypoplastic left-heart syndrome.


Isabelle was pregnant with a baby who had been diagnosed with hypoplastic left-heart syndrome. Addison looked at all the scans and said that neither fetal surgery nor neonatal surgery was an option for her, but Isabelle and her husband, Frank, had another idea. They had conceived the baby with their last embryo and Isabelle didn't have any eggs left, so they wanted to harvest their baby's eggs to use to become parents.

Isabelle and Frank came into the practice to try to convince Addison to do the surgery. She said they had other options to be parents, such as adoption, but Isabelle said she needed to be a parent to a baby she carried herself. Addison agreed to do the surgery, but only after the baby was born, so she wouldn't have to cut into Isabelle's uterus.

When Isabelle went into labor, Addison went to the hospital to deliver the baby. The cord prolapsed, so Addison rushed her into surgery for a c-section.

After the baby was born, Addison asked Frank and Isabelle if they'd thought about a name, but they were just interested in how soon she could do the surgery and didn't want to meet her at all.

Addison brought the baby to see them, saying that they wanted to be parents and this was their chance. They said they didn't want to bond with her because they didn't want to have to grieve. Addison said that was inevitable and they finally held the baby until she died.



She is married to [[Frank (Love and Lies)|Frank]]. They've been together for over  years.


*She had two prior miscarriages.

'''Jack''' is the fianc\ue of [[Lara]].


Jack's fianc\uee, Lara, brought her sister, [[Andi]], to the practice. She said they were cooking dinner when Andi responded as one of her "others", Gina. She'd been diagnosed with multiple personality disorder at the age of seven after a car accident that killed their parents. Lara said it took a lot of therapy to get that under control, but she hadn't seen another personality in nearly ten years, so she was concerned that they were coming back.

Andi then talked to Sheldon herself, believing her sister was worrying too much. When Sheldon started to talk to Andi about what her sister had said, Gina replied, telling him angrily to back off. Sheldon said it was very convincing.

Sheldon talked to Lara and Jack about Andi. Jack said he'd known Andi almost as long as he'd known Lara and he was suspicious because he hadn't seen any of her others before then, a week before they were set to move to Arizona. Lara said she couldn't leave Andi and Jack said he wouldn't go without her.

Sheldon called Andi back in and did art therapy with her, something her previous shrink liked to do a lot. While she colored, he talked to her about Jack. She said she was okay with the moving. She drew a picture of Jack and then suddenly became more aggressive in her drawing. When Sheldon asked her about it, she said she was Maggie, who said they don't care about Andi and asked how Lara could just walk out on her like that. Maggie said that she didn't like Jack because she was taking Lara away. Maggie then asked if she could draw, too. She used crayons and began to draw a childlike picture.

Sheldon was then convinced that it was real, because the pictures were completely different art styles and drawn with different hands.

Sheldon talked to all three of them together. Jack still believed Andi was manipulating them. Jack said that Andi was jealous of him and the time Lara spent with him. Gina then spoke and said he hated Jack. Sheldon then figured out that Andi was faking it, because Maggie had told him she hated Jack, not Gina. Andi then said she loved Jack and didn't want Lara to take him away from her.

Andi told Sheldon that it felt like it was her and Lara against the world and Jack was the first person to understand that. She was jealous of Lara for having him. She apologized for wasting Sheldon's time and he said that if she wanted, they could start over. Lara then came in and said she was mad at Andi, but Andi's her sister and she still loved her, so they needed to figure it out so Andi could stay in their lives, hers and Jack's.



He is engaged to [[Lara]].


He was promoted to manage a new plant in Arizona, requiring a move.

'''Jackie''' is the mother of [[Kenny]].


Jackie's son, Kenny, came into the practice with a stomachache. When he refused to poop in a cup to have tests run, Cooper suggested he just tell the truth. He knew Kenny was faking a stomachache to get out of school. He admitted he was being bullied because he likes anime. His dad had gotten him into it, but his dad was dead. Kenny just wanted to get out of school, but Cooper said he couldn't hide forever, so he should find the other kids who like anime. Jackie then came in and Cooper suggested she keep him home for the rest of the day.

Kenny and Jackie came back into the practice and Jackie was upset because Kenny had taken a knife to school. As they left, Sheldon stopped them and asked to talk to Jackie. He offered his services to help Kenny.

Kenny talked to Sheldon and they bonded over anime. He admitted that the kids had kicked him until he took off his anime shirt. He said he didn't want acceptance. He just wanted to stay at the school long enough to find other kids like him. He'd changed schools six times in two years.

Kenny used anime as a way to escape to a world where his dad was still alive. And his mother constantly pulling him out of schools to protect him prevented him from developing coping skills.

They went to Kenny's house to talk to Jackie. They explained that she needed to stop pulling him out of school. She said that he came home and cried every day. It drove her crazy. She said that her son was a wimp, not knowing that Kenny was listening in.

Kenny later came into the ER after trying to kill himself by stabbing himself. Jackie blamed herself. When Kenny woke up, they told him suicide was not the answer and that he needs to stick around to see things get great. He told his mom he didn't want to switch schools. He wanted to have a chance at his current school and he agreed to keep seeing Sheldon.



She was married until her husband died.


She believes her son is a wimp and moved him from school to school to keep him away from bullies.

'''Jacob Deever''' is a man who was in a car accident with his boyfriend, a prostitute.


Jacob came into the hospital after a minor car accident. The other guy in the car, [[Evan Arnold]], had more serious injuries. Jacob tried to leave without being examined, but the police stopped him. Evan was a prostitute, which is why Jacob tried leaving.

When Pete saw Jacob at the practice later, he found out he was married and his wife had had bladder reconstruction to have a baby. He met Jacob outside the hospital and talked to him. Jacob claimed not to know that Evan was a prostitute.

Charlotte tested Jacob's blood and found out he had HIV, though Angela was negative. Pete brought him back in and told him he had HIV. He said it was only one time, but Pete said he couldn't already be HIV+ from the time in the car with Evan. They talked to him and convinced him that he couldn't keep living the lie.

They called Jacob, Evan, and Angela all in and Jacob tried to tell Angela. She said she already knew and loved and accepted him. However, when she found out he'd exposed her to HIV, she slapped him and left.



[[Angela Deever]]
He was married to [[Angela Deever]] for almost  years.

[[Evan Arnold]]
He started seeing Evan, a male prostitute. However, their relationship developed beyond prostitution.


*He was  at the time of his accident.

'''Jake''' is a man who was injured in a car accident.


While hiking in a canyon, Addison and Sam heard Jake calling for help. He told them they'd crashed and his wife was out there as well. Addison went down to the car while Sam tended to Jake. Addison found Kara and saw that she was pregnant and stuck in the car door. She had lost feeling in her fingers and told Addison they'd been out there since the previous day. Her pregnancy was at term. She said she could feel the baby moving, but Addison couldn't get the right angle to get a fetal heartbeat.

Sam said Jake had a broken rib and internal bleeding. Sam said if he ran, he could get back by dark. Addison said she'd go back and forth between them while they waited for him to get back. Before Sam could leave, Jake's lung collapsed and he had to improvise a chest tube to relieve the pressure.

Addison climbed in the car to examine Kara and she said that she was at fault for the accident, because she grabbed her husband's arm when a bee flew in the car. Addison found that Kara had a broken rib.

Sam brought Jake back down to the car, saying that his chest tube needed to be opened every  minutes or his heart would arrest. Same decided to try to find the road instead of going back the way he and Addison came. However, when Addison climbed back into the car, she and Kara rolled farther down the hill. Addison was injured in the second crash, which trapped her in the car with Kara. Because she was trapped, Sam said he couldn't leave because since Addison couldn't take care of the chest tube, Jake would die if she left.

After nightfall, Kara's water broke. Addison examined her again and determined that the baby was a footling breech because of the second crash. She attempted to change the baby's position to make the delivery easier.

Sam sewed the tube in Jake's chest into place so that he could leave and get help. Addison told Sam Kara's labor was progressing quickly and advised him to stay safe because they needed him to be able to come back and bring help.

When the baby's foot came through the cervix, Addison said she was going to try to push his foot back up the birth canal and change his position from the inside. Addison started to do it, but Kara said it was too painful. Jake gave her a pep talk and said she could do it. Addison was able to change the baby's position successfully. She then coached Kara through difficult delivery.

The baby didn't breathe right away, but Addison was able to stimulate and she started crying. After the birth, Jake stopped responding to them. Addison attempted again to get out of the car, but wasn't able to. However, they heard helicopters coming to find them. They put Jake in a sling and took him to the hospital. They gave the baby oxygen and got her out of there. Then they worked on prying the door open to get Kara and Addison out. However, as soon as they did, Kara started bleeding severely from her arm and she crashed. They tried everything they could, but Kara was dead in the car.

At the hospital, Addison brought the baby to Jake and Sam told him that Kara had died.



He was married to [[Kara (The Hard Part)|Kara]] until her death.


*He wanted a home birth, which Kara said he could have if the baby came out of him.

|first appearance = [[...To Change the Things I Can]] |last appearance = [[In Which We Say Goodbye]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]], [[Season (Private Practice)|]], and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Benjamin Bratt]] }} {{Quote|Look, everything you were saying before. You\ure feeling it because this is right. You and me together is.. right. And I\um not gonna let you run away because you\ure scared, I told you before I stay and fight. And I fought for a year to be with you and that was hard because I like Sam, a lot. But, I knew the moment I met you, in that grocery, and then when you randomly appear on my exam table I knew again. And If I had to wait that was just what I was going to do. And so, I joined the practice, and waited, and waited, and waited. But I\um not gonna wait anymore because this is our time. We\ure supposed to be together. You and me. And I\um in love with you too, though I actually said it. |'''[[Jake Reilly]]''' to '''[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]'''}} '''Jake Reilly''' is the [[Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility|reproductive endocrinologist and infertility specialist]] at [[Seaside Health and Wellness]] and the husband of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]. Like his wife, Jake also has a double-specialty, practicing [[General Surgery|general surgery]]. Jake grew up with three younger sisters. Their dad left when he was years old and their mother died when he was . College had to wait, as he didn't want to split up his family. He worked three jobs and eventually got a free ride to college, and afterwards put himself through med school. There have been many women in his life, but his first real love was Lily. Before coming to Los Angeles, Jake was married to [[Lily Reilly]], a drug addict, who had a year old daughter, [[Angela Reilly|Angela]]. After he met her, he soon adopted her daughter. One evening, Lily's drug dealer came to their home. Jake couldn't get rid of him, so he severely beat up the dealer. As a result, the police stepped in and Jake was arrested. His prints were taken and put into the system. Jake frequently spent long hours at his office in order to unconsciously avoid Lily's drug addiction. Working was his way of escaping. Lily died of an overdose and Jake was left alone to take care of Angela, whom he considers to be his own daughter. He and Addison first met in the supermarket and flirted over pineapples. When they met again, they agreed to go on a date, but decided not to tell each other about who they were in order to make it more exciting. They kissed and flirted and he asked her to come to Fiji with him as a very long date, but standing in the airport after saying goodbye to Naomi, she decided not to go. However, Jake himself didn't go either because of a medical emergency. Soon after, they found out about their identities when he ended up being her fertility doctor. Jake joined the practice to fill the hole left by Naomi. Initially, he felt like an outsider of the practice family. He was happy with that, as he found them to be sharing way too much with each other, but he gradually became part of the family as well. Addison proposed to Jake but he didn't say yes. She was embarrassed and hid out in the bathroom. Jake later talked to a hallucination of his dead wife [[Lily Reilly]], who understood he was old school and thought he was the one who had to propose. Lily convinced him that Jake could move on from her as their vows were till death. Jake then set up a romantic scene at Addison's house and asked her to propose again. She did and he accepted.[[The World According to Jake]], x (PP) During the pandemic, he took interest in model trains.[[With a Little Help From My Friends]], x Jake is a doctor who is incredibly devoted to his patients. He's willing to spend his personal time with patients if that's what they require. He also tries not to judge about what his patients ask for, as he just considers it his job to make it happen if he can. He describes himself as patient and understanding. There is however, a limit to his patience, as demonstrated when Addison wouldn't open up to him about [[Mark Sloan]]. [[Lily Reilly]] At some point in his life, Jake met Lily Reilly. They married and he adopted her year old daughter. However, Lily was a drug addict. Even so, Jake loved her and always hoped that she would choose him over drugs. He once found her on the floor of the bathroom, where she had overdosed on drugs. He performed CPR on her until the paramedics arrived. She died of an overdose. Before Jake married Addison, he occasionally talked to Lily, who had already died, asking for advice about Angela. Eventually, her spirit left him, saying he no longer needed her because Addison loves him and makes him happy.[[The World According to Jake]], x (PP) [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] When Addison's therapist told her to make a change in her life, she met Jake and they flirted over pineapples at the grocery store. They started seeing each other at a coffee shop. However, they both agreed to keep their identities in secret. Jake was going on vacation to Fiji and he asked Addison to come with him. She eventually accepted, but when at the airport, she realized it wasn't right to try to avoid Sam and the problems the practice was suffering. [[File:PPx-.jpg|thumb|left|Jake and Addison at their wedding.]] Later on, Addison started her fertility treatment only to find out that her doctor was Jake. He admitted he never left for Fiji. Flustered and embarrassed, she left his office. Addison was extremely startled when she saw that Jake had applied for the fertility specialist opening at Oceanside Wellness. She insisted that there was something wrong with him as a doctor, but he was the perfect candidate, so he was hired. Later, Addison decided to start fertility treatments again, and Jake was her doctor. He conducted two rounds of IVF on her. When both rounds failed, he helped her attempt to find a suitable surrogate. After Addison broke up with Sam for good, Jake told Addison that she wasn't ready for what he had to offer. He could love her, marry her, and make a baby with her, but she had to get ready. He couldn't have her pining after another man. Addison replied she could get ready. After Addison adopted Henry, Jake moved in with her to be Henry's loving father. A few weeks after, Addison proposed that they get married, startling him and prompting her to lock herself in the bathroom. He insisted he never said no. A few weeks later, Mildred interviewed Jake (a standard procedure when adopting a child) where she found out about Jake's criminal history. Addison wasn't upset about this because she said that her, Jake, and Henry were all supposed to be together, and the judge would see that. When Addison proposed to him one evening, he was stunned. He replied that marriage was a big step, and he wanted the two of them to be ready. Addison was humiliated, and locked herself in the bathroom. Their relationship was tested when Addison accused him of spending too much time with his patients. He shot back that everything was always about her. Fortunately, they got through it after Addison defended Jake to one of his former patients, [[Megan Stewart]]. Jake proposed to Addison and they married after Henry's adoption was finalized. He stated to Addison that he knew she was "the one" when he invited her to Fiji and again when he saw her sitting on his exam table for the first time. Jake grew up as the oldest of four. He has three younger sisters. Their dad left when Jake was years old, and their mother died when he was . [[Henry Montgomery]] Jake is Henry's father. When Jake and Addison were dating, he acted like a father figure to Henry and had to meet [[Mildred Clemons]], the social worker, after he moved in with Addison to make sure he was a good figure in Henry's life. Addison, Jake, and Henry are all now a family. Dr. Reilly graduated from [[Duke University School of Medicine]] and completed [[Resident|residencies]] in [[General Surgery|surgery]] and [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] at [[Johns Hopkins Hospital|Johns Hopkins]], as well as completing a [[Fellow|fellowship]] in [[Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility|reproductive endocrinology and infertility]]. He is also [[Board Certification|double-board certified]] in [[Board Certification#American Board of Surgery|general surgery]] and [[Board Certification#Obstetrics and Gynecology|obstetrics and gynecology]]. He started to work at [[Seaside Health and Wellness]] after [[Naomi Bennett]] left the practice. Before med school, Jake worked three jobs to pay for college: he was a bike courier, a short-order cook, and a bellman. At some point, he even sold his sperm. *He and Addison met while flirting over pineapples, which he hates.[[...To Change the Things I Can]], x (PP) *Before choosing fertility, he played around with idea of specializing in drug addictions.[[Who We Are]], x (PP) *When Jake is formally introduced, his lab coat shows, "Jake Reilly, M.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists|F.A.C.O.G.]]" with "[[Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility|Reproductive Endocrinology]]" on the second line, embroidered in script font. *He and Sam played intramural basketball in college. *Jake is the best fertility doctor in the country, second only to [[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]]. *At some point in his life, Jake sold sperm in order to get money to take care of his family and to go to college. Therefore, it's likely that he has biological children he doesn't know about. *During his interview at [[Seaside Health and Wellness]], [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] specifically mentions he is [[Board Certification|board certified]] in [[General Surgery|general surgery]] and [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]]; despite having completed a [[Fellow|fellowship]] in [[Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility|REI]], subsequent episodes and promotional material for [[Private Practice]] has not stated him being board certified in REI: this cannot be assumed as there is an insufficient evidence by the show to support a board certification in REI. *He is a fan of Game of Thrones as he and his [[Henry Montgomery|son]] binged and subsequently argued over the show, much to the annoyance of his [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|wife]]. [[With a Little Help From My Friends]], x (GA) *During the Covid- Pandemic, He took up model railroading as a hobby. '''James Harris''' is the judge who handled Addison's adoption of Henry.


When Henry and Addison had their final adoption hearing, Judge Harris was assigned to the case. Everything looked good until he got a fax from [[Mildred Clemons]], who had some concerns. He ordered further evaluation and said they'd set another court date.

Jake went to visit James and said that the file was not the whole story. James gave him  seconds to talk. Jake explained about Lily and Angela and the drug dealer and said he had to protect his family. He said he would do the same for Henry. He then said he'd leave Addison if that's what it took to keep Henry and Addison together because they needed to be together.

Jake's speech persuaded him and he signed her final adoption papers.



He has four daughters.


He is a judge.

'''James Peterson''' is an [[Emergency Medicine|emergency medicine]] [[Attending|attending]] at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] whom [[Charlotte King]] hired to replace [[Pete Wilder]] after his death.



James grew up in Tennessee.


On James's first night working at St. Ambrose, it rained heavily, sending many people to the ER. He butted heads with several of the other doctors. Amelia Shepherd disagreed with him on the case of [[Todd Reiter]], whom she believed was fine and whom he believed to have a problem. He was ultimately proven right. He disagreed with Cooper on the case of [[Sarah Nelson]], believing DCFS needed to be involved. He then told Sheldon that there was no help for his patient, [[Nick Calhoun]], who was a pedophile. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")''


James was part of the search for [[Sarah Nelson]] after she disappeared from the ER. ''("[[The Next Episode]]")''

James later told Sheldon a contract worker on the janitorial staff had been arrested in connection with Sarah's disappearance. He was a registered sex offender. ''("[[I'm Fine]]")''


When Charlotte went into labor at  weeks, she was rushed to the ER, where James started working to stop her labor. However, one of the babies was already presenting, so they had to deliver. After the first delivery, Jake determined the rest of the membranes were intact and her labor stopped. ''("[[Life Support]]")''

While Charlotte was on bed rest, James came to visit her and they watched sports together. ''("[[Georgia on My Mind]]")''


James attended Jake and Addison's wedding with Amelia. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''


When he and Amelia attended Naomi and Sam's second wedding, he told her that would be them one day. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''



[[Amelia Shepherd]]
James met Amelia during his first night at St. Ambrose. She disagreed with him about [[Todd Reiter]] and told him to send Todd home. When he found an infection that could have paralyzed Todd, he passed the credit to Amelia. When his shift ended, he found Amelia and asked if he could buy her a drink. However, she declined, telling him she doesn't drink. She then told him she'd given birth to an anencephalic baby and if she started drinking, she'd never stop. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")''

At a barbecue at Sam's house, James approached Amelia again and she turned him down again. ''("[[The Next Episode]]")''

Amelia continued to brush off his attempts to bond with her. He told her he eats at Billy's every Friday and suggested she might join him, because they have really, really good fries there. After Jake told her James was a good guy, Amelia showed up to eat with him. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''

When Amelia decided to start dating again, she went on several bad blind dates before going to Billy's on Friday night to see James. At the end of the night, he hugged her instead of kissing her, to her surprise.

James asked her out again and they went to dinner. At the end of the night, he still didn't kiss her. He later showed up at her place and kissed her, saying the anticipation was killing him.

They later tried to have sex, but she started having flashbacks to Ryan, so she pulled back and left the room. The next morning, she found him still in her apartment, making breakfast. He said she didn't owe him an explanation, but she explained anyway and gave him an out, which he didn't take. They went to bed and had sex. Afterward, she told him about Ryan and her drug use and alcoholism. He then invited her to meet his parents, who were coming into town.

During the dinner, James's mother, Stella, started questioning Amelia. James stepped in and moved the conversation to another topic. Amelia later yelled at James for not letting her stand up for herself and for silencing her during the conversation. She said it wasn't working and asked him to leave. When he refused, she left.

When he saw her later, he asked her what the fight was really about. She told him that all the men she loves die. He told her he loved her. After saving their shared patient, she told him she loved him too. ''("[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]]")''

After seeing Charlotte give birth, Amelia told James she wanted babies, but she was scared to want them because of what happened to her baby. She then said that if they got that far, she wanted to have babies with him. ''("[[Full Release]]")''

At Naomi and Sam's wedding, James told Amelia that would be them one day. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''

However, she freaked out when he proposed to her and went to visit her brother in Seattle, seeing if she could handle a married life with kids. She concluded she couldn't and realized that she loved Seattle. She had several calls with James and broke off the engagement.


His grandmother had cancer. While she was dying, he was busy with medical school, so he didn't spend that much time by her side. He confessed to Addison that he regrets not having made more time for her. ''("[[Apron Strings]]")''

He has an uncle who is  and smokes two packs of cigarettes a day. ''("[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]]")''


[[Vivian Carlsmith]]
When Vivian was in the hospital dying, James regularly visited her, playing cards and talking. He said she reminded him of his grandmother who had died. ''("[[Apron Strings]]")''


James graduated from [[Stanford University School of Medicine]], and completed his [[Emergency Medicine|emergency medicine]] [[Resident|residency]] and [[Fellow|fellowship]] at [[USC Medical Center|U.S.C.]] He then became an [[Attending|attending]] at U.S.C.'s [[Trauma Center#Level I|Level ]] [[Trauma Center]], and worked there for five years before [[Charlotte King]] wooed James to work for [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] with the promise that he would eventually become the [[Attending#Department Head|head]] of the emergency department.


*While not verified on [[Private Practice]], James most likely completed his [[Fellow|fellowship]] in critical care medicine.
*James really likes the pudding at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]].
*He completed the Ironman in .<ref>[[The Next Episode]], x (PP)</ref>
*James only buys American cars.<ref>[[The Next Episode]], x (PP)</ref>
*James likes orange soda.<ref>[[The World According to Jake]], x (PP)</ref>
*He does not like to be called "dude."<ref>[[The World According to Jake]], x (PP)</ref>
*He was a waiter at some point in his past.<ref>[[The World According to Jake]], x (PP)</ref>
*James is a conservative Republican.<ref>[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]], x (PP)</ref>
*James prefers\ua''The Wall Street Journal'' over\ua''The New York Times'' because he believes the former is more objective.<ref>[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]], x (PP)</ref>
*He says he's been in love a few times.<ref>[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]], x (PP)</ref>
*He says he's "pro-life", but supports the death penalty.<ref>[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]], x (PP)</ref>
*His mother stayed at home with him when he was a child.<ref>[[Good Fries Are Hard to Come By]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Jamie''' is one of three girls who made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.


Jamie's mother, [[Ricky]], plus [[Terri (The Hardest Part)|Terri]] and [[Pam (The Hardest Part)|Pam]], were in talk therapy with Sheldon and Violet because their three daughters, [[Casey]], [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]], and Jamie had made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.

The three daughters also came in to have talk therapy together, to try to explain why they'd done it. Casey said she didn't think she should worry about good grades or college when all she wanted was to be a mom, Jamie said it was instant status, and Lisa said babies love you no matter what. There's a lot going on at her house, so her mother can't give them all attention all the time.

Ricky came in late to their joint session. She'd told Jamie she needed to pick up her brother, but she came back with Violet's book, saying Violet wasn't the right therapist for their daughters. She took Jamie and left.

Sheldon and Violet took Casey and Lisa to tour the hospital. Casey and Lisa by that point had read Violet's book and made several comments about it. Violet started to fight back, but Casey started having serious abdominal pain and bleeding. She was rushed in for an emergency c-section. Lisa watched as Casey's baby was delivered and said it wasn't what she expected and left.

Jamie later called Casey and said she was giving her baby up for adoption.



Her mother was upset that she'd made a pact with her friends to get pregnant. When she figured out where she recognized Violet from, she refused to let Jamie see her anymore.


She and her friends [[Casey]] and [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]], made a pact to get pregnant together in high school. However, Lisa and Jamie both backed out of their plan when Casey's baby was born after an emergency.

'''Jamie Carr''' is a pregnant woman who broke her wrist when she slipped and fell in the shower.


Jamie came into the hospital when she slipped and fell in the shower and broke her wrist. She declined pain medication because she was eight months pregnant. She was concerned because he'd been kicking before she fell and had stopped. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] did an ultrasound and discovered that there had been a fetal demise. The x-ray of her wrist showed that the bones were out of alignment, so Jamie needed to be put in traction to re-align the bones before her wrist could be casted. Jamie and her husband were devastated to hear that their baby had died.

Jamie then delivered the baby and held him.



She is married to [[Ted Carr]].


She was eight months pregnant when she fell in the shower. As a result, her baby was stillborn.

Jan was shopping at Circus Liquor when Kelly came in to rob the place. Kelly took Jan, plus [[Sara Hill]] and [[Damon]] hostage and shot Damon in the leg. Sara called Sam, her doctor, to come tend to Damon's leg. Jan and Sara helped with that and then helped deliver Kelly's baby when she revealed she was in labor. '''Jane Finch''' is a woman who needed psych approval in order to have sex reassignment surgery.


Jane was at the practice to have a psych consult before having sex reassignment surgery as part of her transition. The consult went well, but Sheldon noticed scars from a past suicide attempt and they talked about that. After the consult, Sheldon had reservations and asked to continue seeing Jane before authorizing her surgery, feeling that she was rehearsed and was hiding something.

Jane came back in and asked Charlotte what she needed to do. Charlotte advised her to stop pretending she wasn't lonely. Jane said that the one time she stopped pretending was when she attempted suicide. She said that the loneliness was the result of not being able to be herself. Charlotte told Jane to tell Sheldon that.

In her next session with Sheldon, they talked about what Jane expected to feel after her surgery. She also talked about her father kicking her out when he caught her trying on her mother's bra and a man beating her up after finding out she was transgender. Sheldon said he wanted to hear about all of it and he wouldn't okay her surgery yet.

Jane went to Charlotte and said she'd keep doing her work, but Charlotte became concerned about Jane because of some things she said.

Charlotte later got a call from Jane and went to her with Sheldon. When they got to her, they discovered that she was bleeding seriously. She'd cut her own penis off. They got her to the hospital where they were able to save her life.

When she woke up after surgery, she apologized to Charlotte and Sheldon offered that she could still feel better. He agreed to keep seeing her.



Her father kicked her out when he caught her trying on her mother's bras.


*She told her parents she was a girl when she was nine.
*She attempted suicide at the age of .

'''Jane Williams''' is a pregnant woman who had a stroke.


When Jane was  weeks pregnant, she had a stroke. Archer evaluated her and said that if he could stop the stroke within three hours of it starting, she had a good chance of not having any neurological deficits. Her ex-husband asked about the baby. Archer and Addison disagreed about treatment options. Archer did an endovascular clot evacuation. During the procedure, Jane started having contractions, which Addison was able to stop. After the procedure, Jane was stable, though still paralyzed on one side.

Jane went into labor while in recovery. Addison took her up for a c-section. Because stopping the blood thinners would put her at risk for another stroke, Addison decided to do the c-section with a spinal block while Archer monitored her neuro function.

After the baby was delivered, he didn't breathe right away. He had aspirated meconium, but once Addison suctioned it out of his airway, he started breathing.

After the surgery, Addison brought the baby to see Jane. Tim came in with them. She said she was glad that he was there. Tim handed Jane the baby and they sat together in her bed with their son.



She was married to [[Tim Williams]]. They had a long, painful divorce. Their divorce was complicated by the fact that Jane was pregnant. Jane even wished during a fight that she wasn't pregnant, because she resented that it kept Tim in her life.


Her son was born via emergency c-section after she had a stroke.


*She was  years old at the time of her stroke.

'''Janet''' is the mother of [[Lizzie Hagan|Lizzie Hagan's]] late boyfriend, Eric.


Janet's son, Eric, died in an IED explosion that almost completely blinded his pregnant girlfriend, Lizzie. Lizzie later gave birth to a baby she named Natasha. When Lizzie nearly smothered Natasha while breastfeeding, Amelia called in Janet. Janet came up from San Diego to take Natasha home with her. Janet agreed to wait until they operated to try to restore Lizzie's vision, but said if they weren't able to, she'd be taking Natasha back with her.

Lizzie had the surgery and as her bandages were removed, she talked about seeing things around the room. Janet left, upset. She said that things were supposed to go so differently. Eric was supposed to be alive and she was supposed to gain a daughter and she was supposed to be there for her grandchildren.

She returned to Lizzie's room to say goodbye to Natasha before leaving to go home, but was told that Lizzie had lied and was totally blind after her surgery. Janet said she'd stay to help out, just as long as Lizzie needed to get adjusted to taking care of her. They agreed to try that.



Her son, Eric, died in Afghanistan several months before his daughter, Natasha was born.

'''Janine''' is a pregnant woman who needed a heart transplant and got one from her husband.


Janine was  weeks pregnant and short of breath. She wondered if she had gestational diabetes because her husband, [[Phillip (What You Do for Love)|Phillip]], was diabetic. Her brother-in-law, [[Malcolm]], who is a nurse, came to her appointment because Phillip had to work. Addison said that her blood sugar was fine. Addison listened to her lungs and had Dell call an ambulance because she heard fluid in Janine's lungs. She had diffuse myocardial dysfunction. The added pressure of the pregnancy caused the condition to worsen quickly. She needed a heart transplant. Because the pregnancy was putting extra stress on her, Addison recommended termination. Her husband said she should, but Janine said she couldn't do it.

Janine was put at the top of the donor list, but her husband and brother-in-law were told she had only  hours to find a heart.

Phillip later came into the ER with no brain activity. He'd had an insulin overdose that caused brain death. His license revealed that he was an organ donor. They talked to Janine, asking her to take Phillip's heart to save her life. Malcolm encouraged her to take it. They took her in for the surgery, but were stopped by [[Charlotte King]]. She believed it was either suicide or homicide and insisted that evidence be collected before the transplant could take place. They waited and Phillip started to become unstable, so they had to rush once they were cleared to retrieve the heart.

After the transplant, Janine's condition improved, though she worried because she suspected that Malcolm might have killed his brother to get Janine a heart. She knew he was in love with her. Addison confronted Malcolm about it, but he denied it, saying he loved his brother. The ME ruled Phillip's death an accidental overdose. Addison later watched as Malcolm kissed Janine's hand in her hospital room.



She was married to [[Phillip (What You Do for Love)|Phillip]] until his death. When he was declared brain dead, she received his heart for transplant.


Her brother-in-law, [[Malcolm]], came to all her appointments with her during her pregnancy because her husband worked a lot and wasn't able to come. She admitted to Addison that she knew he was in love with her and worried that he'd killed Phillip to get Janine a heart transplant.


*Her blood type is O.

}}

'''Jasmine Spencer''' is the mother of [[Drea Spencer]].


Jasmine's daughter, Drea, came into the ER with several stab wounds, including one to her chest. Her sister, Missy, came into the ER with her and said that she had told Drea she needed half an hour to finish her homework and then they'd make cupcakes, but when she came to get her, she wasn't in her room. Jasmine and Gary arrived just before they prepared to do a thoracotomy on Drea in the ER. When Violet went to lead the family out of the room while they cracked her chest, she noticed that Missy was looking at what they were doing intently.

Drea's parents were upset about her injuries and Violet saw that Missy didn't seem upset, so she asked Gary if he wanted her to speak to Missy to see how she was feeling about the situation. He hinted that others had noticed odd behavior from her and said he wasn't concerned with how Missy was feeling at the moment because Drea was fighting for her life.

After her surgery, Drea was pronounced brain dead. While their parents decided what to do about life support, Violet offered to talk to Missy again. Violet shared with Missy her experience being stabbed and said she wondered what Katie felt while she was stabbing her. Missy said she probably felt powerful and in control.

After that conversation, Violet went to her parents and said she was showing signs of juvenile sociopathy and she believed Missy was involved in the stabbing. Jasmine said it was crazy, but Gary believed her.

Violet talked to Missy again and said she had thought Missy was smart to figure out what Katie did what she did to fell powerful, but Violet disagreed. She thought Katie did it because she was jealous. Missy said she might have stabbed her to know if she could really do it. Violet pretended to be dubious, but Missy said it was only scary for a second and then you were in it. Missy then confessed that she'd stabbed her sister and it wasn't scary for her. It was the coolest thing she'd ever done. The police came in and arrested Missy.

Amelia found Gary sitting by Drea's bedside. He said Jasmine had to leave. His family was destroyed because one of his daughters had killed the other. He felt that Drea's life should have counted for more and asked Amelia about organ donation. Amelia said he could do that and it would matter to a lot of people.



She is married to [[Gary Spencer]].


One of her daughters stabbed the other and caused her death.

'''Jason Madison''' is a child with cancer whose parents had a second child to save his life.


Jason was diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia. He'd undergone treatment, but his parents decided to pay $, to use selective IVF to get pregnant with a baby that could give Jason the cord blood transfusion he needed to save his life. In the meantime, they found a partial match to give him a bone marrow transplant. They prepared for the bone marrow transplant, which included killing off Jason's immune system, but the donor developed pneumonia and was unable to donate.

Despite being only  weeks pregnant, Jason's mother begged Addison to deliver the baby immediately so they could use her cord blood to save Jason. Addison refused, saying that their daughter was important and she wasn't willing to risk the baby's life to save Jason's.

Molly came into the hospital with her water broken. They tried to say it just happened, but Addison refused to help them until they told the truth. Molly admitted that she'd broken her own water with a knitting needle. Addison took her into the OR for a c-section. She delivered the baby and the cord blood was harvested for Jason. While he had his transfusion, Addison did liquid ventilation to keep his sister alive. Despite it being only experimental, it was successful and her condition improved. Jason's transfusion was also successful. Molly later thanked Addison and said she did what she had to do to save her family.



Jason's parents were very concerned with his survival, to the point where they paid $, to conceive another child to save his life.


*He was seven at the time of his cord blood transfusion.
*He likes bugs and has been known to sneak ladybugs into the house in his pocket.
*He likes meatballs and french fries.
*He's afraid of the dark.
*He likes to read.

'''Jason Windsor''' is the father of [[Marisa Windsor]].


Jason's daughter, Marisa, was at the practice for a routine exam when she started seizing. She had juvenile Krabbe's disease, which had caused significant neurological deterioration. She'd been on sedatives, but her parents had them reduced because they were making her a zombie. She'd lost most of her hearing and part of her eyesight. She had six months to a year left to live. Her parents had been seeing Sheldon to try to adjust to that idea.

Pete suggested a stem cell transfusion, but Cooper rejected the idea, worried it might do more damage. They went to the Windsors about it, saying it could give her two or three more years. Her mother, Angela, wanted to do it, but Jason worried about the possibility of it making her worse.

They did the transfusion, but Marisa had a severe allergic reaction and was deprived of oxygen for a significant amount of time, leaving her only minimally functional. Her parents were devastated and blamed the doctors for pushing them into the treatment.

Jason talked to Cooper about Marisa's condition and asked him to help end her suffering. Cooper refused.



He is married to [[Angela Windsor]].

'''Jeffrey''' is the husband of [[Kathleen]] who was also seen for infertility.



Jeffrey came into the practice with his wife, Kathleen, shortly after they were married because during their honeymoon, they found that she was unable to have sex. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] attempted to do an exam, but was unable to get the speculum into Kathleen's vagina. She prescribed muscle relaxants to treat vaginismus, involuntary spasms in the vagina. Kathleen went home, but was still unable to have sex with her husband, so she returned the next day. Addison then diagnosed vulvar vastivulitis and planned targeted lidocaine injections to treat her. The injections were painful, but Kathleen agreed to have them. She then referred Kathleen to [[Pete Wilder|Pete]] to treat the vaginismus. The next day, Kathleen and Jeffery came into the practice and profusely thanked Addison and Pete for their help. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''


Two months later, Jeffrey and Kathleen came back into the practice. They hadn't been able to conceive and since Kathleen was older, they knew they didn't have much time left and wanted help. Addison agreed to run tests on both of them. The tests showed that Kathleen was ovulating. She also had some fibroids, but they decided just to keep an eye on them. The trouble conceiving came from Jeffrey, who was functionally sterile. They decided they'd use a sperm donor to get Kathleen pregnant. Jeffrey privately told Addison that he wanted to give Kathleen what he had. She was adopted and he wanted her to have a family member that looked like her. Kathleen struggled to pick a donor that she liked, so Jeffrey proposed a solution. He brought in his brother, Mark, to donate his sperm. Mark gave his sample and it was good, but when they went to inseminate, both Jeffrey and Kathleen stopped it last minute. Kathleen said his brother was kind of a jerk and she didn't want to have anyone's baby but his. Jeffrey begged them to find another solution so they could have a baby. They looked into the options and found a way, which involved extracting sperm directly from Jeffrey's testicles. They said it could work with only one viable sperm. They did the procedure and were able to find a single viable sperm. They extracted Kathleen's egg, inseminated it, and the implanted it back in her uterus. They were then told to go home and relax while they waited for it to implant. ''("[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]]")''



He is married to [[Kathleen]]. They went on a three-week honeymoon in Africa. They climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro and scaled Victoria Falls on their trip.


He says that his family is crazy, but there's a lot of love. ''("[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]]")''

'''Jenna''' is a  year old terminally ill patient who was hoping for a baby.


Jenna was in the practice to have eggs retrieved so she could get pregnant and have a baby before she died. She had Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma and her last wish was to have a baby. She was already married and had only a year or two to live.

Addison questioned the decision to help a seventeen year old terminally ill child conceive a child. After she spoke to Jenna's husband, Nick, Nick expressed his concerns and ultimately decided he didn't want to go through with it. Determined, Jenna said she wanted to proceed with a sperm donor instead of Nick.

After Addison made them understand that what they all really wanted was for Jenna not to be dying, Naomi shared that truth with Jenna and said she couldn't go forward with the implantation. Nick then came in and said he didn't want a baby, but he did want Jenna.



[[Nick (Let It Go)|Nick]]
Nick is her husband. He was her first true love. He stayed with her throughout the disease. Nick married Jenna at a young age and stayed with the family because he did not have a family of his own. At their wedding, they had strawberry cake and she wore her grandmother's ring, which was a whole karat.


Garry and Lynn are loving parents who supported Jenna's relationship with Nick and supported her throughout the disease and her desire to become a mom.


All the doctors in the practice loved Jenna. She was one of Cooper's first patients.

'''Jennifer Debray''' is the mother of [[Elena Debray]].


Jennifer and her husband, Ronald, were called to the hospital when their daughter, Elena, was in labor after being in a coma for eight months following a car accident. As they had the right to make decisions about her medical care, they asked Addison to do a c-section, which she recommended, over the objections of Elena's boyfriend, [[Shawn]], who hoped that giving birth would wake Elena from her coma.

Just as Addison prepared to do the c-section, Shawn got an injunction as guardian of the baby. [[Judge McLennan]] was called in to make a ruling on the case. After hearing from all sides, he gave Shawn the choice to withdraw his objections or be ruled against. He allowed them to do the c-section. Elena died during the surgery, but the baby was handed off to her father. He then took her into the OR to see Elena before her body was taken away.



She is married to [[Ronald Debray]].


Her daughter, Elena, spent eight months in a coma while pregnant. Elena then died during a c-section to deliver her baby.
