'''Jenny''' is a patient of Violet's who had a psychiatric episode at a store after seeing a child who looked like her dead son.


Jenny was at a store when she suddenly dropped to the floor and started to count the tiles. [[Paul Gonzales]], the manager of the store, found Violet's card on her and called her. Violet arrived at the store and tried talking to Jenny, who had been seeing her for anger, mostly directed at her husband for leaving her. When Violet touched Jenny's shoulder, she lashed out in anger and knocked Violet to the ground. Violet used the security cameras to find out what Jenny had been doing when she started the counting. She found that Jenny had seen an ad with a boy and his family camping. She went back to Jenny and asked her if she had a son that she hadn't told Violet about. Jenny started counting faster. Cooper found a file on her son, Will, and brought it to the store. He began to read the file, from when he was diagnosed with an aggressive brain tumor and how they tried treatment, but eventually stopped and went to the lake as a family until he was re-admitted to the hospital, where he slipped into a coma and they decided to take him off the machines. He breathed on his own for four hours and she held him while he died.



She was married. Her husband left her after their son died.


Her son, Will, was diagnosed with a brain-stem glioma when he was ten. They tried chemo and radiation. It worked at first, but he stopped responding and went into kidney failure, so they made the decision to stop treatment and spend the time as a family. A few months later, he was re-admitted to the hospital with trouble breathing. He slipped into a coma and they decided to turn off the machines. Jenny held him for four hours as he breathed on his own before he died.

|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Thomas Ian Nicholas]]
}}'''Jeremiah Tate''' was a patient who was close to [[Miranda Bailey]] who had cystic fibrosis.



Jeremiah was one of Bailey's first patients when she was an intern. She knew very little about cystic fibrosis and how to treat it, but she learned with his help. They grew very close in the process.


Jeremiah came into the hospital because he'd been in a lot of pain and had had a few seizures. He believed it was his pancreatitis flaring up again. Scans revealed that he needed an exploratory laparotomy, but his lungs made Bailey hesitant to cut. She consulted with Addison, who had previous -year experience working with kids with CF,\uawho said she might have a way to help. They went to Jeremiah and presented their plan to him. He agreed to the surgery and wanted to call his parents, whom he always refused to call until he was better again. Bailey talked him out of it, saying he'd be fine.

They took him into surgery, but he was already not doing well. He had no urine output. He started coding and Bailey started CPR, despite his DNR. Meredith convinced Bailey to let her take over when she was getting tired while Addison tried to convince Bailey that Jeremiah wasn't coming back. He was pronounced dead in the OR. After his death, Bailey called his parents.



Jeremiah didn't like to worry his parents, so he only called them after he was out of the hospital.


He had a great relationship with Miranda Bailey. He was one of her first patients and held a special place in her heart.


*He was  at the time of his death.
*He ran triathlons to raise money for cystic fibrosis research.
*He was pronounced dead at :.

'''Jerry''' is the father of [[Kelli]] and [[Niki]].


Jerry's wife, Renee, labored and gave birth. The baby had been conceived because her older twin girls, [[Kelli]] and [[Niki]], had cancer and they needed to cord blood to treat them. After he was born, Renee declined to hold Trevor, more concerned about getting the cord blood.

Niki and Kelli had been admitted to the hospital in preparation for the transfusion. Addison looked at the cord blood. The sample was good, but there weren't enough cells for both girls. Renee said she couldn't choose between them, but they didn't have time to have another baby. Jerry said he could decide, that he could pick one of his girls to save. He felt guilty for knowing he could do it. He then chose Kelli and said to give her the cord blood. However, Renee stopped him, saying not to do it and told Jerry he was going to hell for making the choice.

Niki went into sepsis and Cooper believed she'd relapsed. She told Cooper she didn't want to die. Cooper believed he could get her into remission, but she'd need the cord blood. Jerry said no, to give the blood to Kelli. Cooper said he couldn't without both parents' permission, so Jerry said he'd get a court order because he didn't want Kelli to die because Renee couldn't make the choice. Renee maintained that she couldn't choose one child over another, but Addison pointed out that she was already doing that by refusing to look at Trevor. She admitted she was worried he'd replace them.

After talking with Renee and Jerry, Cooper told Niki and Kelli that Niki was too sick to get the treatment, so they'd give it to Kelli and Niki wouldn't get better. Kelli said she didn't want it because she and Niki do everything the same. Niki told Kelli she had to get better and gave her her hat, which she said was lucky.

Jerry stayed with Niki while Kelli went to get her transfusion and Renee brought Trevor to her so she could spend some time with her brother.



He is married to [[Renee (Shotgun)|Renee]].


*He admitted to Sam that he favors Kelli over Niki.

'''Jesse''' is a teenager whose mother was scared to sleep because she believed he was a sociopath.


Jesse's mom, Linda, came to Violet for a consult to get sleeping pills. She hadn't been sleeping well since her husband died, but it had recently gotten worse. Violet wanted to talk about what was causing the insomnia. Linda admitted that she was scared of her son, Jesse, whom she believed was a sociopath. She said he'd killed their dog. She found the dog in the garage wrapped in a blanket in the garage with a broken neck. She told Violet he changed when his father died, becoming cold. Linda said she just wanted the pills, but Violet wanted to see Jesse and wanted to help.

Linda brought Jesse in to see Violet. She asked him about the dog and he wouldn't respond to her questions about the dog or about his father. Jesse just asked if he could leave. Violet decided just to let him stew for a while to try to get him to talk. She later went back to Jesse and said she had concerns and didn't feel comfortable letting him leave. She gave him the MMPI to fill out and asked him to do it, saying that he could do it or they could sit there for the rest of the day. His test was inconclusive.

Violet saw Linda again and Linda was upset because Violet said the tests were inconclusive. She couldn't sleep. She would lie awake in bed with a hammer under her pillow because she was so scared of what Jesse might do to her.

Jesse confronted Violet, upset because she'd made his mom cry. He told her to let it go. Violet said she wouldn't stop asking questions and asked him again what happened to the dog. Jesse asked her if she knows what it costs to put a dog down. The dog had cancer and the treatment cost thousands of dollars, but his mom was going to pay for it because she couldn't bear to watch him lose his dog after losing his father to cancer. So he killed the dog so his mother wouldn't have to go through that expense. Jesse started to cry as he talked about it, saying his father said he had to be the man and had to be responsible.



His father died of cancer the year before. His mother struggled to make ends meet because the cancer had nearly bankrupted them.


*He'd had his dog, a Beagle named Dodger, since he was six.

'''Jessica Gilbert''' is the mother of [[Kerri Gilbert]].


Jessica's daughter, Kerri, was in the hospital. Her labs showed that despite a bone marrow transplant from her father, Greg, her cancer had returned. The only option left was a cord blood transfusion. Cooper said they'd search the public donor banks. There were no matches, so Cooper asked Charlotte to search the private banks. She refused because that cord blood is for the families' personal use.

Cooper went to watch a movie with Kerri. She said she was tired and asked if he'd come back the next day. He said he couldn't, but could come back Saturday, prompting her to ask if she'd still be alive on Saturday. Cooper then used Charlotte's computer to search the private banks and found a match.

He went to [[Robert Weston|Robert]] and [[Ellen Weston]], whose deceased son, Kip, was the match. He asked them to give Kerri the blood so spare another family the grief of losing a child. However, they wanted to keep the blood for their other son, Matt, in case he needed it.

Despite this, Cooper used the blood to treat Kerri. The treatment worked and Kerri's condition rapidly improved.

When the Westons came to the hospital to talk to Charlotte about the situation, they cross paths with Greg, who, upon figuring out who they were, hugged them, thanked them, and offered them the chance to meet Kerri, which they took.



She is married to [[Greg Gilbert]].


Her daughter, Kerri, has leukemia. She'd previously received a bone marrow transplant from Greg.

'''Jill Avery''' is a patient who came in for help after being beaten during a carjacking.


Jill was in the ER after being beaten during a carjacking after soccer practice. She had no memory of the event. Pete, who had been treating Jill for a torn rotator cuff, examined her and asked her to speak to Violet. She said she was fine other than being angry because she loved her car and school, but he insisted.

Jill saw Violet and they attempted memory recovery so she could remember what had happened and help the police catch her attacker.

After working with Violet, Pete noticed that Jill was in a lot more pain. He believed her work with Violet was hurting her and asked Violet to back off a little.

Jill came in and said the police had called. They think they had the guy who attacked her and wanted her to come in for a lineup. After identifying her attacker, she was upset because seeing his face again made her remember it and she was scared.

After a month of work, Jill was still only able to remember his face and she saw it everywhere. She didn't know how she could testify against him if she didn't remember. She wanted the fear to go away, so she refused to stop working. After a session, she was highly panicked. Pete was able to calm her down and get her to rest. He again asked Violet to stop.

A month later, at the trial, Jill was worried she couldn't do it, but Violet and Pete talked her through it and had her talk about what he'd done. She finally remembered the details of the attack. After her testimony, the jury found him guilty.


*She plays soccer for her college.
*She likes riding horses at Griffith Park.

'''Jillian McCray''' is the wife of [[Raymond McCray]].


Jillian came to Los Angeles with her husband, Raymond, and [[Dee Bennett]]. Raymond needed cardiac studies after being in the ER a few weeks prior with chest pain. His symptoms had been getting worse since then. His EKG showed non-specific abnormalities, so Sam moved him to St. Ambrose for a chest CT and an echo.

Raymond's tests showed pulmonary hypertension. Sam started him on anti-coagulants and placed an umbrella, which he hoped would solve the problem. When Jillian and Sam left Raymond's hospital room, the camera crew caught Dee and Raymond kissing in his room. Sam walked back in time to see it as well.

Dee, Raymond, and Jillian all attended a barbecue at Sam's house. Raymond pulled Sam aside and said it wasn't a fling and he really loved Dee. Sam told him to get away from him. Raymond collapsed at the party and had to be rushed to the ER. They stabilized him and moved him to the OR to remove the clots.

During the surgery, he started to bleed into his chest. He survived the surgery, but was told he needed a lung transplant. Sam suggested they start testing family members, but Raymond and Jillian said they didn't have any children or nieces and nephews. Dee wanted to pray, but Jillian instead suggested that Sam get tested revealing that Raymond is his biological father. Jillian told Raymond she'd known all along, but hadn't said anything.

Dee talked to Sam about how their relationship played out. Sam decided to get tested to see if he was a match for Raymond. The test revealed that he was a match and he told Raymond he'd donate if Raymond wanted it. Raymond told Sam about how he'd watched Sam grow up and how he'd thought a lot about what would be different if they were a family. But he made the choice to stay with Jillian. He told Sam he wouldn't let Sam take a part of himself to save him. He was ready to go.

Jillian thanked Sam for what he'd done and apologized for telling Sam Raymond was his father. She said she'd also made a choice, the choice to stay with Raymond and not to hate Dee.

Jillian took Raymond back home to die.



She is married to [[Raymond McCray]]. Despite knowing he'd been having an affair, Jillian chose to stay with him.


Despite the affair, she and Dee are friends.

'''Jim''' is the husband of [[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]].


Jim's wife, Lisa, was chosen by [[Carol]] and [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, [[Doug]] (Carol's current husband), and Jim, meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



He is married to [[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]].


Lisa gave birth to a healthy baby girl. She decided to turn the baby over to Carol on the condition that they'd all be a part of her life, giving the baby two moms and three dads.

'''Jimmy''' is the ex-fianc\ue of [[Barbara]].


Jimmy's fianc\uee, Barbara, had severe depression. Jimmy had to drag her into the practice for her treatment, which included biofeedback and talk therapy. She said that she didn't want to continue her treatment and just wanted to kill herself.

Jimmy talked to Pete, saying he watched her all the time, but she'd stopped eating. She had nursed her father and then it had been a whole year of her severe depression. After a session with Violet, Barbara decided she wanted to use electroconvulsive therapy to treat her depression.

They set up the procedure and performed it. Barbara woke up in the hospital with a headache, but without anything pressing down on her shoulders. When Jimmy came in to see her, she asked him who he was.

Violet cautioned him that memory loss was not uncommon. They told him to go in and try to jog her memory.

Violet talked to Barbara, asking her questions, trying to figure out if there were other gaps in her memory. She still had no memory of Jimmy, but everything else was still there. Violet told Pete that because the rest of her memory was intact, she believed that something traumatic happened with Jimmy, something so bad that she blocked it out.

They brought Jimmy into the room and asked him to talk about their last fight. He said they don't fight because he never wanted to make things worse for her. When Barbara was asked to talk about the last fight she'd had with anyone, she said that she didn't want to think about fights because she was so happy and didn't want to go back.

They then talked to Barbara, saying that ECT doesn't erase an entire person from your memory. They told her they believed Jimmy was dangerous and that's why she'd blocked him out. She started laughing at the idea that anyone could find Jimmy dangerous because he was a nice guy. She admitted that when she'd woken up, she smiled, but when she saw him, she did't want to smile anymore. She didn't want to hurt his feelings after everything he'd done, but because she knew ECT caused memory loss, she used that to help her. She couldn't remember why she was engaged to him, saying when she was depressed, he seemed fine, but now that she's not, he didn't seem right for her.

Wanting to spare Jimmy's feelings, Pete and Violet said he was just gone from her memory and wouldn't come back. They said Barbara was happy now and he should try to be happy for her and move on.



He was engaged to [[Barbara]] until after she had ECT and claimed she forgot him.

'''Joanna Gibbs''' is an abused woman Violet met in an airport.



While Violet was in the airport waiting for her flight to New York, she overheard Joanna and David Gibbs talking. When David left to get coffee, Joanna started crying, so Violet offered her a tissue. Joanna opened up to Violet, saying that her husband used to be supportive of her work as a lawyer, but had recently stopped supporting that. She'd made partner, but things hadn't slowed down. She said that it changed something in David. She'd come to LA to get away, but David followed and was apologetic about what he'd said and done. Violet asked what he'd done and Joanna confessed that David had hit her.

She said that his hours had been cut at work while hers were getting worse, so he was always home and stewing. She also said it was partially her fault. She cancelled a run with him last minute. She texted her assistant about missing the conference call she was supposed to be on and he hit her. She hadn't told anyone what happened, even her mother, whom she was visiting.

When David returned, Violet sent Joanna to the bathroom, saying she'd meet her there. In the bathroom, they talked more about the abuse, but Joanna insisted that she was just making a reasonable sacrifice and Violet didn't know anything about her marriage.

As they prepared to board their flight, Violet implored Joanna not to get on the plane. She said that if she couldn't talk to her mother or friends, she could talk to Violet. She slipped Joanna her card as David tried to rush her onto the plane.

Violet later got a call from Joanna, who hadn't gotten on the plane. ''("[[God Laughs]]")''


Joanna came to the practice six months later, pregnant and badly beaten. Violet and Addison took her to the ER where they determined she was  weeks pregnant. David came in and Violet and Pete tried to stop him from seeing her, but he said that the day at the airport was his wake-up call. He'd done therapy and anger management and they were doing so much better. He insisted that he wasn't the one who had beaten her.

After her exam, Addison told David Joanna was bleeding into her abdomen and she wasn't able to detect a fetal heartbeat. She'd lost the pregnancy because of the trauma. Addison also said there was a tear in Joanna's uterus and she might have to do a hysterectomy to stabilize her. David told her to do it. Addison said she might be able to do it without the hysterectomy, but it was riskier. David said just to do the hysterectomy, despite Violet's insistence that he shouldn't be making the decision.

After surgery, Joanna was stable and Addison told David she was able to control the bleeding without doing the hysterectomy. David was angry and decided that he wanted her transferred to another hospital as soon as possible.

Joanna woke up from her surgery and said that David didn't want a baby, but she thought it would be a new start for them. She thought David would be excited like she was, but he wasn't. She got up to get him more food, but he punched her. Joanna said she didn't want to talk to the police. She wanted David dead.

David was shocked to find that Joanna had left the hospital without him.

Joanna went home with Violet to her house, where Violet took care of her while she started to heal. Joanna said that Violet's book made her feel like a failure because she'd gone back to David. She didn't want to go to the police because she didn't want to be treated like a victim. She believed it was her fault because she'd gone back to David. Violet expressed concern about Joanna saying she wanted David dead, but Joanna said she wasn't serious.

The next day, David showed up at Violet's house, angry and insisting that Joanna come with him. David blamed Violet for Joanna leaving him and hit her, knocking her out. When she woke up, she found Joanna stabbing a deceased David repeatedly. Violet stopped her and Joanna said she had to do it and asked if Violet would tell the police that.

The police came to the house and Joanna was arrested. Violet told [[Detective Rollins]], who came to investigate the death, that it was self-defense, despite not witnessing it personally. ''("[[Losing Battles]]")''



She was married to [[David Gibbs]] until his death.


Her mother lives in LA. She says her mother adores David. ''("[[God Laughs]]")''

When she was hospitalized six months later, she told Violet her mom had died. ''("[[Losing Battles]]")''


She is a lawyer. She is the youngest partner at her law firm. ''("[[God Laughs]]")''


*She was in phi beta kappa.<ref>[[God Laughs]], x (PP)</ref>
*She was  at the time of her miscarriage.<ref>[[Losing Battles]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Jodi''' is a pregnant woman who had anterograde amnesia after a car accident.


Jodi came to the practice for an ultrasound. She was pregnant, but had no memory of that fact as she was in a car accident before finding out she was pregnant that caused anterograde amnesia. Her memory reset every five seconds and she had to be constantly reminded who people were. Her husband, Zach, talked to Sheldon about Jodi's condition and taking care of her. He admitted that sometimes, he wished she'd just died in the accident.

They scheduled a c-section to deliver the baby and Addison said they'd talk about how she'd handle life after the baby was born, but Zach had Violet take Jodi to the waiting room and told Addison that after the baby was born, he was leaving her.

Unable to speak to Zach herself, Violet asked Addison to speak to him. She went to him, but he showed her what his life was like taking care of Jodi. He wanted their kid to have a normal life, but he couldn't take care of them both. While she was there, Jodi went into labor.

She labored, confused the whole time about what was happening. Zach came to the hospital, but stayed out of the room until Addison convinced him to come in and talk Jodi through her labor. Jodi's ICP increased as she labored, but Zach was able to talk her through delivery. He said they needed to give her the baby before she forgot. They gave her the baby right after birth, but she quickly forgot what had happened.

Zach later held the baby and said he'd stay until he couldn't stay anymore.



She is married to [[Zach]]. When he tells her the story of when they first met, she lights up. He was a waiter when she came in with all her friends. It wasn't even his section, but he worked that table and all he could see was her. He says he knew at that moment he was in love with her. She came into the restaurant every week for two months after that. After they married, they struggled with infertility, but Violet says they never blamed or resented each other for their trouble conceiving.


Jodi and Zach wanted a baby, but they struggled with infertility. Jodi finally got pregnant shortly before the accident and later gave birth to a healthy baby.


*Before her accident, she made lists of everything.

'''Joe Price''' is a detective at the Los Angeles Police Department.



When the police picked up a man from the streets who was covered in someone else's blood, Joe called Sheldon in to get the man talking and evaluate him. All they knew was that his name was Lee. He watched as Sheldon tried to get more information out of Lee. ''("[[Did You Hear What Happened to Charlotte King?]]")''


After learning that Charlotte had been raped, Sheldon went to Joe and told him he believed he knew the person Lee had raped. ''("[[What Happens Next]]")''

They called in Charlotte to come to the station. Cooper went in and was told that they think they found the guy and needed Charlotte to identify him so they could charge him. When they did a lineup, she froze and said he wasn't there, despite Lee being in the line. Charlotte later came in to do a second lineup and identified Lee as her rapist. ''("[[Can't Find My Way Back Home]]")''


Joe came to Sheldon when [[Aaron]] needed to be cleared to return to work after fatally shooting a robbery suspect. Joe expected Sheldon to clear him easily and became upset when Sheldon refused. Sheldon eventually convinced Aaron to tell the truth about what had happened during the shooting, leading Joe to tell Sheldon they weren't friends anymore and not to call him if he needed something. ''("[[The Standing Eight Count]]")''


When Sarah had been missing for  days, a suspect had been arrested, but Sarah hadn't been found. Sheldon went to Joe and told him be believed the man who had been arrested hadn't taken Sarah and Sarah was actually with one of his patients, [[Nick Calhoun]]. The next day, Sheldon had a session with Nick in which he tried to goad Nick into confessing that he'd taken Sarah.

After he placed Nick on a  hold, he lied to Joe and said Nick had confessed and said he had Sarah. They went to Nick's house, where they found Sarah in the basement. ''("[[I'm Fine]]")''



[[Sheldon Wallace]]
He and Sheldon are friends. Whenever the police force needed a psychiatrist for something, Joe called Sheldon in.


Joe is a detective at the Los Angeles Police Department.\uaHe'd been a cop for  years. ''("[[I'm Fine]]")''

}}
'''Joe Roberts''' is the father of [[Maggie Roberts]].


Joe's daughter, Maggie, came into the practice with a cut on her forehead. Cooper cleaned it and said she wouldn't need stitches, just a few bandages. When he put the bandages on, Maggie said that Eli didn't believe her. Her parents explained that Eli was her imaginary friend. Maggie then went on to say the Eli believed it was his fault, because he wanted her to make new friends and so she introduced him to someone other girls, but they were rude.

Worried about Maggie, Cooper consulted with Sheldon, thinking Maggie was using her imaginary friend to isolate herself.

After seeing Maggie, Sheldon said he believed Maggie was schizophrenic. Her having an imaginary friend wasn't the problem. The problem is that she believes he's real. He wanted to prescribe anti-psychotics. Time was critical because she was pre-pubescent and starting the medicine early gave her a shot at a functional adulthood.

They met with her parents and talked about her situation. Her father, Joe, denied it, saying she was just a creative kid. He and his wife, Cyndy, then left.

Cyndy returned to the practice alone and said she had concerns about Maggie. She believed Sheldon was right and she didn't know what to do because her husband wasn't seeing it.

They called Maggie back in and her parents and Cooper watched through the glass while Maggie talked to Sheldon. He asked her about Eli and she admitted that sometimes Eli made her do things she didn't want to do, like drowning her cat.

Joe was still adamant that he didn't want to send Maggie away and didn't believe the diagnosis was correct. Sheldon figured out that Joe had been through it before. He admitted that his sister had schizophrenia. They put her in residential care and medicated her and she ultimately killed herself. He felt guilty because Maggie got it from his side of the family. Sheldon assured him that treatment has evolved since his sister and they don't do things the same way anymore.

They made the decision to put Maggie in residential care.



He is married to [[Cyndy Roberts]].


His sister and daughter both had schizophrenia. His sister was put in residential care an ultimately killed herself. He feared the same thing happening to Maggie.

'''John Burton''' is the husband of [[Beth Burton]].


John came to the hospital with his wife after her head was lacerated during a home invasion. He was on a business trip when it happened. Beth wanted to forget the whole thing had happened and specifically asked for a drug she knew that could help her forget her trauma. However, it quickly came out that during the home invasion, she'd been sexually assaulted. She'd hidden it because she didn't think John could handle it. John tried to say that he'd quit his job and they'd get a gun because he felt guilty for not being able to protect her. She didn't want that, and Violet brought both of them in to start talking through the trauma.



He is married to [[Beth Burton]].


He and his wife have at least two children, including a son.


His job requires him to travel a lot.

'''Judi''' is the birth mother of [[Henry Montgomery]].



Dr. Addison Montgomery delivered Judi's baby at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]]. However, she couldn't take care of her baby, so she gave him up for adoption. She looked through the adoption agency's book of prospective mothers and chose Addison to be Henry's mother. ''("[[It Was Inevitable]]")''

As they discussed the terms of the open adoption, Judi was unsure how much contact she wanted with Henry. When [[Mildred Clemons]] suggested weekly photos and monthly visits, Judi agreed to that. ''("[[Apron Strings]]")''


Eight months after Henry's birth, Judi made contact with Addison for the first time, saying she wanted to see Henry. She came to Addison's house to visit him. When Addison wondered why Judi was visiting now after not having any contact for eight months and Judi said she felt weird. Judi asked if she could schedule another visit the next day and Addison, despite discomfort at the idea, agreed.

They met at the park the next day and Judi brought her mother, Donna. Donna declared herself Henry's grandmother and said she hadn't known that Judi was pregnant. Judi admitted that her mother's pressure is what convinced her to contact Addison and see Henry.

Judi came to Addison's office the next day and Addison told Judi she needed to stop ambushing her or she'd disappear with Henry. Judi said she'd come to tell Addison it hurt too much to see him and she couldn't do it anymore. She said Addison was a great person and mom and she wouldn't bother her again.

Addison then visited Judi at work and gave her a necklace with the letter H to symbolize her relationship with Henry. She encouraged her to keep seeing Henry, but Judi believed Henry would hate her when he grew up for giving him up for adoption. Addison convinced her otherwise and said they were both his mothers and she was always welcome in Henry's home. ''("[[Apron Strings]]")''


*Addison gave Judi a gold necklace with the letter "h" on it to symbolize her relationship with Henry.

{{Patient Infobox |image = PPJudy.png |name = Judy |status = Alive |diagnosis = Pregnancy |doctors = *[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] *[[Naomi Bennett]] *[[Violet Turner]] |treatment = *Prenatal care *C-section delivery |siblings = Brother |parents = Father |workplace = '''Former'''
Admissions office |first appearance = [[Know When to Fold]] |last appearance = [[Nothing to Fear]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Sarah Drew]] }} '''Judy''' was a patient of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]. Judy was pregnant and came into the practice for prenatal care. After her ultrasound, she told Dell she was worried about making ends meet with a baby, especially since she'd had to quit her job. She said she wanted to go to law school, but didn't know how she'd be able to. She told him she'd been thinking about adoption. Judy was then screened by Violet before being matched up. Before her consult, she asked Dell about what to say and he told her in detail. Violet approved Judy and she met [[Carrie Sinclair|Carrie]] and [[Matt Sinclair]], who wanted to adopt a baby. After their meeting, Judy thanked Dell for his help, saying the Sinclairs had offered to pay for all her living expenses until the baby was born. She also mentioned that she could change her mind after the baby was born, which concerned Dell. ''("[[Know When to Fold]]")'' Judy came back to the practice to delivery. During delivery, the baby got stuck by his shoulder. Addison pushed the baby back up and they took her to the the hospital for a c-section. She delivered the baby and noted that the baby had a diaphragmatic hernia. They asked her what she wanted to do, but she insisted that the Sinclairs make the decision because he was their baby. Addison explained the condition to the Sinclairs and gave them two options. They decided they couldn't make the decision and left. Violet came in to counsel Judy on the decision, who was worried she couldn't make the choice and then let go of him. The surgery was successful and afterward, Judy worried about him being all alone. Dell then took her to see him. The Sinclairs returned, saying that they wanted him still, but Judy said no, because they left when things were hard. She looked at the baby and said she was going to keep him. The Sinclairs stopped by the practice to bring the things they'd bought for the baby, wanting him to have them even though they didn't have him. Naomi told Judy about the stuff they'd brought and said that she'd know what the right decision to make was. She ultimately decided to give the baby to the Sinclairs. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")'' She worked in the admissions office of her college, but had to quit during her pregnancy because she was tired all the time. ''("[[Know When to Fold]]")'' *She was in her third year of college when she became pregnant.[[Know When to Fold]], x (PP) PPJudy.png|[[Know When to Fold]] PPJudy.png|[[Nothing to Fear]] {{Judy Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (OB/GYN)]] [[Category:Patients (MFM)]]

{{Patient Infobox

}}

'''Julie''' is the daughter of [[Sharon (Can't Find My Way Back Home)|Sharon]].


Julie was at the practice being examined because she was worried that she was fifteen and hadn't yet started to menstruate. Addison examined her and said that starting anywhere between ten and sixteen is normal, so Julie didn't need to worry.

When they went to leave, Julie's mother, Sharon, had a seizure. Julie immediately jumped into action, making sure she was still breathing. She noted that Sharon had taken her meds late that morning and she had documented it in her notebook.

Amelia hooked her up to a device that would tell them where the seizure activity was occurring. Sharon had been having the seizures for seven years, since a car accident. No treatment since then had helped. Sharon seized and stopped breathing during the scan, but they were able to locate the lesion that caused the seizures.

Amelia suggested a new treatment that could remove the scar tissue so that she wouldn't have seizures anymore. It was risky and had the potential to paralyze her. Sharon said she didn't want the surgery, saying that she and Julie were doing okay with how things are.

Amelia talked to Julie about how things were going and tried to get her to talk to her mom about having the surgery. Addison then talked to Julie and said that with the way she was taking care of her mom, she earned the right to have a say in it. She asked her if it were her choice, what would she want.

Julie went to her mother and said she should have the surgery. She said that she was always scared for her mother and wanted her to take the chance and have the surgery. If something bad happened, they'd deal with it together. She didn't want just ten more years. She wanted more than that. Sharon agreed to have the surgery.

Sharon had the surgery and was stable and awake afterward.



Her father died in the car crash that injured her mother.


She has friends named Carrie and Becky. She's four months older than Becky.


*She was  at the time of her mother's surgery.
*She does Model UN, plays in the jazz band, and plays soccer.

'''Julie Phillips''' is a patient who had fetal surgery to separate blood vessels between her twins.



Julie found out while she was pregnant that her husband was cheating on her. Three weeks into her pregnancy, he moved in with his mistress. When Julie found out, she invited the woman out to have lunch with her in order to put a face to the woman who got her husband to throw away  years of marriage. When she was hospitalized being informed about the procedure she was about to undergo, she picked up on the fact that Meredith had slept with Addison's husband and began to speak disparagingly to her. When Julie asked to have Meredith removed from her case, Addison confronted her, saying that she had her information wrong and that Meredith was actually the wronged woman in their situation and prompted her to apologize.


While she was pregnant, Julie was diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome, which was endangering their lives. She came to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] because [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] was one of the few surgeons in the country who could separate the blood vessels and save both babies.

When the babies started to show signs of heart failure, the doctors took Julie into surgery immediately to separate the vessels. The surgery was successful and Julie was awake and stable afterward.



She was married to Jeff Phillips for  years when he had an affair. Three weeks into her pregnancy, he moved in with his mistress.


Julie was pregnant with twins.

'''Julie Russell''' is the one of the quintuplets born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Julie was part of a quintuplet pregnancy. She was diagnosed in utero with an omphalocele, meaning she'd need to have surgery to push her abdominal contents back in once she was born. When their mother was  weeks pregnant, she was hospitalized until she was ready to deliver, which she hoped would not be until  weeks. However, she started having contractions at just  weeks. They put her in trendellenberg and put her on magnesium to try to stop the labor. Despite their efforts, her placenta started tearing, forcing them to deliver all five babies at  weeks. ''("[[Much too Much]]")''


After birth, Julie had surgery on her omphalocele. Because of her small size, they weren't able to reduce the entire sack into her abdomen, so they had to wait and do a second surgery. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''



She is part of a set of quintuplets. Their parents also have a set of triplets.


*Her mother said she was pretty mellow in utero.<ref>[[Much too Much]], x</ref>

'''Justin Tanner''' is an obese teenager who had multiple health problems as a result.


Justin came into the practice for the first time in three years. Cooper was shocked to see that he had gained a large amount of weight. It had gotten a lot harder for him to move around, especially recently. Cooper weighed him and found that he had gained  pounds in three years.

Cooper consulted with Naomi and called in Justin's parents to talk about the situation. He had diabetes and high blood pressure. His father, Bruce, believed he was just lazy. They'd hired him a trainer and nutritionist and sent him to fat camp. They ruled out hormonal causes for his weight gain. Justin said he didn't want to get any bigger and he didn't feel good. While they were talking, Justin passed out. They took him to the hospital.

His blood sugar spiked, which caused dehydration. His parents argued over his case. His mother, Pam, said that he was stressed and used the food as comfort while his father said his mother coddled him.

When Justin woke up, he told Cooper that he was being molested and that's why he kept eating, because he thought it would stop if he gained enough weight. Cooper angrily went out to the waiting room and punched Bruce, believing he was the abuser. Bruce quickly called a lawyer to sue Cooper and the hospital.

Cooper went back to Justin's hospital room and told Bruce he was telling the police what he'd been doing to Justin. Justin then said it wasn't Bruce. It was Pam. Pam tried to comfort him and both Bruce and Cooper told her to back away. Bruce was very angry and asked how she could hurt their son like that. Pam said that Justin loves him. Bruce then tried to attack Pam, but Cooper restrained him and had security called.

Naomi brought in Sheldon to talk to Justin, who said he didn't want to talk about it. He blamed himself for his mom getting arrested. Sheldon said that being fat was his protection. He didn't know how to stop. Bruce came in and apologized for not seeing what Pam was doing to him. Justin said it was okay, but Sheldon told him not to bury his feelings, to tell his father how he really feels. Justin asked how he didn't see it, why he didn't protect him. Bruce said he loves Justin and he failed. He hoped that someday, Justin would forgive him. They hugged.



His father was distant and believed he was just lazy. His mother had been molesting him.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He makes Cooper mixed CDs.

'''Kara''' is a woman who was injured in a car accident.


While hiking in a canyon, Addison and Sam heard Kara's husband, Jake, calling for help. He told them they'd crashed and his wife was out there as well. Addison went down to the car while Sam tended to Jake. Addison found Kara and saw that she was pregnant and stuck in the car door. She had lost feeling in her fingers and told Addison they'd been out there since the previous day. Her pregnancy was at term. She said she could feel the baby moving, but Addison couldn't get the right angle to get a fetal heartbeat.

Sam said Jake had a broken rib and internal bleeding. Sam said if he ran, he could get back by dark. Addison said she'd go back and forth between them while they waited for him to get back. Before Sam could leave, Jake's lung collapsed and he had to improvise a chest tube to relieve the pressure.

Addison climbed in the car to examine Kara and she said that she was at fault for the accident, because she grabbed her husband's arm when a bee flew in the car. Addison found that Kara had a broken rib.

Sam brought Jake back down to the car, saying that his chest tube needed to be opened every  minutes or his heart would arrest. Same decided to try to find the road instead of going back the way he and Addison came. However, when Addison climbed back into the car, she and Kara rolled farther down the hill. Addison was injured in the second crash, which trapped her in the car with Kara. Because she was trapped, Sam said he couldn't leave because since Addison couldn't take care of the chest tube, Jake would die if she left.

After nightfall, Kara's water broke. Addison examined her again and determined that the baby was a footling breech because of the second crash. She attempted to change the baby's position to make the delivery easier.

Sam sewed the tube in Jake's chest into place so that he could leave and get help. Addison told Sam Kara's labor was progressing quickly and advised him to stay safe because they needed him to be able to come back and bring help.

When the baby's foot came through the cervix, Addison said she was going to try to push his foot back up the birth canal and change his position from the inside. Addison started to do it, but Kara said it was too painful. Jake gave her a pep talk and said she could do it. Addison was able to change the baby's position successfully. She then coached Kara through difficult delivery.

The baby didn't breathe right away, but Addison was able to stimulate and she started crying. After the birth, Jake stopped responding to them. Addison attempted again to get out of the car, but wasn't able to. However, they heard helicopters coming to find them. They put Jake in a sling and took him to the hospital. They gave the baby oxygen and got her out of there. Then they worked on prying the door open to get Kara and Addison out. However, as soon as they did, Kara started bleeding severely from her arm and she crashed. They tried everything they could, but Kara was dead in the car.

At the hospital, Addison brought the baby to Jake and Sam told him that Kara had died.



She was married to [[Jake (The Hard Part)|Jake]] until her death.

'''Kara Wei''' is a Congressional candidate and old friend of Violet Turner.



Kara's mother used to beat her and her brother. When Kara was sixteen, her mother hit her with a belt and knocked four of her teeth out. She used to put the hand of her nine year old son Robbie on the stove because he mouthed off. Kara later killed her mother, but the judge ruled it self-defense. She became depressed and went through shock therapy at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] to help.

In college, she met [[Violet Turner]] and they became best friends. She helped Violet after she was raped, but she never told the full story about her mother.


When Kara was running for congress, she called Violet and asked for a favor, for her to destroy her medical records. She believed that if a politician or reporter got the file, which, although illegal, could be done, then her political career would be destroyed.

Violet could not decide, but after a fight with Kara and later [[Cooper Freedman]], she decided to take the file. She was almost found out, but an oblivious [[Charlotte King]] vouched for Violet and Violet walked away with the file.

She approached Kara and asked her to let her in. Kara told her about her childhood and Violet handed her the file, but gave her an ultimatum: to choose her friendship or her career, and choose the person she was and not the person she wanted to be. However, without hesitation, Kara started shredding the contents of her file and Violet left.



Kara killed her mother to defend her brother from severe abuse.


Kara and [[Violet Turner]] met in college and became best friends. Kara helped Violet through her rape, but never opened up to Violet about the abuse she suffered as a child. Their friendship ended when Kara shredded her medical files instead of facing the person she was.


Kara Wei is currently the Assistant District Attorney and a Congressional candidate.

'''Karen''' is the mother of [[Wes]].


Karen came into the practice with her son, Wes. He had a painting he wanted to give the doctors, but when he got to the practice, he refused to go upstairs. He was schizophrenic and had to stop seeing Violet when she was suspended and had since started declining because he refused to take his meds.

Violet went to see Wes in the park where he was painting. She tried to talk to him and get him to start taking his meds again, because in addition to his psychiatric condition, he had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

Sam recommended a psychiatric hold for Wes, but Karen said that it made his condition worse and when he went off his meds afterward, he trusted her less and the only way she could be there for him was if he trusted her.

Wes came into the ER after collapsing in the street. He had an arrhythmia from not taking his heart meds for so long. They stabilized him, but he still needed continuous care. His mother was told she could apply for conservatorship and make his decisions for him, but she refused to do it. She said keeping him drugged up and locked up was the same as him disappearing.

After he was discharged, she gave him some money and her phone number and they parted ways.



She loves her son, but refused to institutionalize him because it made him trust her less and the only way she was able to help him was if he trusted her.

'''Karen Adams''' is a woman who had Wegener's disease who was ultimately killed by her husband in what he claimed was a mercy killing.



Karen came into the practice enraged after her husband told her he wanted a divorce. She blamed Violet for planting the idea in his mind. During the confrontation, Karen had a nosebleed, so Sam took her into a room to cauterize it. Doug later came back after speaking with Violet resolute in his decision to ask for a divorce, but hesitated when he saw that the bleeding had worsened. Sam believed that she had Wegener's disease, which would ultimately be fatal. He went to run tests to confirm, but learned that Karen had already been diagnosed at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] six months prior. Despite this, Doug decided to stay with Karen, saying it's what he wanted. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''


Karen was later shot to death by her husband. He initially claimed that it was a mercy killing and she asked him to do it, but later confessed that he had shot her in cold blood. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''



She was married to [[Doug Adams]] for  years when he told her he wanted a divorce. She constantly belittled him and tried to guilt him into staying with her, especially after he found out she had Wegener's disease. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''

He later murdered her after enduring months of her throwing things at him and calling him an idiot. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''

'''Kathleen''' is a patient who was unable to have sex after getting married. She also later saw the doctors for infertility.



Kathleen came into the practice with her husband shortly after they were married because during their honeymoon, they found that she was unable to have sex. Addison attempted to do an exam, but was unable to get the speculum into Kathleen's vagina. She prescribed muscle relaxants to treat vaginismus, involuntary spasms in the vagina. Kathleen went home, but was still unable to have sex with her husband, so she returned the next day. Addison then diagnosed vulvar vastivulitis and planned targeted lidocaine injections to treat her. The injections were painful, but Kathleen agreed to have them. She then referred Kathleen to Pete to treat the vaginismus. The next day, Kathleen and Jeffery came into the practice and profusely thanked Addison and Pete for their help. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''


Two months later, Jeffrey and Kathleen came back into the practice. They hadn't been able to conceive and since Kathleen was older, they knew they didn't have much time left and wanted help. Addison agreed to run tests on both of them. The tests showed that Kathleen was ovulating. She also had some fibroids, but they decided just to keep an eye on them. The trouble conceiving came from Jeffrey, who was functionally sterile. They decided they'd use a sperm donor to get Kathleen pregnant. Jeffrey privately told Addison that he wanted to give Kathleen what he had. She was adopted and he wanted her to have a family member that looked like her. Kathleen struggled to pick a donor that she liked, so Jeffrey proposed a solution. He brought in his brother, Mark, to donate his sperm. Mark gave his sample and it was good, but when they went to inseminate, both Jeffrey and Kathleen stopped it last minute. Kathleen said his brother was kind of a jerk and she didn't want to have anyone's baby but his. Jeffrey begged them to find another solution so they could have a baby. They looked into the options and found a way, which involved extracting sperm directly from Jeffrey's testicles. They said it could work with only one viable sperm. They did the procedure and were able to find a single viable sperm. They extracted Kathleen's egg, inseminated it, and then implanted it back in her uterus. They were then told to go home and relax while they waited for it to implant. ''("[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]]")''



She is married to [[Jeffrey (Season )|Jeffrey]]. They went on a three-week honeymoon in Africa. They climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro and scaled Victoria Falls on their trip.


Kathleen was adopted. Her husband says her parents are great.


*She was  at the time of her wedding.<ref>[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Kathy''' is a woman who came into the practice with several injuries in a short period of time.


Kathy fell on a treadmill while running. Sam noted that it was her fourth sports injury in three months and asked what was going on. She said she was a normal, sexual person, but her husband, [[Paul (Season )|Paul]], wouldn't have sex with her. They hadn't had sex in  months. She turned to exercise in order to avoid cheating on him. Sam referred her to see [[Violet Turner]].

Kathy and Paul came in to see Violet and Paul said he wanted to have sex, but he wanted to want it. Violet then ordered him to have sex with his wife, whether or not he was in the mood.

They reported back that he had erectile dysfunction, so Sam agreed to run tests to look for a physical problem. Kathy went out that night and was out all night. However, she showed up to Paul's appointment and told him she hadn't cheated, even though she'd had the chance to. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Paul's test results showed a tumor on his adrenal gland that was causing his problems. Because of the type of tumor it was, treatment was difficult and risky, but Paul was told there was hope.

After hearing her husband's diagnosis, Kathy spoke to Violet. She confessed that she had lied to Paul and she had slept with another man the night she didn't come home. She wanted to know what to do. Violet told her just to keep loving her husband. Kathy told her she'd have to tell her that a lot, which Violet agreed to do. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



She is married to [[Paul (Season )|Paul]]. She was upset because he had no desire to have sex with her. When she found out he had an adrenal tumor that was causing his low sex drive, she was upset. She confessed to Violet that she had slept with another man the night she was out all night.


*She has a pool at her house.<ref>[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]], x</ref>

'''Katie Kent''' was a schizophrenic patient of [[Violet Turner]].



Katie was schizophrenic. When she became pregnant, she had to go off her medication, so they used alternative treatments to keep her delusions in check. She was doing well and was almost through her first trimester when she came in for treatment for morning sickness. She also had an ultrasound. When the ultrasound showed fetal demise, they tried to tell Katie, but Katie refused to believe it was true and left the practice saying she could feel the baby moving. Violet went to Katie's apartment to talk to her. Katie was still convinced that she was still pregnant, but Violet got her to agree to come to the practice by saying that Addison wanted to apologize to her. She and Violet talked, but Violet couldn't convince her that she'd had a miscarriage. While they were talking, she started to show signs of sepsis. Dell finally spoke to her and got her to believe that her baby was gone. She then consented to a D&C. ''("[[What Women Want]]")''


After her miscarriage, Katie continued to receive therapeutic massage. During her massage, Pete became concerned because Katie seemed euphoric. She said she was doing great despite her miscarriage, which she said wasn't causing her grief anymore. Pete reminded her that she needed to keep taking her medications. He told Violet about his concerns, so she said she'd talk to Katie about it during their session that afternoon. In the session, Violet emphasized the importance of Katie taking her medications, but Katie asked several questions about Violet's baby and touched her belly to feel the baby move. Violet agreed with Pete that Katie was off her meds and lying about it.

Katie later showed up at Violet's house, saying she knew that Violet had her baby and she wanted it back. She injected Violet with a drug to paralyze her from the neck down. She then used a medical textbook and medical supplies purchased off the internet to start to cut Violet's baby out of her uterus. While she prepared, Violet tried to talk her down, to get her to remember what happened. When Violet agitated her, Katie broke her nose. She then started to cut into Violet. Violet advised her of where to cut so she wouldn't cut the baby. She talked her through how to deliver the baby step by step. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''

After delivering the baby, she took him and left Violet to die. She later showed up at the hospital with the baby, saying she heard about Violet on the news. She told Cooper she'd had her baby and showed him Violet's baby. He had a nurse call security and used the guise of a newborn exam to get Katie to hand the baby to Cooper. Once he had the baby, security took Katie. ''("[[A Death in the Family]]")''


When Katie's trial began, Pete, Naomi, and Violet were called to testify. Pete and Naomi did so, but Violet was unable to face Katie in court. Katie's father then came to Violet, asking her to go see Katie. She did and Katie said that if she went to prison, she'd slip and be crazy again and she didn't want that. Violet said that Katie had made her crazy and left.

Violet said the Dr. Turner in her wanted Katie to get help, but the Violet in her wanted Katie dead. While on the stand, Violet said that she believed that Katie was delusional when she attacked Violet and stole her baby, meaning she'd get treatment instead of prison. ''("[[Strange Bedfellows]]")''

She sued Violet over mentioning her in her book. After she dropped the lawsuit, it was known that it was her lawyer that complained to the medical board about Violet's license. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''


After Violet's book came out, Katie filed a lawsuit against Violet, saying publishing the book was a breach of confidentiality and was hindering her recovery. She wanted them to cease publishing and pull all copies from the shelves.

Violet went to the restaurant where Katie was working to try to talk her into dropping the lawsuit.

Katie then showed up at the practice and scared Violet, saying she agonized over what she'd done to Violet. She couldn't escape it. She later chose to drop the lawsuit. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''



After she got out of psychiatric care, she dated a man named Justin. However, his sister read Violet's book and figured out who Katie was and he broke things off with her. ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''


She says her mother dying was very difficult for her. It's what started her downward spiral and was the first signs of her schizophrenia. She thought the doctors had killed her mother and that people were plotting to steal her casket, so she went to the cemetery to guard it.\ua''("[[What Women Want]]")''


She is a waitress.  ''("[[What We Have Here...]]")''

'''Kaye Ramsey''' is a patient who came into the ER with a scalp laceration.


Kaye came into the ER with a cut on her forehead after falling at an audition due to a seizure. James stitched up her cut. She'd recently moved to LA to be an actress, even though she felt she was pretty old to be doing that. It was the only thing she'd ever wanted. She'd been in LA for six months. James called for a neuro consult because of the seizure. Amelia examined her and she started seizing again, so Amelia ordered a CT.

Her tests results showed findings consistent with a fungal infection. Amelia found a lesion on her scan and planned a biopsy, but James suggested using anti-fungals instead.

After the anti-fungals, there was no sign of the lesion and Kaye was told she shouldn't have more seizures.

Kaye later came back to the ER after another seizure. Amelia figured out that something was wrong with Kaye's heart. They did an echo and found a tumor in her heart. They took her into surgery to remove it.



After college, she moved back to her mother's and stayed with her until she died.


She is an actress. She moved to Los Angeles to pursue it seriously.


*She's from Albuquerque, New Mexico.

'''Kayla Lindy''' is a woman who was a surrogate for a triplet pregnancy.


Kayla, acting as a surrogate for [[Angie McConnell|Angie]] and [[Simon McConnell]], was pregnant with triplets. At  weeks, she was on bed rest because of a blood clot. Even with heparin, she was forming more clots. Addison recommended reducing the pregnancy to one, but Angie and Simon opposed the idea.

The McConnells called in [[Vanessa Hoyt]] as a consult and she believed that it was safe for Kayla to continue the pregnancy as triplets.

Sam agreed to do the surgery on Kayla. It was successful.

Kayla was stable for a while after the surgery, but then she started forming clots above the umbrella. Addison rushed her into surgery to reduce the pregnancy load. Before she could do that, Kayla started throwing more clots and they needed to close and move her to ICU. Her heart stopped when a clot moved to her lung. There was no evidence of higher brain function and she was put on life support. The McConnells asked about the baby that was left and were told that the reduction hadn't been performed. As long as Kayla was on the ventilator, the babies would continue to grow. ''("[[Triangles]]")''

As Kayla was in a coma, Eddie decided he wanted to turn the machines off, believing Kayla wouldn't want to live like that. Vanessa, opposing the decision, went to Simon and Angie and told them about it. They believed Kayla would want them to continue life support until the babies were born. Eddie still insisted he just wanted Kayla to have peace. The McConnells got a lawyer to prevent him from turning off the machines. Only essential medical personnel were allowed in Kayla's room while they waited for a judge to rule on what would happen.

Eddie waited outside Kayla's room in the hallway. He called some lawyers, but couldn't afford any of them. [[Charlotte King]] gave him the name of a lawyer at a non-profit aid group and encouraged him to call.

The judge came in and ruled that Kayla's life would have to continue until viability had been reached. She also ordered that her room continued to be closed to all but essential medical personnel.

Charlotte later saw Eddie waiting outside Kayla's room, so she left the door unlocked and told him the nurse was on break. He went into her room and locked the door. He then disconnected her ventilator. They broke a window to get into the room, but before they could reconnect the ventilator, they saw that Kayla was breathing on her own. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''

After six weeks in a coma, Eddie called in [[Geraldine Ginsberg]] to try to wake Kayla up. After she ran tests and examined Kayla, Ginsberg believed nothing could be done. However, [[Amelia Shepherd]], who was on Ginsberg's team, had an idea. Ginsberg believed it wouldn't work, so she refused to do it. When Ginsberg fired Amelia, she stayed to help Kayla. After speaking with Eddie, Amelia agreed to do the surgery.

After hearing about what Amelia had planned, the McConnells asked her not to operate, to give them a little more time so the babies could mature more. Despite this, she operated. During the surgery, the three babies had to be delivered, but Amelia was then able to finish the procedure.

After surgery, Kayla's reflexes started to re-emerge and she woke up. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''



She is married to [[Eddie Lindy]]. Until her hospitalization, they barely spent a night apart. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''


She and her husband have two kids.


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.

'''Keith''' is the husband of [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]].


[[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] was chosen by [[Carol]] and [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, [[Doug]] (Carol's current husband), and her own husband, [[Jim (Season )|Jim]], meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



He is married to [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]].

'''Keith Embry''' is a drug addict who got a severe infection in his heart from using dirty needles.


Keith came into the practice for an appointment with Pete. Pete wasn't in, but Dell took Keith to his office. When Pete came in, Keith was on the floor with a needle next to him, overdosing. Pete pushed narcan and called an ambulance. While they waited for the ambulance, Pete told Sam that Keith originally came to him for stress related to his job as a real estate agent. When the market crashed, he lost his job, his wife, and contracted hepatitis C when drug addiction consumed him. Pete kept treating him for free, but believed that Keith kept coming back because Pete gave him clean needles, not wanting him to die in the streets. Keith regained consciousness, but lashed out at the doctors and pushed Dell into a shelf before running away.

Dell believed that Pete should call the police and let them handle him, but Pete believed he could get Keith into a program, where he could get clean. Pete went out looking for him. He went to Keith's house, where his wife said she hadn't seen him in months. She was surprised that he was still seeing Pete and was upset that Pete was enabling Keith. She believed he was beyond help.

Keith was found down by the beach and taken to the hospital. He had an infection caused by sharing needles. Pete was upset to learn that because he had given Keith clean ones. Keith admitted that he traded the needles for more drugs. Keith said he wanted to do better and believed he could. Keith tried to leave, but Pete told him if he left, he would die.

Pete went to Violet to see if she'd sign off on a -. After hearing about Keith's case, she said if he didn't want it for himself, he'd just leave after the hold was over.

Keith tried to leave the hospital, but Pete stopped him, saying that he needed Keith to get better and so did Ellen. Outside the door, police officers held Keith and Pete told him he'd be committed to the psychiatric ward. Ellen then told Pete Keith had to want it for it to work. Pete said he'd get there and he wasn't beyond hope.



He is married to [[Ellen Embry]], though she hadn't seen him for months prior to his hospitalization.


He is a real estate agent. The stress from his job is why he initially came to see Pete.

'''Kelli''' is a girl who had cancer whose parents had a baby to save her and her sister's life.


Kelli's mother, Renee, labored and gave birth. The baby had been conceived because her older twin girls, Kelli and [[Niki]], had cancer and they needed to cord blood to treat them. After he was born, Renee declined to hold Trevor, more concerned about getting the cord blood.

Niki and Kelli had been admitted to the hospital in preparation for the transfusion. Addison looked at the cord blood. The sample was good, but there weren't enough cells for both girls. Renee said she couldn't choose between them, but they didn't have time to have another baby. Jerry said he could decide, that he could pick one of his girls to save. He felt guilty for knowing he could do it. He then chose Kelli and said to give her the cord blood. However, Renee stopped him, saying not to do it and told Jerry he was going to hell for making the choice.

Niki went into sepsis and Cooper believed she'd relapsed. She told Cooper she didn't want to die. Cooper believed he could get her into remission, but she'd need the cord blood. Jerry said no, to give the blood to Kelli. Cooper said he couldn't without both parents' permission, so Jerry said he'd get a court order because he didn't want Kelli to die because Renee couldn't make the choice. Renee maintained that she couldn't choose one child over another, but Addison pointed out that she was already doing that by refusing to look at Trevor. She admitted she was worried he'd replace them.

After talking with Renee and Jerry, Cooper told Niki and Kelli that Niki was too sick to get the treatment, so they'd give it to Kelli and Niki wouldn't get better. Kelli said she didn't want it because she and Niki do everything the same. Niki told Kelli she had to get better and gave her her hat, which she said was lucky.

Jerry stayed with Niki while Kelli went to get her transfusion and Renee brought Trevor to her so she could spend some time with her brother.



She and her sister did everything together.


*She and Niki were eight when Trevor was born.

'''Kelli''' is the girlfriend of [[Ryan Crawford]].


Kelli and her boyfriend, Ryan, wanted to go to the homecoming dance together. However, because Ryan was born with SCID, he needed to have an adequate count in order to be allowed to go. He made the cutoff, but was told he couldn't go because his mother had a fever, possibly compromising his health. He decided to sneak out anyway and went to the dance. Pete and Cooper arrived at the dance to take him home, but he wouldn't leave until he'd gotten the chance to kiss Kelli. He then collapsed and had to be rushed to the hospital, where he was taken into isolation. Kelli later visited him in the hospital and held his hand.



She is dating [[Ryan Crawford]].

'''Kelly''' is a woman who gave birth while holding people hostage at [[Circus Liquor]].


Kelly, desperate to get money to raise her baby after she believed [[Damon]] left her, she robbed [[Circus Liquor]], where Damon worked. She shot him in the leg and took him, plus [[Sara Hill]] and [[Jan]] hostage. Sara called in Sam to treat Damon's leg, which he did as best he could. However, then Kelly revealed that she was in labor and needed his help to deliver the baby. He called Naomi to get some assistance and prepared for the delivery. After the baby's head was out, the baby didn't deliver the rest of the way, so he called Naomi, who told him he needed to rotate the baby counter-clockwise to release the shoulder. He did so and delivered the baby the rest of the way. He offered her to Kelly, but Kelly didn't take her and instead, Sam handed the baby to Damon and then called the police to come get Kelly.



She was seeing [[Damon]]. She got pregnant and during the pregnancy, he broke up with her.


She has a daughter with Damon. She believed he had left her and wasn't going to help her support the baby, but he said that's why he took the job at Circus Liquor, so he'd have money to help raise the baby.

|name = Kelly
|status = Alive
|diagnosis = Pica
|marital = [[Scott Nelson]] ''(husband)''
|children = [[Oliver]]
|only appearance = [[Second Choices]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Perrey Reeves]]
}}

'''Kelly''' is the mother of [[Oliver]].


Kelly's son, Oliver, came into the practice with a stomachache. Cooper was surprised that he was wearing a hockey mask that was locked over his face. He said his parents don't let him take it off. His parents explained that he was eating non-food items. It had started when they got married the previous year and had gotten worse.

Cooper removed the mask and started to examine Oliver. Cooper said eating things like he does is usually pica. He asked Oliver why he did it and he said he didn't know, but he couldn't stop.

Cooper consulted with Sheldon, who said it could also be OCD or nutritional deficiency. He agreed to see Oliver to try to figure out the problem.

Sheldon asked Oliver about Scott. He said that he likes Scott. He never had a dad before, so he gets to do cool things with him. His mom is the one who got him the mask. He said it's uncomfortable, but it helps him stop with the eating. He says he doesn't even think and he does it. While they were talking, Oliver started eating the potpourri on his coffee stable.

Sheldon gave him vitamins and sent him home. He ate dirt, so his mother came back in the next day. She was worried about it scaring off Scott, who had been patient through the whole thing. Cooper convinced her that she needed to let them work on figuring out what was wrong with her son so they could fix it.

Oliver and his parents came into the ER. They'd had an argument about Oliver and he overheard and ate something. They had to pump his stomach. He had eaten some moldy lawn furniture cushions. While getting him settled into his hospital bed, Cooper discovered Oliver's mother eating toilet paper. She also had pica.

She talked to Cooper about it. She said she'd had it since she was a child, but only when she was nervous or sad. She got it under control, but with Oliver being sick, it was too much. He said that Oliver was feeling alone and knowing that his mom had struggled with it too would have helped him. His mother had difficulty, but told him that she also had pica.

Oliver was upset that his mother had lied. Cooper explained that she was scared and had made a mistake. Oliver said he wouldn't forgive her. He told Oliver about a time his parents had made a mistake and he refused to forgive them. He said that even as an adult, he hadn't forgiven them for it. He advised Oliver not to be like him, to forgive his mom.



She is married to [[Scott Nelson]].


Her son, Oliver, has pica like she does.

'''Kelly Andrews''' is the wife of [[Rick Andrews]].


Kelly was seeing Sheldon along with her husband, Rick, for marital counseling. Kelly said Rick had been having nightmares since he returned from Afghanistan, which caused him to stop sleeping. She'd tried everything, but Rick wasn't interested in sex. He would freeze every time she touched him. Sheldon suggested talking to each of them separately, but Kelly said he wouldn't talk and Rick said it was because he talking about what happened there would bring it back. She objected that it was already there, between them.

Sam went to visit Rick at his house and found him unconscious after taking and overdose of pills. He called an ambulance and they took him to the ER and gave him charcoal. He woke up confused about why he was still alive. He tried to refuse their help and had to be given haloperidol to calm him down when he started getting aggressive with them.

When Rick woke up again, he was cuffed to the bed. Sheldon said they needed to talk about his attempted suicide. Rick said military service wasn't what he expected. He started believing being sent home in a body bag would be good because it would be a release. Sheldon asked what he was thinking when he decided to take the pills. When Sheldon questioned him about his experiences, Rick admitted he'd been raped by his sergeant, Sergeant Hamill.

Sheldon started to get Rick to talk about being raped. He believed Hamill was going to snap his spine and froze, unable to move. Nothing felt real until he actually started raping Rick. Rick said he wished he died right there. Sheldon told him what he'd done was brave, but Rick felt that he'd been weak by letting Hamill rape him.

Rick didn't want to tell Kelly, saying he'd rather work it out on his own. Sheldon encouraged him, saying it could help him.

Rick decided to tell Kelly, but she was confused, asking how Rick could have possibly been raped by a single man, why he didn't fight Hamill off. She later told Sam she believed Rick had let it happen, but Sam corrected that he didn't let it happen. She told the story of how they met and how she believed with him around, nothing bad would happen and knowing he'd been raped shattered that illusion. She didn't feel the same looking at him after knowing he'd been raped. Sam said that Rick had been injured in Afghanistan, like her father, and she needed to look at it that way.

Rick told Sheldon Kelly wasn't returning his calls and he believed she'd left him. Kelly came into Rick's room at that point and took his hand.



She is married to [[Rick Andrews]]. The first time they met, Rick was on leave and visiting high school buddies. She was out with some girlfriends. He introduced himself, saying he couldn't dance, but he'd try for her.


Her father was a solider and was lost his right leg below the knee in Vietnam.


*She lives at  Patrick Henry.
