'''Ken Wilson''' is a patient who died while giving a sperm sample.


Ken and his girlfriend, [[Leslie]], decided they wanted to have a baby, but due to Leslie's limited fertility, they decided to use artificial insemination to get Leslie pregnant. When he went in to make his deposit, he had a sudden stroke and was rushed to the hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Leslie then stated that she still wanted his sperm, in order to get pregnant. However, because he was dead, [[Charlotte King]] denied the request, saying she wouldn't let them molest a dead man.

Naomi then showed up at the hospital, with Ken's signed consent for the procedure. A hospital lawyer cleared her to extract his sperm for Leslie's use. Naomi prepared to do the procedure, but then [[Maria Wilson]], Ken's estranged wife, showed up at the hospital and blocked her access. She also decided she wanted his sperm for her own use. However, after Naomi spoke to her, she agreed to let Leslie have the sperm to have a baby for herself.



[[Maria Wilson]]
He was married to Maria Wilson for  years. He then left her, saying he needed to find himself.

[[Leslie]]
After separating from Maria, he started dating Leslie. Together, they decided they wanted to have a baby, but he died before he could give his sperm deposit. However, Leslie successfully petitioned to have his sperm extracted for her use.


*He was pronounced dead at : AM.
*He has the distinction of being the first person to die on ''[[Private Practice]]''.

{{Patient Infobox
|image = PPxKendraTempleton.png
|name = Kendra Templeton
|status = Alive
|doctors = *[[Jake Reilly]]
*[[Violet Turner]]
*[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]
|only appearance = [[Are You My Mother?]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Jamie Silberhartz]]
}}
'''Kendra Templeton''' is one of a polyamorous triad that wanted to have a baby via assisted reproduction.


Kendra came in with [[Rose Filmore]] and [[Evan Olsen]]. She and Rose said they'd been together for six years and they were ready to have a baby. Evan was there to be the sperm donor. They wanted to use Rose's egg, but have Kendra carry so they could both be part of the experience. Jake consulted with them and then insisted that they sit down with Violet before proceeding because they were using a known donor, so that everyone would know what the expectations and limitations were.

They sat down with Violet, who asked Evan what he saw his role as. He said he'd donate the sperm, put together the crib, and then be the cool uncle. Violet questioned what would happen when the baby got a little older and he disagreed with a parenting decision. Her insistence on the truth pressed the three of them to admit that they were a polyamorous triad and planned to raise the baby together. Violet reminded them that they'd have to raise the child in the real world, which wouldn't be as accepting of their family as they were. They believed that they had enough love that they could it through.

Rose and Kendra went in to be examined before starting the process. Kendra's exam was unremarkable, but Rose was informed that she had uterine scarring and ovarian failure secondary to pelvic tuberculosis, making her completely infertile. However, Jake said that Kendra and Evan would not likely have trouble conceiving without assistance if they want. Rose quickly backed out of the pursuit for a baby, saying that they couldn't do it if they couldn't all be part of it.

Kendra and Evan saw Violet without Rose, saying they didn't understand the problem. Violet explained Rose's point of view on them sharing something she wasn't part of. They wanted to fix it, so Violet suggested a compromise.

Rose went to Jake asking if there was anything he could do to make her able to participate. He said that many women come to him unable to conceive and he still finds a way to make them mothers. She was worried a baby would change everything. He said that if the love were real, it could withstand anything, but admitted he didn't actually believe that. Love's powerful, but sometimes life wins.

Rose went to Kendra and Evan and said she wanted a baby, but not that way. Despite that, she said she loved them and agreed to trust them and have them conceive together. Evan agreed, but Kendra said she couldn't do it. She said the reason they worked was because of the rules. They needed unanimous to avoid someone getting hurt. She said they could have a baby another way, but given the choice, she chose the three of them. Evan said it wasn't trivial. He wanted a biological child and wasn't sure he could choose the relationship above that.



She's been seeing Rose and Evan for six years. They said the first night was amazing and so was the next morning and the morning after that. To make the relationship work, they had very strict rules to follow, including one that stated all decisions had to be unanimous so no one felt ganged up on. Rose's infertility threatened their relationship, leaving their future together in question.


*She was planning to stay home with the baby.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Templeton, Kendra}}

'''Kendra Walker''' is a patient who came in for help getting pregnant after losing her first child.


Kendra and her husband, Dave, came in to see Naomi because they wanted to have a baby. Because Kendra had lupus, they planned to use a surrogate to carry their embryo. They'd used a surrogate before and told Naomi they'd lost their son, Max, when he was five months old.

When Naomi talked to Addison about their case, Addison revealed that she'd been in the ER when their son came in. He'd suffocated because Dave left him in the car.

Naomi asked the Walkers to sit down with Sheldon. He asked about why they didn't tell Naomi about Max and their grief process. Dave replayed the day. He'd taken the baby to day care, which was normally Kendra's job. He went to work like he normally did and forgot that his son was in the backseat. While he was sitting at work, his screen saver popped up, his son's face, and he remembered. He ran out to the car, but it was too late. Sheldon asked Kendra about her feelings. She said she didn't hate her husband, but she did feel numb. She needed to try to start over. Despite the situation, Sheldon cleared them to use a surrogate.

Because their surrogate had uterine scarring, they needed Addison to operate on her in order to allow her to carry a baby. Kendra came to Addison and said that she remembered Addison from the ER and said for a long time, she couldn't look at her husband and then she couldn't look at herself. She also said that her husband was the only person who understood how people look at you after you've lost a child the way they did. She promised that if Addison gave them their second chance, they'd never make the same mistake again.

After that talk, Addison agreed to do the surgery so they could have their baby.



She is married to [[Dave Walker]].


Her first child, Max, died after being left in a hot car.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Walker, Kendra}}

'''Kenny''' is a kid who faked sick to get out of going to school because he was being bullied.


Kenny came into the practice with a stomachache. When he refused to poop in a cup to have tests run, Cooper suggested he just tell the truth. He knew Kenny was faking a stomachache to get out of school. He admitted he was being bullied because he likes anime. His dad had gotten him into it, but his dad was dead. Kenny just wanted to get out of school, but Cooper said he couldn't hide forever, so he should find the other kids who like anime. His mother then came in and Cooper suggested she keep him home for the rest of the day.

Kenny and Jackie came back into the practice and Jackie was upset because Kenny had taken a knife to school. As they left, Sheldon stopped them and asked to talk to Jackie. He offered his services to help Kenny.

Kenny talked to Sheldon and they bonded over anime. He admitted that the kids had kicked him until he took off his anime shirt. He said he didn't want acceptance. He just wanted to stay at the school long enough to find other kids like him. He'd changed schools six times in two years.

Kenny used anime as a way to escape to a world where his dad was still alive. And his mother constantly pulling him out of schools to protect him prevented him from developing coping skills.

They went to Kenny's house to talk to Jackie. They explained that she needed to stop pulling him out of school. She said that he came home and cried every day. It drove her crazy. She said that her son was a wimp, not knowing that Kenny was listening in.

Kenny later came into the ER after trying to kill himself by stabbing himself. Jackie blamed herself. When Kenny woke up, they told him suicide was not the answer and that he needs to stick around to see things get great. He told his mom he didn't want to switch schools. He wanted to have a chance at his current school and he agreed to keep seeing Sheldon.



His father died and his mother was raising him by herself. She is very protective of him.


*He was  at the time of his problems.
*His dad bought him his first pack of Pok\uemon cards when he was seven.

'''Kerri Gilbert''' is a child whose cancer came back despite a bone marrow transplant.


Kerri was in the hospital. Her labs showed that despite a bone marrow transplant from her father, Greg, her cancer had returned. The only option left was a cord blood transfusion. Cooper said they'd search the public donor banks. There were no matches, so Cooper asked Charlotte to search the private banks. She refused because that cord blood is for the families' personal use.

Cooper went to watch a movie with Kerri. She said she was tired and asked if he'd come back the next day. He said he couldn't, but could come back Saturday, prompting her to ask if she'd still be alive on Saturday. Cooper then used Charlotte's computer to search the private banks and found a match.

He went to [[Robert Weston|Robert]] and [[Ellen Weston]], whose deceased son, Kip, was the match. He asked them to give Kerri the blood to spare another family the grief of losing a child. However, they wanted to keep the blood for their other son, Matt, in case he needed it.

Despite this, Cooper used the blood to treat Kerri. The treatment worked and Kerri's condition rapidly improved.

When the Westons came to the hospital to talk to Charlotte about the situation, they cross paths with Greg, who, upon figuring out who they were, hugged them, thanked them, and offered them the chance to meet Kerri, which they took.



Her father donated bone marrow to her to treat her leukemia.


She and Cooper watched movies together when she was in the hospital. They were planning to watch Oliver! when she got sick again.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gilbert, Kerri}}

'''Kevin Mason''' is the brother of [[Ryan Mason]].


Kevin's brother, Ryan, who was already in kidney failure, developed cardiomyopathy secondary to the dialysis. His kidneys had completely shut down and he was added to the transplant list. He knew that his chances were small of getting a kidney because of a prior blood transfusion which made him a difficult match. Charlotte suggested that he contact his brother, who would make a better match as a family member. Ryan instead tried to buy his way to the top of the transplant list, but Charlotte said it wouldn't work. He agreed to call his brother.

His brother, Kevin, came to the hospital, but then Charlotte found out he was intellectually disabled. Ryan admitted that he didn't want to call Kevin because he's needy. He needs to have everything explained multiple times. He said that his brother would do anything for him.

Kevin was a good match and said he wanted to donate the kidney. Despite Charlotte's reservations, the surgery went forward.

The surgery went well and Ryan pledged to be different to Kevin. However, while they were playing Checkers together, Ryan started bleeding into his abdomen and had to be rushed back into surgery. His body had rejected the kidney, so he was going to die.

They explained the situation to Kevin, who didn't understand that his brother wasn't going to get better. Ryan then tried to get Kevin to understand that it wasn't his fault, but Ryan wasn't going to be going home.



After his parents died, his brother took over paying for his care, but stayed mostly uninvolved in his life.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Mason, Kevin}}

SWAT Officer
'''Former'''
Police Officer |workplace = Los Angeles SWAT |first appearance = [[In Which Sam Gets Taken for a Ride]] |last appearance = [[Nothing to Fear]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[David Sutcliffe]] }} '''Kevin Nelson''' is a police officer and ex-boyfriend of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]. Kevin came to the practice to support [[Susan McCullough]], his late partner's wife, who was giving birth. She declined to let him in the labor and delivery room because she wanted it to be about the baby and felt Kevin would make it about Jason. However, he and several other cops decided to wait out in the lobby to support her. After the baby was born, Addison brought him out to introduce him to his father's co-workers. At the end of the day, Kevin asked Addison out on a date, but she declined, saying she already had plans. ''("[[In Which Sam Gets Taken for a Ride]]")'' Kevin came back to the practice to have a physical done. He came back to get the results of his physical to turn into his work. He also interacted with Addison while he was there. After that meeting, Addison went to the police department to find him. ''("[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]]")'' Kevin agreed to go on a date with Addison, but he didn't call her, so she believed he was blowing her off. However, he showed up at the practice two weeks later and showed her that he wasn't blowing her off. He had training. He had been selected to join the SWAT team. Addison brushed him off, but he later showed up at her house to ask her out on a date. ''("[[A Family Thing]]")'' Worried that Kevin might be cheating on her, Addison followed Kevin in her car. She followed him right into a tenuous work situation and she was arrested because of her proximity. This prompted a discussion about trust between the two. ''("[[Serving Two Masters]]")'' Kevin and Addison returned from a date to find that someone was in her house. Kevin pulled his gun, but it turned out to be Addison's brother, [[Archer Montgomery]]. Kevin and Archer butted heads because Archer didn't believe that Kevin was rich or cultured enough for his sister. Kevin was shocked to learn that Addison has a $ million trust fund at a party. He then asked to leave early and didn't call Addison afterward. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' Addison later got a call that Kevin had been shot on the job. She observed his surgery as another doctor removed the bullet. After his surgery, Addison visited him. He talked about how he didn't fit into her life and didn't feel comfortable there. Addison said that she hadn't once said he wasn't good enough and told him not to give up on them. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' After he was released from the hospital, he stayed at Addison's place and she took care of him. He objected that he didn't want to feel like an invalid, but Addison said that he wasn't a burden. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")'' He grew bored of bed rest and decided to get up and go around doing things. Addison admonished him for that. Addison later came home to find him sitting at the bottom of the steps, unable to get up. She helped him up the stairs. ''("[[Know When to Fold]]")'' Once he had recovered, Kevin talked about going back to his place because he had dishes in the sink. Addison hired a cleaning lady to take care of the mess. When Kevin found out, he was upset. He also disagreed with Addison treated college call girls, saying that once you get into that life, it's hard to get out and believing Addison was enabling them by not counseling them to stop. He later gave Addison money to repay her for the cleaning lady and gardener and left her house to go home. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")'' When Violet was looking for someone to talk to about whether or not [[Doug Adams]] killed his wife in cold blood, Addison sent her to Kevin. He said he'd never seen a women who killed herself or asked to be killed with a gun. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")'' [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] Addison met Kevin as part of the police force that came to visit one of Addison's pregnant patient who had just given birth (and whose husband was killed in the line of duty). Kevin asked Addison out on a date. She declined, saying she had plans. ''("[[In Which Sam Gets Taken for a Ride]]")'' They met again when Kevin came to the practice for a physical. After a few interactions, Addison went to the police department to find him. ''("[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]]")'' Kevin did not call Addison back after their date for a while and she grew agitated, but she later discovered he was training to be a SWAT officer. He showed up to her house to ask her out again. ''("[[A Family Thing]]")'' Addison was worried about Kevin not calling her after a date. She eventually called him and left a rambling message. ''("[[Equal and Opposite]]")'' Addison later saw Kevin outside the hospital. He apologized for being inconsistent and said he was there to woo her. He brought her donuts and said he shouldn't write her off. They also had burgers in between Addison's surgeries. He later took her to the shooting range to fire a gun. ''("[[Nothing to Talk About]]")'' They continued seeing each other, but didn't have sex. Addison didn't want to rush into anything. Kevin invited her for a weekend in Cabo San Lucas. Addison said she had rules now and didn't want to break them. She told him about her rules and said she wanted to wait until it felt right. He said he was okay with waiting. Despite the rules, Addison later called Kevin to her house and they had sex. ''("[[Past Tense]]")'' Two weeks later, Kevin and Addison were still together and Kevin spent many nights with her as she struggled to figure out how to save the practice. He helped her talk through ideas. ''("[[Let It Go]]")'' Their relationship went well until Kevin told Addison that he loved her, which startled her. Because of her trust issues from cheating on Derek and being cheated on, Addison looked through Kevin's phone after he mentioned that many guys on the force were cheating on their significant others. She saw many calls from a "Leslie," which raised her suspicion. She followed him around and got herself arrested when she came upon a serious work situation. He sat in the back of the car with him and explained that Leslie was a man and one of his co-workers, though he was upset that Addison didn't trust him. Kevin later came to her house asking for an explanation. She explained her history with Derek and said she wasn't ready to say she loved him, but if he stuck around, she'd get there because he's honestly and loyal and worthy of trust. ''("[[Serving Two Masters]]")'' [[Archer Montgomery|Addison's brother]] immediately took a dislike to Kevin, his first words to him being "[A] Forbes-Montgomery dating a cop." And he later told Kevin that Addison was just enjoying him, though Addison assured him that wasn't true. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")'' Their relationship hit another snag when Addison paid for a cleaning lady and gardner to clean up Kevin's home while he was nearing the end of his recovery from a gunshot. It made him realize how different their worlds were. He later repaid her for those services and left her house. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")'' Addison found that she missed Kevin after he left and decided to call him after work to tell him that she missed him. ''("[[Contamination]]")'' He returned to her place, but she said that things felt different. As they ate dinner together, he was upset because she said she had to do cystic fibrosis research for a patient instead of spending more time with him. ''("[[Homeward Bound]]")'' Kevin got suspicious about Addison returning home late after work. He kept insisting, telling Addison he's a cop and he's learned when people are lying. Eventually he let it go and apologizes, only for Addison to admit to kissing [[Wyatt Lockhart|another man]] and Kevin left. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")'' Addison initially met Kevin as a police officer, but after he didn't call her back after a great date, she began to wonder why. Kevin eventually returned, telling her he was training to become a SWAT officer. *He gets his news from "Yahoo!".[[Tempting Faith]], x (PP) *He goes go-cart racing.[[Tempting Faith]], x (PP) *He has a couple thousand dollars in credit card debt.[[Tempting Faith]], x (PP) *He lives in the valley.[[Worlds Apart]], x (PP) PPKevinNelson.png|[[In Which Sam Gets Taken for a Ride]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[In Which Dell Finds His Fight]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[A Family Thing]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Nothing to Talk About]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Past Tense]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Let It Go]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Serving Two Masters]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Tempting Faith]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Crime and Punishment]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Know When to Fold]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Worlds Apart]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Homeward Bound]] PPKevinNelson.png|[[Nothing to Fear]] PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg {{Kevin Nelson Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nelson, Kevin}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]] [[Category:Police Officers]]

'''Kim Merring''' is one of the four sisters who repeatedly turned blue.


Kim came to the practice with her mother when her sister's skin turned cornflower blue. After looking for possible causes, Cooper found out that Erin had recently had her first ever cavity filled at the dentist and believed the dental drugs had reacted with the hemoglobin in her blood, which had turned her blue. He gave her methylene blue to make her pink again and sent her home. However, she came back and was blue again, along with her three sisters.

After giving them all methylene blue, Cooper went to their house to look for environment poisons, but found nothing. While he was there, Erin had a seizure and had to rushed to the hospital. Desperate to find an answer, Cooper went back to the house and pretended to be a princess with Becky, Kim, and Sasha, and they led him to their castle, which was a shed that had bags of fertilizer with ammonium nitrate in it, which was poisoning them.



Kim is very close with her three sisters. The four of them play princesses, which included going into a castle together. They rarely speak to adults.


*She and her sister, Becky, are twins.

'''Kirk Jensen''' is a patient with a terminal illness who wanted to end treatment so he could die.


Kirk came into the practice with his father for an exam. He hadn't been very compliant with the meds. At the practice, he stopped breathing, so he was taken to the hospital and intubated. When he woke up, he pulled the tube out of his throat and said he didn't want to be intubated. He knew the tracheotomy was next and didn't want that. He asked Sam to let him die.

Charlie later called Sam to the hospital to ask him to put the tube back into Kirk's throat. Sam did so under pressure from Charlie. In order to keep Kirk from pulling the tube out again, they restrained him.

Sam later went back to the hospital and told Charlie that he wouldn't want to force someone he loved to live a life they couldn't deal with. Charlie agreed to let Sam remove the tube and he stayed with Kirk as he died.



His mother had died two years prior, which made his father even more reluctant to lose him.


*He was  at the time of his death.
*He was diagnosed when he was .

'''Kurt Wilson''' is the husband of [[Elise Wilson]].


Kurt's wife, Elise, was in jail. Sheldon came to speak with her as her doctor. She said that, like every other day, she felt like she was a monster because she'd murdered her two children. She was pregnant with her third when it happened.

Kurt was upset to learn that Sheldon was going to testify on her behalf. Jake said he'd called Sheldon in for a consult because Elise was on suicide watch. Kurt said that Elise had murdered their two children and should rot in jail.

Sheldon believed Elise had a psychotic break due to undiagnosed postpartum depression. Jake felt guilty because he'd helped Elise and Kurt conceive their second and third children. He noticed something was off with Elise during the second try, but he didn't step back.

Elise told Sheldon the story of what happened that day. Kurt was out on a business trip. Max was sick and Josie was upset that Elise couldn't give her the attention that she wanted. Both of them couldn't stop crying and they would wake up over and over again in the middle of the night. Elise was exhausted. So, she told them they were going to the park, got them dressed, and put them in their car seats. She said to them that she was going to get their snacks and went inside, leaving her two children in the running car to suffocate. Elise was sent to jail for that.

Sheldon explained to her that she'd had a psychotic break and he wanted her to understand that and wanted to help everyone else understand that. Elise said she didn't deserve it because she'd killed her children. While they are talking, Elise suddenly collapsed.

Addison told Elise she'd had an eclamptic seizure. The baby was stable, but as soon as Elise was stable, Addison said she'd induce labor so Elise could give birth. She'd have a few moments with the baby before she'd be handed over to Kurt. Once she recovered, she'd be sent back to the jail.

Addison delivered her baby at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]], where Kurt was waiting to whisk the baby away. Elise initially refused to look at her, but when Addison held her up by Elise's face, she apologized to the baby, but refused to name her and she was taken to Kurt.

Kurt held his daughter and then took her back into Elise's room so Elise could see her.



He is married to [[Elise Wilson]].


His daughter, Josie, was four when she died. She had red hair and freckles. Max was two and still in diapers.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Wilson, Kurt}}

'''Lainie''' ''aka'' '''Kim Walters''' was a patient who came in pregnant who was found to have been kidnapped.


Lainie, being called Kim, came into the ER with [[George Walters]], who claimed to be her father. She was  weeks pregnant and had serious back pain. She hadn't had any prenatal care, but Addison said the baby was the appropriate size for her gestation. She called in Sam for a consult, noting that something was off about the two of them.

Her scans revealed an abdominal aortic aneurysm, so they said they wanted to keep her at the hospital to watch her and run more tests and delay surgery because of her pregnancy. They also asked for a family medical history. George insisted on accompanying Kim to all of her tests.

When Sam reviewed a second set of scans and said she needed surgery right away, even with the risks to the baby. She tested positive for the gene associated with fibrillin disease, which caused the aneurysm. It also revealed that George wasn't biologically related to her because he didn't have the disease.

Sam used the excuse of running more tests to get Kim away from George and took her to talk to Sheldon.

She told Sheldon she didn't remember her mother, whom they had said was dead, at all. He asked her about future plans. She said George didn't think she needed to go to college. She then asked about him. He then told her that the condition she had could only have been inherited from a father and George didn't have it.

After speaking to her, Sheldon said he believed they were witnessing an abducted girl and her kidnapper. George overheard that and tried to take Kim out of the hospital. Sheldon called security while Sam restrained George. However, Kim started bleeding and they called for an OR to operate on her. They rushed her into surgery and were able to stop the bleeding and save the baby.

When Kim woke up after surgery, she was told that the FBI was trying to find her parents and George had been arrested. She said that she needed to see George, a result of having spent  years isolated from everyone else.

As she waited, she started to remember some things she'd forgotten. When her parents arrived at the hospital, they came in to see her and embraced her.



She was kidnapped as a child and over the next fifteen years, forgot much of her time with her family.


*She used to sneak to the living room on Saturday mornings to watch cartoons.

'''Lara''' is the sister of [[Andi]].


Lara brought her sister, [[Andi]], to the practice. She said they were cooking dinner when Andi responded as one of her "others", Gina. She'd been diagnosed with multiple personality disorder at the age of seven after a car accident that killed their parents. Lara said it took a lot of therapy to get that under control, but she hadn't seen another personality in nearly ten years, so she was concerned that they were coming back.

Andi then talked to Sheldon herself, believing her sister was worrying too much. When Sheldon started to talk to Andi about what her sister had said, Gina replied, telling him angrily to back off. Sheldon said it was very convincing.

Sheldon talked to Lara and her fianc\ue, [[Jack]], about Andi. Jack said he'd known Andi almost as long as he'd known Lara and he was suspicious because he hadn't seen any of her others before then, a week before they were set to move to Arizona. Lara said she couldn't leave Andi and Jack said he wouldn't go without her.

Sheldon called Andi back in and did art therapy with her, something her previous shrink liked to do a lot. While she colored, he talked to her about Jack. She said she was okay with the moving. She drew a picture of Jack and then suddenly became more aggressive in her drawing. When Sheldon asked her about it, she said she was Maggie, who said they don't care about Andi and asked how Lara could just walk out on her like that. Maggie said that she didn't like Jack because she was taking Lara away. Maggie then asked if she could draw, too. She used crayons and began to draw a childlike picture.

Sheldon was then convinced that it was real, because the pictures were completely different art styles and drawn with different hands.

Sheldon talked to all three of them together. Jack still believed Andi was manipulating them. Jack said that Andi was jealous of him and the time Lara spent with him. Gina then spoke and said he hated Jack. Sheldon then figured out that Andi was faking it, because Maggie had told him she hated Jack, not Gina. Andi then said she loved Jack and didn't want Lara to take him away from her.

Andi told Sheldon that it felt like it was her and Lara against the world and Jack was the first person to understand that. She was jealous of Lara for having him. She apologized for wasting Sheldon's time and he said that if she wanted, they could start over. Lara then came in and said she was mad at Andi, but Andi's her sister and she still loved her, so they needed to figure it out so Andi could stay in their lives, hers and Jack's.



She is engaged to [[Jack]].


Her parents died just after she turned . After the accident, she took over caring for her sister, Andi, who was seven.

'''Larry Cannon''' is a psychiatrist whom Charlotte saw when she was unable to have sex with Cooper after being raped.


Charlotte went to see Larry because of the emotional and sexual repercussions of having been raped. She was shocked when after one session, he gave her a prescription for several medications and said she was good for five months.

Sheldon was shocked that Larry had seemingly abandoned narrative talk therapy, a practice he pioneered. He tried calling Larry's office. When he finally went to the office, he found him playing Mah Jong. Larry said that talk therapy was futile and that drugs were what helped people.

Sheldon went to dinner with Larry and was shocked to see him take pills. Sheldon took the pills from him and said he wouldn't give them back. Sheldon asked him to let him help. Larry then freaked out in front of the other patrons of the restaurant and left.

Sheldon believed Larry had had a psychotic break and knew he needed to call the police.

Sheldon brought the police to Larry's house and he was arrested. He yelled at Sheldon as he was taken out of his house.



He and [[Sheldon Wallace]] were best friends.


He is a psychiatrist. He pioneered narrative talk therapy and then taught it to Sheldon.


*He has an IQ of .
*He's written six books
*He has published  papers.

'''Laura Larson''' is a pregnant woman whose baby was diagnosed with DiGeorge Syndrome.


Laura was pregnant and had been working with Pete on her holistic birth plan. She saw Addison for an ultrasound to determine the sex because her husband Daniel wanted to know. However, Addison also saw signs of DiGeorge Syndrome. Tests confirmed it, so they gave her information on the syndrome and advised her on her options.

When Addison found out that Daniel had another wife, [[Amy Larson]], she called both women into the practice and left them in a room together, where they quickly figured out that they were married to the same man. They were both angry, but Laura suggested that they work together, because they were both victims in the situation. When Amy went into labor, Laura held her hand while she gave birth. Laura also decided she wanted to keep the baby and Amy pledged to help her however she could. When Daniel returned after the baby was born, they asked him to leave.



She is married to [[Daniel Larson]]. After finding out that Daniel had another wife, she decided to leave him.


She is pregnant. When she went in for an ultrasound, she found out the baby had DiGeorge Syndrome. Despite the signifiant health problems, Laura decided to continue the pregnancy.

'''Laura Martin''' is a woman with Parkinson's who became extremely impulsive due to her medication.


Laura came to see Amelia for a checkup. Amelia was dismayed to learn that she'd increased her own dosage without consulting with Amelia. She said she needed to because she was scaring the kids in her kindergarten class. Amelia warned her that there are risks to such a high dosage and asked if she'd been impulsive lately. Laura avoided the question, but then her husband came in and said she'd given him gonorrhea. She admitted she'd been having side effects.

She'd slept with one of the dads in her class after a parent-teacher conference. And the janitor. And the man who came to fix her dripping faucet. It wasn't characteristic of her. She loved her husband, but she couldn't help herself. Amelia suggested an HIV test and STD panel before moving forward.

Amelia had the idea to use deep brain stimulation to treat the Parkinson's symptoms so she could stop the medication. Amelia presented this plan to Laura and Will. Laura was averse to the risk, but Will thought she should do it. Laura came to Amelia and said she didn't want to have the surgery because she liked what the meds were doing for her. She finally felt sexy and alive.

Sam met Laura outside the practice and asked why she'd throw away her marriage for this. Laura said that will would only have sex in the missionary position and if he finished first, he'd roll over and go sleep. Once, she tried to finish herself and he called her disgusting. Sam then realized she needed this in order to enjoy the time she had left.



She has been married to [[Will Martin]] for  years.


She is a kindergarten teacher. She has a student named Eva who has a rough home life, so she spent extra time with her.


*She was  at the time of her infection.

After their trip, she and Sheldon got back together. ''("[[Aftershock]]")''

They went to a black tie gala together. While they were dancing, Sheldon told Laura he had prostate cancer. His prognosis was good, but she said their weekends together were supposed to be a break from real life and she ended things with him. ''("[[I'm Fine]]")''

'''Laurel''' is a woman who was pregnant with twins, one of whom needed fetal surgery.


Laurel came into practice for prenatal care. She and her wife, Dani, were expecting twins. During an ultrasound, Addison saw a severe diaphragmatic hernia on one of the babies. They asked about surgery after he was born, but she said if he were born with it, his quality of life would be severely diminished. They then asked about fetal surgery, but because Laurel was carrying twins, there was risk to the other fetus if she operated.

Addison asked Violet to talk to them, to help them make the right decision for their family. They saw Violet, but Laurel said they'd made a decision. They weren't having the surgery. However, Dani said she didn't actually agree to that. She wanted to take the chance. Laurel said that it was her body, so it was her decision. Dani said it was her eggs. They started to fight about it. Dani said that if Laurel let one of their babies die without trying everything she could, she'd never forget it.

Laurel came to Addison alone and said Dani had left her and wasn't answering her phone. She regretted saying that it was her body because she was only carrying because she won the coin toss. She asked Addison about the surgery. Addison said she was confident she could do it, but didn't want Laurel to have the surgery because Dani left her. Laurel said she couldn't live without Dani.

Dani showed up at the hospital when Laurel went into surgery. She wanted to see Laurel before the surgery, so Laurel would know she was there. She said when she gets scared, she gets mad, but Laurel just gets scared. Dani said Laurel needed to know she loved her. Addison said that was why she was having the surgery. Addison then agreed to let Dani go into the gallery to see Laurel and calm her down for a minute before her surgery.

During the surgery, Addison found an amniotic band on the other fetus that didn't show up on the scans. Jake helped her remove the band while she placed the balloon into the other fetus's trachea.

When Laurel woke up after surgery, Addison told them about the amniotic bands and they were relieved that they'd chosen to have surgery.



She is married to [[Dani]].


She and Dani are expecting twins after fertility treatments.


*She and Dani both have grandmothers named Sarah.

'''Lauren Woods''' is a patient who tried to kill herself after her husband left her.


Lauren came into the ER after nearly drowning. She was  weeks pregnant. Addison met her in the ER and she had surgery to repair a VSD caused by the trauma. Her baby was also delivered via emergency c-section.

After her surgery, Lauren was sedated in the ICU. She needed a second surgery for persistent VSD, but couldn't have it until she was stable. Her baby struggled to breathe in the NICU after her premature birth.

When Lauren woke up, they asked if her husband was in the boat with her and that's why he couldn't be found. She said that he told her he didn't love her anymore and left, which is why she tried to kill herself by jumping into the water.

They called in Violet to talk to her, but Lauren said she didn't want to feel better. Violet asked her about what happened with her husband. She didn't know. She just came home to a note saying that he'd left. She waited for him to come back, but she couldn't think or breathe, so she decided to kill herself. She didn't want to be alone. Violet said she wasn't alone because she'd had a baby. Lauren pointed out that she'd almost killed her baby. She then decided she didn't want the surgery to repair her heart.

She agreed to try antidepressants, which Violet said she hoped would help change Lauren's mind about the surgery. Addison said she'd try to find Michael. When she found him, he said he'd gotten the messages. He said him leaving wasn't out of the blue and he'd been trying to get her to see it for a while. He tried to make it work when she got pregnant, but he never wanted a baby, so he left. He believed if he went back, she tried to kill herself the next time he left, so he refused to go to her.

Lauren continued to refuse surgery, though her baby's condition improved. Addison wanted to take the baby to see Lauren, but Violet recommended against it.

When Lauren's condition became emergent, Addison told Lauren Michael wasn't coming back and she needed accept that. Lauren agreed to have the surgery.

After her surgery, Addison brought the baby to see her. Lauren apologized to her for hurting her.



She was married to [[Michael Woods]] until he left her because he didn't love her anymore.


*She was  at the time of her attempted suicide.

'''Lawrence Freedman''' is the father of [[Cooper Freedman]].


Lawrence and his wife came to Los Angeles for Cooper's wedding. When the arrived, they found Violet, whom they're very fond of. They decided to go out to lunch and neither Charlotte nor her mother was included, though Violet was invited to come along. After Violet left their lunch, they told Cooper they didn't think Charlotte was good enough for him. They thought she was cold and recalled at the times he'd told them about when she hurt him.

At the party the night before the wedding, Amelia talked to them and told them to give Charlotte a chance, to get to know her better. Instead, they talked to her mother and the three of them agreed that Charlotte and Cooper shouldn't get married.

In reaction to hearing this, Charlotte and Cooper skipped out on their wedding to elope in Vegas.

He and his wife had a son, Andy, who died. After Andy's death, they adopted Cooper as a newborn.

'''Leah Hudley''' is a cancer patient who declined radical surgery to preserve her fertility.


Leah came in to have what she believed was a cyst removed. However, pathology revealed stage II ovarian cancer. Leah was eager to jump right into treatment, but objected when Addison suggested immediately removing her uterus and both ovaries. She wanted to have a baby. Leah said she wanted a second opinion and left.

Leah saw [[Wyatt Lockhart]], who offered her a clinical trial that would fight her cancer while preserving her fertility. Leah came back to Addison upset because she hadn't released her file to Lockhart's office. After telling Addison that this was all she ever wanted, to have a baby and show she could provide for the baby by herself, Addison gave Leah her file and said she hoped it worked for her.

When the treatment caused a perforation to her colon, Addison had to take Leah into emergency surgery. Addison repaired the perforation and Lockhart noticed that the tumor had shrunk. Addison said she'd send a sample to pathology, but Lockhart was convinced his protocol was working. The biopsy showed that the tumor was shrinking, but Leah said that she didn't want to die and asked if Addison would still do the surgery. Addison said she would. She said they'd get rid of the cancer and then they'd find a way for her to have her family.


*At her work, she has child care written into her contract and has a nursery off her office.
*She has a hotel that underwent a $ million remodel.

'''Leanne Thompson''' is a woman who gave birth to a child at the practice.


Leanne came into the practice in labor. She gave birth after a quick labor, but while after their child was born, Addison noticed genital ambiguity. The baby had both a penis and a vaginal opening, but was otherwise perfectly healthy. Addison agreed to run genetic and hormonal tests to give them more information.

The tests revealed an XX karyotype, but a disorder which causes an excess production of testosterone in utero, which caused a penis to grow. About % of them identify as male and % as female as adults. Naomi said they could have the parents choose and alter the genitalia to reflect that and support it with hormone therapy, but Addison said they should raise the baby how they want now, but leave the genitalia as is until the child is an adolescent. Naomi said the ambiguity would create problems for the child's whole life.

The doctors went to the Thompsons with the options and they said they figured it was best to figure out a solution and put it behind them. They decided on surgery, but instead of giving the baby female genitalia, they said they wanted male genitalia, despite only a % chance the baby would orient to male.

Addison agreed to do the surgery, but as she prepared to operate, she changed her mind and told the parents that the baby was fine and had no problems, but she couldn't do the surgery. Naomi said they could still have a son and take him home and raise him as Matthew and accept him as he is. And then when he's ready, he can make the choice for himself. Mitch said they'd fine another surgeon to operate, but Leanne said no. She didn't want to make a mistake. Mitch said he couldn't take the baby home and hope it turns out right, so he left.

Leanne held Matthew. She was unsure how to raise Matthew by herself, but Dell said even though she was unsure, he believed she was doing the right thing.

Naomi went to Mitch and told him that he should be there for his family and love them. He said he wasn't sure he could, but she told him to grow up and step up and not hurt the woman who loves him. This prompted Mitch to return to the hospital, kiss Leanne, and hold Matthew.



She is married to [[Mitch Thompson]]. He left her briefly when they disagreed over their child, but came back when Naomi told him to step up.


Her first child was born with genital ambiguity. After much anguish, they decided to raise the baby as a boy and leave the genitals unaltered until Matthew could make his own decision.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Thompson, Leanne}}

'''Lee McHenry''' is the man who sexually assaulted\ua[[Charlotte King]].



After a fight with his girlfriend in which she hit him, Lee came to the ER to have a doctor examine him. However, every doctor was busy, so he accosted a doctor trying to have the doctor examine him before the other waiting people. Charlotte noticed this and told him to wait his turn, saying someone would be there to look at him in a minute. He was offended because she was "mean" to him, so he decided to assault her. He waited outside her office, and when she closed the door to head home, he knocked her head against the door, prevented her from screaming, and dragged her back inside. ''("[[All in the Family]]")''


Lee was then arrested while screaming in the streets, covered in Charlotte's blood. Sheldon was called in to talk to him, because they couldn't get him to tell them what happened and how he got the blood on him. Sheldon was able to get him to start talking once he got some food in him. Lee told him his last name and said he wasn't ready to start talking about what had happened. Sheldon retrieved Lee's file and read that he had no criminal record and had been dishonorably discharged from the Navy. He told Sheldon about having a fight with his girlfriend after catching her cheating in their bed. He said he wasn't angry and that his girlfriend was his whole world. Sheldon asked where the blood came from. He said he didn't want to discuss it. Sheldon asked about his girlfriend and he said the blood didn't belong to his girlfriend. After Sheldon talked to him some more, he admitted that he'd attacked a woman who wasn't nice, who told him he had to wait. He pushed Sheldon into a wall and was restrained. ''("[[Did You Hear What Happened to Charlotte King?]]")''

Lee was brought back in for a line-up, but Charlotte froze and said he wasn't in the line-up, despite recognizing him. As he was leaving, Sheldon told him he'd rape again. Lee said he didn't have proof that he did it. Sheldon said the feelings wouldn't go away and when they surfaced, he'd rape another woman. Lee said that Sheldon doesn't know him and left. Sheldon followed Lee and discovered that he had a girlfriend and a son.

Lee was brought back in for a second line-up and Charlotte identified him as her rapist. ''("[[Can't Find My Way Back Home]]")''

Because of Charlotte's conflicting statements, the ADA decided not to charge him with her rape. ''("[[Just Lose It]]")''


Lee came into the ER with a stab wound to the chest. He'd been hitting [[Nancy]], so she stabbed him. In the ER, Sam figured out that he was the man who had raped Charlotte. Because his blood wasn't clotting, they had to wait to operate until he was able to clot better in order to avoid him bleeding to death. Lee's condition worsened as they waited to operate. Lee's condition finally stabilized enough that he was taken into surgery.

Before his surgery, Charlotte came in to see him, saying she wanted to make sure that if he died, the last image he had was of her.

After surgery, Lee woke up handcuffed to the bed. Nancy had called the police, said that he'd confessed to her about raping Charlotte. Charlotte was by his bedside and said that she'd built him up as a monster in her mind, but she realized he was nothing. She pitied him for having to beat and rape women to feel big. She then said she forgave him and left. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''



He has a girlfriend, whom he found cheating on him with someone in their bed. He claimed he wasn't angry at her, as she meant everything to him. Together, they have a son. After she stabbed him for hitting her continuously, she took their son and left after calling the police on Lee. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''

'''Leslie''' is a patient who was meant to get artificially inseminated.


Leslie and her boyfriend, Ken, came to the practice after deciding they wanted a baby. Due to Leslie's limited fertility, they decided to use artificial insemination to get her pregnant. When he went in to make his deposit, he had a sudden stroke and was rushed to the hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Leslie then stated that she still wanted his sperm, in order to get pregnant. However, because he was dead, [[Charlotte King]] denied the request, saying she wouldn't let them molest a dead man.

Naomi then showed up at the hospital, with Ken's signed consent for the procedure. A hospital lawyer cleared her to extract his sperm for Leslie's use. Naomi prepared to do the procedure, but then [[Maria Wilson]], Ken's estranged wife, showed up at the hospital and blocked her access. She also decided she wanted his sperm for her own use. However, after Naomi spoke to her, she agreed to let Leslie have the sperm to have a baby for herself.



She was dating [[Ken Wilson]] until his death.

'''Lewis Cartwright''' is a prisoner who was psychologically cleared for release from prison.


Lewis was  years into a -year sentence for murder and armed robbery. He said he was a different man than when he'd entered prison. After answering a few questions for Violet, he said he'd been up for parole twice. Both times, a therapist like her came in and he said what he needed to say to get the result he wanted. He didn't want to waste her time, so he just confessed that he wanted to stay in prison and asked for her help to do that. He'd spent more of his life locked up than free and he was afraid he wouldn't make it out in the real world. He felt safe in prison and had a good life built for himself.

After thinking about it, Violet decided not to lie and testified that she believed Lewis would be a model citizen if released. After he was released, Violet talked to him about his life on the outside. She gave him some money and set up a job for him at a car wash.

Violet worried when Lewis hadn't called her. She went to the car wash. She tried to give him her card, but he threatened her and told her to leave and stay away from him.

Lewis later came into Violet's office. He started talking about the day of the robbery and how he never planned to kill the woman. He shot her because he knew she'd remember his face and then he ran. Her name was Stephanie and he wonders about her all the time. He didn't feel like he should get to live his life because she died. Violet told him everybody deserves help. He talked about the guilt he felt over being free. She assured him it's okay to live. He's done the best he can to make amends.

Lewis later called Violet to tell her he got a job as a barista. The owner trusted Lewis's smile.


After his release, Violet got him a job at a car wash. He later got a job working as a barista at a coffee shop.


*He went to prison in .
*He worked in the mail room at the prison for  years.
*He was  at the time of his release.

}}'''Lillie Jordan'''\uawas\uaa patient who had ovarian cancer.


Lillie had stage IV ovarian cancer. Addison did a house call to examine her. Lillie deduced that it had spread to her liver. She refused to return to the hospital, saying she knew she was going to die and the only thing she was concerned about was [[Milo (Cat)|Milo]], her cat. She couldn't leave him in the house alone. Addison agreed to take the cat so Lillie would go to the hospital.

Addison came to see Lillie in the hospital and met her new oncologist, [[Brian Reynolds]]. They told Addison that Lillie had decided to stop treatment. She believed she was holding onto her life too hard, but Addison agreeing to take Milo made the decision easier.

After she started hospice, Addison brought Milo in to visit Lillie, but when she arrived, she found Lillie already dead and her body being taken away.



Her closest family was her second cousin, [[Iris Rogerson]], whom she asked to make her arrangements for her.


She was a fashion designer.

'''Lily Ann Reilly''' was the wife of [[Jake Reilly]] until her death.


Even before Lily met Jake, she struggled with drug addiction. Her dealer visited her house one day, where Jake beat him up in order to protect Lily and Angela.
[[File:Grave.jpg|thumb|left|px|Jake visiting Lily's grave.]]
Lily used to play with her AA chip when she was planning a slip. One day, she overdosed. Jake found her on the bathroom floor and performed CPR for  minutes until the paramedics arrived.

After her death, Jake continued to imagine her and have conversations with her as if she were there. He consulted her when Addison proposed and when Angela was dating a much older man. She advised him that it was time to let her go and move forward with Addison.



Lily loved Jake very much. Jake always hoped that she would choose him over drugs. Unfortunately, she chose drugs, and it cost her her life.


*She loves crullers. Whenever she tried to stay clean from drugs, she would eat them.

'''Linda''' is a patient of Violet's who was having trouble sleeping because she was scared of her son.


Linda came to Violet for a consult to get sleeping pills. She hadn't been sleeping well since her husband died, but it had recently gotten worse. Violet wanted to talk about what was causing the insomnia. Linda admitted that she was scared of her son, [[Jesse]], whom she believed was a sociopath. She said he'd killed their dog. She found the dog in the garage wrapped in a blanket in the garage with a broken neck. She told Violet he changed when his father died, becoming cold. Linda said she just wanted the pills, but Violet wanted to see Jesse and wanted to help.

Linda brought Jesse in to see Violet. She asked him about the dog and he wouldn't respond to her questions about the dog or about his father. Jesse just asked if he could leave. Violet decided just to let him stew for a while to try to get him to talk. She later went back to Jesse and said she had concerns and didn't feel comfortable letting him leave. She gave him the MMPI to fill out and asked him to do it, saying that he could do it or they could sit there for the rest of the day. His test was inconclusive.

Violet saw Linda again and Linda was upset because Violet said the tests were inconclusive. She couldn't sleep. She would lie awake in bed with a hammer under her pillow because she was so scared of what Jesse might do to her.

Jesse confronted Violet, upset because she'd made his mom cry. He told her to let it go. Violet said she wouldn't stop asking questions and asked him again what happened to the dog. Jesse asked her if she knows what it costs to put a dog down. The dog had cancer and the treatment cost thousands of dollars, but his mom was going to pay for it because she couldn't bear to watch him lose his dog after losing his father to cancer. So he killed the dog so his mother wouldn't have to go through that expense. Jesse started to cry as he talked about it, saying his father said he had to be the man and had to be responsible.



She was married until her husband died the previous year.


She says her son, Jesse, became cold after his father died of cancer. Paying for his treatment nearly bankrupted them.


She works two jobs.

'''Lisa''' is one of three girls who made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.


Lisa's mother [[Pam (The Hardest Part)|Pam]], plus [[Terri (The Hardest Part)|Terri]] and [[Ricky]], were in talk therapy with Sheldon and Violet because their three daughters, [[Casey]], Lisa, and [[Jamie]] had made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.

The three daughters also came in to have take therapy together, to try to explain why they'd done it. Casey said she didn't think she should worry about good grades or college when all she wanted was to be a mom, Jamie said it was instant status, and Lisa said babies love you no matter what. There's a lot going on at her house, so her mother can't give them all attention all the time.

Ricky came in late to their joint session. She'd told Jamie she needed to pick up her brother, but she came back with Violet's book, saying Violet wasn't the right therapist for their daughters. She took Jamie and left.

Sheldon and Violet took Casey and Lisa to tour the hospital. Casey and Lisa by that point had read Violet's book and made several comments about it. Violet started to fight back, but Casey started having serious abdominal pain and bleeding. She was rushed in for an emergency c-section. Lisa watched as Casey's baby was delivered and said it wasn't what she expected and left.

Lisa went to see Violet and said she'd read her whole book. She said seeing Casey's baby being born made her feel like she'd screwed up. She said it wasn't fair to her mother to put another child on her as she already had three. She needed her mom and didn't want to be more of a burden. Lisa said she wasn't sure if she wanted to keep the baby, but she needed help talking to her mom about it. Violet suggested they talk to her together.



Her mother is a single mom raising three kids by herself.


She and her friends [[Casey]] and [[Jamie]] made a pact to get pregnant together in high school. However, afters seeing Casey give birth, she wasn't sure whether or not she wanted to keep her baby.

'''Lisa''' was a surrogate who had no idea which of three candidates was the father of her baby.


Lisa was chosen by [[Carol]] and [[Rick (The Other Side of This Life)|Rick]], who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, [[Doug]] (Carol's current husband), and her own husband, [[Jim (Season )|Jim]], meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



She is married to [[Jim (Season )|Jim]]. Despite this, the week she was implanted, she had sex with him, Rick, and Doug.


Lisa gave birth to a healthy baby girl. She decided to turn the baby over to Carol on the condition that they'd all be a part of her life, giving the baby two moms and three dads.


*Her blood type is B+.<ref>[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]], x</ref>

'''Lisa Jacobs''' is a patient who came to the practice because she and her husband were unable to conceive.


Lisa came into the practice with her husband, Brian. They'd been married for five years and hadn't been able to conceive. They came to the practice in the hopes that the doctors could help them conceive. The doctors ran tests and found that Lisa and Brian were biological half-siblings. Their parents had used the same sperm donor to get pregnant.

Naomi and Addison broke the news to Lisa and Brian and they asked the doctors to help them get pregnant still. They said they were staying together and still wanted a baby. Addison and Naomi said they couldn't help them conceive. They couldn't use a sperm donor or adopt. Brian said they could be together and not have kids. Addison said they'd have to stop having sex because no birth control was %. Lisa then declared that she wanted her tubes tied. Addison said she wouldn't do it because Lisa was only .

Lisa came to Addison alone, pleading with her to do the surgery because she said Brian was her missing piece.

The next day, they came back to the practice, hoping Addison would do the surgery. She said she wouldn't. And then Brian revealed that he knew before they got married that they had the same biological father. He thought it was suspicious that they had the same allergy, blood type, and toes. He looked into it. Lisa was horrified that he had known and married her anyway. She said it was over between them.

Addison set Lisa up with an appointment to see Violet and Brian got a hotel room.



She is married to [[Brian Jacobs]]. They met in middle school and married when they were . They felt like they were meant to be together because they had so much in common. When Lisa learned that Brian knew that they were siblings before they were married, she was disgusted and left him.


Lisa's parents used a sperm donor to conceive her.


*She's allergic to grass and peanuts.
*She was  at the time she came into the practice for fertility problems.

'''Lisa King''' is the mother of [[Ben King]] and ex-girlfriend of [[Pete Wilder]].


Lisa brought her son, Ben, to his appointment with Pete. Her ex-husband usually took him, so she wasn't sure if she should come in or not. Ben insisted that she stay and then tried to set her up with Pete.

Lisa later brought Ben back into the practice with trouble breathing. Pete gave him adrenaline to get him breathing again. Pete also asked Lisa out on a date and the three of them spent some time together happily. ''("[[Do the Right Thing]]")''

After they'd been seeing each other for a while, Pete told Lisa that Violet's baby might be his. He said he wanted to be open with her about it because he liked her a lot. She decided it wasn't the end of the world for her, but she also had to consider Ben.

Pete later went to Lisa's house. He said that he needed to be there for the baby and for Violet and ended things with her. He said he wanted to keep treating Ben, but Lisa wasn't sure about that. ''("[[What You Do for Love]]")''



Ex-Husband
She is divorced from Ben's father.

[[Pete Wilder]]
She briefly dated [[Pete Wilder]] after being set up with him by her son. He ended things when he realized he needed to be there for Violet and the baby.


Her son, Ben, has severe allergies and asthma. He sees Pete for alternative therapies to treat them, including acupuncture.


*She does pilates.<ref>[[Do the Right Thing]], x (PP)</ref>
*She makes awesome meatloaf.<ref>[[Do the Right Thing]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Lisa Nussbaum''' is the daughter of [[Abe Nussbaum]].


Sam came to Lisa's father, Abe's, home for a house call. Lisa was frustrated because he drank a lot and wasn't doing much in his life. His home healthcare worker, [[Simone Parker]], enabled him instead of helping him. She left in anger and Sam talked to Abe about his health and how to improve it. He said that without his late wife, he had nothing to look forward to. Sam tried to get him to come in for an exam, but Abe declined.

Abe later came into the practice and agreed to be examined. Sam diagnosed COPD and said he wanted to talk about getting him better in-home care than Simone.

When Pete found out that Simone had several credit cards in Abe's name, the doctors called in Lisa, who said that since her mother died, her father had become a completely different person. He'd been pushing his daughter away. Lisa was told she needed to get rid of Simone and they'd help her find someone else.

When Abe found out that Simone had been fired, he said he knew she'd been stealing and said he didn't care, because he'd hired her because he liked to look at her ass. He admitted it bothered him to need help because he'd always been the one to help. He'd taken extra jobs and sacrificed where needed to give his family whatever they wanted.

Sam brought Lisa to Abe's home and she invited him to come live with her and her family, saying she'd love it. She said she wanted to be the help for once. He agreed to move in with her.



She is married to Barry.


She and her husband have at least two children, some of which are boys.


*She went to Brown.

'''Lizzie Hagan''' is a patient who was mostly blind after a war injury.


Lizzie was injured in an IED explosion in Afghanistan. She had lost her right eye and had diminished vision in her left because of shrapnel lodged in her brain. Her fianc\ue, Eric, had died in the accident. Amelia was called in to consult on her case. Lizzie accidentally smothered her two month old, Natasha, while breastfeeding. Amelia and Pete were able to resuscitate her.

Amelia called in [[Janet (Blind Love)|Janet]], Eric's mother, who lives in San Diego. She came up to take Natasha home with her. She said she didn't find out about the pregnancy until later, when she found a half-written letter. Janet agreed to wait until they operated to try to restore her vision, but said if they weren't able to, she'd be taking Natasha back to San Diego with her.

An MRI showed that the shrapnel was wedged near her optic nerve. Amelia said if she operated, Lizzie could lose what vision she had left. Despite this, Lizzie wanted the surgery. When Lizzie learned that Janet was there, she became panicked and said that she wanted to take Natasha, she always had.

After surgery, Lizzie's bandages were removed and she talked about being able to see things around the room. Janet said she was happy for her and left. Janet cried because she said it wasn't supposed to be like that. Eric was supposed to come home and it was all supposed to be different. She left the hospital and Amelia told Pete she knew that Lizzie was really blind and he'd coached her to fool Janet to get her to leave.

Before leaving for San Diego, Janet came back to say goodbye to Natasha first. While she was there, Pete confessed that Lizzie was totally blind now. Janet wanted to take Lizzie to court over Natasha, but Pete said that they both loved Eric and they both love Natasha and Natasha needed both of them. Janet said she could stay until Lizzie got more comfortable taking care of Natasha by herself. They agreed to try that.



She was engaged to man named Eric before his death in the same accident that blinded her.


Her daughter, Natasha, was born several months after Eric died.


She served in the US Army.

'''Lori''' is the wife of [[Rich]].


Lori and her husband, Rich, were in couples counseling. Lori said that Rich had suddenly started wanting sex all the time, more than a normal fluctuation. She worried about their daughter, Whitney, because Rich had started looking at her weirdly and going into the bathroom while she was showering. He admitted that he had sexual feelings about his daughter and he couldn't control them. He'd never touched her, but she was scared of him. When Rich confessed that, Lori said she wanted him out of the house, saying he was a monster. Rich started seizing in Sheldon's office.

An EEG showed a lesion on Rich's brain that was causing the seizures and the hypersexuality and lack of impulse control. Amelia said she could operate and remove the lesion, which would relieve him of the symptoms. Despite the risks, Rich decided he wanted the surgery because he didn't want to be a danger to Whitney.

Before Rich's surgery, he asked Amelia to kill him if she couldn't get all the lesion.

After surgery, Amelia told Rich she'd gotten the whole lesion, but he'd need time to recover fully. During that time, he would continue to see Sheldon and Whitney would continue to see Violet. He wouldn't be able to go home until they agreed that that's what was best for his family. Lori and Whitney visited him in his hospital room and he promised Whitney he'd do everything he could to earn back her trust and he hoped it was possible. Whitney and Lori then left the room without saying anything. Violet told Rich that Whitney was brave and hopeful.



He is married to [[Rich]].


She is very protective of her daughter, Whitney. When Rich revealed that he had sexual thoughts about their daughter, she told him to leave the house.

|name = Lorraine
|status = Alive
|diagnosis = Cancer
|doctors = *[[Pete Wilder]]
*Oncologist
|treatment = Radiation
|marital = [[Elliott]] ''(husband, separated)''
|children = Daughter
|siblings = [[Claudine]]
|only appearance = [[A Step Too Far]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Marina Black]]
}}

'''Lorraine''' is a cancer patient whose sister carried a baby for her via surrogacy.


Lorraine came to see Pete. He examined her and she was shocked that after so much time, she was cancer-free and pain-free. Her husband and sister were her support group. Her sister, [[Claudine]], was even acting as a surrogate so that Lorraine and her husband, [[Elliott]], could have a baby. After Lorraine's exam, Claudine had abdominal pain, so Pete called in Addison to check her out.

When Addison came to examine her, Pete was shocked to see Claudine and Elliott kissing. Elliott said it wasn't a tawdry affair. Before the cancer, things weren't great between him and Lorraine. Then the cancer happened and he and Claudine teamed up to take care of her. They spent a lot of time together and bonded over their shared experience. The feelings got stronger until they gave into them. Elliott planned to tell Lorraine after the baby was born. They were planning for him to leave Lorraine so they could be together.

Addison said Claudine was in the very early stages of labor. Because her OB was out of town, she asked Addison to deliver the baby. She also refused to tell Lorraine about the affair. Lorraine had always wanted to be a mom, but Claudine didn't want kids. She only wanted to fall in love. It had never happened for her until Elliott.

When the baby went into distress, Elliott comforted Claudine before she was taken for an emergency c-section, leading Lorraine to figure out they'd been having an affair. After the baby was delivered, Claudine had a lot of bleeding.

After her surgery was completed, Addison told Claudine she'd had to perform a hysterectomy to stop the bleeding, meaning Claudine wouldn't be able to carry more children. Elliott then said they could take the baby and leave together.

Pete told Lorraine about their intentions and told Lorraine she needed to fight, to dig deep.

Addison brought the baby to see Claudine, who asked Addison what she'd do in her position. Addison said if she was asking, Claudine could have the baby or Elliott, but not both.

Elliott and Claudine prepared to leave the hospital without talking to Lorraine. Lorraine confronted them and said she wanted the baby. Elliott said it wasn't hers and they'd go to court if necessary. Elliott tried to get Claudine to leave, but she said the baby wasn't hers. It was Lorraine's. She asked Lorraine for forgiveness, but Lorraine said she couldn't. They'd never been what they were before, but she could still be a good aunt to Lorraine's baby. Claudine then handed the baby over to Lorraine.



She was married to [[Elliott]] for eight years. They split when Lorraine learned that Elliott had been having an affair with her sister.


She and her sister were close. However, after learning that her sister was having an affair with her husband, she said their relationship would never be the same again.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Lorraine}}
