'''Lucas Wilder''' is the son of [[Pete Wilder|Pete]] and [[Violet Turner|Violet]].



[[File:xPPViolet.jpg|thumb|left|Violet and Katie as Katie prepares to cut Lucas out of Violet's uterus.]]
Lucas was born after a patient of his mother, Violet, cut him out of her uterus. The patient, [[Katie Kent|Katie]], who was mentally ill, stole Lucas. She lost a baby and convinced herself that Lucas was hers. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''


She left Violet to die, but she was found in time to be taken to the hospital. The baby was missing, so they put out an Amber alert. Katie later brought him to the hospital, saying she'd heard about Violet on the news. She told Cooper she'd had her baby and showed him Violet's baby. He had a nurse call security and used the guise of a newborn exam to get Katie to hand the baby to Cooper. Once he had the baby, security took Katie and Cooper gave the baby to Pete. He had bruising on his belly and was anemic. He had blood in his belly, so Addison took him into surgery. When Violet stopped clotting, Addison was forced to return to her and leave a pediatric surgeon to finish the baby's surgery. She later returned to the baby and was able to save his life. When Violet woke up, she said he was beautiful. ''("[[A Death in the Family]]")''

A month after Lucas was born, Pete decided to return to work. Violet, still dealing with the aftermath of the attack, had trouble holding Lucas and bonding with him. Pete told her that while everyone else could wait, Lucas didn't understand and needed her now. He said she needed to do it herself and he needed to let her, so he decided to go back to his house and leave Lucas with her. Violet later admitted to Charlotte that she didn't feel anything for Lucas. She took Lucas to Pete's house and said she wanted to be a good mother. She didn't know how to do that when she looked at Lucas and didn't feel anything. She said that being a good mother meant doing what was best for your child. She then handed Lucas over to Pete and left. ''("[[The Way We Were]]")''


After learning that Lucas was living with Pete, Sheldon asked Violet for a paternity test. She consented and Addison did the test, which showed that Pete was his father. ''("[[Right Here, Right Now]]")''


Pete took care of Lucas, bringing him to the practice when the nanny got sick. He tried to get Violet to acknowledge him, but even after being left with him while Pete pretended to have a consult, she didn't pick him up even after he woke up. Pete then made the decision to move to [[Pacific Wellcare Center]] so that Violet wouldn't have to see Lucas constantly. ''("[[Pushing the Limits]]")''

When Pete started to date Addison, she began to spend more time with Lucas and take care of him. ''("[[Triangles]]")''

Pete raised him with help from [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] until Violet was ready to be his mother. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''


When Violet returned, Pete introduced her to Lucas. She said she was ready to be Lucas's mom again. Violet then told Pete that she wanted to share custody of Lucas. Pete said that he wouldn't agree to that because of what had happened with Lucas so far. ''("[[Second Choices]]")''

Violet then pursued custody through the courts. Pete and Violet both hired lawyers and their friends were divided, forced to choose sides as they presented their arguments to the court. At the end of the hearing, the judge ruled that Pete would retain full custody of Lucas, with Violet getting supervised visitation. ''("[[War]]")''


Despite the ruling, Pete soon after agreed to start letting Lucas have overnight visits with Violet. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")''

Pete and Violet later wed, with Lucas in attendance. ''("[[Take Two]]")''

When [[Monica Bratton]] dropped Betsey back off at the practice, Violet took her home for the night. In the morning, Violet was worried because Lucas wasn't in his crib, but she found him on the couch with Betsey, watching cartoons. ''("[[A Better Place to Be]]")''


Wanting Lucas to have the same childhood experience she had, Violet tried to make him a Halloween costume. However, Pete bought him a costume and said he could still have those experiences. They then took him trick or treating together. ''("[[All in the Family]]")''


When Pete's mother, Frances, was hospitalized after a digoxin overdose, Pete brought Lucas to visit her. Shortly after this visit, Frances died. ''("[[The Hardest Part]]")''


When Violet's medical license was suspended, she decided to go on a three-week book tour. However, shortly after she left, Pete had a heart attack. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")''

Pete wasn't discovered for several more hours, when Cooper arrived to cheer him up about Violet leaving. Lucas had gotten scared and hidden under the table. Pete and Lucas were taken to the hospital, where Lucas stayed with Addison while Pete got treatment. ''("[[God Laughs]]")''


Lucas went with Violet to one meeting with a mommy group. ''("[[Deal With It]]")''


When Violet and Pete decided to separate, Violet moved out, staying at hotel for the night, but saying she'd come back in time for breakfast in order to keep things steady for Lucas. ''("[[The Breaking Point]]")''


Lucas attending Thanksgiving dinner at Addison's house along with his parents. ''("[[The Breaking Point]]")''


After Addison adopted Henry, Violet took Lucas over for a visit. ''("[[And Then There Was One]]")''


When Lucas was three, Pete was arrested for murdering [[Troy Davis]]. When he failed to show up to his preliminary hearing, they believed he had fled. However, he was later found dead of a heart attack. ''("[[Aftershock]]")''

During Pete's party funeral, Amelia took Lucas, Henry, and Mason next door to Sam's house when they got bored. Lucas watched "The Muppets" movie. ''("[[Mourning Sickness]]")''

After Pete died, Lucas kept asking Violet where daddy was, not understanding that Pete was gone. Violet repeatedly told him that daddy isn't coming back several different ways, but nothing seemed to work, as Lucas kept asking. One night, Violet tucked Lucas in and said that she loved him. He replied, "I love you too, Mommy." Then he looked toward the sky and said, "I love you too, Daddy." He had finally that his father was gone. ''("[[Good Grief]]")''


After Pete's death, Lucas started sleeping in Violet's bed with her, which frustrated his nanny, [[Clara]]. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")''



After he was born, his mother had trouble bonding with him, so she gave him to his father, who then raised him for most of his first year. After Violet got treatment and started to feel like she could be a good mother, they began to share custody and then got married shortly thereafter.


When he was an infant, his father had a relationship with [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] and she regularly took care of Lucas during that time.


*He had a credit only appearance in [[Gone, Baby, Gone]].
*Violet called him Boo-Boo.<ref>[[A Better Place to Be]], x (PP)</ref>
*As a baby, the motion of going up and down in the elevator calmed him.<ref>[[Another Second Chance]], x (PP)</ref> 
*He likes The Muppets movie. <ref> [[Mourning Sickness]], x (PP) </ref>

'''Lucia''' is the pregnant wife of [[Carl (Second Choices)|Carl]].


Lucia's husband, Carl, came into the practice with her when she was pregnant. He had passed out on the toilet and hit his head, so Addison referred him to Amelia to get checked out. He was on leave for three weeks so he could be home when the baby was born. He admitted that sometimes, he got dizzy. His EKG showed that there might be a problem with his heart.

Lucia confessed that she wanted them to find something wrong, something that would keep him out of the Army because she was worried about him dying.

Sam reviewed Carl's cardiac CTs and found a serious blockage in his artery. He believed Carl was a candidate for a stent, but Addison suggested drug therapy instead, so that he could get discharged.

Sam brought Lucia and Carl in to talk to them about their options. Lucia believed the surgery was too risky, but Carl said that he has guys who depend on him to stay alive. Lucia said that she and the baby depend on him too. Carl said he still wanted the surgery, because he was a soldier and wanted to go back.

As he went into surgery, he said that he knew he should be there for his wife and child, but he felt a responsibility to go back to service.

In surgery, Sam said that his vessels were more clogged than he thought. The stent might not hold. He used bypass instead, which would permanently take him out of the Army.

After the surgery, Sam told Carl he wouldn't be able to return to active duty. Carl was upset because that's not what he wanted.



She is married to [[Carl (Second Choices)|Carl]].


She and her husband are expecting their first child.

'''Lucy Henderson''' is a teenager who went into congestive heart failure while giving birth.


Lucy got pregnant as a teenager. She hid the pregnancy from her father until she was in labor, when she had him take her to the practice to give birth. She had a holistic birth plan, so she had acupuncture while she labored. When she started pushing, she went into congestive heart failure, at which point, they told her to stop pushing while they evaluated her. They called an ambulance, but they didn't have time to wait for it, so Addison made the room as clean as possible and prepared to do a c-section. When Addison expressed concern about operating without anesthesia as there wasn't even time to do an epidural, Pete said he could block her pain receptors. He did so and Addison operated. The paramedics arrived just as she delivered the baby. Lucy became unstable after the delivery and had to be resuscitated before the paramedics could take her, her father, and her baby to the hospital.



Her mother died giving birth to her. When she became pregnant at seventeen, her father was disinterested in helping her during her labor until she went into congestive heart failure, when he became worried about her.

'''Lucy Russell''' is the one of the quintuplets born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Lucy was part of a quintuplet pregnancy. She had been diagnosed in utero with hydrocephalus, meaning she'd need to have surgery to place a shunt shortly after birth. When their mother was  weeks pregnant, she was hospitalized until she was ready to deliver, which she hoped would not be until  weeks. However, she started having contractions at just  weeks. They put her in trendellenberg and put her on magnesium to try to stop the labor. Despite their efforts, her placenta started tearing, forcing them to deliver all five babies at  weeks. ''("[[Much too Much]]")''


After birth, Lucy had surgery to insert a shunt to drain the fluid off her brain. She was doing well in the NICU after her surgery. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''



She is part of a set of quintuplets. Their parents also have a set of triplets.


*She would kick back when kicked.<ref>[[Much too Much]], x</ref>
*She was Baby C.<ref>[[Much too Much]], x</ref>

'''Lyla''' is the ex-girlfriend of [[Brandon Henry]].


Lyla came into the practice with her boyfriend, Brandon, who had a sore throat. When the sore throat turned out to be throat cancer caused by HPV, Lyla blamed herself. She hadn't told him she had the virus because she didn't think it could hurt him. Brandon said he didn't blame her, but when Brandon was told he'd need a surgery to remove part of his jaw, she left him, saying she couldn't look at him every day and know that she caused it.



She was dating [[Brandon Henry]]. They met when they were lab partners at school. He was planning to propose, but hadn't gotten up the nerve to ask her. When he was diagnosed with cancer, she left him.

'''Lynn''' is the mother of [[Jenna]].


Lynn came into the practice with her daughter, Jenna, who was dying of cancer and wanted a baby as her last wish. They retrieved her eggs and got a sperm sample from her husband, [[Nick (Let It Go)|Nick]], and fertilized one of her eggs. However, Nick confessed that he didn't really want a baby and was only doing it because Jenna wanted it so badly.

When Nick didn't come home that night, Jenna decided to go ahead with the pregnancy with a sperm donor with her parents' support. However, Naomi said she couldn't do it, because what they all really wanted was for Jenna not to be dying. Nick agreed, saying he didn't want a baby, but he did want Jenna.



She is married to [[Garry]].


Her only daughter, Jenna, is dying of cancer. Desperate to keep a part of her alive, her parents supported her decision to try to have a baby.

'''Lynn Jarvey''' is the mother of [[Evan Dawson]].


Lynn showed up at the practice and confronted Cooper, saying she knew he'd treated her son and she believed he knew where he was. She had hired a private investigator and knew that Cooper tracked Evan's insulin pump. Cooper said that he'd said he was abused by his stepfather, but Lynn insisted that that had never happened.

Lynn and Ted came to the grand jury hearing for Cooper. He still refused to tell them where Evan and Frank were. However, because Addison knew he'd sent Charlotte in his place to see Evan, she had the police follow her and they found Frank and Evan. Frank was arrested and Evan was returned to his mother and stepfather.

Evan later came into the ER with stab wounds saying Ted stabbed him. Ted insisted that he hadn't done anything. When Evan was examined, they found that he had intention marks, meaning he'd done it to himself. He admitted that he'd made the whole thing up to try to get his parents back together and then he didn't know how to stop.

Lynn dropped the charges and Frank was released from jail.



[[Frank Dawson]]
She was married to Frank Dawson. They had a son together and then divorced.

[[Ted Jarvey]]
After her divorce from Frank, she married Ted Jarvey.

'''Lynn McDonald''' is a patient who spent two days in labor before giving birth.


Lynn spent two days in labor before her water finally broke. She was committed to unmedicated childbirth, so she used several techniques to try to progress her labor.

Because her labor wasn't progressing, Dell called in Addison. Addison said she could give Lynn pitocin and pain medication, but Lynn said she had a birth plan and didn't want that. She maintained that as long as the baby was okay, she wanted to give birth unmedicated. She'd try any natural remedies to progress labor, but no drugs. Everything up to that point had been out of her hands, so she wanted something to go according to plan.

She continued to labor and admitted she wanted it to be beautiful because she read that the way a baby comes into the world shapes their whole life. She wanted her baby to have a good life. Dell said even if she took something for pain, she'd have many opportunities to give her kid a good life.

By the time Lynn got to the time to push, she was exhausted and asked for pain medications. Dell said it was too late for that. He coached her through it, saying they were almost done. She stuck to her plan, which not everyone can do. They'd get through the rest of it together.

Lynn's baby was born and she held him.



She was married to a great guy, but he didn't want kids, so they divorced.


Once her divorce was final, she decided to let loose. She got pregnant by a guy she met at a tequila bar.

{{DEFAULTSORT:McDonald, Lynn}}

'''Maggie Klein''' is a patient who gave birth with vacuum assistance.


Maggie went into labor and after progressing for a while, the baby stopped descending. They determined that they needed to use vacuum assistance to complete the delivery. The baby had a hematoma on her head from the vacuum, but was otherwise healthy.

Despite Addison saying everything was okay, Dell continued to check on the newborn, Beth. At the end of the day, Dell came in to check on them and Beth was crying and Jake said they couldn't get her to stop. Dell said she was probably just hungry. Maggie initiated breastfeeding and Beth calmed down.



She is married to [[Jake Klein]].


She has a daughter named Beth born with vacuum assistance. Despite a hematoma on her head, she was perfectly healthy.


*She says Naomi is her good luck charm.

'''Maggie Roberts''' is a young girl who was diagnosed with schizophrenia.


Maggie came into the practice with a cut on her forehead. Cooper cleaned it and said she wouldn't need stitches, just a few bandages. When he put the bandages on, Maggie said that Eli didn't believe her. Her parents explained that Eli was her imaginary friend. Maggie then went on to say that Eli believed it was his fault, because he wanted her to make new friends and so she introduced him to some other girls, but they were rude.

Worried about Maggie, Cooper consulted with Sheldon, thinking Maggie was using her imaginary friend to isolate herself.

After seeing Maggie, Sheldon said he believed Maggie was schizophrenic. Her having an imaginary friend wasn't the problem. The problem is that she believes he's real. He wanted to prescribe anti-psychotics. Time was critical because she was pre-pubescent and starting the medicine early gave her a shot at a functional adulthood.

They met with her parents and talked about her situation. Her father, Joe, denied it, saying she was just a creative kid. He and his wife, Cyndy, then left.

Cyndy returned to the practice alone and said she had concerns about Maggie. She believed Sheldon was right and she didn't know what to do because her husband wasn't seeing it.

They called Maggie back in and her parents and Cooper watched through the glass while Maggie talked to Sheldon. He asked her about Eli and she admitted that sometimes Eli made her do things she didn't want to do, like drowning her cat.

Joe was still adamant that he didn't want to send Maggie away and didn't believe the diagnosis was correct. Sheldon figured out that Joe had been through it before. He admitted that his sister had schizophrenia. They put her in residential care and medicated her and she ultimately killed herself. He felt guilty because Maggie got it from his side of the family. Sheldon assured him that treatment has evolved since his sister and they don't do things the same way anymore.

They made the decision to put Maggie in residential care.



Her aunt also had schizophrenia and killed herself because of it.


*She was  at the time of her diagnosis.
*She likes to paint and read.

'''Malcolm''' is the brother of [[Phillip (What You Do for Love)|Phillip]] and brother-in-law of [[Janine]].


Malcolm's sister-in-law, Janine, was  weeks pregnant and short of breath. She wondered if she had gestational diabetes because her husband, [[Phillip (What You Do for Love)|Phillip]], was diabetic. Malcolm, who is a nurse, came to her appointment because Phillip had to work. Addison said that her blood sugar was fine. Addison listened to her lungs and had Dell call an ambulance because she heard fluid in Janine's lungs. She had diffuse myocardial dysfunction. The added pressure of the pregnancy caused the condition to worsen quickly. She needed a heart transplant. Because the pregnancy was putting extra stress on her, Addison recommended termination. Her husband said she should, but Janine said she couldn't do it.

Janine was put at the top of the donor list, but her husband and brother-in-law were told she had only  hours to find a heart.

Phillip later came into the ER with no brain activity. He'd had an insulin overdose that caused brain death. His license revealed that he was an organ donor. They talked to Janine, asking her to take Phillip's heart to save her life. Malcolm encouraged her to take it. They took her in for the surgery, but were stopped by [[Charlotte King]]. She believed it was either suicide or homicide and insisted that evidence be collected before the transplant could take place. They waited and Phillip started to become unstable, so they had to rush once they were cleared to retrieve the heart.

After the transplant, Janine's condition improved, though she worried because she suspected that Malcolm might have killed his brother to get Janine a heart. She knew he was in love with her. Addison confronted Malcolm about it, but he denied it, saying he loved his brother. The ME ruled Phillip's death an accidental overdose. Addison later watched as Malcolm kissed Janine's hand in her hospital room.



He is in love with his brother's wife, [[Janine]]. She even suspected that he killed his brother to get Janine a heart transplant.


His brother trusted him to take care of Janine while he worked. When Phillip died of an insulin overdose, Malcolm was suspected of having killed him to get Janine his heart.


He is a nurse. That is part of the reason why they suspected that he killed his brother, because he would know the dosage required to kill him without stopping his heart.

}}'''Margaret Delhom''' is a pregnant woman whose husband was dying of cancer.


Margaret's husband, Neil, had cancer that started in his abdomen, but spread to his liver and lungs. Margaret was pregnant and he needed to live for six more weeks so he could meet his daughter.

Neil's labs showed that he likely only had a few weeks, but [[Gabriel Fife]] suggested some new therapies in order to give him a few extra weeks to give him a chance to meet his baby. He proposed inserting a device into Neil's abdomen to heat up the tumor.

Gabriel and Pete implanted the device and Neil woke up in extreme pain from hand-foot syndrome. Margaret wanted to stop, but Neil insisted he didn't care about the side effects as long as it kept him alive. However, the treatment failed, so Gabriel proposed that they instead deliver the baby early so that Neil could meet her.

Addison induced Margaret's labor and delivered her baby. They then took the baby to Neil's room and put her next to his face.



She is married to [[Neil Delhom]].


They spent two years trying to get pregnant. They finally got pregnant, but learned that Neil was dying. To ensure that he got a chance to meet his daughter, the baby was delivered early.

'''Marilyn Sullivan''' is a woman who had multiple sclerosis and was abusing her child as a result.


Marilyn came into the practice with her daughter, Tess, who had a broken wrist. She said that she missed the curb while walking home. Cooper noticed a bruise on her arm that looked like someone had grabbed her and asked her about it. She denied anything having happened. While Tess's wrist was being casted, Marilyn went with Sam to get samples of some new meds to treat her multiple sclerosis.

Cooper looked into Tess's medical records and found a spiral humerus fracture from before she was his patient, along with several other breaks. When Violet said that when a child was being abused, the most likely culprit was the adult in the house. Cooper then sadly resigned himself to calling CPS on Marilyn. Cooper went to Sam with his concerns and Sam refused to believe that Marilyn could be hurting Tess. He said Cooper needed to be sure before making the call. Cooper struggled, but ultimately made the call to CPS.

Marilyn and Tess returned to the practice enraged because a social worker had come to their home. Marilyn and Tess said that Tess had helped her when she fell and that's how her arm got broken, though Cooper didn't believe them because they would have been forthcoming with that story if it were true.

A hearing was scheduled to determined if the concerns were founded. Before the hearing, Tess came to Cooper and asked what he'd say. He said he'd tell her if she rolled up her sleeves. Tess said her mom hits her, but it's okay because she's in pain and needs to take it out on someone. Cooper said it wasn't okay for her to take it out on Tess. During the hearing, Cooper reported on the injuries he'd observed on Tess. He said that her injuries could have only happened in an abusive situation. He then went on to say that Tess was strong, but even the strongest kid shouldn't have to take the kind of abuse Tess was going through. Once you do that, you're not a kid anymore. The judge ruled that Tess would be removed from Marilyn's custody. Marilyn pleaded with Sam to believe her and help her, but he walked away.



She was raising her daughter, Tess, as a single mother. However, after it came to light that she was abusing her daughter, Tess was removed from her custody and placed in foster care.


She is a writer.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Sullivan, Marilyn}}

'''Marion''' is a patient who was depressed after the loss of a boyfriend.


Marion was in assisted living. Naomi did a house call to check on her. Marion was diabetic, so Naomi checked her sugar and found that it was very high, so she asked if she'd been taking her insulin. Naomi suggested that she start seeing a therapist. However, Gabriel instead suggested brain surgery to cure the depression. Marion rejected both options.

Naomi went back to the practice and asked Sheldon to go see Marion. He came to see her, but she was disinterested in talking to him. Sheldon asked around her community and found that she'd lost a friend named Walter to a heart attack a few weeks prior. Sheldon said he recommended talk therapy.

Gabriel went to visit Marion by himself. He said that they believed it was grief due to the loss of Walter, but he noticed that she thrived after the loss of her husband. She said Walter was her friend. They used to play Scrabble together. She couldn't ever tell him she loved him because she felt like she was betraying Jerome. They'd argued over it a week before he died. Gabriel said that there's no way Walter didn't know she loved him.



Jerome
She was married to Jerome for nearly  years when he died.

Walter
After Jerome died, she became close with another man in her living community, Walter. They played Scrabble together, but she couldn't tell him she loved him because she felt she was betraying Jerome. When he died, she was upset because she worried he didn't know that she loved him.

|only appearance = [[...To Change the Things I Can]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]

}}

'''Marisa Windsor''' is a child who suffered brain damage after an allergic reaction.


Marisa was at the practice for a routine exam when she started seizing. She had juvenile Krabbe's disease, which had caused significant neurological deterioration. She'd been on sedatives, but her parents had them reduced because they were making her a zombie. She'd lost most of her hearing and part of her eyesight. She had six months to a year left to live. Her parents had been seeing Sheldon to try to adjust to that idea.

Pete suggested a stem cell transfusion, but Cooper rejected the idea, worried it might do more damage. They went to the Windsors about it, saying it could give her two or three more years. Her mother, Angela, wanted to do it, but her father, Jason, worried about the possibility of it making her worse.

They did the transfusion, but Marisa had a severe allergic reaction and was deprived of oxygen for a significant amount of time, leaving her only minimally functional. Her parents were devastated and blamed the doctors for pushing them into the treatment.

Jason talked to Cooper about Marisa's condition and asked him to help end her suffering. Cooper refused.



Marisa's parents had a hard time accepting her inevitable death.


*She was eight at the time of her hospitalization.
*She used sign language to communicate.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Windsor, Marisa}}

'''Mark''' is the brother of [[Jeffrey (Season )|Jeffrey]].


When Mark's brother, Jeffrey, and sister-in-law, [[Kathleen]], found out they had a very low chance of conceiving a baby together due to Jeffrey's low sperm count, Jeffrey, desperate to give his wife the baby she wanted, approached Mark to be the sperm donor. He happily gave his sample and it was good, so they went to inseminate, but Jeffrey and Kathleen both stopped it at the last minute.



He agreed to donate sperm so his brother and sister-in-law could have a baby. However, they ultimately didn't go through with it because he's kind of a jerk.

'''Mark Miller''' is the father of [[Dean Miller (Private Practice)|Dean Miller]].


Mark's son, Dean, came into the practice to see Cooper. While Cooper was examining him, he told Cooper that he had a girlfriend and he was going to have sex with her. Cooper pushed condoms on him because he knew that Dean was HIV positive. Dean was unaware of his condition because his parents refused to tell him. When he was diagnosed, they thought he wouldn't live long enough to understand, so they told him he had a kidney condition and most of his symptoms were side effects of the HIV cocktail.

Unable to tell Dean's parents about his intent to have sex and unable to tell Dean about his HIV status, Cooper called Dean's parents into his office and told them he believed it was time to tell Dean. They refused and warned him not to overstep his boundaries.

Desperate to prevent Dean from passing HIV to another kid, Cooper called the whole family into his office and told Dean's parents that he was planning to have sex with his girlfriend. They asked him to leave the office so they could talk to Dean. They told him about his HIV status, but he angrily told Cooper that it was too late and they'd already had sex. His father also attacked Cooper and knocked him down.

The next day, Dean came into the practice with his parents, his girlfriend, and her parents. He said they had a lot of questions. Cooper invited them back to his office to answer them.



He is married to [[Robin Miller]].


His son, Dean, has HIV. Not wanting to tell him that, they told him he had a kidney condition.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Miller, Mark}}

'''Marla Thomkins''' is a doctor who negatively reviewed Violet's book.



When ''Beautiful Scars'' was released, Marla reviewed it, saying that Violet revealed more about herself than others when writing it and seemed more selfish than therapeutically-minded.

Marla came to Violet's book release party and met Sheldon, whom she liked. ''("[[A Step Too Far]]")''

She and Sheldon dated briefly, but she broke it off because she believed Violet's opinion of their relationship was more important than hers. ''("[[The Hardest Part]]")''



She briefly dated [[Sheldon Wallace]] after meeting him at Violet's book release party. Despite being told it would be berating Violet to see her, Sheldon went to her hotel room. ''("[[A Step Too Far]]")''

Marla broke it off after realizing that Sheldon worried more about what Violet thought about them seeing each other than what Marla thought. ''("[[The Hardest Part]]")''


She is a psychiatrist. She also reviews books and in the past, has taught.


*She hiked Machu Picchu, taught for a semester at Oxford, and studied at Le Cordon Bleu.

'''Marshall Holden''' is the father of [[Ike Holden]].


Cooper examined Marshall's son, Ike, after he'd had a hernia repaired and Ike had a little trouble making sentences, but Cooper said it was probably after-effects of the anesthesia wearing off. [[Scott Barker]], Ike's surgeon, then came to see him, saying the surgery went well. Cooper said the anesthesia effects would wear off in an hour or so.

When the time came for Ike to be discharged, Scott didn't show up, so Cooper did the discharge.

Ike later came back to the hospital with ischemia. Scott planned to operate, but Charlotte asked him if he'd taken anything that day. She wouldn't let him operate until he said he hadn't taken anything that day. He wasn't able to say that.

'''Marshall Rakoff''' is the former foster brother of [[Betsey Parker]].


Marshall came to the hospital with his parents, Phil and Gina, and his foster sister, Betsey, who had fallen down the stairs. Because of that injury and a previous healed clavicle fracture, Cooper suspected she was being abused. Naomi got Gina and Phil out of the room and Cooper asked her about it, but she said she fell. When they figured out what was happening, the Rakoffs asked Cooper to leave.

Cooper called in [[Gladys]] because of his concerns. Gladys said she believed he was wrong, but she'd follow-up on his complaint.

Later, while eating ice cream with Marshall, Sheldon had concerns that Marshall was the one who had hurt Betsey. He went to the Rakoffs about it, but they were angry at the implication and refused to listen.

Sheldon went to Gina alone and deduced that she'd already been concerned about Marshall. She said that she'd known for a while that he was different, but she didn't want to see it. She thought bringing another kid into their home would give him a friend. She told a comatose Betsey that she loved her and left, saying she needed to put Marshall first.



Marshall's mother worried about his behavior because he had no friends and had frequent confrontations with other children.


He has no friends.


*He and Betsey are very close in age.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Rakoff, Marshall}}

|portrayed by = [[DaJuan Johnson]]
}}
'''Martin Salter''' is the husband of [[Zoe Salter]].



After trying for two years, Marty's wife, Zoe, was finally pregnant. However, when she came in for a checkup, Naomi had to inform her that a mistake had been made and the fetus she was carrying came from an embryo supplied by [[Amelia Sawyer]] while Amelia was pregnant with Zoe and Marty's baby.

Naomi shared the news with Amelia and the Salters separately, but they figured out what had happened as they left. Zoe and Amelia had met each other in the waiting room and bonded over their similar stories. Amelia wanted to continue the pregnancy and have Zoe do the same, saying she'd respect the Salters' wishes. However, Zoe said she and her husband wanted to terminate and start over with the other embryos they had stored. When Amelia heard that, she said if they terminated, she'd have the baby she was carrying and keep it.

Zoe later returned to the practice to talk to Amelia. Amelia told Zoe she wanted the baby she was carrying, but understood she couldn't make Zoe carry him. She believed that maybe it happened because the baby she was carrying, Zoe and Martin's, was her new chance. Naomi said sometimes, you have to let go of one dream so you can move forward with another one. Zoe said she couldn't let Amelia keep the baby, apologized, and left.

Zoe returned to the practice against Marty's advice and suggested that she could continue to carry Amelia's baby while Amelia carried hers and they could switch them after they were born. ''("[[Yours, Mine & Ours]]")''


Zoe and Amelia began seeing another OB for their pre-natal care. However, when he found something that might be wrong with the baby Zoe was carrying, he said they needed a surgical consult and recommended Addison. Addison did an ultrasound and diagnosed a fetal teratoma that was taking over the baby's blood supply. Addison recommended surgery, but advised Zoe that she'd have to perforate the uterus, which can sometimes cause problems for future pregnancies. Martin had left her because he didn't understand the bond between Zoe and Amelia and the decision they'd made. Zoe said she couldn't do it, so Addison recommended termination. Zoe decided she wanted to wait and left the fetus die in utero naturally, to get Amelia further along in her pregnancy. She didn't want Zoe to think she'd just given up. Addison wanted her to tell Amelia, but Zoe said that she couldn't.

Amelia went to see Naomi, saying she thought something was wrong with the baby and Addison and Zoe were lying to her about it.

They called Zoe in and Naomi told her about what Amelia had said to her. She reminded her about the decision she'd made. Zoe said that she felt like both babies were both of theirs. If she told Amelia what she was going to do, it would be bad for Amelia's already-high blood pressure. She was already at risk for eclampsia and they could lose both babies. Addison again recommended the surgery. Naomi told her she either needed to let Addison operate or let her end the pregnancy because that was the safest choice if she wanted to get pregnant again. Zoe said she'd do it, but they needed to tell Amelia why the surgery couldn't be done because she couldn't do it.

They called Amelia in and told her about the teratoma. Amelia said she understood. She said she was worried at first that Zoe wouldn't try to make it work. When she heard they wanted to terminate, she told Zoe she wanted to be there for her. Her blood pressure was high, so they gave her oxygen, which helped. After seeing what Amelia was going through for the baby she was carrying, Zoe decided to take the risk and have the surgery.

Addison operated. Zoe was fine afterward, but Addison was unable to save the baby. Amelia said it was okay because the baby she was carrying was still okay and they were a family. When Marty showed up and made up with Zoe, Amelia left. Naomi told her she couldn't leave and keep the baby, but Amelia said he was all she had left.

Martin was enraged about Amelia leaving, but Zoe said she believed that Amelia was a good person and would come back. She explained to Martin her view of it, from the time she'd spent with Amelia while Martin was gone. ''("[[Strange Bedfellows]]")''



He is married to [[Zoe Salter]]. He left briefly after she and Amelia decided to continue carrying each other's babies, but returned after Zoe lost the baby she was carrying.

'''Mary Singleton''' is the mother of [[Rebecca Singleton]].


Mary's daughter, Bex, had an enlarged pelvic lymph node that they had to biopsy. Before her biopsy, they ran labs that showed that her hormone levels were unbalanced, indicating the use of birth control pills. George asked her about it and she confessed that she'd been taking them to try to grow breasts.

Addison took her into biopsy, but they discovered that the tumor was compressing what they believed was an ovary. The pathology report revealed that it was actually a testes, meaning Bex is intersex. They talked to Bex's parents and called for a psych consult. The parents were told that physically, Bex would be fine as the tumor was benign, but the doctors encouraged the whole family to get therapy.

Bex's parents came to Addison and said they didn't want to tell Bex and asked Addison to remove the male sex organs when she went in to remove the tumor. Addison declined and said they'd have a hard time finding a doctor who would agree to it.

Before Bex's surgery, unable to lie to her, George forced Bex's parents to tell her about her condition. They were upset and George was taken off the case, but he later went to check on Bex and told her that she didn't have to be a boy, but she could if she wanted to. He then started to cut her hair at her request. Her parents came in and her mother took over the haircut.



She is married to [[Mr. Singleton]]. They have one child.


When Mary and her husband found out their child is intersex, they tried have all of Bex's male sex organs removed without telling her. However, when Addison refused to do it and George refused to lie to Bex, they were pushed into telling Bex, who then asked for a haircut, which George started and Mary finished.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Singleton, Mary}}

'''Mason Warner''' is the son of [[Cooper Freedman]] and [[Erica Warner]]. His mother Erica raised him from the time he was born until she died. He is currently being raised by [[Cooper Freedman]] and [[Charlotte King]] following the death of his mother.



Mason was conceived in the back of Erica's car.


Mason met Cooper when he had his check-up. He was unaware that Cooper was his dad and thought he was just his doctor. They bonded nicely doing different activities together.

Mason decided he didn't want to keep seeing Cooper. When Cooper talked to him later, Mason asked if Cooper was his dad. Mason said they couldn't be friends if he was not going to be around, like the other guys. Erica and Cooper told Mason he was his dad and Cooper said he wasn't going anywhere.\ua


Even though Erica explicitly said she didn't want Mason to meet Charlotte, Charlotte came home early and Mason and Cooper were there. Cooper introduced Charlotte to Mason. They started to bond when they were playing a video game together. Erica walked in and was unhappy to see Mason talking to Charlotte. They both left without Mason saying goodbye to Charlotte. At the end of the day, Erica returned with Mason, and said that he could have a sleepover and Mason bonded with Cooper and Charlotte.


Mason had to see his mother suffer through her brain tumor, yet he has no idea about it and just thought she was tired. One day while he was at Charlotte and Cooper's house, he wanted to see his mom, but he wasn't allowed. Charlotte turned her back for one minute and he ran out the door to see his mom. He was found only a few minutes later sitting outside on a bench.

Erica told him that she was sick when they were in Seattle, where Derek and Amelia would attempt to remove the tumor. He was upset, but forgave her after she came out of surgery safely. However, she was later admitted with severe abdominal pain and she threw up blood. Cooper quickly took Mason away from his mother, who was found to have metastases. She only had one more week to live in severe pain, so she refused to let Mason see her become weak and pathetic. Charlotte understood and explained this to Mason, so they arranged one last visit to say goodbye. They told each other they loved one another and Mason promised he'd be a good boy.

As Charlotte continued to care for Erica, she showed her some pictures of Mason Cooper took. Erica still decidedly refused to let him see her, resulting in a weird situation where Mason would hang out at the hospital with Cooper and Charlotte, knowing his mother was still alive. It was very tough on Mason, so when Charlotte went to deliver a final drawing of Mason's in Erica's final moments, she urged Erica to let Mason see her. Erica consented, so Charlotte quickly ran off to get Mason. They returned just in time for Mason to tell his mother that he loved her, after which she passed away. This final moment was what Mason needed to accept that his mother was truly dying, finally bursting into tears.

During his grief process, Mason began to sleep in Cooper and Charlotte's bed, which he'd wet. He also refrained from talking. Charlotte eventually confronted him about this. He said he started to forget things about his mother, which made him sad. He knew she had asked them to talk about her and keep his life as normal as possible, but his life didn't feel normal to him at all, so he didn't want to talk about it. When Cooper later tried to get him to talk while tucking him in, Mason just turned his back towards him and remained silent.


Mason is hardworking and intelligent. His grades in school matter a lot to him, and sometimes, according to Erica, he pushes himself too hard.\ua He has a good heart and very polite.\ua He is similar to his father.\ua\ua



[[Erica Warner]]
Erica was Mason's mom. He had a very loving relationship with her. After her death, he started to pee his bed and didn't talk to his dad or to [[Charlotte King|Charlotte]].

[[Cooper Freedman]]
Cooper is Mason's dad. When Erica found out about her tumor, she brought Mason to LA to find Cooper. Mason was not very close with Cooper or Charlotte at first, and immediately following Erica's death, he didn't talk to either of them. After a while, he bonded with Charlotte and Cooper, as well as his three little sisters who were born later on.


[[Charlotte King]]
Mason was initially not allowed to see Charlotte, but when she came home early and Mason was there, she was introduced and they bonded together.


*He named his sister, Caroline.
*He calls [[Charlotte King|Charlotte]] Mama.
*To date, he's the only child to be a member of the main cast of [[Private Practice]] or its parent show, [[Grey's Anatomy]] or its other spin-off show, [[Station ]].
*He likes to dip his fries in a strawberry milkshake.
*He's allergic to chocolate.<ref>[[Don't Stop 'Till You Get Enough]], x (PP)</ref>
*He only sleeps on Jersey sheets.
*His mother let him have twenty minutes to be upset about something, then he had to have fun.
*While he has never appeared on Grey's Anatomy, [[Amelia Shepherd|Amelia]] showed [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]] a picture of him in [[Have You Seen Me Lately?]].
*He loves the Disney show Phineas and Ferb.

'''Matt Sinclair''' is a man who was attempting to adopt [[Judy|Judy's]] baby.



Matt and his wife, Carrie, wanted to adopt a baby. They'd met two prior birth mothers, but both adoptions fell through. They were then matched with [[Judy]] and the doctors allowed them to talk and get to know each other. They also sat down with an adoption attorney and agreed to pay Judy's living expenses until the baby was born. ''("[[Know When to Fold]]")''


Judy came back to the practice to delivery. During delivery, the baby got stuck by his shoulder. Addison pushed the baby back up and they took her to the the hospital for a c-section. She delivered the baby and noted that the baby had a diaphragmatic hernia. They asked her what she wanted to do, but she insisted that the Sinclairs make the decision because he was their baby. Addison explained the condition to the Sinclairs and gave them two options. They decided they couldn't make the decision and left. Violet came in to counsel Judy on the decision, who was worried she couldn't make the choice and then let go of him. The surgery was successful and afterward, Judy worried about him being all alone. Dell then took her to see him. The Sinclairs returned, saying that they wanted him still, but Judy said no, because they left when things were hard. She looked at the baby and said she was going to keep him.

The Sinclairs stopped by the practice to bring the things they'd bought for the baby, wanting him to have them even though they didn't have him. They explained that every time Carrie had a miscarriage or an adoption fell through, they felt like they'd lost a baby and didn't want to lose him. Naomi told Judy about the stuff they'd brought and said that she'd know what the right decision to make was. She ultimately decided to give the baby to the Sinclairs. ''("[[Nothing to Fear]]")''



He is married to [[Carrie Sinclair]].


He and his wife adopted a baby boy born to [[Judy]].


He is a lawyer.

}}
'''Matt Weston''' is the brother of Kip Weston, whose cord blood was given to [[Kerri Gilbert]].


Matt's parents, Robert and Ellen, banked their kids' cord blood when they were born. Kip died in a car accident when he was six, but they kept his blood in case Matt ever needed it. When [[Kerri Gilbert]] needed a cord blood transfusion, Cooper found that Kip was a match and approached the Westons about using Kip's blood. They wanted to continue to keep the blood for Matt, but Cooper said that since he was a teenager, it was unlikely he'd need it. He said they had the chance to spare another family the pain they'd gone through of losing a child.

When Robert found out that Cooper had forged his signature and used the blood anyway, Robert threatened to sue the hospital and told Cooper he'd stolen the only thing they had left of Kip.

In order to avoid a lawsuit, Charlotte called the Westons in and talked to them about the new protocols they'd put in place to avoid a similar situation happened in the future. She walked them out just as [[Greg Gilbert]] was nearby. When he figured out who they were, he thanked them and hugged them. He offered to give them the chance to meet her, which they took.



His brother, Kip, died in a car accident at age six.


He has friends named Gary and Lee. He plays basketball with them.

|portrayed by = [[Eric K. George]]
}}
'''Matthew Cole''' is the husband of [[Shira Cole]].


When Matthew's wife, Shira, was  weeks pregnant, she started having contractions, so she saw Pete to try to stop the contractions. Before he could start acupuncture, her contractions intensified and Naomi said it could be active labor. Shira's water broke and blood was present.

They called Addison because of the bleeding and she determined that Shira had had a placental abruption. Shira begged her not to let the baby be born, but Addison was forced to deliver him in the ambulance because they couldn't stop her contractions. Shira was rushed into surgery to stop her bleeding while her baby, Langston, was taken to the NICU.

Langston struggled greatly in the NICU. He weighed less than two pounds and a cerebral hemorrhage, as well as necrotizing enterocolitis. Addison offered them surgery, but made it clear that he'd have a whole series of surgeries and would be suffered between them. They decided they wanted the surgery. Addison agreed after some reluctance.

In surgery, Addison found no clear margins and said there was no part of the bowel she could save. She was forced to close without doing anything. When she told Shira and Matthew, they asked for odds. She said there was a less than % chance he'd leave the NICU. Addison said she could put in a central line to feed him, but she refused to do another surgery.

Matthew asked Pete about Dr. Graham at County. Pete said Graham was good, but he supported Addison's decision. When Shira talked about never having touched him, Naomi said there was a way she could hold him. Shira agreed to let him go, but Matthew needed more convincing that it was the right thing to do.

Langston was disconnected from his machines and his mother held him and sang to him as he died.



He is married to [[Shira Cole]].


He and his wife are both English teachers.

'''"Maxine"''' is the baby [[Vivian Carlsmith]] was forced to give up for adoption.


When Vivian was , she gave birth to a baby she was forced by her mother to give up. When Vivian was dying of gastric cancer, she asked Addison to find the baby she'd given up and give her a letter, talking about how she had thought about her every second for the rest of her life.

Addison found her and sat with her as she read the letter.



After she was adopted, she had a full life with a big Catholic family.


*As Vivian didn't raise her and therefore didn't name her, it's unlikely Maxine is really her name.

'''May''' is a patient who found out she was allergic to her boyfriend's sperm.


May was at the practice with pain. Her boyfriend, [[Henry (Fear of Flying)|Henry]], had just flown in from another country and they consummated their relationship. She had severe pain in her genitals, so Naomi did an exam.

May had signs of an allergic reaction, but she couldn't pin down the cause, so she called in Pete for help. Pete determined that she was allergic to Henry's sperm and the next reaction would likely be worse. Naomi said they could still have a baby, washing his sperm before inseminating. They were also told they'd need to use condoms until Pete could figure out a treatment. He consulted with [[Charlotte King]] for information on semen allergies.

May later showed up in the ambulance with difficulty breathing. Pete gave her a breathing treatment to ease her breathing. Henry said they'd used a condom, but it either broke or leaked because there was seminal fluid present. Henry said he couldn't keep doing that because he didn't want to hurt or kill her. Pete asked them to be patient while he looked for a way.

May later came to Pete and said Henry had broken up with her, so he didn't have to waste his time looking for a solution.

Pete had Henry and May both come in and suggested exposure therapy. He couldn't guarantee it would work and it would take months, but it could help them.



She met her boyfriend, Henry, online. She believed he was her one.

'''Maya Bennett''' is the daughter of [[Sam Bennett|Sam]] and [[Naomi Bennett]], and the mother of [[Olivia Davis]].



Although her parents divorced, the divorce didn't upset Maya much and Naomi thought that she probably enjoyed having extra everything for when she was living at Naomi's and living at Sam's.


When Addison visited LA to look into having a baby and get away from [[Seattle]], Maya was happy to see her. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''


Maya decided at one point that she wanted to stay at her dad's place for a whole week. Her mother was worried about it, but allowed it after reminding Sam to check her homework. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]]")''


Maya came to Addison with her friend [[Ruby]] and said she worried about having gonorrhea. Addison did an exam and ran some tests and they were negative. However, Maya later called Addison to her house because Ruby had collapsed. She had a late-stage ectopic pregnancy and had to be rushed into surgery. Once she was taken away, Maya called her mother. Naomi was shocked to hear that Ruby was having sex and wasn't consoled by Maya telling her she wasn't having sex. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds a Showerhead]]")''


One morning, Maya found her parents in bed together and asked if that meant they were getting back together. After dodging her questions, Naomi eventually told her that they weren't getting back together. ''("[[Let It Go]]")''


Maya was at the practice late with Sam, who had forgotten his wallet. He told her to wait for a minute. During that time, [[Hal Jarvis]], a pedophile who was seeing Violet after hours, sat down to talk to her. When the other adults saw, Violet pushed Hal out the door and they asked Maya what he had said to her. She said he hadn't done or said anything. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")''


When her father started dating [[Sonya Nichols]], Maya met her and liked her. She even said that Naomi would like her if she got to know her. ''("[[Homeward Bound]]")''


Naomi caught Maya wearing makeup and less modest clothes to go to school and sent her back upstairs to change. That day, she came home, shocked to find that Maya had her boyfriend, [[Fillmore Davis|Dink]], over. Sam took her to live at his house and started picking Maya up from school and said that he'd start treating her like she knew right from wrong so long as she told him where she was going and with whom. When he came home to find her throwing a party, he sent everyone home. He then dropped Maya back off at Naomi's and told her to go apologize to her mother and mean it. ''("[[The Parent Trap]]")''


After ignoring her mother for weeks, Naomi talked to Maya, saying that she should talk to someone about what was going on, even if she couldn't talk to her own mother. Maya then went to Addison and confessed that she was pregnant. ''("[[Another Second Chance]]")''

When Maya was unable to tell them, Addison told Sam and Naomi that Maya was pregnant. Sam wondered how it could have happened while Naomi just left the room, unable to deal with it. Naomi later returned and dragged Maya into Addison's office to ask for an abortion. When Maya said she didn't want one, Naomi slapped her. Addison said that she couldn't force Maya to have an abortion. After seeing [[Lynn McDonald]] in labor, Maya agreed to have an abortion. However, when Addison took Maya in for the procedure, she said she didn't understand. Addison said she could ask whatever she wanted. Maya said she didn't understand why Naomi would do this when she believes abortion is murder. Maya then decided she didn't want the abortion. When she told Naomi about it, Naomi dragged her to see Lynn give birth and asked if she wanted that. Lynn's baby was then born and Maya was awed by seeing that. ''("[[Best Laid Plans]]")''

Maya had her first ultrasound with Dink there. They both thought it was pretty cool. ''("[[Shotgun]]")''


Shortly before her wedding, Maya went to her mother and asked her personally to come to the wedding, saying she needed her. Naomi refused, saying her wedding was a public reminder of how Naomi had failed her. Sam came to the wedding and said that while he was a little worried, he loved her and supported her. Naomi then showed up, giving her her old, new, borrowed, and blue items. ''("[['Til Death Do Us Part]]")''


Maya came into the practice three weeks before her due date for an ultrasound. Later that day, Maya went into labor and when Dell arrived, she told him she wanted to go to the hospital. He put her in his car and started to drive her there, but on the way, they were in a head-on collision with a drunk driver. They had to be airlifted to the hospital. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")''

In the ER, Maya was examined. She said that her contractions had been bad, but she wasn't able to feel them anymore, alerting them that she had some spinal damage. They took her into surgery to deliver the baby, but as soon as Addison moved her uterus, she started to bleed out because her uterus was holding pressure on a bleeder. They packed the wound and waited for Amelia to arrive to check out her spinal damage. Amelia looked at Maya's scans and saw a fracture at L- and a bone fragment at L-. The baby had stabilized the area, but trying to deliver had de-stabilized it. Amelia said that if they delivered the baby, she'd be paralyzed. If she repaired the spine, the baby could die. Gabriel suggested hypothermia to give them more time to fix the damage, possibly buying them enough time to save both of them. They cooled her down and Amelia started working on her spine. The procedure was successful and despite having to be resuscitated after birth, Maya and the baby were both stable afterward. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''


When Maya was preparing to go to college, the dean of admissions at Columbia called her to say she was perfect Columbia material. ''("[[Two Steps Back]]")''


She got into Columbia and decided she wanted to go there. When Naomi and Gabriel got engaged, they decided to move to New York so that Naomi would help Maya with Olivia while she was going to school. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")''



Maya once had Addison test her for STDs, which came back negative, but Maya was trying to cover for a friend of hers. Instead, Maya's friend was suffering from an ectopic pregnancy in which the fallopian tube ruptured and Addison had to take her into surgery. Maya admitted this and tells Naomi that she is still a virgin, to Naomi's relief. ''("[[In Which Addison Finds a Showerhead]]")''

[[Fillmore Davis]]
Maya turned to Addison once again, revealing she was pregnant. The baby belongs to her boyfriend "Dink". ''("[[Another Second Chance]]")''

Much to Naomi's chagrin, Maya and Dink decided to keep the baby and get married. Naomi shunned her daughter, leaving Sam to care for her. Maya and Dink decided they wanted to get married, and went to Sam for help. Sam and Dink's mother started talking, and finally gave their consent. However, Naomi was infuriated. She stated that she would take no part in planning their underage child's wedding. ''("[[Shotgun]]")''

The wedding was quickly planned and the two of them married. ''("[['Til Death Do Us Part]]")''


[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]
Maya and Addison have a close bond. Maya went to Addison when she found out she was pregnant. She did that because she trusted Addison with her secret.


*Maya was played by [[Shavon Kirksey]] in the backdoor pilot of Private Practice but was later replaced by [[Geffri Maya]].
*She plays violin.<ref>[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]], x (PP)</ref>
*Her first tooth got lost in the yard and her family spent four hours looking for it.<ref>[[Best Laid Plans]], x (PP)</ref>
*She loves rainbow sprinkles.<ref>[[The Parent Trap]], x (PP)</ref>
*She used to do gymnastics.<ref>[[Shotgun]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Meg Porter''' is an [[Internal Medicine|internal medicine]] doctor and old flame of [[Pete Wilder]].



Meg came into the practice one day and chimed in on the case of [[Sharbat Qalzai]] before kissing Pete. She said that she was there for a developing nations conference, though she expressed concern for Pete, who seemed unhappy to her. She said she had plans to go to Ghana to organize a malaria program and invited him to go along. He hesitated and she noted that that wasn't the Pete she knew, though the Pete she knew would also have thrown her on the desk as soon as she walked in. He then moved a lamp off the table and they had sex. After they finished, he saw a bite on her back that concerned him. She brushed it off, but it later turned out to be a remnant of a tick, which Sam removed. At the end of the day, Meg asked Pete again to come to Ghana. He instead invited her to stay in Los Angeles. ''("[[Past Tense]]")''


Meg packed to leave for Ghana. She said it wasn't anything to do with Pete. It was just who she was. Pete shared with her how [[Anna Wilder|his wife]] didn't quit smoking before she died. Pete encouraged Meg to go to Ghana, but told her to come back because he was happier when she was there. ''("[[Let It Go]]")''


After her trip, Meg came back to Los Angeles. She revealed that she was wearing a nicotine patch to try to quit smoking. Pete suggested more natural approaches. He attempted acupuncture on her. However, he later came home to find her smoking. He confronted her about why she was there, saying he knew she hated it there. She said she liked being around him. He said that was too much pressure on him. She later told him she wanted to be with him and admitted that she thought he'd fill a hole for her. ''("[[Tempting Faith]]")''


Meg took up running due to boredom. Pete suggested that she find a job to give her something else to do during the day. That day, Meg came into the practice to talk to Naomi. She'd offered her services to the Venice Family Clinic and they had many patients, but not enough exam rooms, so Naomi offered to let them use their space as part of their community outreach. However, she came under fire when the first patient she saw at the practice was there for an abortion. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''


Meg returned after time away and noticed that Pete was acting differently. He initially denied it, but she later caught him kissing Violet. She left him. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")''



[[Pete Wilder]]
She and Pete met when they were both residents and later worked together as Doctors Without Borders. Once during the war in Bosnia, Pete refused to evacuate and, despite the mortar fire, stayed with sick children for the whole night, saving the lives of most of them. ''("[[Past Tense]]")''

As Meg packed to go to Ghana, Pete told her to go, but to come back because he was happier when she was there. ''("[[Let It Go]]")''

When Meg returned from Ghana, she said that Pete was different from when they knew each other before. He said that he hated his wife until she was gone and that changed her and it was hard for him to trust women. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''

She later returned to Los Angeles, but she left after she caught Pete and Violet kissing. ''("[[Worlds Apart]]")''


Dr. Meg Porter is a Doctor Without Borders physician and [[Attending|attending]] [[Internal Medicine|internist]].

While in LA, she began to work at the [[Oceanside Wellness Group]] for the Venice Family Clinic, but she was not on staff at Oceanside and borrowed the facilities of the practice, as the Venice Family Clinic had an overflow of patients and not enough exam rooms. Meg negotiated with [[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]] about using Oceanside's exam rooms ''pro bono'', using Oceanside to attract a new patient base, with Venice managing their patient loads. Controversially, one of her first procedures was an abortion. ''("[[Crime and Punishment]]")''


*She smokes.<ref>[[Past Tense]], x (PP)</ref>
*Meg was in the same [[Resident|resident class]] as [[Pete Wilder|Dr. Pete Wilder]].<ref>[[Past Tense]], x (PP)</ref>
*She lives in Nigeria.<ref>[[Past Tense]], x (PP)</ref>
*Meg referred to Pete Wilder as Peter.<ref>[[Past Tense]], x (PP)</ref>
*She doesn't like to run.<ref>[[Crime and Punishment]], x (PP)</ref>
*She's pro-choice.<ref>[[Crime and Punishment]], x (PP)</ref>

The next day, Megan was coughing, so Robin picked her up and her water broke. Dell, who had come to examine her, brought Cooper to look at Megan. Cooper then got Megan set up upstairs so they could deliver the baby downstairs.

'''Megan Stewart''' is a former patient of Dr. Jake Reilly. He helped her achieve pregnancy five times.


Megan was a patient of Dr. Reilly who desperately wanted to become pregnant, so he helped her through the IVF process several times. She miscarried four times. The fourth miscarriage required a D&C. While waiting for the D&C, she saw [[Pam Reiter]] give birth and cried. After her D&C, Jake told Megan that he thought it was time for them to talk about other options for her. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")''

Megan begged Jake to try once more. He agreed and Megan became pregnant for the fifth time. Jake advised her to take it easy. Megan came into the ER with mild cramping. Jake assured her it was normal and it was just fear. She said it was hard to relax because she felt like she was waiting to lose the pregnancy. He wanted to discharge her, but she said she felt safer at the hospital and asked him to stay for a while with her.

One night, she called him to her house. She was cramping and believed she was miscarrying, though he said her symptoms were probably due to the progesterone shot he'd given her the day before. After she calmed down, he said she couldn't keep panicking like that. He said he'd been by her side the whole way and she kissed him. He pulled back quickly and left. The next morning, she came into the practice to clear the air, but he gave her a list of other doctors and told her she needed to choose someone else to see her through her pregnancy, as his level of care for her as his patient was being misinterpreted.

As she left, she angrily told Addison that Jake had made a pass at her. Addison didn't believe her and said that she couldn't lie about the one man who had tried to help her. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''



She was married to Danny Stewart. They wanted a baby, so they moved to Los Angeles to see Jake because other fertility specialists had told them it was a long shot. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")''

Addison implied that their relationship wasn't good and wondered if Danny even wanted a baby. ''("[[The World According to Jake]]")''


*She previously miscarried four times.<ref>[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Melanie White''' was a potential birth mom for Addison when she was trying to adopt.


After [[Mildred Clemons]] approved Addison's application to adopt, Melanie chose to meet with her as a potential birth mom. She was a semester away from graduation and planning to go to law school afterward and she was pregnant. During their meeting, she asked Addison if Addison believed she was a bad person for giving up the baby when she had the means to support her. Addison shared with her the story of having an abortion after she became a doctor and assured Melanie she didn't think she was awful. Melanie said she was amazing for sharing her abortion story so candidly.

Melanie said that the other family she was considering was a couple from her church. They had a son already and they were nice, but a little boring.

Melanie later went into labor. Her mother was out of town and so she had them page Addison to be with her during the delivery. When the baby presented face up, the OB attempted to use vacuum assistance. When that failed, Addison stepped in an used rotational forceps to complete the delivery.

Addison came to visit Melanie after she gave birth. Melanie gave her the baby to hold, but then said that despite believing Addison was the perfect fit, she was choosing the couple from her church. Addison is amazing, but she has a busy life while the baby could just slide right into the family from her church without being an interruption.



Her mother asked her to talk to a family from her church about adopting the baby. She ultimately ended up choosing them.


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.

'''Melinda Stinson''' is the mother of [[Emily Stinson]], who was switched at two days old with [[Sarah O'Brien]].


Melinda and Duncan were called into the practice when it was discovered that their baby had been switched with [[Beth O'Brien|Beth]] and [[Greg O'Brien|Greg O'Brien's]] baby when they were infants. Duncan in particular was upset when they learned that their daughter had an incurable genetic disorder, because they'd spent thousands of dollars on fertility treatments to get pregnant.

After looking through staff schedules and visitor logs, the doctors determined that Duncan had been the one to switch the girls after Emily had a seizure when she was two days old and he was arrested. Melinda was upset at him for having given away her baby. She'd had a c-section with complications, meaning she was unaware of anything being wrong with the baby after she was born. Melinda struggled with having to give up the O'Briens' baby, whom she'd been raising as Sarah, saying that she could just leave and take Sarah with her. Violet reminded her that she couldn't do that because Emily is her baby and a mother never leaves her baby behind. Under Violet's observation, Melinda handed Sarah over to the O'Briens and took Emily into her arms. She and Beth talked to each other for a moment, sharing tips, things they'd learned about the babies they'd been raising.



She is married to [[Duncan Stinson]]. However, after learning that he'd switched their baby with another one in the nursery, she said he wasn't her husband anymore, indicating that she'd be pursuing divorce.


She and Duncan wanted a baby, but were unable to conceive on their own, so they enlisted the help of [[Naomi Bennett]], who helped them conceive. When their baby was two days old, she had a seizure, so Duncan switched the two girls. Melinda unknowingly raised the O'Briens' baby for nine months until the switch was discovered and the girls were switched back.


*She sang Madonna songs to Sarah because they're the only ones she knows all the words to.

'''Melissa''' is the wife of [[Brendon]].


Melissa came into the practice when her husband was there being treated for priapism. She revealed to Violet that she was pregnant and that it wasn't Brendon's. They'd made a virginity pact, but her sister pressured her to get it done so that it would be good with Brendon. The result was a pregnancy. She thought that if the wedding day were close enough, she wouldn't have to say anything, but Violet said she didn't want a marriage built on lies.

She confessed the pregnancy during Brendon's shunt placement. He was angry and refused to speak to her, but after Charlotte talked to him, he decided he loved her and didn't want to leave her.



She is married to [[Brendon]]. They made a virginity pledge while they were dating. However, Melissa broke that and had sex with someone else, which resulted in a pregnancy. Despite this, he decided to stay with her.


Before her wedding, her sister Jenny pressured her to get losing her virginity over with so it would be good when she was with Brendon.

'''Melissa''' is a drug addict who left her newborn alone with her adult daughter.


Melissa's daughter, Denise, brought in Eli, whom she said was her son. He had been crying for  hours and wasn't able to eat or sleep. Pete and Cooper examined him and said he was small for ten days and he was malnourished and dehydrated. They questioned why she was bottle feeding instead of breastfeeding, if there was trouble latching or what. Cooper then noticed she didn't look like she'd given birth ten days prior. They figured out Eli wasn't her son.

Denise explained that Eli was her brother. Her mother's a drug addict who gave birth and then left him two days later to score. Her mom had been doing it to her since she was eight. She was in foster care for a while and went back and forth. She wanted better for Eli, so she was taking care of him.

Eli had neonatal abstinence syndrome because of his mother's drug use and a cystic adenomatoid malformation. It needed to be removed, but operating with him being so small was risky. Pete brought in Melissa, whom he had found. She said she'd left to score drugs, but she changed her mind and got clean instead by locking herself in a motel room for eight days. She said she'd called during those eight days, but Denise didn't answer or call or her back.

Melissa went in to see Eli and Denise yelled at her, saying she wouldn't let her hurt Eli. Eli started crashing and they had to rush him into surgery.

After his surgery, Melissa said she was trying to do the wrong thing and really wanted to have the chance to be a mother to Eli.

Because of the complicated situation, they called social services, who sent [[Gladys]]. Gladys spoke to Melissa and Denise and said that if the doctors believed Melissa having Eli was to his detriment, they could explore other options.

Cooper spoke to Denise, telling her that Melissa would need a lot of help taking care of Eli and said that even if it didn't seem like it, they were a family and they needed to look out for one another.

Denise came to see Eli in the NICU and talked to Melissa. Melissa told Denise she was sorry and Denise told her to do better with Eli.



She had two children. Her daughter, Denise, has a rough relationship with her because she used drugs for Denise's entire childhood, leading to an unstable life for her. When Eli was born, Melissa decided to get clean and Denise agreed to work on their relationship.

'''Melody''' is a child who felt he was born in the wrong body.


Melody came into the practice with his parents. He\ud been miserable all week. First, he said his throat hurt, then he stopped eating, then he said his ears hurt. Cooper took him in for an exam. His mother, [[Pam (True Colors)|Pam]], tried to join him, but Melody said he didn't need his mom to come. Cooper said they'd come get his mother if they needed her.

Cooper did the exam and said it kind of seemed like Melody just wanted to skip school. Melody confessed that he was a\uaboy and his parents wouldn't believe him . He said he'd felt like that forever.

Cooper asked Violet to talk to Melody and those feelings.

Violet talked to Michael and Pam about it and they brushed it off as Melody playing pretend. She asked for their permission to talk to Melody about the situation and assess what was happening. Michael was receptive to the idea, but Pam immediately shut it down and told Violet and Cooper to leave.

During the school day, Melody took the bus to the practice and Violet and Cooper went in to talk to him. He said his parents had argued the night before. Michael wanted to know more about the medicine that could help him, but his mother refused to hear anything about it. Melody said that in his dreams, he was always a boy. When he wakes up, for a second, he\us still a boy and then his mother comes in and lays out his clothes. He refuses to wear the clothes, they fight, and he loses TV. He hates wearing girl clothes and acting like a girl because it feels like he\us pretending all the time and no one will let him stop.

Mason came in with Charlotte and told Melody that his mom died. Melody said he was a boy and no one believed him. Mason invited Melody to play. They played with a paper football on a tabletop.

Michael and Pam arrived at the practice and Violet said that they couldn't berate Melody into changing his mind. The most they could do would be to support him. Melody refused to go with his parents, but Pam tried to drag him out. Cooper stopped her and said they needed to try to understand Melody. Pam started to cry and say that Melody was her little girl. Melody hugged her as Violet explained that they could help them all adjust as Melody became the person he was meant to be.



Melody's mother refused to believed that Melody was actually a boy, while his father was slightly more supportive and willing to hear about options for them.


Mason invited Melody to play for a while at the practice.


*Melody was ten years old at the time of his confession.
*Melody had been seeing Cooper since the age of two.

'''Michael''' came in with his mother to see [[Cooper Freedman|Cooper]].


Michael was brought by his mother to see Cooper, who believed that he had mono. The test came back negative, but once his mom was out of the room, Michael admitted that he knew he didn't have mono. He was just in love. He then talked to Cooper about a person that he liked and whether or not he should confront this person. Cooper also admitted that he likes someone and was afraid to tell her. Cooper and Michael made a deal that they would both tell their crushes how they feel.

Michael later came into the practice injured and Cooper asked what had happened. Michael said that the person he asked out did this to him, the boy he asked out, his best friend [[Brian (In Which Addison Has a Very Casual Get Together)|Brian]].

Michael went missing and his parents came to ask Cooper if he'd seen him. Cooper searched for him. After asking Brian where he might be, Cooper found Michael on the roof of a building. Michael then stepped down and the two began to talk.



Michael had a crush on his friend, [[Brian (In Which Addison Has a Very Casual Get Together)|Brian]]. When Brian found out about this crush, he punched Michael because he did not reciprocate the feelings.


When he disappeared, Michael's parents were worried about him.


*He was  at the time he came to see [[Cooper Freedman]].

'''Michael Perkins''' is an unvaccinated child who contracted measles on an airplane.


Michael came into the practice with his mother, Arlene, and two brothers. His mother believed he'd picked up a cold on the airplane, but when Cooper examined him, he determined that Michael actually had the measles. Michael went home with his mother, but she brought him to the hospital when his fever spiked and she couldn't get it down. Michael's condition continued to worsen and he had to be intubated when he stopped breathing. He later coded and was unable to be resuscitated.



His best friend in Switzerland has sheep and cows at his house.


*He had just learned to tie his shoes when he died.
*He was pronounced dead\uaat : PM.
