}}'''Olivia Davis''' is the child of [[Maya Bennett]] and [[Fillmore Davis]] and the grandchild of [[Sam Bennett]] and [[Naomi Bennett]].



When Maya was three weeks before her due date, she went into labor. She then decided that she wanted to go to the hospital instead of having the baby at the practice like she originally planned. On the way to the hospital, she was in a car accident. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")''

When they learned that Maya had a spinal fracture that threatened her ability to walk, they decided to operate and deliver the baby. However, before that could happen, they discovered that the baby was keeping Maya's spinal fracture stable, so they couldn't move the baby without risking paralysis. Gabriel then suggested hypothermia, which would give them more time to repair Maya's spine and hopefully save the baby as well. During Maya's surgery, Addison delivered the baby. She had to be resuscitated because she wasn't breathing, but she quickly stabilized. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''


As a newborn, Olivia lived with Naomi and Maya at Naomi's house, primarily cared for by Naomi as Maya was recovering and Dink was scared of Naomi, who didn't believe he was prepared to take care of Olivia. Dink, encouraged by Sam, stood up to Naomi and insisted that he was ready and would be taking care of Olivia and Maya. ''("[[Take Two]]")''


When Maya got into Columbia, Olivia moved to New York with her family. ''("[[...To Change the Things I Can]]")''


*According to Naomi, she and Betsey adore each other. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''

'''Ollie Graham''' is a child whose parents believed he needed medicine for ADHD.


Ollie came into the practice with his parents. Cooper examined him and said there were no physical causes. His parents believed he had ADHD like his older brother. They said he was having fits. Cooper recommended that they talk to Sheldon about his situation. Sheldon was concerned that the parents were prompting answers from Ollie. When he mentioned diagnostic evaluations, they were upset because they hadn't had to go through that with their older son. They decided to take Ollie to another doctor.

Cooper later witnessed Ollie raging and hitting his father in the mouth. Cooper talked to his parents about the episode and alternate possible causes. Ollie mentioned to Cooper that the medicine made him not hungry anymore. Cooper discovered that his parents had been giving him the amphetamines on their own, leftover from their older son. His mother confessed that they wanted him diagnosed with ADHD so he'd get extra time on his tests. They had invested a lot in his education and didn't want that to be wasted.

Cooper later went to his house and said what they were doing was child abuse, both giving him the pills and the pressure they're putting on him. He said they needed to stop giving him the pills and he'd have Ollie in for monthly blood tests. If he found out they were giving them to him again, he said he'd call the police on them.



His older brother, Brian, goes to Stanford. His parents put pressure on him to perform as well as his brother did.


*He's very knowledgeable about Ferraris.
*He went to a $,/year preschool.
*He's on the honor roll at his school.
*He was eight years old and in third grade when his parents tried to get him diagnosed with ADHD.

'''Oscar Schmitt''' is a man who was diagnosed with prostate cancer after a pain in his pelvis.


After Charlotte and Cooper gave a presentation on safer sex as a retirement home, Oscar came to Cooper, saying he was embarrassed to talk about it, but he'd been with his girlfriend, [[Nora (Eyes Wide Open)|Nora]] for several months. Their sex life had been good, but he had a pain in his pelvis, which made it hard for him to get in the mood. Cooper recommended that he make an appointment with Charlotte to get a full exam.

Charlotte did an exam and diagnosed prostate cancer. She recommended radiation therapy, but when he found out he had a % chance of impotence after surgery, he decided against it.

Charlotte sent Cooper to talk to Oscar and got Oscar to agree to have treatment, telling him that even if they couldn't have sex, Nora still loved him.

He and Nora then came into the practice to talk about options for after radiation.



Wife
He was married until his wife died.

[[Nora (Eyes Wide Open)|Nora]]
He met a woman named Nora at his retirement home and they started dating.


He says his kids have their own lives.


*He was  at the time of his diagnosis.

'''Paige''' is a girl who got hepatitis from a bite from her boyfriend.


Paige had had a fever for a few days, so her mom brought her to see Cooper. He noticed she looked yellowish, so he examined her glands, but found a bite mark on her neck. She claimed not to know anything about it, but she had signs of hepatitis B, which meant they needed to figure out who bit her so that they could stop the spread.

They asked Paige and after her mom left the room, Paige said that he was her soul mate and they were bound together for eternity. She was worried about her mom not letting her see him anymore, so she made them promise not to tell her mom or she wouldn't tell them who the boy was.

[[Seth (Love Bites)|Seth]] came in to get blood work to test for Hepatitis B. He claimed he hadn't bitten any other girls. When Cooper put pressure on him, he left, still refusing to give him the names of the other girls.

They then went to Paige, but she refused to believe Seth was biting other girls. Charlotte went to Paige and talked to her and convinced her to tell Charlotte the names of the other girls.



She was dating [[Seth (Love Bites)|Seth]]. He bit her as a romantic, sexual gesture.


Her mother was shocked to learn she'd let a boy bite her.


She has friends named Ashley and Amber.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.
*She had recently started at a new school.

'''Paige Merring''' is the mother of four girls who repeatedly turned blue.


Paige brought her daughter, Erin, to the practice when her skin turned cornflower blue. After looking for possible causes, Cooper found out that Erin had recently had her first ever cavity filled at the dentist and believed the dental drugs had reacted with the hemoglobin in her blood, which had turned her blue. He gave her methylene blue to make her pink again and sent her home. However, she came back and was blue again, along with her three sisters.

After giving them all methylene blue, Cooper went to their house to look for environment poisons, but found nothing. While he was there, Erin had a seizure and had to rushed to the hospital. Desperate to find an answer, Cooper went back to the house and pretended to be a princess with Becky, Kim, and Sasha, and they led him to their castle, which was a shed that had bags of fertilizer with ammonium nitrate in it, which was poisoning them.



She is married. Her husband travels a lot for work, so she quit her job to stay home with their kids.


She has four daughters. According to her, they don't talk to her or anyone else over the age of eight.

'''Pam''' is the mother of [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]].


Pam, [[Terri (The Hardest Part)|Terri]], and [[Ricky]] were in talk therapy with Sheldon and Violet because their three daughters, [[Casey]], [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]], and [[Jamie]] had made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.

The three daughters also came in to have talk therapy together, to try to explain why they'd done it. Casey said she didn't think she should worry about good grades or college when all she wanted was to be a mom, Jamie said it was instant status, and Lisa said babies love you no matter what. There's a lot going on at her house, so her mother can't give them all attention all the time.

Ricky came in late to their joint session. She'd told Jamie she needed to pick up her brother, but she came back with Violet's book, saying Violet wasn't the right therapist for their daughters. She took Jamie and left.

Sheldon and Violet took Casey and Lisa to tour the hospital. Casey and Lisa by that point had read Violet's book and made several comments about it. Violet started to fight back, but Casey started having serious abdominal pain and bleeding. She was rushed in for an emergency c-section. Lisa watched as Casey's baby was delivered and said it wasn't what she expected and left.

Lisa went to see Violet and said she'd read her whole book. She said seeing Casey's baby being born made her feel like she'd screwed up. She said it wasn't fair to her mother to put another child on her as she already had three. She needed her mom and didn't want to be more of a burden. Lisa said she wasn't sure if she wanted to keep the baby, but she needed help talking to her mom about it. Violet suggested they talk to her together.



She is a single mother with three kids. Her daughter, Lisa, didn't want to be any more of a burden to her mother by adding a child of her own onto her responsibilities.

}}

'''Pam''' is the mother of [[Melody]].


Pam came into the practice with her child, Melody. Melody had been miserable all week. First, she said her throat hurt, then she stopped eating, then she said her ears hurt. Cooper took her in for an exam. Pam tried to join her, but Melody said she didn't need her mom to come. Cooper said they'd come get her if they needed her.

Cooper did the exam and said it kind of seemed like Melody just wanted to skip school. Melody confessed that she was boy and her parents wouldn't believed her. She said she'd felt like that forever.

Cooper asked Violet to talk to Melody and those feelings.

Violet talked to Michael and Pam about it and they brushed it off as Melody playing pretend. She asked for their permission to talk to Melody about the situation and assess what was happening. Michael was receptive to the idea, but Pam immediately shut it down and told Violet and Cooper to leave.

During the school day, Melody took the bus to the practice and Violet and Cooper went in to talk to her. She said her parents had argued the night before. Michael wanted to know more about the medicine that could help her, but her mother refused to hear anything about it. Melody said that in her dreams, she was always a boy. When she wakes up, for a second she's still a boy and then her mother comes in and lays out her clothes. She refuses to wear the clothes, they fight, and she loses TV. She hates wearing girl clothes and acting like a girl because it feels like she's pretending all the time and no one will let her stop.

Mason came in with Charlotte and told Melody his mom died. Melody said she was a boy and no one believed her. Mason invited Melody to play. They played with a paper football on a tabletop.

Michael and Pam arrived at the practice and Violet said that they couldn't berate Melody into changing her mind. The most they could do would be to support her. Melody refused to go with her parents, but Pam tried to drag her out. Cooper stopped her and said they needed to try to understand Melody. Pam started to cry and say that Melody was her little girl. Melody hugged her as Violet explained that they could help them all adjust as Melody became the person she was meant to be.



She is married to [[Michael (True Colors)|Michael]].


When her daughter, Melody, said she was really a boy, she refused to believe it, insisting that Melody was a girl and forcing Melody to wear pink clothes and skirts.

'''Pam Reiter''' is pregnant woman who came into the ER during a rain storm.


Pam pulled into the ER and called for help. Her husband, Todd, couldn't move his legs, which is why she drove them to the hospital even though she was in labor. They both said it was in Todd's head, because he'd had symptoms like that during her previous pregnancies.

In the ER, Todd was put in a collar and Pam was determined to be only at four centimeters, meaning they had time before she'd give birth. Todd's legs stopped tingling and he was able to move them again. Despite him having experienced sympathetic symptoms with his wife's three prior pregnancies, James wanted a neuro consult for Todd. Amelia looked at his chart and said she'd see him in her office later that week. Despite that, James ordered a CT.

Pam continued to labor down in the ER while they waited for a bed in labor and delivery to become available.

Pam had late decels and needed a c-section. Because the ORs were all full, they prepared to do a c-section in the ER. As they prepared, doctors came in to take Todd, who needed surgery for a spinal infection, which had caused his transient weakness. During the c-section, a uterine artery was lacerated, but Jake was able to stop the bleeding as Addison tended to the baby. Addison then introduced Pam to her daughter.

After Todd's surgery, Addison took the baby to see him. He couldn't hold her because of his surgery, but he was able to give her a kiss.



She is married to [[Todd Reiter]]. At the time of her fourth pregnancy, they'd been married for  years.


Todd and Pam have four kids. With Pam's first pregnancy, Todd got rashes. The second brought abdominal cramps. The third one had fainting spells. During the fourth, he had transient weakness and paralysis in his legs, though that was found to be due to an infection.

'''Pam Tanner''' is the mother of [[Justin Tanner]].


Pam's son, Justin, came into the practice for the first time in three years. Cooper was shocked to see that he had gained a large amount of weight. It had gotten a lot harder for him to move around, especially recently. Cooper weighed him and found that he had gained  pounds in three years.

Cooper consulted with Naomi and called in Justin's parents to talk about the situation. He had diabetes and high blood pressure. His father, Bruce, believed he was just lazy. They'd hired him a trainer and nutritionist and sent him to fat camp. They ruled out hormonal causes for his weight gain. Justin said he didn't want to get any bigger and he didn't feel good. While they were talking, Justin passed out. They took him to the hospital.

His blood sugar spiked, which caused dehydration. His parents argued over his case. Pam said that he was stressed and used the food as comfort while his father said his mother coddled him.

When Justin woke up, he told Cooper that he was being molested and that's why he kept eating, because he thought it would stop if he gained enough weight. Cooper angrily went out to the waiting room and punched Bruce, believing he was the abuser. Bruce quickly called a lawyer to sue Cooper and the hospital.

Cooper went back to Justin's hospital room and told Bruce he was telling the police what he'd been doing to Justin. Justin then said it wasn't Bruce. It was Pam. Pam tried to comfort him and both Bruce and Cooper told her to back away. Bruce was very angry and asked how she could hurt their son like that. Pam said that Justin loves him. Bruce then tried to attack Pam, but Cooper restrained him and had security called.

Pam was then arrested for her crime.



She is married to [[Bruce Tanner]]. When he learned she was molesting their son, he tried to attack her and had to be restrained.


She molested her son for at least three years before being arrested for it.

'''Patrick Hoffman''' is a young piano prodigy who had a brain tumor.


Patrick, a piano prodigy, came in to see Cooper because of numbness. Cooper decided to order an MRI and have Amelia consult. He was being raised by his grandfather, Dennis, after his parents died in a car accident when he was five.

The MRI showed a large brain tumor in the area of Patrick's brain that controls hand function. Amelia recommended surgery, but said the safest option meant that Patrick might lose all function in his right hand, meaning he wouldn't be able to play piano. The alternative was an awake craniotomy, in order to allow her to track progress and monitor his hand function as she worked. But because it would take longer, there was a risk he'd end up with paralysis in his right leg. Patrick said he needed piano and asked Dennis to let him have the surgery because he needed piano, but didn't need his legs.

However, Dennis said they were going to go with the safer option, though Patrick said it wasn't what he wanted. Amelia and Cooper informed them that they couldn't do what Patrick wanted without Dennis's consent and they also couldn't do what Dennis wanted without Patrick's consent. It would become a matter for the courts. They'd probably rule with Dennis, but they didn't have time to wait for that. Patrick said Dennis could either let him do the awake craniotomy or let him die.

Cooper went to talk to Patrick, who said that being a musician was the most important thing in the world to him. He also said that music was his entire relationship with his grandfather. After his parents' funeral, Dennis never looked at him until he started to teach him to play piano. He believed Dennis couldn't learn another way to bond with him.

Amelia brought Dennis in and said that they needed to talk to each other and choose a surgery because his tumor would keep growing. Dennis said he loves Patrick, even though he doesn't say it. Amelia told him what Patrick had said about his relationship and said Dennis needed to tell Patrick he loves him. He became angry, saying she didn't understand, but after she told him about her father's death, he said to do the surgery if that's what Patrick wanted.

Patrick was taken in for surgery and believed his grandfather wouldn't show up to see him before the surgery because he only loved him for his music. During the surgery, Patrick played piano in order to give Amelia an idea of which areas she could cut into and which she couldn't. He said he wished Cooper had been right about his grandfather loving him no matter what.

Dennis arrived at the hospital after Patrick was already in surgery. He regretted agreeing to the surgery, saying he thought if he gave Patrick what he wanted, Patrick would know how he felt. Not wanting to risk Patrick dying before he had a chance to tell him, Cooper brought Dennis into the OR to tell Patrick he loved him. At that moment, Patrick started bleeding and said he couldn't feel his hand. Cooper took Dennis back out of the OR while Amelia worked to stop the bleeding.

Amelia later came out and told Dennis she'd gotten the whole tumor. They wouldn't know until he woke up if he'd have any paralysis, but she was hopeful.



His parents died in a car accident when he was five and his grandfather has been raising him ever since.


*He was  at the time of his surgery.

'''Patrick Minahan''' is the husband of [[Ashley Minahan]].


Patrick's wife, Ashley, was pregnant with her fourth child and ultrasounds had indicated that it was a girl after three boys. She was very excited to be finally having a girl. She came to the practice for a checkup and was found to be in labor. She labored at the practice for a while and then told Dell the baby was coming. He called Naomi to deliver the baby, but by the time she arrived, the baby was born. Naomi had to tell Ashley that the baby was a boy. She was upset and demanded a girl. She refused to look at her new son. They called in Violet to talk to her, to try to get her to bond with her son. Ashley said she couldn't raise four boys on her own. Her husband didn't really help with the parenting. He preferred just to be their friend.

The doctors called Patrick in and confronted Patrick along with Ashley. They said he needed to grow up and become a parent. Naomi then also said that Ashley needed to grow up. She needed to take the boy she got and not get upset. Or she could meet one of the families Naomi treated who can't even have a baby. When the Minahans' other sons were brought in, Patrick told them to give their mom a break, stepping up.



He is married to [[Ashley Minahan]].


He and his wife have four sons. Before the fourth was born, he preferred to be the kids' friends, playing with them instead of parenting. However, after the fourth was born, he agreed to step up and grow up.

'''Patty''' is a woman who had an abortion that failed.


Patty came into the practice to see Addison. While riding up to the practice in the elevator with Addison, Patty vomited. Addison gave her an antiemetic and examined her. Patty said that she'd had an abortion two months prior. She tried to go to a clinic, but there were protesters outside. She then had a hard time finding a doctor to do it. Addison did an ultrasound and found that Patty was still pregnant. She was at  weeks.

Addison explained to her how it could have happened. Patty asked her to do another abortion, but Addison explained that it was now a much more complicated procedure. Addison said they could talk about other options, but Patty said she'd considered them the last time.

When Patty returned, Addison was at the hospital, so Naomi offered to let Patty wait in her office. Patty talked to Naomi about the plan she had. Naomi told her no one was ever ready to have a baby. Naomi talked to Patty about the fetus's anatomy and asked her to consider carrying to term.

Addison visited Patty at work, saying it was her decision and she needed to make it herself. She said whatever decision Patty made needed to be for her and Addison would do the abortion or help her place it for adoption, whichever she chose.

Patty chose to have the second abortion and Addison did the surgery.



She had a boyfriend named Charlie. He left when she told him she was pregnant.


She was working as a bartender to put herself through graduate school.

'''Patty''' is a patient who was injured in a car accident when she was five.


Patty was injured in a car accident when she was five. Her knee was badly injured and needed to be reconstructed. However, before her surgery, her mother brought her to the practice, said she was going to get money, and left her there. Cooper, concerned that she wouldn't get the surgery if she were turned over to social services because it was elective, attempted to find her parents. Violet talked to Patty about her home life and determined that her home life seemed healthy.

While they looked for her parents, Cooper gave Patty a shot to help with her pain.

He finally found Patty's parents at her aunt Katie's house. He talked to them and they said that Patty's injury had ruined them and the bills were piling up. He told them they didn't deserve her and left.

Back at the practice, he told Patty that her parents weren't coming.

He then went to Charlotte, asking her to ensure that Patty got her surgery before she was handed over to DCFS. Her surgery went well and afterward, they called [[Michelle (Acceptance)|Michelle]] to come take care of her.



Her parents abandoned her at the practice before her surgery because her care was too expensive for them.

Her aunt Katie lives near Disneyland.


*She has a stuffed bear named Felix.
*Cooper had been her doctor since she was born.

'''Paul''' is a man who found himself unable to have sex with his wife.


After Paul's wife, Kathy, told [[Sam Bennett]] she was upset because she and her husband hadn't had sex in  months, Sam referred them to [[Violet Turner]].

Kathy and Paul came in to see Violet and Paul said he wanted to have sex, but he wanted to want it. Violet then ordered him to have sex with his wife, whether or not he was in the mood.

They reported back that he had erectile dysfunction, so Sam agreed to run tests to look for a physical problem.

Paul came in for a physical exam and was upset because Kathy hadn't come home the night before and he worried she had cheated. Kathy came in in the middle of the exam and said she hadn't cheated. Kathy then left the exam room for the waiting room after saying she was stuck with Paul. Sam drew blood for labs. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Paul's tests showed a hormone imbalance, which was why he didn't want to have sex. Sam said there were many options for why his hormones were imbalanced, so final diagnosis could take a while. Sam did an MRI and consulted with Dr. Straley from Sloan Kettering. He had a tumor on his adrenal gland, which was causing his low sex drive. He was informed that tumors of that type were usually aggressive and found late, so treatment was difficult and risky, but there was hope. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



He is married to [[Kathy]]. Despite loving his life, he had no desire to have sex.


*He has a pool at his house.<ref>[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]], x</ref>

'''Paul''' is a member of the couples support group run by Violet and Sheldon.


Three couples ([[Sasha (Wait and See)|Sasha]] and [[Ryan (Wait and See)|Ryan]], [[Eleanor (Wait and See)|Eleanor]] and Paul, and [[Greg (Wait and See)|Greg]] and [[Carol (Wait and See)|Carol]]) were in a therapy group together. At the group, Eleanor said her husband, Paul, didn't want to have sex anymore. He defended that he was tired when he got home from work.

After Violet caught Eleanor in the stairwell with Ryan, she and Sheldon called the two of them in privately. They talked about how the affair had come to be. They said it was easy and the communication was there unlike with their spouses. Sheldon suggested that they go home, talk to their spouses, and work on their marriages. Eleanor insisted that they wanted to be together and they should tell their spouses so they could start a new life together.

After Ryan started to work on things with his wife and they talked about it in group, Eleanor admitted to having an affair, though she didn't say with whom. Paul was outraged and asked if it was someone he knows. Eleanor said she made a mistake, but Paul said he didn't care. He decided he was done and left the room.



He is married to [[Eleanor (Wait and See)|Eleanor]]. Their relationship was strained because Paul never wanted to have sex after he came home from work. He ultimately left her after she admitted to having an affair.

'''Paul Gonzales''' is the manager of the store where [[Jenny]] had a psychiatric episode. He called [[Violet Turner]].


Paul was working when [[Jenny]] dropped to the floor in his store and started counting the tiles. He found [[Violet Turner|Violet's]] card and decided to call her instead of the police because his sister is also mentally ill. He helped Violet as she worked to calm Jenny down and figure out what had happened. He offered her a snack, but reminded her that she'd have to pay for it, as well as the shoes and ice pack she took. After her violent outburst, Paul called the police, but Violet asked them to hold off and just be back-up if she needed it. In order to figure out what set Jenny off, he allowed Violet access to the security cameras in the store. Once Violet figured out that she had reacted to a video of a boy playing at the lake with his family, she asked Paul to block off an area of the store so she could talk to Jenny, which he did.



He has a sister whom he says is a good person despite being mentally ill.


Paul is the manager of a store.

'''Penny Gibson''' is a patient of [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison Montgomery-Shepherd]] who had a c-section after seven weeks of bed rest.


Penny was pregnant. She was put on bed rest after her membranes ruptured at  weeks. She spent the next seven weeks on bed rest and then had a c-section.



She is married to [[Mr. Gibson]]. Unbeknownst to her, he briefly flirted with Addison while she was treating Penny. However, once their child was born, he immediately returned his attention to his wife and child.


She has one child with her husband.

[[St. Ambrose Hospital]] '''Former'''
[[Oceanside Wellness Group]]
[[Pacific Wellcare Center]] |first appearance = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[In Which We Meet Addison, a Nice Girl From Somewhere Else]] |last appearance = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Gone, Baby, Gone]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]], [[Season (Private Practice)|]], [[Season (Private Practice)|]], [[Season (Private Practice)|]], and [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Tim Daly]] }} '''Pete Wilder''' was an alternative medicine specialist at [[Seaside Health and Wellness]] and a critical care specialist at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] until his death. He was married to\ua[[Violet Turner]], with whom he has a son named\ua[[Lucas Wilder|Lucas]]. During his childhood, Pete had to clean up after his mother while his brother, Adam, made excuses. She was an alcoholic 'A party all by herself', and liked a lot of men. She met a serious partner, Henry, but later stabbed him to death when he tried to leave in front of Pete, who was especially close to Henry and the age of fifteen. He is now estranged from his brother and does not know who his father is. Before her pregnancy, Violet was sleeping with both Pete and Sheldon. During her whole pregnancy, no one knew who was the biological father. Cooper came to live with her to help her with her pregnancy. She was treating [[Katie Kent]], who was pregnant, but lost the pregnancy. Kate refused to accept this and wouldn't allow them to do a D&C to remove the dead tissue. With Violet's help, Katie came to terms with it and she continued treatment with Violet.[[What Women Want]], x (PP) During this time, Violet chose to be with Pete and Sheldon had to just sit back and did not really say anything but hoped the baby would be his. She was overdue and was tired of being pregnant and wanted it out but still went to work every day. One day, Katie came to her door while she was home alone. Katie stabbed her with a syringe that caused Violet to be conscious but unable to move from her head down. Katie believed Violet's baby was her own. Unable to stop Katie, but wanting to make sure the baby was okay, Violet talked Katie through a C-Section.[[Yours, Mine & Ours]], x (PP) Pete had a heart attack mere hours after Violet left for her book tour with only his son Lucas as a witness. Fortunately, Cooper came by to hang out and discovered him on the floor. He started CPR and called .\uaPete was taken to St. Ambrose, where Sam and Amelia saved his life. Violet came home as soon as she found out and later became the object of Pete's post-heart attack frustration.[[God Laughs]], x (PP) After Pete's heart attack, their relationship was strained and uncomfortable. Once Pete was cleared for all physical activity, they slept together, however they both confided in others saying it was awkward and not as good as it used to be. While Pete was grieving his attack, he said passive aggressive comments to Violet, and treated her poorly, however Violet dismissed it because the psychiatrist in her said it was just the grief talking. During Amelia's intervention, she verbally attacked both of them saying to Violet that Pete didn't want her anymore and she was just an aging old woman, and told Pete that saving his life after the brain bleed following the heart attack, may not have been worth it, and "God's angels should have just taken him then". Both Pete and Violet escaped into the kitchen where they laughed hysterically at the things Amelia said to them, and it felt like the old them. However time past and things were still strained and not normal. Violet and Addison had grown closer as Addison was trying to get pregnant and Violet was helping her, and while they were talking one day, Violet realized something. She found Pete in his office and started talking. She said that she didn't want to be like Anna, Pete's previous wife until her death. She didn't want Pete to feel obligated to stay with her even though he was miserable. But she also knew that Pete didn't have it in him to leave. So she said that if Pete didn't want their marriage to continue, ''she would leave him'', so he wouldn't have to feel guilty, and they would figure out a way to share Lucas. She told Pete to think about that, and left his office. Later, while they were sitting at their table, Violet asked if Pete had thought about what she said. He responded saying, "I'm sorry Violet." Meaning he wanted to end their marriage. Violet's reaction was unclear but she said that they should keep things as normal as possible for Lucas, and they should still go to Addison's thanksgiving dinner together, for Lucas. She then picked up her bag, and walked out of the house. Pete had had a heart attack previously. He also got in trouble with the law because he illegally took a man who wanted to die off of life support. He was resistant to agree with the court so he was held until he cooperated. Violet talked Pete into cooperating with the court and he got out and had to go to a preliminary court hearing. On the day of the hearing, Pete went for a run and texted Violet, "I went for a run. No matter what happens, I will always love you." Violet showed up for the hearing, but no one could find Pete. Violet got a call later from his phone. It was a police officer telling her something had happened to the owner of the phone and asking if she could come and identify him. It turned out that Pete had had a second heart attack and died on the side of the path and was lying there all day until someone found him.[[Aftershock]], x (PP)\ua Pete could\uabe cold at times but had a loving heart. He was loyal to his wives even though he hated them at some point. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] [[Image:x-.jpg|thumb|left|px|His first kiss with Addison.]] During Dr. Addison Forbes Montgomery's first visit to Oceanside Wellness, Pete and Addison established a teasing and often flirtatious relationship. Addison initially labelled Pete a \ucquack,\ud but she allowed the \uccute hippy boy\ud to treat her with acupuncture. Although Pete was immediately attracted to her, he promised their mutual friend, Dr. Sam Bennett, that he would stay away from Addison. However, after finding Addison crying over her newly discovered infertility, Pete kissed her to prove that she wasn\ut \ucdried up.\ud Addison seemed open to pursuing a relationship with Pete, but was warned off by Sam. According to Sam, Pete is a serial monogamist, unable to emotionally connect with any woman since the death of his wife. Pete's last foray into office romance was apparently disastrous, and resulted in the unnamed OB/GYN's sudden departure from the practice. In response, Oceanside Wellness instituted a strict "no consorting" rule. Later, they got together again, after [[Violet Turner|Violet]] left Pete and [[Lucas Wilder|Lucas]] behind. They raised Lucas together for a while. They split up after Violet's return. [[Anna Wilder]] Pete's relationship with his wife is somewhat mysterious and he appears reluctant to discuss their marriage. During a visit to her grave on the anniversary of her death, we discover Anna Wilder died in , at the age of . In a discussion regarding a patient, Pete hints to the other doctors that he stayed in an unhappy marriage because his wife was sick and that they were unable to make the marriage work. Pete eventually tells Addison that he went to bed with his wife on a Tuesday night and when he awoke the following Wednesday morning she was dead and that he thought she was ignoring him and argued with her dead body for minutes before ripping the blankets of the bed and realizing that she had been dead. He further states that no night was perfect during their marriage, not even their wedding night. This information was the most that Pete has ever divulged to any of his co-workers about his wife. During a second visit to his wife's grave, Pete unleashes his pent-up anger to his wife's headstone. After stating that Anna was "a mean, cold bitch" and that he hated her, Pete softens and apologizes for not being able to save her. Pete later reveals to Violet that at the time of Anna's death they had been trying to conceive a child. [[Meg Porter]] Pete and Meg met when they were both residents and later worked together as Doctors Without Borders. Meg reveals to Pete's surprised co-workers that once during the war in Bosnia, Pete refused to evacuate and, despite the mortar fire, stayed with sick children for the whole night, saving the lives of most of them. Later Pete told Meg, who has a smoking habit, that his wife was a smoker and she didn't quit the habit before she died. Despite their renewed relationship, Meg decides to come back to Ghana, where she works in malaria fighting program, but Pete asks her to come back to him, because she makes him happy. Despite that, Meg returned later to LA and even tried to give up smoking for Pete, the relationship didn't work. Meg wasn't sure if she wants to live in LA and Pete admitted that ever since his unhappy marriage he doesn't trust women anymore. When Pete and his Oceanside Wellness Group colleague [[Violet Turner|Violet]] hooked-up, the relationship with Meg was definitely over. [[Violet Turner]] The relationship with Violet started with just sex, but later Pete realized that he wanted more. When he asked Violet if they could move to the next level and begin a real relationship, she turned him down, saying that she didn't trust him because of his past. But it was Violet's behavior that really caused the end of their relationship, when she started secretly dating Sheldon, the therapist from the rival practice, Pacific Wellcare. Pete ended their relationship because of Violet's infidelity. Afterward, Violet revealed to both Pete and Sheldon she was pregnant, and willing to raise the child, but ignored who the father was. Pete confronted Violet and said that he loved her and they could be a real family. Violet turned him down, but later she kissed him and told about her feelings towards him. In the end, Violet was kidnapped by her patient, [[Katie Kent|Katie]], who believed that Violet's baby was her own. Pete found Violet lying unconscious on the floor of her house, bleeding to death. Katie cut the baby out of Violet and ran away with him. Pete saved Violet and together with Naomi rushed her to the hospital where Addison and Naomi operated on her. In the meantime, Katie appeared at the hospital with Violet's baby and was apprehended by Pete, Cooper, and security. While waiting in the hospital for Violet's surgery to be finished, Pete thought about their first meeting. They met just four days after Pete's wife's death, when Sam and Naomi, Pete's friends who just opened their private practice, recommended Violet to him as his therapist. Pete at first was reluctant to talk with Violet, but finally he opened to her and admitted that he hated his wife and argued with her all the time, even the night she died. The next morning, he was still yelling at her and only a few minutes later, he noticed that she wasn't answering because she was dead. Pete admitted that he was relieved after his wife's death and felt free. After that, Pete, who was the owner of an Infectious Diseases practice in Beverly Hills, decided to change his job, and started working in Oceanside Wellness Group as an Alternative Medicine specialist, where he still worked eight years later. A month after Lucas's traumatic birth, Violet was still trying to recover and get over her trauma. Pete lived with her and took care of her and Lucas. Violet was not leaving her house and had panic attacks every time the doorbell rang. After getting advice from Sheldon, Pete decided to move out, to help Violet recover and push her to go outside. Violet realized that after traumatic events in her life, she couldn't bond with her baby and gave Lucas to Pete, asking him to take care of the baby. A couple of weeks later, Sheldon requested a paternity test and it was revealed that Pete is the biological father. A few months later, Violet returned and wanted joint custody of Lucas. Pete didn't want to let this happen and battled her in court. Their relationship was strained for a while until Pete discovered that Violet had changed and that she was a good influence on Lucas and him.\uaAfter Dell's death, Pete and Violet decided to get married. After Pete had his first heart attack, he started to resent Violet, believing she was coddling him, and that resulted in their separation. When Violet started seeing Scott, Pete realized he was still in love with Violet. Eventually, after Scott and Violet broke up, Violet also decided that she was still in love with Pete. Pete and Violet attempted to go to couples therapy, but Pete decided that they were in love and that was enough for him. Violet still wanted him to work, for them to work and sort out their problems. When Pete went out for his run, he texted Violet, telling her that he loved her. Concerned when Pete didn't show up for the hearing that he was meant to go to, she thought he had left. When she realized that Pete was dead, she told Cooper that Pete didn't look like Pete at all. According to her, Pete had always looked warm, even when he was angry, but now he just looked cold. [[Lisa King]] Pete briefly dated Lisa after her son, [[Ben King]], one of Pete's patients, set them up. After realizing that he needed to be there for Violet and the baby, he showed up at Lisa's doorstep and broke things off with her. Pete worked at the [[Oceanside Wellness Group]] as a [[Alternative Medicine|naturopathic doctor and licensed herbalist]]. He graduated from medical school and practiced traditional western medicine for a number of years before spending five years in China studying alternative medicine. Pete\us medical practice combines eastern and western medicine in an integrative approach, and he is often asked to provide expectant mothers with holistic birthing plans. Pete has also lectured locally and internationally on the subject of Oriental and Eastern Medicine. He used acupuncture on Addison during her first visit to the Oceanside Wellness Group and made her release negative energy. Before Oceanside, Pete owned a practice in Beverly Hills which worked in [[Infectious Disease|infectious disease]]. Pete also had training in [[Critical Care Medicine|critical care]]. Pete was offered a job at Oceanside Wellness Group when the doctor they originally hired, a [[Dermatology|dermatologist]], was sued for inappropriately touching his patient's feet. However, [[Violet Turner|Violet]] had doubts as he was seeing her for therapy following the death of [[Anna Wilder|his wife]]. Eventually, Violet saw progress and allowed him to work at the practice. After some time at Oceanside, Pete accepted Naomi's offer and left the Oceanside Wellness Center to start working in [[Pacific Wellcare Center|Pacific Wellcare]]; additionally, he has picked up shifts at [[St. Ambrose Hospital|St. Ambrose Hospital's ER]], becoming employed as an [[Attending|attending]] critical care physician. *Before settling on the name Pete Wilder, the creators of the show considered and rejected "Pete Finch" and "Pete Fisher." *Pete rode a Triumph motorcycle.[[Know When to Fold]], x (PP) *According to [[Sam Bennett|Sam]], Pete couldn't parallel park to save his life.[[Mourning Sickness]], x (PP) *Pete wanted a Balinese party instead of a normal funeral.[[Mourning Sickness]] x (PP) *Pete never ate the crust off his pizza.[[Mourning Sickness]], x (PP) *He loved mint chocolate chip ice cream.[[Mourning Sickness]], x (PP) *He liked meatloaf.[[Do the Right Thing]], x (PP) *He spoke Spanish.[[Playing God]], x (PP) PPPeteWilder.png PPxPeteWilder.png PPPeteWilder.png PPxPeteWilder.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Pete-centric or otherwise very informative about his life. *[[In Which Addison Finds the Magic]] *[[A Death in the Family]] *[[War]] *[[Take Two]] *[[All in the Family]] *[[Can't Find My Way Back Home]] *[[The Hardest Part]] *[[God Laughs]] *[[And Then There Was One]] *[[True Colors (Private Practice)|True Colors]] *[[Gone, Baby, Gone]] *[[Mourning Sickness]] :'''Pete:''' My wife went to sleep beside me in bed on a Tuesday night, on Wednesday morning when I woke up, she was dead. It was one bad night. But... all our nights were bad and we never had a perfect night. Not even our wedding night. '''Phil Rakoff''' is the former foster father of [[Betsey Parker]].


Phil and his wife, Gina, came into the ER when their foster daughter, Betsey, fell down the stairs. Because of that injury and a previous healed clavicle fracture, Cooper suspected she was being abused. Naomi got Gina and Phil out of the room and Cooper asked her about it, but she said she fell. When they figured out what was happening, the Rakoffs asked Cooper to leave.

Cooper called in [[Gladys]] because of his concerns. Gladys said she believed he was wrong, but she'd follow-up on his complaint.

Later, while eating ice cream with Marshall, Sheldon had concerns that Marshall was the one who had hurt Betsey. He went to the Rakoffs about it, but they were angry at the implication and refused to listen.

Sheldon went to Gina alone and deduced that she'd already been concerned about Marshall. She said that she'd known for a while that he was different, but she didn't want to see it. She thought bringing another kid into their home would give him a friend. She told a comatose Betsey that she loved her and left, saying she needed to put Marshall first.



He is married to [[Gina Rakoff]].


His son, Marshall, has emotional problems. Because of this, he and his wife stopped fostering Betsey to focus on his care.

'''Phillip''' is the husband of [[Janine]] whose heart was given to her after he was declared brain dead.


Phillip's wife, Janine, was  weeks pregnant and short of breath. She wondered if she had gestational diabetes because Phillip was diabetic. Her brother-in-law, [[Malcolm]], who is a nurse, came to her appointment because Phillip had to work. Addison said that her blood sugar was fine. Addison listened to her lungs and had Dell call an ambulance because she heard fluid in Janine's lungs. She had diffuse myocardial dysfunction. The added pressure of the pregnancy caused the condition to worsen quickly. She needed a heart transplant. Because the pregnancy was putting extra stress on her, Addison recommended termination. Her husband said she should, but Janine said she couldn't do it.

Janine was put at the top of the donor list, but her husband and brother-in-law were told she had only  hours to find a heart.

Phillip later came into the ER with no brain activity. He'd had an insulin overdose that caused brain death. His license revealed that he was an organ donor. They talked to Janine, asking her to take Phillip's heart to save her life. Malcolm encouraged her to take it. They took her in for the surgery, but were stopped by [[Charlotte King]]. She believed it was either suicide or homicide and insisted that evidence be collected before the transplant could take place. They waited and Phillip started to become unstable, so they had to rush once they were cleared to retrieve the heart.

After the transplant, Janine's condition improved, though she worried because she suspected that Malcolm might have killed his brother to get Janine a heart. She knew he was in love with her. Addison confronted Malcolm about it, but he denied it, saying he loved his brother. The ME ruled Phillip's death an accidental overdose. Addison later watched as Malcolm kissed Janine's hand in her hospital room.



He was married to [[Janine]] until his death. When he was declared brain dead, his heart was transplanted into her.


His brother, [[Malcolm]], went to Janine's appointments in his place.


*His blood type was O.

'''R.L. Hansen''' is a judge.



When Elisa's father wanted her to be healed by a shaman instead of having chemotherapy, Hansen was called in to rule on her case. She took the family's religious beliefs into account, but when she learned that Elisa didn't share the beliefs and wanted to deny chemo to save her family money, she ordered that Elisa have chemo. ''("[[What Happens Next]]")''


When Pete didn't show up for his preliminary hearing, Judge Hansen said he forfeited his bail and issued a warrant for his arrest. Pete was later found dead. ''("[[Aftershock]]")''


She is a judge.

'''Rachel''' is a patient who experienced postpartum psychosis.


Rachel brought in her young daughter, Cynthia, after Cynthia became submerged in a bath when Rachel answered the phone. Cooper examined her and said that she was fine, but noticed that Rachel was exhausted. He held Cynthia and told Rachel to rest for a minute. He asked Violet to come talk to her, but when they got back, Rachel was gone. They searched the practice and found her in a maternity suite. She talked about Cynthia's birth and said her husband named her, but she loves her. Cooper kept Cynthia and Violet talked to Rachel.

After their talk, Violet suggested medication, but Rachel declined because she was breastfeeding, so Violet suggested acupuncture as an alternative. Pete talked about what he was going to do. Rachel talked rapidly to Pete about how Cynthia wasn't sleeping, which led to Pete going to Violet, telling her Rachel was manic. She already knew that. She believed Rachel had postpartum psychosis, so she talked to Rachel's husband and he agreed to pre-admit her to the hospital and come get the baby. While they were talking, Rachel came out of Pete's office with the acupuncture needles still in her face, believing that Cynthia was crying somewhere and trying to get to her. She found Cynthia with Cooper, getting ready to eat. Rachel panicked when they wouldn't let her have Cynthia. Rachel then confessed that she had held Cynthia under the water. She knew her husband wouldn't be home until dinner and no one would know and she could finally get some sleep. Violet sedated Rachel with benzos and started her on an antipsychotic.

Andrew, her husband, came in and was shocked at what Rachel had done. He'd wondered what he'd missed or what he could have done. Pete and Violet reassured him that it wasn't his fault and there wasn't anything he could have done. Rachel woke up after a few hours of sleep and wanted to see Cynthia, leading Andrew to wonder what he should do.

The doctors discussed it. Violet believed Rachel was still a danger to Cynthia, but Cooper and Pete insisted that it'd be okay because she'd be monitored the whole time.

They brought Cynthia in to see Rachel. They handed her off to Andrew and told him to stay right there with her. Rachel held Cynthia and said she was sorry for what she had done. After their visit, Andrew and Rachel slept peacefully in Rachel's hospital bed while Cynthia rested in a basinet next to them.



She is married to [[Andrew (Ex-Life)|Andrew]].


Before giving birth, Rachel picked out names, but didn't end up using any of them because they didn't match. She says Cynthia was such a good baby before she was born, but struggled after giving birth because of postpartum psychosis.

'''Rachel''' is a patient who had multiple health issues and who abused her husband as a side effect of her treatment.


Rachel had multiple health problems. She and her husband were in marriage counseling and she said that she worried that her health problems had stolen his youth, though he insisted that wasn't the case. Nick was asked how he relieves the stress caused with dealing with her illness. He admitted that sometimes he and Rachel fight and Sheldon asked why the thought of it made him so uncomfortable. Sheldon then witnessed Rachel slapping and then hitting Nick, who quickly subdued her and said she didn't mean to.

Sheldon went to Addison about it, who said she wasn't concerned about the abuse, which Sheldon said was resonant of rages that addicts have.

Sheldon visited Nick at home and said he had to report the abuse. Nick said he'd deny it if Sheldon said anything. Nick said that he could handle it.

Rachel came in and Addison examined her for possible causes for her rages. Her tests showed excess testosterone in her blood, which was caused by metastatic breast cancer. She'd had a mastectomy ten years prior, but leftover cells had caused the cancer to grow somewhere else. Addison said the only way to confirm was with surgery, which was risky for someone in her condition. Rachel said she wanted to do it for Nick.

Sheldon talked to Nick about what would happen going forward with Rachel and her treatment. Nick insisted that no matter what, he wouldn't leave Rachel because he loved her.

In surgery, Addison said the tumor was more invasive than she thought. She wasn't able to remove it all. Addison had to break the news to her that she was dying. Addison suggested testosterone-blocked agents, but said they aren't very effective. Sheldon then suggested hospice care, with people who are trained to deal with cases like hers. Nick objected, but Rachel said that she wanted to go into hospice care, saying it was the right thing. She wanted to take care of him for once.



She's been married to [[Nick (What Happens Next)|Nick]] for  years. They met when he was just out of journalism school and working at the Times as a reporter. He covered a performance of Swan Lake. He saw her dance and was mesmerized.


She was a ballerina. She met her husband when he was covering her performance in Swan Lake.

'''Rachel Gold''' is the wife of [[Shimmon Gold]].


Rachel brought her two month old, Ruthie, in for a well-baby visit. Cooper examined her and said she was perfectly healthy. He asked Rachel how she was doing, because Ruthie had six kids under the age of eight. Rachel said she was fine, but when pressed, she said that her husband, Shimmon, wasn't interested in having sex with her since Ruthie was born. She then said she didn't think Cooper could help and that it wasn't proper to talk to him about it.

Cooper went to Violet and Charlotte to talk about it. They brought in Rachel, who said that it had happened after previous births, but this one was persisting longer. When she talked about his other symptoms, Charlotte diagnosed couvade, his body mimicking her pregnancy symptoms. They suggested several options to get him back in the mood. However, she said that she didn't want that because while she loved her six kids, she couldn't raise or ask Shimmon to provide for any more than that. They also couldn't use birth control, so the couvade was a good way to keep them from having more kids. Violet and Charlotte suggested having Shimmon come in to talk about other options.

Believing he wouldn't talk to a woman, Cooper sat down with Shimmon and asked if he ever thought there'd be a point where he'd want to stop having kids. Shimmon replied that the Torah tells them to be fruitful and multiply to fill the earth. They interpreted it as doing nothing to stop a pregnancy from happening. He said he loves his wife and didn't want to stop being intimate with her. Cooper suggested other options that aren't birth control, but Shimmon said they'd chosen to be faithful and wouldn't fool God anyway.

They brought in a rabbi to get a religious perspective. He said that there were options, but the Golds sounded like they wanted to live by the letter of the law. The doctors then discussed other options. When they talked about what the pill has in it, Violet figured out a solution. They brought the Golds back in to tell them they had lots of options if they decided to use them. As they were leaving, Violet said that she believed Rachel might be anemic, common among young mothers. She gave her oral contraceptives to help, saying they contain iron. She said if she felt like she needed it, it would be up to her. Rachel took the pills and left with her husband and kids.



She is married to [[Shimmon Gold]]. She says he's very lovely and she loves being intimate with him.


She and her husband have six children under the age of eight.

'''Rachel King-Freedman''' is the youngest daughter of\ua[[Charlotte King]]\uaand\ua[[Cooper Freedman]].



Eight weeks after Georgia was born, Charlotte went into labor with the remaining two triplets. She delivered Caroline easily, but Rachel was transverse. Addison decided she could rotate the baby and deliver her breech. Despite the problem, Rachel was healthy at birth. Cooper then decided on the name Rachel for her. ''("[[Full Release]]")''


After they went home, Cooper decided to stay home to raise the triplets. However, after doing so for a while, he decided that they needed to hire a nanny. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")''



Rachel is one of a set of triplets, along with [[Georgia King-Freedman|Georgia]] and [[Caroline King-Freedman|Caroline]]. They live with their parents and older brother, Mason.

'''Randy Hatcher''' is the father of [[Tyler Hatcher]].


Randy's son, Tyler, a wrestler, passed out while wrestling. He'd also had some dizziness while wrestling at other times. The next day was the conference finals and Tyler needed to do well to get a scholarship to college. Cooper examined him and heard a heart murmur, so he told Tyler and his parents he wanted him to get checked out by Sam. They wanted to get it done today and needed Cooper to sign a medical release saying that Tyler could wrestle again.

Sam diagnosed Tyler with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, but said he could still wrestle. There were risks, but there was a chance he could do it without any problems. Despite his recommendation, Cooper said he couldn't allow Tyler to wrestle.

Tyler came to Cooper and said his mom had gotten laid of and his dad was working double shifts to pay the rent. He worked a part-time job on the weekends to help out. Wrestling was his way to get to college. Cooper just said he couldn't risk it and had scheduled a cardiac MRI for Tyler.

Randy came into the hospital, saying he understood how important getting the MRI was. He was surprised that Tyler hadn't arrived because his mother had said she'd bring him. They then figured out she had taken him to the conference finals instead.

They arrived at the match and tried to get [[Coach Patterson]] to stop it. He said that the medical release had been signed, but Stacy had forged it. Tyler won his match, but shortly after, went into cardiac arrest. They rushed him to the hospital, where they were able to restart his heart, but he was deprived of oxygen long enough that there was the potential for brain damage. They put him in a medically-induced coma. Stacy said that Tyler had come to her, saying how much he wanted it. Everything he'd always worked for to get a chance for something better.

While they waited on Tyler, his mother showed Cooper a letter from UCLA. They'd already decided to give him a full scholarship before the finals. Stacy and Randy cried at their son's bedside.



He is married to [[Stacy Hatcher]].

'''Ray Daniels''' is a bicyclist whose career was cut short by a heart condition.


Ray came into [[Pacific Wellcare Center]] looking for treatment for his knee injury. He'd been a professional cyclist, but retired five years prior. However, he was hoping to make a big comeback. At the patients' welcome breakfast, Sam and Pete approached him and convinced him to come back to [[Oceanside Wellness Group]] with them in order to work on his knee. However, while they were working with him, his wife came in and said that he had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and wasn't supposed to be riding. He planned the comeback because they'd lost their house and didn't have any money. He hadn't been able to find a job and didn't know how to do anything but race.

Pete and Sam did research to try to make it as safe as possible for Ray. He was able to ride for ten miles with no pain. However, when he left, Pete advised him not to race. However, Ray insisted that he was going to win and then he and his wife would have the money they needed.

During the race, Sam and Pete monitored his heart rate over the internet. He won the race and his heart rate was stable until after he crossed the finish line, at which point, he became unstable. When Sam and Pete arrived at the hospital, they found out that he had been pronounced dead and was in the morgue.



He was married to [[Monica Daniels]] until his death.


Ray was a professional cyclist until he was diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, forcing an early retirement. When he needed money, he planned a comeback.


*He's an Olympic gold medalist.
*He participated in the Tour de France.
*His last race before his death was the SoCal .

'''Ray Paget''' and his wife, Angie, came to the practice to get help conceiving.


Ray and his wife Angie came into the practice because they were unable to conceive. Angie had had tests done and Naomi determined that she was ovulating, so they started running tests on Ray. While Ray was getting his tests run, Angie came to Naomi and Addison and asked them to lie to Ray and asked them to lie to him and say he's the reason they can't get pregnant. She'd been lying to him. For a while, she was on the pill, but then she got a cervical cap, which is why they hadn't conceived. She said she had her reasons and when pressed, she said she just didn't want kids, but Ray loved kids, so she couldn't just tell him she didn't want them. Addison said they couldn't lie to Ray about his test results. Angie left the practice with Ray when he returned.

Angie returned to the practice the next day. She said she'd read about Addison's genetics specialty and said she needed to know if she had Huntington's, which her mother and grandmother had. She wanted to grow old with Ray and wanted to know, if there was a chance she might not have it.

Angie had the test and it came back positive, so they brought in Violet in to talk to her. However, Angie left and implied that she'd be leaving Ray, which she believed was for his own benefit.

Ray came into the practice shocked and upset about Angie leaving him. He said she said that her appointment had been a wake-up call and wondered what they'd said to her. They repeatedly called Angie and she eventually came to the practice. She didn't want Ray to have to watch her die and it was better if he just hated her for leaving him. Addison said that she had a disease and was going to die, but she's still alive and she can have all the things she wants. She should live and tell her husband what their future held.

Angie and Ray returned to the practice and said they wanted to share what time they have together with a child and wanted help to conceive as soon as possible. Ray accepted that his wife was going to die and they both accepted the chance that the baby might also have Huntington's.



He is married to [[Angie Paget]].


He comes from a big family.

'''Raymond McCray''' is the biological father of [[Sam Bennett]].


Raymond came to Los Angeles with [[Dee Bennett]] and his wife, Jillian. Raymond needed cardiac studies after being in the ER a few weeks prior with chest pain. His symptoms had been getting worse since then. His EKG showed non-specific abnormalities, so Sam moved him to St. Ambrose for a chest CT and an echo.

Raymond's tests showed pulmonary hypertension. Sam started him on anti-coagulants and placed an umbrella, which he hoped would solve the problem. When Jillian and Sam left Raymond's hospital room, the camera crew caught Dee and Raymond kissing in his room. Sam walked back in time to see it as well.

Dee, Raymond, and Jillian all attended a barbecue at Sam's house a few days later. Raymond pulled Sam aside and said it wasn't a fling and he really loved Dee. Sam told him to get away from him. Raymond collapsed at the party and had to be rushed to the ER. They stabilized him and moved him to the OR to remove the clots.

During the surgery, he started to bleed into his chest. He survived the surgery, but was told he needed a lung transplant. Sam suggested they start testing family members, but Raymond and Jillian said they didn't have any children or nieces and nephews. Dee wanted to pray, but Jillian instead suggested that Sam get tested revealing that Raymond is his biological father. Jillian told Raymond she'd known all along, but hadn't said anything.

Dee talked to Sam about how their relationship played out. Sam decided to get tested to see if he was a match for Raymond. The test revealed that he was a match and he told Raymond he'd donate if Raymond wanted it. Raymond told Sam about how he'd watched Sam grow up and how he'd thought a lot about what would be different if they were a family. But he made the choice to stay with Jillian. He told Sam he wouldn't let Sam take a part of himself to save him. He was ready to go. Jillian took Raymond back home to die.



[[Jillian McCray]]
He's married to Jillian McCray. She knew of his affair and that he'd fathered two children with Dee.

[[Dee Bennett]]
Raymond had an affair lasting over  years with Dee Bennett. The relationship produced two children, Sam and Corinne. Raymond decided to stay with his wife instead of being a family with them.


He fathered two children with Dee Bennett, though they weren't aware he was their father until Jillian told Sam when he was an adult in order to prompt him to get tested as a potential match for a lung transplant.


He owns a print shop.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He gave Sam the toy stethoscope that started his interest in medicine.

'''Rebecca Bloom''' is a patient who wanted to have a vaginal birth, but ended up having a cesarean.


Rebecca was in labor. She was  cm. dilated, but only at minus  station. They decided to monitor her and perform a c-section if descent stopped entirely. Rebecca objected to that, saying she had a natural birth plan and [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] had agreed that they could try to stick to that.

By the time she was fully dilated, the baby was still only at minus  station. She insisted that the baby just needed more time, but the baby's heart rate was slowing with each contraction. She still wanted to continue with her birth plan.

Addison allowed it, but when the baby started having late decels, she was forced to perform a crash c-section. Rebecca's baby was healthy when born and she thanked Addison.



She is married to [[Jeff Bloom]].


She and her husband have one child, born via c-section after a long, difficult labor.

'''Rebecca Hobart''' was Addison and Sam's patient.


Rebecca left the hospital where she was on a psychiatric hold after seeing Sam on TV. She came to the practice with the hope that she would believe him. She was five months pregnant, but badly underweight. Addison said the baby was healthy despite being small. Rebecca said she'd had stomach problems her whole life and no one thought she could get pregnant. When [[Charlotte King]] came to the practice, she told them that Rebecca had been in and out of hospitals since she was eighteen and tests showed nothing. She'd been diagnosed with Munchausen syndrome. Addison made a case to keep her at the practice to be treated as she was having contractions. She wasn't convinced that Rebecca had Munchausen and asked Violet to do a psychiatric evaluation after she stopped Rebecca's contractions. Violet said she didn't seem to match the Munchausen profile.

Rebecca's mother arrived to take her back to the hospital. Her labs showed that she hadn't eaten in days, though she protested she had been eating, so Addison let them take her, but before they could leave, Sam made a case to keep her for a little longer to figure out what was really wrong. Mrs. Hobart agreed to give them one more hour.

They took her back to the hospital, but the doctors convinced Charlotte to let them run a GI study, which they used to diagnose her with Crohn's disease.



She has a boyfriend.


Rebecca's mother is her medical guardian. When she learned that Rebecca had Crohn's disease, she apologized for not believing her.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hobart, Rebecca}}

'''Rebecca "Bex" Singleton''' is a patient who came in with a hormonal imbalance and was found to have a tumor.


Bex had an enlarged pelvic lymph node that they had to biopsy. Before the biopsy, they ran labs that Bex had unbalanced hormone levels, indicating the use of birth control pills. George asked Bex about it and Bex said they were trying to make their breasts grow.

Addison took Bex for the biopsy, but they discovered that the tumor was compressing what they believed was an ovary. The pathology report revealed that it was actually a testes, meaning Bex is intersex. They talked to Bex's parents and called for a psych consult. The parents were told that physically, Bex would be fine as the tumor was benign, but the doctors encouraged the whole family to get therapy.

Bex's parents came to Addison and said they didn't want to tell Bex and asked Addison to remove the male sex organs when she went in to remove the tumor. Addison declined and said they'd have a hard time finding a doctor who would agree to it.

Before Bex's surgery, unable to lie, George forced Bex's parents to tell them about their condition. Bex's parents were upset and George was taken off the case, but he later went to check on Bex and said they didn't have to be a boy, but they could if they wanted to. He then started to cut Bex's hair at Bex's request. Bex's parents came in and their mother took over the haircut.



Bex's parents were unable to help when they struggled with depression in middle school. When they found out Bex was intersex, they tried to have Bex's male sex organs removed and didn't plan to tell Bex about it. However, after George started to cut Bex's hair, Bex's mother stepped in and finished.


Bex had a best friend named Jen who stopped hanging out with them when she became interested in boys.


*Bex likes to draw comics.
*Bex cut themselves.
*Bex was  at the time of their hospitalization.

'''Renee''' is the mother of [[Kelli]] and [[Niki]].


Renee labored and gave birth. The baby had been conceived because her older twin girls, [[Kelli]] and [[Niki]], had cancer and they needed to cord blood to treat them. After he was born, Renee declined to hold Trevor, more concerned about getting the cord blood.

Niki and Kelli had been admitted to the hospital in preparation for the transfusion. Addison looked at the cord blood. The sample was good, but there weren't enough cells for both girls. Renee said she couldn't choose between them, but they didn't have time to have another baby. Jerry said he could decide, that he could pick one of his girls to save. He felt guilty for knowing he could do it. He then chose Kelli and said to give her the cord blood. However, Renee stopped him, saying not to do it and told Jerry he was going to hell for making the choice.

Niki went into sepsis and Cooper believed she'd relapsed. She told Cooper she didn't want to die. Cooper believed he could get her into remission, but she'd need the cord blood. Jerry said no, to give the blood to Kelli. Cooper said he couldn't without both parents' permission, so Jerry said he'd get a court order because he didn't want Kelli to die because Renee couldn't make the choice. Renee maintained that she couldn't choose one child over another, but Addison pointed out that she was already doing that by refusing to look at Trevor. She admitted she was worried he'd replace them.

After talking with Renee and Jerry, Cooper told Niki and Kelli that Niki was too sick to get the treatment, so they'd give it to Kelli and Niki wouldn't get better. Kelli said she didn't want it because she and Niki do everything the same. Niki told Kelli she had to get better and gave her her hat, which she said was lucky.

Jerry stayed with Niki while Kelli went to get her transfusion and Renee brought Trevor to her so she could spend some time with her brother.



She is married to [[Jerry (Shotgun)|Jerry]].

'''Renee Olsen''' is a patient who came in for an abortion.


Renee was referred to [[Meg Porter]] for an abortion. She came into the practice, but when Dell found out why she was there, he told her his opinion on abortion, which caused her to leave.

Renee later returned to the practice, saying Dell had come to find her and talked to her. Meg took her back and performed the abortion.

After the procedure, Renee thanked Dell before she left.


*Her abortion was the first ever performed at [[Oceanside Wellness Group]].

'''Reyna Reyes''' is a pregnant woman who was in danger of being deported.


Reyna came into the ER  weeks pregnant with nausea and vomiting. Addison examined her and Reyna said her baby needed to come. She admitted that she'd had a drink that she was told would induce labor. She drank so much, it became toxic to her, so they had to give her charcoal to absorb some of it. She said she'd done it because she was being deported back to El Salvador and wanted her baby to stay in the US.

Addison didn't want to induce labor because she was worried about a baby being born at  weeks. Pete, however, pointed out that if the baby went back to El Salvador, the quality of life would be much lower than what they could expect in the US.

Pete talked to Reyna about life in El Salvador. He'd spent a year down there setting up a clinic, but Reyna told him the doctors had left and it was just an empty building.

Addison told Reyna she needed to understand the risks of having the baby early, but Reyna told Addison she needed to understand the risks of having the baby back in El Salvador. She'd applied for asylum, but was denied and lost her appeal.

Immigration came to the hospital to take Reyna and deport her. Addison made the decision to induce labor and allow Reyna to labor and give birth. The baby was born and he was healthy. Reyna decided to hold him for as long as she could. Addison had Charlotte tell Immigration that Reyna wasn't able to be moved that day.

Addison talked to Reyna about her decision to leave her baby and said there had to be a better way. Pete offered to go back to El Salvador with her to help her while she applied to return to the US.

Reyna disappeared from her hospital bed. She had taken her son and run.



She said she had no family back in El Salvador. Her parents were dead and her brother had left home years ago.


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Reyes, Reyna}}

'''Rich''' is a man who had a lesion in his brain that caused an increase in his sex drive.


Rich and his wife, Lori, were in couples counseling. Lori said that Rich had suddenly started wanting sex all the time, more than a normal fluctuation. She worried about their daughter, Whitney, because Rich had started looking at her weirdly and going into the bathroom while she was showering. He admitted that he had sexual feelings about his daughter and he couldn't control them. He'd never touched her, but she was scared of him. When Rich confessed that, Lori said she wanted him out of the house, saying he was a monster. Rich started seizing in Sheldon's office.

An EEG showed a lesion on Rich's brain that was causing the seizures and the hypersexuality and lack of impulse control. Amelia said she could operate and remove the lesion, which would relieve him of the symptoms. Despite the risks, Rich decided he wanted the surgery because he didn't want to be a danger to Whitney.

Before Rich's surgery, he asked Amelia to kill him if she couldn't get all the lesion.

After surgery, Amelia told Rich she'd gotten the whole lesion, but he'd need time to recover fully. During that time, he would continue to see Sheldon and Whitney would continue to see Violet. He wouldn't be able to go home until they agreed that that's what was best for his family. Lori and Whitney visited him in his hospital room and he promised Whitney he'd do everything he could to earn back her trust and he hoped it was possible. Whitney and Lori then left the room without saying anything. Violet told Rich that Whitney was brave and hopeful.



He is married to [[Lori]].


He was disturbed when he started having sexual thoughts toward his daughter, Whitney. He decided to have risky surgery in order to stop those thoughts and urges and agreed to live out of the house until his doctors felt he wasn't a risk to his daughter.

'''Rick''' is the ex-husband of [[Carol]].


[[Lisa (The Other Side of This Life)|Lisa]] was chosen by [[Carol]] and Rick, who were married at the time, to be their surrogate. However, the week she was inseminated, she had sex with Rick, [[Doug]] (Carol's current husband), and her own husband, [[Jim (Season )|Jim]], meaning that any of them could be the father of the baby.

Right after having sex, she left town, meaning she hadn't had any prenatal care. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] brought her in for an examination. She did an ultrasound and an amniocentesis. The ultrasound showed placenta accreta. The tests also determined that despite Lisa being implanted with an embryo made of Carol's egg and Rick's sperm, the baby had no genetic ties to Carol.

They held a meeting with all the people involved and told them the situation. Lisa asked if that meant that she could keep the baby and she was told that legally, she could. She was also told that she would be taken in for a c-section if she went into labor. Lisa said she wanted Addison to take over her medical care. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''

Lisa later came into the practice in pain. Her water broke and she was rushed to the hospital. Addison planned to do a c-section, but in the OR, Lisa started crowning. Addison warned her not to push as the cord was wrapped around the baby's neck. The baby was quickly delivered. Addison said she should be able to deliver the placenta easily, but Lisa hemorrhaged from a uterine rupture, likely due to her placenta accreta. Addison had her sedated and she repaired the damage.

Addison was able to stop the bleeding and Lisa and the baby were both stable, so went to deliver the news to the group, but they were more concerned with which of them was the father. Because of their reaction, Addison ordered that none of them could go near Lisa or the baby.

Lisa held the baby and the doctors asked her what she wanted to do with the baby. They had the paternity results, but Lisa didn't want to know and she already knew what she wanting to do with the baby. She turned the baby over to Carol on the condition they'd all be in her life. ''("[[The Other Side of This Life, Part ]]")''



Rick was previously married to [[Carol]]. They decided to have a baby together, so they chose a surrogate and had her implanted with one of their embryos. However, he and Carol then split up and Rick married [[Keith (The Other Side of This Life)|Keith]].


Lisa gave birth to a healthy baby girl. She decided to turn the baby over to Carol on the condition that they'd all be a part of her life, giving the baby two moms and three dads.
