You deserve to have the face of the man who loves you be the last thing that you see. And I deserve the chance to love you for as long as I can, for as hard as I can. '''Shimmon Gold''' is a man who had no desire for sex after the birth of his latest child.


Shimmon's wife, Rachel, brought their two month old, Ruthie, in for a well-baby visit. Cooper examined her and said she was perfectly healthy. He asked Rachel how she was doing, because Ruthie had six kids under the age of eight. Rachel said she was fine, but when pressed, she said that Shimmon wasn't interested in having sex with her since Ruthie was born. She then said she didn't think Cooper could help and that it wasn't proper to talk to him about it.

Cooper went to Violet and Charlotte to talk about it. They brought in Rachel, who said that it had happened after previous births, but this one was persisting longer. When she talked about his other symptoms, Charlotte diagnosed couvade, his body mimicking her pregnancy symptoms. They suggested several options to get him back in the mood. However, she said that she didn't want that because while she loved her six kids, she couldn't raise or ask Shimmon to provide for any more than that. They also couldn't use birth control, so the couvade was a good way to keep them from having more kids. Violet and Charlotte suggested having Shimmon come in to talk about other options.

Believing he wouldn't talk to a woman, Cooper sat down with Shimmon and asked if he ever thought there'd be a point where he'd want to stop having kids. Shimmon replied that the Torah tells them to be fruitful and multiply to fill the earth. They interpreted it as doing nothing to stop a pregnancy from happening. He said he loves his wife and didn't want to stop being intimate with her. Cooper suggested other options that aren't birth control, but Shimmon said they'd chosen to be faithful and wouldn't fool God anyway.

They brought in a rabbi to get a religious perspective. He said that there were options, but the Golds sounded like they wanted to live by the letter of the law. The doctors then discussed other options. When they talked about what the pill has in it, Violet figured out a solution. They brought the Golds back in to tell them they had lots of options if they decided to use them. As they were leaving, Violet said that she believed Rachel might be anemic, common among young mothers. She gave her oral contraceptives to help, saying they contain iron. She said if she felt like she needed it, it would be up to her. Rachel took the pills and left with her husband and kids.



He is married to [[Rachel Gold]]. She says he's very lovely and she loves being intimate with him.


He and his wife have six children under the age of eight.


He works two jobs six days a week.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gold, Shimmon}}

'''Shira Cole''' is a pregnant woman who started having contractions at  weeks.


When Shira was  weeks pregnant, she started having contractions, so she saw Pete to try to stop the contractions. Before he could start acupuncture, her contractions intensified and Naomi said it could be active labor. Shira's water broke and blood was present.

They called Addison because of the bleeding and she determined that Shira had had a placental abruption. Shira begged her not to let the baby be born, but Addison was forced to deliver him in the ambulance because they couldn't stop her contractions. Shira was rushed into surgery to stop her bleeding while her baby, Langston, was taken to the NICU.

Langston struggled greatly in the NICU. He weighed less than two pounds and a cerebral hemorrhage, as well as necrotizing enterocolitis. Addison offered them surgery, but made it clear that he'd have a whole series of surgeries and would be suffered between them. They decided they wanted the surgery. Addison agreed after some reluctance.

In surgery, Addison found no clear margins and said there was no part of the bowel she could save. She was forced to close without doing anything. When she told Shira and Matthew, they asked for odds. She said there was a less than % chance he'd leave the NICU. Addison said she could put in a central line to feed him, but she refused to do another surgery.

Matthew asked Pete about Dr. Graham at County. Pete said Graham was good, but he supported Addison's decision. When Shira talked about never having touched him, Naomi said there was a way she could hold him. Shira agreed to let him go, but Matthew needed more convincing that it was the right thing to do.

Langston was disconnected from his machines and his mother held him and sang to him as he died.



She is married to [[Matthew Cole]].


She and her husband are both English teachers.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Cole, Shira}}

{{Patient Infobox
|image = PPSimonMcConnell.png
|name = Simon McConnell
|status = Alive
|marital = [[Angie McConnell]] ''(wife)''
|children = Three children
|first appearance = [[Triangles]]
|last appearance = [[Eyes Wide Open]]
|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Michael Reilly Burke]]
}}
'''Simon McConnell''' is the father of the babies carried by [[Kayla Lindy]].


Kayla, acting as a surrogate for Angie and Simon, was pregnant with triplets. At  weeks, she was on bed rest because of a blood clot. Even with heparin, she was forming more clots. Addison recommended reducing the pregnancy to one, but Angie and Simon opposed the idea.

The McConnells called in [[Vanessa Hoyt]] as a consult and she believed that it was safe for Kayla to continue the pregnancy as triplets.

Sam agreed to do the surgery on Kayla. It was successful.

Kayla was stable for a while after the surgery, but then she started forming clots above the umbrella. Addison rushed her into surgery to reduce the pregnancy load. Before she could do that, Kayla started throwing more clots and they needed to close and move her to ICU. Her heart stopped when a clot moved to her lung. There was no evidence of higher brain function and she was put on life support. The McConnells asked about the baby that was left and were told that the reduction hadn't been performed. As long as Kayla was on the ventilator, the babies would continue to grow. ''("[[Triangles]]")''

As Kayla was in a coma, Eddie decided he wanted to turn the machines off, believing Kayla wouldn't want to live like that. Vanessa, opposing the decision, went to Simon and Angie and told them about it. They believed Kayla would want them to continue life support until the babies were born. Eddie still insisted he just wanted Kayla to have peace. The McConnells got a lawyer to prevent him from turning off the machines. Only essential medical personnel were allowed in Kayla's room while they waited for a judge to rule on what would happen.

Eddie waited outside Kayla's room in the hallway. He called some lawyers, but couldn't afford any of them. [[Charlotte King]] gave him the name of a lawyer at a non-profit aid group and encouraged him to call.

The judge came in and ruled that Kayla's life would have to continue until viability had been reached. She also ordered that her room continued to be closed to all but essential medical personnel.

Charlotte later saw Eddie waiting outside Kayla's room, so she left the door unlocked and told him the nurse was on break. He went into her room and locked the door. He then disconnected her ventilator. They broke a window to get into the room, but before they could reconnect the ventilator, they saw that Kayla was breathing on her own. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''

After six weeks in a coma, Eddie called in [[Geraldine Ginsberg]] to try to wake Kayla up. After she ran tests and examined Kayla, Ginsberg believed nothing could be done. However, [[Amelia Shepherd]], who was on Ginsberg's team, had an idea. Ginsberg believed it wouldn't work, so she refused to do it. When Ginsberg fired Amelia, she stayed to help Kayla. After speaking with Eddie, Amelia agreed to do the surgery.

After hearing about what Amelia had planned, the McConnells asked her not to operate, to give them a little more time so the babies could mature more. Despite this, she operated. During the surgery, the three babies had to be delivered, but Amelia was then able to finish the procedure.

After surgery, Kayla's reflexes started to re-emerge and she woke up. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''



He is married to [[Angie McConnell]].


He and his wife have three kids, carried by [[Kayla Lindy]].

'''Simone Parker''' was a home healthcare worker working for [[Abe Nussbaum]].


Simone was hired to care for Abe Nussbaum in his home. Instead, she enabled his unhealthy habits and when she took him to the practice for a checkup, Pete discovered that she was stealing from him.

Sam called her in to talk to her about the theft. She denied it, but then said it was because the pay wasn't good and she had debt. He told her to leave and never see Abe again. She left, saying that Abe wouldn't press charges because he loves her.


She did in-home care for [[Abe Nussbaum]].

{{Patient Infobox
|image = PPxSissy.png
|name = Sissy
|status = Alive
|marital = [[Aaron]] ''(husband)''
|only appearance = [[The Standing Eight Count]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Natalie Avital]]
}}
'''Sissy''' is the wife of [[Aaron]].


Sissy's husband, Aaron, was in a session with Sheldon. He talked about the incident that led him to therapy. He and his partner had been following a car after an armed robbery. The driver ran out of the car, so Aaron followed him. He cornered him. The man reached for his waistband, so Aaron shot him. He later found out the man was unarmed. He said he felt like he'd followed protocol. Sheldon, believing there was more to it, asked if he was sleeping. Aaron said he just wanted to get back to work. When Sheldon pressed, he said that he sometimes sees things on the job that he can't describe to his wife. Sheldon said Aaron could talk to him about it. Their session was interrupted by [[Joe Price]], who said he needed to take Aaron home. Sheldon said Aaron wasn't ready to go back to work. Joe said he needed Sheldon to sign off on him returning to work because internal affairs was still investigating and Sheldon not signing off would be a red flag.

Sheldon went to Aaron's house and spoke to him and Sissy. They'd gotten threats because of what the papers were saying about the shooting. Sissy said the night before the shooting, Aaron had driven a kid from corner to corner to find his mom because she'd left him to find drugs.

Aaron and Sheldon spoke without Sissy and Sheldon said that he didn't believe Aaron was ready to go back to work. Without work, Aaron said, all he did was sit around and replay the night, seeing the perp's face over and over again. He admitted that he'd lied when he said the perp reached for his waistband. Aaron said he was just scared, so he fired.

Joe told Sheldon that Aaron had tried to quit. Sheldon said that he needed to keep seeing Aaron and wouldn't clear him until he was ready.

Sheldon went to Aaron's house and found him playing baseball with neighborhood kids. He didn't want to agree to keep seeing Sheldon, but Sheldon said that if he didn't sign off on Aaron's psych evaluation, it would be almost impossible to get back on the force. And if he signed off on Aaron returning to work, Aaron would still have to deal with the trauma, but all by himself.

Aaron went to internal affairs and told them the truth about what happened, potentially ending his career.



She is married to [[Aaron]].

{{Patient Infobox
|name = Amy
|image = PPSisterAmy.png
|status = Alive
|diagnosis = Typhoid
|doctors = *[[Sam Bennett]]
*[[Naomi Bennett]]
|treatment = Antibiotics
|job = Nun
|workplace = St. Mary's
|only appearance = [[In Which Cooper Finds a Port in His Storm]]
|seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season  (Private Practice)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Keiko Agena]]
}}'''Amy''' is one of the nuns who was part of the typhoid outbreak.


Amy greeted Sam and Naomi when they came to the convent to tend to a sick nun. It was the first time she'd been out of the convent in three weeks because they'd been sequestered together. She led them into the convent to Sister Helen. They examined Virginia and took pictures of her rash to send to an infectious disease specialist. Soon after they arrived, [[Sister Virginia]] also started to show signs of the illness. They decided to send Helen out to the hospital, but before they could take her, they noticed that it was spreading quickly and isolated the building. The nuns continued to worsen and the infectious disease specialist came back with a diagnosis of typhoid. They moved all the nuns to the hospital and began treating with antibiotics, though the cause of the outbreak was still a mystery as the incubation period was only two weeks and they'd been sequestered for three weeks. They traced the source to [[Father Mark]], who was a non-symptomatic carrier.


Amy is a nun. Her convent travels the world doing mission work.

'''Sonya Nichols''' is a doctor and former love interest of [[Sam Bennett]].



When [[Michael Perkins]] was diagnosed with measles after being at [[Oceanside Wellness Group]], Sam called the county health department. They sent Sonya, who quickly started to look over all the practice's records and interview everyone. She criticized their lack of preparedness and Sam spent the entire day running around, trying to make sure things were as they should be. After her evaluation was done, Sam asked if she liked being a bully. She asked him if he knew what it was like to have everyone hate him before they've even met him. She told him she took the job because she wanted to do good things. ''("[[Contamination]]")''



After Sonya finished evaluating the practice after a measles case came through, she admitted to Sam that she'd spent the whole day thinking about how his lips might taste like chocolate and she couldn't look at them. They then shared a kiss and later went out dancing together. ''("[[Contamination]]")''

Their relationship progressed and she met [[Maya Bennett|Maya]], which made Naomi jealous. ''("[[Homeward Bound]]")''

They dated for a while before consummating their relationship. The night they first attempted to have sex, Sonya ended up having to call  because he had an asthma attack. Naomi took Sam to Pete to get a treatment for anxiety-induced asthma so they could finally have sex. ''("[[Second Chances]]")''

After Sam went to Seattle to be with Archer and Naomi, Sonya questioned him about why he went. He said he went to support Naomi because she doesn't always have it all together. They continued to see each other happily until Sam called Sonya by the name of [[Naomi Bennett|Naomi]], signaling he was not over her. ''("[[Wait and See]]")''

They fought over it and Sam insisted that he wasn't thinking about Naomi while they were having sex. Despite this, she refused him sex. Sam tried to mend fences by getting Naomi's help to plan a vacation. Their vacation went well, but Naomi said afterward that she was done helping him with Sonya. Sonya came to him about a date and he admitted that you don't call out your ex's name if your new relationship is working. He ended things with her. ''("[[Finishing]]")''


Sonya Nichols is a doctor working for the County Health Department. She is constantly harsh because even before she enters a building, she is disliked. ''("[[Contamination]]")''

'''Stacy Hatcher''' is the mother of [[Tyler Hatcher]].


Stacy's son, Tyler, a wrestler, passed out while wrestling. He'd also had some dizziness while wrestling at other times. The next day was the conference finals and Tyler needed to do well to get a scholarship to college. Cooper examined him and heard a heart murmur, so he told Tyler and his parents he wanted him to get checked out by Sam. They wanted to get it done today and needed Cooper to sign a medical release saying that Tyler could wrestle again.

Sam diagnosed Tyler with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, but said he could still wrestle. There were risks, but there was a chance he could do it without any problems. Despite his recommendation, Cooper said he couldn't allow Tyler to wrestle.

Tyler came to Cooper and said his mom had gotten laid of and his dad was working double shifts to pay the rent. He worked a part-time job on the weekends to help out. Wrestling was his way to get to college. Cooper just said he couldn't risk it and had scheduled a cardiac MRI for Tyler.

Tyler's dad, Randy, came into the hospital, saying he understood how important getting the MRI was. He was surprised that Tyler hadn't arrived because his mother had said she'd bring him. They then figured out she had taken him to the conference finals instead.

They arrived at the match and tried to get [[Coach Patterson]] to stop it. He said that the medical release had been signed, but Stacy had forged it. Tyler won his match, but shortly after, went into cardiac arrest. They rushed him to the hospital, where they were able to restart his heart, but he was deprived of oxygen long enough that there was the potential for brain damage. They put him in a medically-induced coma. Stacy said that Tyler had come to her, saying how much he wanted it. Everything he'd always worked for to get a chance for something better.

While they waited on Tyler, his mother showed Cooper a letter from UCLA. They'd already decided to give him a full scholarship before the finals. Stacy and Randy cried at their son's bedside.



She is married to [[Randy Hatcher]].

'''Stan''' is a patient who came in because he was fainting often.


Stan came in to see Pete with his fianc\uee, Sylvie, when she was worried because he kept passing out in the middle of activities. While talking to Pete, he got up to leave, but fell to the floor. He awoke quickly, but had hit his head and needed stitches. Pete ran some tests, which showed nothing noteworthy, but he continued to look for the answer.

He suddenly had an idea. He asked them if they'd been having a lot of sex in the same position. They had because his sciatica restricted their options, so he said the repetitive motion had caused a pressure point, which caused painless migraines and caused him to pass out. He said they could do intensive muscle therapy to work it out and treat the sciatica so they could try some other positions.



He is engaged to [[Sylvie]].


*He was  at the time of his problems.

{{Nurse Infobox |image = PPx-.jpg |name = Stephanie Kemp |status = Alive |alias = Steph |job = Nurse |parents = Mother |workplace = '''Current'''
[[St. Ambrose Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[UCLA Medical Center]] |first appearance = [[Aftershock]] |last appearance = [[In Which We Say Goodbye]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Private Practice|PP]]:''' [[Season (Private Practice)|]] |portrayed by = [[Justina Machado]] }} '''Stephanie Kemp''' is a nurse at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] who dated [[Sam Bennett]] for a time. When [[Debra Diamanti]] went into labor, Stephanie attended to her as she labored, reassuring her that everything would be okay. ''("[[Aftershock]]")'' Stephanie came down to the ER to attend to [[Pam Reiter]], who was in labor. Pam inadvertently revealed to Stephanie that Sam had previously dated Addison. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")'' When Charlotte was put on bed rest after the first of her triplets was born at weeks, Stephanie was Charlotte's choice to take care of her. She decided to make Stephanie her private nurse, despite Stephanie being the floor manager. Stephanie continued to care for her during her pregnancy. When Stephanie told Addison that Charlotte had adjusted her own magnesium drip, Charlotte was upset and tried to get another nurse and then tried to fire Stephanie. Stephanie pointed out all the other nurses would rather quit than take care of her. ''("[[Georgia on My Mind]]")'' When Charlotte went into labor, Stephanie started off attending to her, but tried to leave when her shift was ending. However, Charlotte manipulated her into staying until the delivery was completed. ''("[[Full Release]]")'' Stephanie attended Jake and Addison's wedding at Sam's date. However, at the wedding, he slept with Naomi, resulting in her pregnancy. Despite cheating, he continued to see Stephanie. He later broke things off with her and she knew it was because of Naomi. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")'' [[Sam Bennett]] Stephanie and Sam starting dating after [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Addison]] chose [[Jake Reilly|Jake]] over him. ''("[[Aftershock]]")'' Stephanie was upset with Sam for not sharing any information about his past relationships. He talked to her and said he liked her and didn't want to be the guy she talked about to the next guy. ''("[[Good Grief]]")'' Stephanie was shocked to learn that not only had Sam dated Addison, but had been friends with him for over years and lived next door to him. He hadn't mentioned anything about Addison to her. Sam talked to Stephanie about Addison and assured her that he and Addison were done. When Stephanie learned it had ended because she turned down his marriage proposal, she was even more upset. She told him she thought he was one and felt stupid for thinking that so early on. She said he was fantastic, but then said goodbye. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")'' They ran into each other again when Sam came to visit Charlotte, whom Stephanie was taking care of. They awkwardly greeted each other. When Sam came to visit a second time, Charlotte watched them interact. Once Sam was gone, she asked Stephanie if she was still into Sam. Stephanie refused to answer, but Charlotte asked her if she'd give Sam another chance. When Charlotte later told Sam to get back with Stephanie, he said he could make his own choice, but then told Stephanie he chose her and said he wouldn't make the same mistakes again. ''("[[Georgia on My Mind]]")'' Despite Sam attending Jake and Addison's wedding with her, Sam slept with Naomi, resulting in her pregnancy. Despite this, she and Sam continued to see each other without her knowing he'd cheated. Three months later, Sam started to break up with Stephanie. She tried to leave before he said it because she didn't want him to see her cry, but before she left, she told him the next time he got a second chance with a woman, he should mean it. She knew he was leaving her for Naomi, whom she said she actually liked when she met her. ''("[[In Which We Say Goodbye]]")'' Josh She had a past boyfriend named Josh whom she lived with. He had a habit of getting high and cheating on her, so she kicked him out and threw herself into her work. ''("[[Good Grief]]")'' [[Charlotte King]] While Charlotte was confined to bed rest during the remainder of her pregnancy after the delivery of Georgia, Stephanie quickly became the only nurse who could tolerate her. ''("[[Georgia on My Mind]]")'' During the delivery of the remaining two triplets, Stephanie stayed past the end of her shift at Charlotte's prompting. ''("[[Full Release]]")'' She is a floor manager nurse at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]]. Addison said Stephanie was one of the best labor and delivery nurses she'd ever worked with. ''("[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]]")'' Before coming to St. Ambrose, she worked at UCLA. *She was years old while dating Sam. *Although she was Sam's love interest during at least half of the season, she does not appear in the episode that is Sam-centric. *Her mother wouldn't let her have gum as a child, because she said it looked like a cow chewing the cud.[[Georgia on My Mind]], x (PP) PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[Aftershock]] PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[Good Grief]] PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[You Don't Know What You've Got Till It's Gone]] PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[Georgia on My Mind]] PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[Full Release]] PPxStephanieKemp.png|[[In Which We Say Goodbye]] PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg PPx-.jpg {{Stephanie Kemp Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kemp, Stephanie}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:PP Characters]] [[Category:PP S Characters]] [[Category:Nurses]]

'''Steven Stone''' is the husband of [[Elena Stone]].


Steven's wife, Elena, was  weeks pregnant and came into the ER in severe pain. Pete called in Addison, who did an ultrasound. She'd had chronic pain for the last five years, but no one had been able to find any cause. The baby was fine, but Addison believed the pregnancy was exasperating her condition. Pete believed she had fibromyalgia. They couldn't use meds because it was dangerous for the baby and they didn't have time for alternative methods to work.

Her pain worsened and she asked for something to help with the pain. She was told she couldn't have anything because anything strong enough to help would hurt the baby. She asked about delivering the baby, but she hadn't yet reached viability. She said that if they couldn't help, she couldn't continue the pregnancy.

Steven begged them not to let her terminate. She didn't want a kid in the first place, but he pushed her and now he can't touch her because of the pain, so he'd never felt the baby kick, but he was excited about the baby.

When Amelia overheard Pete and Addison discussing her case, she told them to run an MRI. The MRI showed a chiari malformation. It put pressure on her brain, causing her pain. Amelia said she could operate. Pete opposed surgery, suggesting alternative methods.

They went to the Stones with their plans and Elena decided she wanted the surgery after Addison said she recommended it.

They operated and Elena and the baby were both stable afterward. When she woke up, she had a headache, but was otherwise pain-free. Steven was able to feel the baby kick for the first time.



He is married to [[Elena Stone]]. He says that when he met her, he fell hard and fast. He also said that at some point, the thing that drew him to her was gone, possibly as a result of her disease.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Stone, Steven}}

'''Stevie Walker''' is the son of [[David Walker]] who also got mysteriously sick.


Stevie's father, David, had a headache and nausea and called Sam at the practice to get a house call. Sam arrived and found Dave on the kitchen floor. Dave's mother, Gloria, seemed dazed and wouldn't let Sam in, so he broke a window. By that point, Stevie was with his father, who was unresponsive. Sam called an ambulance and had the paramedics take Stevie and Gloria along with Dave to the hospital, worried about leaving Gloria in charge of Stevie. In the ER, Dave was quickly discharged at his own request. Later, Stevie came to the practice with the same symptoms of his father. Suspicious, Sam ran tests and found coprine in Stevie's blood, a natural antabuse from ink cap mushrooms. He deduced that Gloria had been feeding them to Dave to get him to stop drinking, because drinking made him violently ill after consuming the mushrooms. Sam spoke to Gloria privately, trying to convince her to stop, but she was unwilling to do so because she knew she didn't have much time left to live and didn't want her son to keep drinking, as she knew he would end up dead. Sam called Stevie and Dave into his office and lied to them, saying that Dave was allergic to alcohol and that it could be genetic, so Stevie also shouldn't drink to be safe.



His father is an alcoholic and his mother left them. Stevie was living with his father and his grandmother.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Walker, Stevie}}

'''Susan Grant''' was the assistant and secret lover of [[Bizzy Forbes]] for twenty years.



Susan came along with Bizzy when she was summoned to Los Angeles to talk to Addison. Addison was shocked to find Susan kissing Bizzy and even more shocked to learn they'd been together for  years. ''("[[Blowups]]")''


Bizzy called Addison in the middle of the night when Susan became sick. They then flew to Los Angeles to get Addison's help. ''("[[Just Lose It]]")''

Susan had stage IV ovarian cancer. Addison ran tests and then had to deliver the news that the cancer had spread and there was nothing she could do. Bizzy slapped Addison and commanded Addison to save Susan's life. Addison called in [[Eric Rodriguez]] and asked for his professional advice. He agreed that there was nothing there could do, but agreed to do some research and consult with colleagues. He suggested that Addison scope her. When Addison did the scope, she saw that the tumor had spread to her liver. She suggested not doing anything, but Bizzy kept pushing, so Addison suggested using the [[Da Vinci Surgical System]] to get angles she couldn't get with her own hands. Susan agreed to try it for Bizzy. Addison brought Eric in on the surgery to use hot chemo to kill the cancer cells left behind. They were able to remove the cancer and place her port for chemo. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

After her surgery, Susan was doing well and was discharged from the hospital. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''


Bizzy, wanting to give Susan the wedding she wanted, had Addison plan an elaborate ceremony. When Addison went to check to see if Susan was dressed for the wedding, she discovered that Susan wasn't better. She knew that her cancer had come back and had chosen to be discharged anyway because she wanted her wedding. She said she'd signed a DNR and didn't want Addison to tell Bizzy. After the wedding, Susan collapsed. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''


Susan was rushed to the hospital, where they rushed to try to save her life. She was in septic shock. They were able to stabilize her and started antibiotics. She had an infection because the chemo had destroyed her immune system. Susan then developed a clot in her lungs, but because of her DNR, Addison was unable to do anything about it. Shortly after Bizzy arrived back at the hospital, Susan died. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''



[[File:PPx-.jpg|thumb|left|Bizzy and Susan at their wedding.]]
[[Bizzy Forbes]]
She had a  year secret relationship with Bizzy.

When Bizzy and Susan returned to Los Angeles, after Susan had surgery, Bizzy told Addison that she had divorced The Captain and was marrying Susan. ''("[[If You Don't Know Me By Now]]")''

Addison planned an elaborate wedding and the two married. ''("[[Heaven Can Wait]]")''

When Susan died, Bizzy killed herself. ''("[[Blind Love]]")''


*She is close in age to Addison.<ref>[[Blowups]], x (PP)</ref>

'''Susan McCullough''' is a woman who gave birth after her husband died.


Susan was widowed early on in her pregnancy. When she reached term, she had a very specific labor and birth plan she wanted to follow because she'd be having panic attacks. She had every contingency written out and had prepared for every outcome she could think of.

They did relaxation techniques as she labored on the birthing ball. After a few hours, she started crying and said there's really no rule book for doing it on your own. Addison reminded her that she could call in one of the guys from the waiting room, Jason's co-workers who were there to support her. She said they wouldn't understand how lonely it is.

Susan moved to the birthing pool to finish her labor. She dropped the sheet with her contingencies into the water and started to panic. She said she couldn't do it and felt something was wrong. Pete and Addison tried to talk her through her panic, but she wasn't able to calm down, so Addison climbed into the birthing tub behind her and held her through her delivery.

After the baby was born, she thanked Pete for his help.



She was married to Jason McCullough until he was killed in the line of duty.


Her son was  pounds and  ounces at birth. She named him after his father.

{{DEFAULTSORT:McCullough, Susan}}

}}
'''Susanna Palmer''' is the mother of [[Danielle Palmer]].


Susanna's daughter, Danielle, was homeless and living on the street with her son, Elliot. At the homeless shelter's clinic day, Addison examined her and gave her birth control samples and hygiene products. Addison recommended that in order to get her and her son regular doctors visit, she could apply for Medi-Cal, but she said she didn't have the required documents. Addison asked if she had anyone else helping, because she was so young herself. She said her mom was out of the picture, had told her that if she wanted to keep her baby, she had to leave.

Elliot had had a runny nose for weeks. Danielle said she had given him cold medicine, but it hadn't helped. Addison said he had a fever and called Cooper over to look at him. Cooper found a large rash on his belly and said that they needed to go back to the practice for an EKG. The EKG revealed aneurysms in the blood vessels leading to his heart, indicating Kawasaki syndrome. Cooper said they could treat with immunoglobulin, but because Elliot and Danielle were homeless, Sam suggested a bypass procedure as a more permanent solution. To help, Addison suggested that they try to find Danielle's mom.

Elliot was admitted to the hospital for treatment. Danielle was worried about getting back to the shelter by eight, but Sam said she could stay in the room with Elliot. Addison located Danielle's mom and said she was on her way to the hospital. Susanna came and said that she'd looked for Danielle, but couldn't find her. She said that Danielle could come home, but Danielle said that her mother had driven her to an abortion clinic and when she wouldn't do it, told her she had to give the baby up for adoption. When Susanna wouldn't leave, Danielle said she would and took Elliot and left.

Cooper and Addison went out to look for them and found Danielle trying to stop Elliot from crying. Addison said that they needed to get him back to the hospital and called an ambulance.

One of his aneurysms had ruptured. Danielle was presented with options and told that bypass was the better option and Sam said he could do it. Danielle told him to do it.

Susanna told Addison she'd spoken to an attorney and she'd be petitioning for custody after the surgery. Addison told her she was an ass. Danielle's a mother now, too, and she should be considerate of that. Susanna said she needed to think for Danielle and not about her.

Cooper later found Danielle stealing supplies from a hospital supply room. He told her that when she decided to have Elliot, she made the decision to do what was best for him. She told him about not being able to buy Elliot cheese puffs because she needed the money for the bus.

When Elliot was out of surgery, Danielle and Susanna were told he'd be okay. Susanna went to leave, but Danielle invited her to go see Elliot.



She was estranged from her daughter for a few years after her grandson was born.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Palmer, Susanna}}

'''Sydney Harris''' is the mother of [[Zack Harris]], whom she gave marijuana.


Sydney came into the practice with a migraine, which Pete treated. She said she felt better, but that might be due to the fact that she got an hour away from her son, Zack, who is autistic. She was worried because he was getting bigger and therefore, harder to handle. Cooper noticed while with Zack that he was much calmer than the previous week, but his eyes were glassy, so he wanted to run some tests. Sydney declined. She said she stopped giving Zack his regular meds and was instead giving him the marijuana Pete gave her for her migraines.

Pete went to Justine's house. He said she needed to stop giving him the marijuana and they'd find other things to do for Zack. She became angry when Pete said he understood what she was going through and forced him to leave, saying she wouldn't give him Pete's pot anymore.

Without the pot, Zack's behaviors became more pronounced very quickly. Sydney begged Cooper to give Zack pot, but Cooper refused.

Sydney and Zack later came into the ER because Zack was in a rage. Sydney admitted she'd purchased marijuana off the street and Zack's tests showed it was laced with PCP. They were able to stabilize him, but they had to call the police. Sydney was arrested and Zack was turned over to DCFS.



Her husband left her because he couldn't handle Zack's autism.


She takes care of her autistic son, Zack, which she says is getting harder as he's getting bigger. He was taken away from her when she gave him marijuana she bought off the street.

'''Sylvie''' is the fianc\uee of [[Stan (In Which Addison Has a Very Casual Get Together)|Stan]].


Sylvie came to see Pete with her fianc\ue, Stan, who had been falling asleep during daily activities. She was worried about him. Pete struggled to figure out what was wrong with Stan, because the tests didn't show anything. Sylvie worried that it was stress and that Stan didn't want to marry her because it had started right after he proposed. However, he asked if they had a lot of sex in the same position. Sylvie confirmed that they did because of Stan's sciatica. Pete told them the repetitive motion caused a pressure point, which gave him painless migraines and caused him to pass out. Pete said they could do intense muscle therapy for the pressure point and treat the sciatica to give them a choice of positions.



She is engaged to [[Stan (In Which Addison Has a Very Casual Get Together)|Stan]]. She'd been married once before, but believed Stan was her one and only.

'''Tammy Larsen''' is a patient who came into the ER with a broken arm who was found to have a tumor causing rages.


Michelle, Darren, and Tammy Larsen came into the ER after a violent incident at their home. Tammy's arm was broken when her father threw her across the room and Michelle was beaten. However, Darren's injuries were the most severe. Michelle had stabbed him nine times. Cooper splinted Tammy's arm and said they'd cast it later. He also asked her if she wanted to talk about it and she said she couldn't. He said that people wanted to help her and she could talk about it later. She was worried about her dad.

Sam examined Darren and ordered a head CT. Darren asked if he'd be okay and asked about Michelle and Tammy. Sam told him it was a little late to be worried about them.

Since Michelle was pregnant, Addison did an ultrasound and said that the baby looked fine for ten weeks. She then asked Michelle if Darren hitting her and Tammy happened often. Michelle said it was an accident and asked to see Tammy. Addison asked again about the attack. Michelle said it wasn't like that. She said she was cooking. She and Darren started arguing and Tammy got in the way, so Darren pushed her. She got mad, overreacted, and stabbed him. As Addison took her to see Tammy, police officers showed up at the hospital to arrest Michelle. Addison said she needed medical care, so they told Addison to admit her to the jail ward and handcuffed her.

Michelle and Darren had conceived with assistance from Naomi because they wanted a sibling for Tammy.

Darren continued to insist to Sam that it was an accident. Darren had a seizure due to a brain contusion, which caused swelling in his brain. Sam put him in a drug-induced coma. They gave him mannitol to try to reduce the swelling in his brain.

Michelle maintained that Darren wasn't abusive, even when Addison advised her that she could go to jail if Darren died.

Cooper talked to Tammy about her dad being in a coma. He asked her to talk about what happened because her mom wasn't talking. He wanted her to tell the truth about what happened. She admitted that she was supposed to say it was an accident, but it wasn't. She was cutting a cantaloupe. Her dad came in and was being silly, singing along with the radio, but she got mad. She just gets so mad sometimes. Her dad could see that was happening. He held her to try to calm her down, but she bit him. He called for her mom, but Tammy still had the knife in her hand and stabbed him. And she was upset because he was going to die.

When Michelle was released from custody, she realized that meant that Tammy told the truth about what had happened. She believed it was her fault because she'd used drugs during her pregnancy with Tammy. Tammy had ADHD and then the rages started. Her school counselor said it was just adolescence, but Michelle was convinced it was her fault, because the test hadn't showed any other cause. She said Darren was the strong one and she needed him, but he was in a coma and she was worried Tammy would be taken away.

When juvenile officers came to take Tammy, Cooper asked to keep Tammy in the hospital for longer. He went to Tammy's room and found her in a rage, attacking a nurse. He restrained her an ordered lorazepam to calm her down.

The next day, Cooper consulted with Addison. Everything Cooper ran was negative, but Addison ordered an abdominal MRI, which showed an ectopic pheochromocytoma on her ovary. It released the excess adrenaline, which caused the rages. Addison told Michelle and Tammy about it and assured Michelle that nothing she did caused it. It was a simple surgery to remove it and then she wouldn't have the rage anymore. Tammy said she still felt guilty about her father.

Darren was still in his coma when Addison took Tammy into surgery. He wasn't a surgical candidate, but wasn't waking up.

Cooper talked to Tammy about her guilt, saying it wasn't her fault and he knew that people saying that wasn't making her feel better. She asked what would happen if he died and she didn't get to say she was sorry.

Darren woke up and Tammy visited to tell him she was sorry.



Her parents worked together to manage her rages.


*At different points, Cooper said Tammy was both ten and eleven years old.
*She's a starting fullback on her soccer team.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Larsen, Tammy}}

'''Tanya George''' is a teenager with down syndrome who became pregnant after having sex with [[Ricky (Two Steps Back)|Ricky]], who had learning disabilities.


Tanya came into the practice with her mother, Erin, who was worried because she'd caught Tanya having sex with Ricky, a classmate of hers who also had special needs. She had been complaining of stomach pains, so her mother asked Sam to run a pregnancy test. He did an ultrasound, which revealed that she was pregnant.

Her mother was worried she would be unable to carry a pregnancy safely because of her heart problems, but Sam said it would be high-risk, but not impossible. Erin then asked about how Tanya and Ricky would manage raising a child, especially if the baby also had special needs. The baby had a % chance of having Down syndrome. Erin said she loved Tanya, but she didn't know if she could raise another child with Down syndrome. She felt aborting the baby was the only option she had. Naomi suggested CVS before doing that, so she'd know if the baby was healthy or had Down syndrome. Erin agreed to let her run the test.

They did the CVS and Ricky came into the room just after they finished. Erin then decided to tell Ricky and Tanya about the pregnancy. They were both excited about it. Erin said that despite their excitement, she couldn't trust them with the baby, so she'd have to baby. She then told Ricky and Tanya they didn't get to have the baby for sure.

Naomi got the results of Tanya's CVS back, but Erin wasn't answering the phone, so Naomi and Sam drove over to her house. Naomi told Erin the baby didn't have Down syndrome or any other abnormalities, but Erin said that she'd taken Tanya for an abortion that morning.



Tanya's mother stayed home with her to raise her.


She and [[Ricky (Two Steps Back)|Ricky]] go to school together and are close friends. At some point, they started having sex and conceived together.

'''Ted Carr''' is the husband of [[Jamie Carr]].


Ted came into the hospital with his wife, Jamie, who had slipped and fallen in the shower while eight months pregnant. X-rays showed that her wrist was broken and the bones were out of alignment, so she was put in traction and then casted. [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] also did an ultrasound and determined that there was fetal demise. Ted stayed by his wife's bedside as she delivered their stillborn son and held him.



He is married to [[Jamie Carr]].


When his wife was eight months pregnant, she slipped and fell in the shower. As a result, their baby was stillborn.

'''Ted Douglas''' is the father of [[Bobby Douglas]].


Ted and his wife, Barbara, came to the hospital when their son, Bobby, had an allergic reaction. He'd been given medication to treat chlamydia by his teacher, [[Donna Keating]], with whom he'd had sexual contact. However, he lied and told his parents that his friend had given him something to help him stay awake so he could study. However, they found out the truth when Donna came back to the hospital to visit him. They were horrified and Donna was arrested for statutory rape. After she was bailed out, Barbara and Ted allowed Donna to speak to Bobby to break things off with him.



He is married to [[Barbara Douglas]].


His son, Bobby, was hospitalized for an allergic reaction after taking medicine for chlamydia.

}}'''Ted Jarvey''' is the stepfather of [[Evan Dawson]].


Ted's wife, Lynn, showed up at the practice and confronted Cooper, saying she knew he'd treated her son and she believed he knew where he was. She had hired a private investigator and knew that Cooper tracked Evan's insulin pump. Cooper said that he'd said he was abused by his stepfather, but Lynn insisted that that had never happened.

Lynn and Ted came to the grand jury hearing for Cooper. He still refused to tell them where Evan and Frank were. However, because Addison knew he'd sent Charlotte in his place to see Evan, she had the police follow her and they found Frank and Evan. Frank was arrested and Evan was returned to his mother and stepfather.

Evan later came into the ER with stab wounds saying Ted stabbed him. Ted insisted that he hadn't done anything. When Evan was examined, they found that he had intention marks, meaning he'd done it to himself. He admitted that he'd made the whole thing up to try to get his parents back together and then he didn't know how to stop.

Lynn dropped the charges and Frank was released from jail.



He is married to [[Lynn Jarvey]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Jarvey, Ted}}

'''Terri''' is the mother of [[Casey]].


Terri, [[Pam (The Hardest Part)|Pam]], and [[Ricky]] were in talk therapy with Sheldon and Violet because their three daughters, [[Casey]], [[Lisa (The Hardest Part)|Lisa]], and [[Jamie]] had made a pact to get pregnant together in high school.

The three daughters also came in to have talk therapy together, to try to explain why they'd done it. Casey said she didn't think she should worry about good grades or college when all she wanted was to be a mom, Jamie said it was instant status, and Lisa said babies love you no matter what. There's a lot going on at her house, so her mother can't give them all attention all the time.

Ricky came in late to their joint session. She'd told Jamie she needed to pick up her brother, but she came back with Violet's book, saying Violet wasn't the right therapist for their daughters. She took Jamie and left.

Sheldon and Violet took Casey and Lisa to tour the hospital. Casey and Lisa by that point had read Violet's book and made several comments about it. Violet started to fight back, but Casey started having serious abdominal pain and bleeding. She was rushed in for an emergency c-section. Lisa watched as Casey's baby was delivered and said it wasn't what she expected and left.

Casey held her baby after his birth. Lisa had not come back. Jamie called and said she was giving her baby up for adoption. She felt her friends had abandoned the pact. Casey said he mom had only come by to criticize her and yell. She wondered how she'd do it on her own because she was totally alone. Sheldon told her she wasn't alone. She had Ben. She said she was scared and Sheldon said they could work on that.



When she found out her daughter was pregnant, she tried to force her to have an abortion. After her grandson was born, she showed up at the hospital only to criticize Casey and yell at her.

|portrayed by = [[Kathe Mazur]]
}}
'''Terri Bishop''' is the mother of [[Annie Bishop]].


Terri's daughter, Annie, had a cardiac tumor. She was scheduled to have the tumor removed. [[Noah Barnes]] operated, but wasn't able to get the whole tumor. He said he believed chemo would shrink it more and then he'd be able to remove the rest in another month. Annie didn't believe them, as that's what they'd said the last time. She said she didn't want more surgery.

A month later, after chemo, her labs looked good. She said she still didn't want the surgery. She talked to Cooper and said that she wanted to feel good for a little bit and live her life and be normal for a while before she died. Her parents and doctors had a meeting and Cooper stood up for her, saying that stopping the treatment might be the best thing for her. Noah still insisted he could help, but her parents decided they wanted to take her home. Cooper went to take her catheter out, but Charlotte stopped him, saying Noah was going to a judge to get a court order. [[Judge McLennan]] came in and ruled that her catheter would stay in and she'd have the surgery on the first available date.

After another month, Annie was upset. She believed she'd die in the hospital. After seeing her condition, [[Charlotte King]] went to Noah and said she supported the decision to end treatment and questioned who Noah was really fighting for. Noah went to Cooper and said he wouldn't push anymore. He told the judge he reevaluated his position. Annie was told that once the catheter was out, it would be hard to get it back in, meaning they wouldn't be able to get medicine to her fast enough if something went wrong. Annie said it was okay and that she'd finally get to see the ocean.

A month later, on Annie's th birthday, she had a party on the beach and was able to surf and talk to her friends. At the party, Terri told Cooper she was having a hard time dealing with the fact that it would be Annie's last birthday.



She is married to [[Greg Bishop]].


Her daughter, Annie, had a cardiac tumor. Despite not wanting to lose her,she and her husband supported her decision to stop treatment and live the life she had left.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Bishop, Terri}}

'''Tess Milford''' is a patient who was pregnant with triplets, two of which had TTTS, after using IVF.


Tess was pregnant with triplets after using IVF. An ultrasound showed that two of the triplets had TTTS, so Addison wanted to operate. However, the Milfords were religious and decided not to interfere a second time.

Tess later collapsed at the airport. One of the babies had fluid around his heart and Tess was mirroring. She stabilized while resting, but was advised that that wasn't enough. Addison pleaded with Gregory to let her help Tess. Tess had the surgery, but had a reaction to the anesthesia, so Addison wasn't able to finish.

Addison later got paged to Tess's bedside. Addison did an ultrasound and determined that the triplet not involved in the connection had died. Tess begged Addison for her help. Addison said she was too weak for another surgery. Addison said they could do local, but it was too dangerous. Tess implored her to try something, so Addison agreed and did the surgery with local anesthesia. It was successful and the blood vessels were separated.



She is married to [[Gregory Milford]].


Desperate to have children, Tess and Gregory turned to IVF. They had one embryo implanted and it split into triplets. However, one of the triplets later died in utero.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Milford, Tess}}

'''Tess Sullivan''' is the daughter of [[Marilyn Sullivan]], who was abusing her.


Tess came into the practice with a broken wrist. She said that she missed the curb while walking home. Cooper noticed a bruise on her arm that looked like someone had grabbed her and asked her about it. She denied anything having happened.

Cooper looked into her medical records and found a spiral humerus fracture from before she was his patient, along with several other breaks. When Violet said that when a child was being abused, the most likely culprit was the adult in the house. Cooper then sadly resigned himself to calling CPS on Tess's mother, who had multiple sclerosis. Cooper went to Sam with his concerns and Sam refused to believe that Marilyn could be hurting Tess. He said Cooper needed to be sure before making the call. Cooper struggled, but ultimately made the call to CPS.

Tess and her mother returned to the practice enraged because a social worker had come to their home. Marilyn and Tess said that Tess had helped her when she fell and that's how her arm got broken, though Cooper didn't believe them because they would have been forthcoming with that story if it were true.

A hearing was scheduled to determined if the concerns were founded. Before the hearing, Tess came to Cooper and asked what he'd say. He said he'd tell her if she rolled up her sleeves. Tess said her mom hits her, but it's okay because she's in pain and needs to take it out on someone. Cooper said it wasn't okay for her to take it out on Tess. During the hearing, Cooper reported on the injuries he'd observed on Tess. He said that her injuries could have only happened in an abusive situation. He then went on to say that Tess was strong, but even the strongest kid shouldn't have to take the kind of abuse Tess was going through. Once you do that, you're not a kid anymore. The judge ruled that Tess would be removed from Marilyn's custody.



Tess was being raised alone by her mother, who had multiple sclerosis and took her pain out on her daughter by repeatedly injuring her.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Sullivan, Tess}}

Derek and Addison took Theresa's baby into surgery and removed the tumor, which relieved the pressure and allowed her to breathe.

'''Tim Williams '''is the ex-husband of [[Jane Williams]].


When Tim's ex-wife, Jane, was  weeks pregnant, she had a stroke. Archer evaluated her and said that if he could stop the stroke within three hours of it starting, she had a good chance of not having any neurological deficits. Tim asked about her baby. Archer and Addison disagreed about treatment options. Archer did an endovascular clot evacuation. During the procedure, Jane started having contractions, which Addison was able to stop. After the procedure, Jane was stable, though still paralyzed on one side.

Jane went into labor while in recovery. Addison took her up for a c-section. Because stopping the blood thinners would put her at risk for another stroke, Addison decided to do the c-section with a spinal block while Archer monitored her neuro function.

After the baby was delivered, he didn't breathe right away. He had aspirated meconium, but once Addison suctioned it out of his airway, he started breathing.

After the surgery, Addison brought the baby to see Jane. Tim came in with them. She said she was glad that he was there. Tim handed Jane the baby and they sat together in her bed with their son.



He was married to [[Jane Williams]]. They had a long, painful divorce. Their divorce was complicated by the fact that Jane was pregnant. Jane even wished during a fight that she wasn't pregnant, because she resented that it kept Tim in her life.


His son was born via emergency c-section after Jane had a stroke.

'''Toby Chang''' is a foster kid who had lupus.


Toby had been diagnosed with lupus. He came to see Cooper because of abdominal pain. He'd been in nine foster homes in four years because no one wanted to be responsible for a sick kid. He was currently living in a group home. Cooper decided to run more tests to find the cause of the abdominal pain. Toby came out and said that he didn't feel well and Cooper saw that his nose was bleeding, so he tried to stop the bleeding with tissues.

Toby had to be admitted to the hospital when his temperature kept spiking and he had signs of liver failure. The lupus triggered hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis. He needed chemotherapy and a stem cell transplant to treat him. Cooper told [[Jim Davies]], his social worker, that he needed to find Toby a foster home because he couldn't go through it all alone.

Toby resisted when he needed to be sedated to get a central line for his stem cell transfusion. He refused to let [[Dr. Berman]] sedate him, believing he'd never wake up if she put him to sleep. Cooper got him to calm down, saying he wasn't going to die. Toby then asked Cooper to stay. Cooper said Jim could stay, but Toby said Jim had other kids he needed to take care of, so Cooper agreed to stay along with Jim.

After his stem cell treatment, Toby started to feel much better, stronger every day. His t-cell count also went up.



Cooper brought Mason in to spend time with Toby after his treatment. Mason bright Pok\uemon cards and showed him how to play the game.


*He hates needles.
*He'd never played Pok\uemon until Mason showed him.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Chang, Toby}}

'''Todd Reiter''' is a man who came into the ER with his pregnant wife who had transient weakness.


Todd's wife, Pam, pulled into the ER and called for help. Todd couldn't move his legs, which is why she drove them to the hospital even though she was in labor. They both said it was in Todd's head, because he'd had symptoms like that during her previous pregnancies.

In the ER, Todd was put in a collar and Pam was determined to be only at four centimeters, meaning they had time before she'd give birth. Todd's legs stopped tingling and he was able to move them again. Despite him having experienced sympathetic symptoms with his wife's three prior pregnancies, James wanted a neuro consult for Todd. Amelia looked at his chart and said she'd see him in her office later that week. Despite that, James ordered a CT.

Pam continued to labor down in the ER while they waited for a bed in labor and delivery to become available.

Pam had late decels and needed a c-section. Because the ORs were all full, they prepared to do a c-section in the ER. As they prepared, doctors came in to take Todd, who needed surgery for a spinal infection, which had caused his transient weakness. During the c-section, a uterine artery was lacerated, but Jake was able to stop the bleeding as Addison tended to the baby. Addison then introduced Pam to her daughter.

After Todd's surgery, Addison took the baby to see him. He couldn't hold her because of his surgery, but he was able to give her a kiss.



He is married to [[Pam Reiter]]. At the time of her fourth pregnancy, they'd been married for  years.


Todd and Pam have four kids. With Pam's first pregnancy, Todd got rashes. The second brought abdominal cramps. The third one had fainting spells. During the fourth, he had transient weakness and paralysis in his legs, though that was found to be due to an infection.

'''Tom Russell''' is the husband of [[Dorie Russell]] and father to the quintuplets born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Tom and his wife, Dorie, used fertility drugs and got pregnant with triplets: Adam, Oliver, and Graham.


When the triplets were four, Dorie and Tom had used fertility drugs again and Dorie was pregnant with quintuplets. Four of the five girls had health problems that would require surgery shortly after birth.

When she was  weeks pregnant, she was admitted to the hospital for bed rest. She wanted to try to get to  weeks, but she started having contractions. Addison gave her magnesium and put her in Trendelenburg position in order to stop the contractions, but Dorie's placenta started tearing and so she had to be taken into an emergency c-section. ''("[[Much too Much]]")''

After their births, the quintuplets were all taken to the NICU. Dorie visited them in the NICU, but while she was visiting Charlotte's lung collapsed, so she went back to her room. Meredith called her husband to see if he could bring their sons to visit, but they had the flu, so Meredith said bringing them wasn't a good idea.

Emily had hypoplastic left-heart syndrome and needed surgery to repair her heart. However, once they opened, they discovered that there was nothing that could be done and had to close. Emily died early the next morning. After she died, her mother was allowed to hold her.

Charlotte's lungs were a little less developed than her sisters', so she was given a special mask to help her breathe. Her lung collapsed, but they re-inflated it. When she stopped breathing again, they intubated her. Meredith then had the idea to put the most stable quint, Kate, in with Charlotte, to help comfort her. It worked and Charlotte immediately started improving.

Lucy had hydrocephalus, so she had surgery to insert a shunt and was doing well afterward.

Julie had an omphalocele, a sac of her organs outside of her body. She had once surgery shortly after birth, but they weren't able to close because it put too much pressure on her lungs, so they had to wait a few more days to perform her second surgery.

Kate was premature, but otherwise had no major health problems. She was in the NICU to be monitored and gain weight. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")''



He is married to [[Dorie Russell]]. Together, they have eight children. Tom had considered selective reduction when Dorie was pregnant with quints, but Dorie ultimately decided not to reduce.


He and his wife have eight children: triplet boys and quintuplet girls. One of the girls, Emily, is deceased.

His mother, who is , took care of their triplets while they were at the hospital, but she could only handle them for half a day at a time.

'''Tracy Woods''' is a mother whose baby was born with a large tumor on her lung.


Tracy labored and gave birth at the practice while her husband, Daniel, recorded the birth. However, once the baby, Kyla, was born, she wasn't crying due to a large tumor on her lung, which was putting pressure on her heart. The doctors planned surgery to remove it, but before that, they called in an oncologist, [[Eric Rodriguez]], who suggested chemotherapy to shrink the tumor instead of surgery to remove it. He and Addison disagreed over which treatment option was better.

While they were discussing it, Tracy collapsed by Kyla's bedside. She had a postpartum hemorrhage, which Addison repaired in surgery. While she was unconscious, Eric talked to Daniel and convinced him to go with chemo instead of surgery.

When Tracy woke up, she was shocked to learn that Daniel had cancelled the surgery and chosen chemo. Tracy was upset that he'd made the decision without her. Addison asked them to make a decision. Tracy was adamant that she wanted the surgery, so Daniel left the room.

Sam found Daniel outside the nursery and talked to him. He agreed to the surgery. In surgery, they found that the tumor was more entwined than the scans showed. A vessel burst because the tumor invaded it, but they were able to remove the whole tumor and Kyla was stable after surgery.



She is married to [[Daniel Woods]].

'''Troy Davis''' is a heart patient whose partner and father disagreed over his care.


Troy, who had a history of cardiomyopathy, came into the ER unable to breathe. When they said they needed to put him on a ventilator so he could keep breathing, his partner, Roger, said that Troy didn't want that and just to let him go. However, before they could comply, [[Carl Davis]], Troy's father, came in and asked them to keep Roger away from Troy. Carl hadn't seen Troy in five years because he didn't accept his son's relationship with Roger, whom he insisted was simply Troy's roommate. Carl decided he wanted them to do whatever possible to keep Troy alive, including putting him on a ventilator. They hadn't filled out the paperwork making Roger his medical proxy because they thought they had more time, so when Carl said Roger had to leave, he had no choice.

Despite being ordered to stay away, Roger decided to sneak in after Carl left and sit by Troy's bedside to hold his hand and talk to him.

Carl was told that Troy's cardiac function was still declining despite the ventilator. Sam said that they could do more to help him, but it would only prolong the inevitable and Troy was going to die. He asked Carl why he was doing all this, despite knowing what Troy wanted and how much he loved Roger. Carl talked about Troy's childhood and how close they were. He believed Roger had manipulated Troy. Sam said that he believed Roger really loved Troy and didn't want to lose him, so he must be honoring Troy's wishes. Carl still decided to have Sam continue extraordinary care.

Roger brought to the hospital printed pages from Troy's computer journal saying he didn't want to be hooked up to machines. However, Pete said it wasn't a legal document and they couldn't honor it.

Despite this, Pete allowed Roger to go into Troy's hospital room to say goodbye before turning off the machines. Roger stayed by his side, holding him while he took his last breaths and telling him how he wanted more time with him and he loved him.

Carl attacked Pete when he learned Troy had died, saying Pete had killed him. Pete said that Troy was gone and forced Carl to face the fact that his son wasn't coming back. Carl wondered what he had done.



He was involved with [[Roger]] until his death. They met at a wedding where two members of the bridal party got in a fight. Troy blushed at seeing them fight and Roger says he fell for him right that moment.


His mother died when he was very young. He was close with his dad all his life, but he was scared to come out to him. He eventually did come out when he started seeing [[Roger]] and his father cut him off. Despite this, Troy never stopped trying to reconnect with his father.


*He was  at the time of his death.
*He hated the carpet in their living room.

'''Troy Hagen''' is the man who was drunk and hit a car containing a pregnant [[Maya Bennett]] and [[Dell Parker]], resulting in the latter's death.



Troy was in a head-on collision with Dell and Maya. He was taken to the hospital via ambulance and taken into surgery by Sam, who didn't know that Troy had almost killed Maya. ''("[[In the Name of Love]]")''

Before his surgery, Troy told Sam that he thought God was mad at him because he'd screwed up. Sam said that it would be okay and started to operate. He finished operating and then returned later to put Troy on bypass. While he was working, Troy started moving because his anesthesia lightened. The anesthesia informed him that he was drunk and that's why he'd been in the accident, tipping Sam off that it was the man who had hit Maya. Pete lied and said it wasn't him, that the guy who hit Maya had died. Sam continued operating, repairing the damage. [[Dr. Mason]] arrived later and took over the surgery so that Sam could leave. ''("[[The End of a Beautiful Friendship]]")''


Troy came into the practice to apologize to Sam and ask for forgiveness for what happened with Maya. He said he'd made a deal with the prosecutor and was going to be sentenced. Sam refused to forgive him and choked him. Troy collapsed and was taken to the hospital. At the hospital, [[Dr. Campbell]] diagnosed coronary artery disease and planned bypass surgery. Troy refused the surgery because he felt he deserved to die. Sam then talked to him and convinced him to have the surgery, telling him to be better next time. He also told Charlotte to have Dr. Campbell look at the scans again because he had seen a pseudoaneurysm and didn't know if Campbell noticed it. If she wasn't aware, it could kill Troy. ''("[[Playing God]]")''


*He was  at the time of the car accident.

'''Ty''' is the husband of [[Colette]].


Ty's wife, Colette, had been raped and was having difficulty in her marriage because of it. She said Ty couldn't even look at her. He said he didn't want to keep bringing it up, but Violet told him it happened and if he couldn't work through what had happened to her, they wouldn't be able to move forward together. After Ty left the room at the end of their session, Colette told Violet that she was pregnant. Because of the timing, she wasn't sure if her husband or her rapist was the father.

In Violet's office, Colette told Ty she was pregnant. He was excited, because they'd been trying, but then he was told the paternity test revealed he wasn't the father. He asked how soon they could abort. Colette said she knew it was awful, but they'd been trying for so long to have a baby and this could be their chance. Ty said he didn't want that and left.

Colette returned the next day and said that Ty hadn't come home. Violet explained that he didn't understand why she'd consider keeping the baby. She said she loved Ty, but she was having a baby. She told Violet she believed she was up for it, but Violet asked if she knew what it would be like to see that baby every day, to remember being raped every day. Colette left in horror.

Ty came into the practice to thank Violet, saying that Colette had scheduled an abortion for the next day. Violet asked if she was sure about it, but Ty said Colette wouldn't talk to him.

Violet called Colette and Ty back in and apologized, saying she'd imposed too much of her personal situation into theirs. Ty then stopped and asked Colette what she wanted.



He is married to [[Colette]]. They met when they were camp counselors together.

'''Tyler Hatcher''' is a high school wrestler who was diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.


Tyler, a wrestler, passed out while wrestling. He'd also had some dizziness while wrestling at other times. The next day was the conference finals and Tyler needed to do well to get a scholarship to college. Cooper examined him and heard a heart murmur, so he told Tyler and his parents he wanted him to get checked out by Sam. They wanted to get it done today and needed Cooper to sign a medical release saying that Tyler could wrestle again.

Sam diagnosed Tyler with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, but said he could still wrestle. There were risks, but there was a chance he could do it without any problems. Despite his recommendation, Cooper said he couldn't allow Tyler to wrestle.

Tyler came to Cooper and said his mom had gotten laid of and his dad was working double shifts to pay the rent. He worked a part-time job on the weekends to help out. Wrestling was his way to get to college. Cooper just said he couldn't risk it and had scheduled a cardiac MRI for Tyler.

Tyler's dad, Randy, came into the hospital, saying he understood how important getting the MRI was. He was surprised that Tyler hadn't arrived because his mother had said she'd bring him. They then figured out she had taken him to the conference finals instead.

They arrived at the match and tried to get [[Coach Patterson]] to stop it. He said that the medical release had been signed, but Stacy had forged it. Tyler won his match, but shortly after, went into cardiac arrest. They rushed him to the hospital, where they were able to restart his heart, but he was deprived of oxygen long enough that there was the potential for brain damage. They put him in a medically-induced coma. Stacy said that Tyler had come to her, saying how much he wanted it. Everything he'd always worked for to get a chance for something better.

While they waited on Tyler, his mother showed Cooper a letter from UCLA. They'd already decided to give him a full scholarship before the finals. Stacy and Randy cried at their son's bedside.



His parents supported his wrestling. His dad even practiced with him at home when he wasn't allowed to practice at school.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Val Woodward''' is a pregnant woman who was diagnosed with cancer.


Val was  weeks pregnant. During a routine exam, Sam saw that her glands were swollen, so he did a biopsy. The biopsy revealed Burkitt's lymphoma. Because it was so aggressive, they suggested getting her to the hospital immediately for more testing. The type of cancer she had made chemotherapy her only option, but she couldn't start treatment while she was pregnant. She didn't have time to wait until she reached full term in her pregnancy, so Addison suggested delivering the baby immediately. Gary wanted to deliver and start treatment, but Val said with all the past miscarriages, she wanted to carry the baby to term, even if it killed her.

Val was admitted to the hospital for testing. She told Addison that Gary said he could deal with being with a career woman, but no kids would be a deal breaker for him. When Addison pushed a little more, Val admitted she'd had an abortion early in their marriage without telling Gary. While talking to Addison, Val started to have trouble breathing, so Addison gave her oxygen.

Even though her condition was deteriorating and she had a problem with her heart, Val continued to insist that she didn't want to start treatment yet. Gary said he wanted to be a parent, but not without her. Val admitted that she'd had an abortion. He was upset and left the room.

Despite his anger, Gary stayed in the waiting room because he couldn't leave. Addison spoke to him and convinced him to tell Val to have the c-section. After the c-section, they watched over their baby in the NICU.



She is married to [[Gary Woodward]].


She's a commodity trader.

'''Vanessa Hoyt''' is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|perinatologist]] and [[Neonatology|neonatologist]] working at [[St. Ambrose Hospital]] and the former girlfriend of [[Sam Bennett]].



Sam called Vanessa in for a consult for [[Elisha]], whose baby had a heart condition. ''("[[Fear of Flying]]")''


When Addison advised [[Kayla Lindy]] that she needed to reduce the triplets she was carrying to a singleton, the people she was carrying the baby for called Vanessa in for a second opinion. She proposed a procedure that would allow Kayla to continue the pregnancy. The procedure was done, but it didn't help and Kayla was left in a coma when she started throwing clots during a second surgery. ''("[[Triangles]]")''

Kayla remained on life support. Her husband decided he wanted to remove life support and let Kayla have peace, but Vanessa and the McConnells opposed the decision because she was still pregnant with the McConnells' triplets. A judge ruled that Kayla had to remain on life support and her room was restricted to medical personnel. However, Eddie, with help from Charlotte King, ended up in her room alone and disconnected her ventilator. To the doctors' shock, Kayla started breathing on her own. ''("[[Pulling the Plug]]")''

When [[Geraldine Ginsberg]] was brought in to look on Kayla's case, her fellow, [[Amelia Shepherd]] believed she could help Kayla even when Ginsberg felt it was hopeless. Vanessa asked Amelia not to do the surgery she planned because the fetuses were near viability. She did the surgery despite this request and during the surgery, the three babies had to be delivered and taken to the NICU. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''



Vanessa was briefly involved with [[Sam Bennett]]. During a date, he left to tend to a patient and said he'd return, but he never did. So she confronted him about it, saying she'd lived in the professional shadow of Addison and she didn't want to live in her shadow in her personal life. Sam later went to her and said he was ready to chase her, so she better be ready to get caught. ''("[[Fear of Flying]]")''

After Sam didn't stand up for her while Addison was working on [[Kayla Lindy]], Vanessa broke things off with him because he wanted Addison. ''("[[Eyes Wide Open]]")''


Dr. Hoyt's career is overshadowed by [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Dr. Montgomery]] due to their similarities as neonatal specialists, with the primary difference that Dr. Hoyt is not trained in the [[Neonatal Surgery|surgical care of infants]]. ''("[[Fear of Flying]]")''

As a [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|perinatologist]], Dr. Hoyt completed an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|residency]] followed by a maternal-fetal medicine [[Fellow|fellowship]]. Like Addison, her patients include pregnant mothers with high-risk pregnancies.

As a [[Neonatology|neonatologist]], Dr. Hoyt completed a [[Pediatrics|pediatrics]] residency followed by a neonatal-perinatal medicine fellowship. Although her patients in this field are primarily premature babies/neonates and practicing in [[St. Ambrose Hospital|St. Ambrose Hospital's]] [[Neonatal Intensive Care Unit|NICU]], her function is non-surgical care management, treatment, and, if needed, consultations with [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric]] and neonatal surgeons.


*Dr. Hoyt referred to [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Dr. Montgomery]] as a "[[Board Certification|double-board certified]] red-head".

'''Vick Graham''' is the father of [[Ollie Graham]].


Vick came into the practice with his wife and their son, Ollie. Cooper examined Ollie and said there were no physical causes. His parents believed he had ADHD like his older brother. They said he was having fits. Cooper recommended that they talk to Sheldon about his situation. Sheldon was concerned that the parents were prompting answers from Ollie. When he mentioned diagnostic evaluations, they were upset because they hadn't had to go through that with their older son. They decided to take Ollie to another doctor.

Cooper later witnessed Ollie raging and hitting his father in the mouth. Cooper talked to his parents about the episode and alternate possible causes. Ollie mentioned to Cooper that the medicine made him not hungry anymore. Cooper discovered that his parents had been giving him the amphetamines on their own, leftover from their older son. His mother confessed that they wanted him diagnosed with ADHD so he'd get extra time on his tests. They had invested a lot in his education and didn't want that to be wasted.

Cooper later went to his house and said what they were doing was child abuse, both giving him the pills and the pressure they're putting on him. He said they needed to stop giving him the pills and he'd have Ollie in for monthly blood tests. If he found out they were giving them to him again, he said he'd call the police on them.



He is married to [[Rosie Graham]].


His older, Brian, had gotten into Stanford. He and his wife expected Ollie to perform to that same level.
